description:
If I could give them more than 5 stars, I would. 

Every single staff member was friendly, attentive, and went above and beyond to make our meal exceptional. Our server Bob was wonderful!! 

The food was to die for!! We started with the Brussels sprout chips and loved them so much we ordered a second serving! We also had the bone marrow which was delicious. Every single dish ordered by our table was a big hit, but the polenta (which is what I ordered) was life changingly delicious!! I would travel back to SF simply to go to Marlowe for their polenta!!

Drinks were yummy too! I had the baker's wife and loved it. Citrusy and refreshing! 

The ambience is also great for a nice dinner out. Small, but cozy and cute.

The menu isn't very big, but they have mastered every single item on it. Quality over quantity!! If you're looking for a restaurant for a nice night out, look no further!!
author: Samantha D.

description:
Absolutely delicious food. Burrata. Dear god.

Also great ambiance and service- AND our server/bartender was completely accommodating when we realized we were about to miss our movie and got out us out of there in a flash with our dessert to go.
author: E E.

description:
I loved our lunch experience at Marlowe. I was dropping my beau off in SF for work and decided we ought to treat ourselves to a little lunch date since I wouldn't see him for the rest of the week. 

He ordered the famous burger (which was truly delicious) and I got the steak tartare as my main and we shared the burrata starter and a cocktail that featured Gin & Thyme. 

We sat at the bar which is always fun if you're a duo, we sat on the end off to the side with a full view of the entire restaurant which was excellent for people watching.

I think Marlowe makes for a good business lunch and I think the ambiance for dinner could be nice for a first date. It is expensive so it's definitely not the type of place you can make a real habit out of (unless you're one of the Silicon Valley's many millionaires) but I don't have a bad thing to say about it.
author: Siobhan F.

description:
When they say 'best burger,' they mean it. And by they, I mean the many, many peeps who crown the Marlowe Burger as THE burger of SF. While I can't verify the validity of that bold statement (I need to eat at least 50 more burgers across the city before doing so) I will say it was f-ing fantastic. Melted, gooey cheese; bacon that added a nice salty crisp w/out overpowering any other flavors; a perfectly seasoned medium rare patty; caramelized onions, providing a touch of sweetness; & horseradish aioli to wake them nostrils up. All between the perfect bun that somehow soaked up the juices but never got too soggy. Burger is served with fries or a tossed salad--ask for half and half, and you'll still get a pile of both. 

K, we addressed the burger sitch but there are plenty more standouts here. The wife and I stopped by for a lunch date before I had to leave for work for a few days, so we went all out. We also ordered...

++Steak Tartare, with a poached quail egg on top. 4/5
++DiStefano Burrata, with roasted butternut squash and smoked honey. 6/5, it was THAT good. 
++Gin w/Thyme Cocktail, a really easy refreshing sipper 

Everything was legit. Yea it was a bit spendy but we were sorta celebrating and treating ourselves and blah blah no regrets.
author: Jon S.

description:
This restaurant has been in my bookmarks list for a very long time, and we finally went today! We made reservations in the morning for lunch at 12:30PM. When we arrived, there were a few tables available. It's a good thing we made reservation anyways, you'll never know when there's a line!

We ordered toasted levain and half dozen oysters for our starters. The bread case with cultured butter, and together they tasted sooooooo good. I wish butter isn't bad for you cause I'd slather on a crap ton of butter on my toast. | The oysters were pretty good, especially for a restaurant not known to be an oyster bar. They were fresh and briny! So delicious. They were small breed oysters, so I'm guessing probably kumamotos or shigokus. $30 for market price. 

For entrees we got the Guittard chocolate toast and cod & shrimp Benedict. I never really order sweet toasts cause I never thought they were worth the calories or effort. But I was craving for something sweet today and I went ahead with the chocolate toast. It had olive oil, sea salt and chili flakes on it. Man, it was the best chocolate toast I've ever had. The combination of sweet and a tiny hint of savory made it so wholesome. I wish they were bigger and came with more than 3 slices. 

The Benedict was just ok. Not the best I've ever had but it was pretty good. It came with two poached eggs and one big cod/shrimp cake. Kinda funny, the best part about the benedict to me were the greens. Nothing much to say about this dish, it's kinda what you'd expect. 

We ordered two drinks: 
Morning Glory (tequila and coffee with lavender buds) - it was uh...interesting. I'm not a huge fan of tequila so I thought the combination was disgusting. I don't think my brain could comprehend tequila and coffee in one. The boyfriend got a second glass though. 
The Baker's Wife (vodka with grapefruit and lemon peel) - I prefer vodka over tequila. I also like cocktails that are more citrusy. This was perfect. Got me slightly buzzed during my meal, but I'm not complaining. 

Overall, the service was good, food is good. The only thing that bothered me was how close all the tables are, that we had very little room to move. When new patrons arrive and got seated next to us, we had to adjust the table a little to the left or right to give them room to sit. When I'm trying to enjoy my meal, that's not something I wanna be cautious about the entire time. At the same time, I also can't blame anyone cause that's just how it is.
author: Elle T.

description:
Despite a rollercoaster of foodie emotions that Marlowe put me on, I was overall sold with their solid entree choices.

After the Giants game at AT&T park, my friend and I were looking for a nice place to eat before heading back home.  Marlowe was not too far with enough good reviews to try out.  

When we got there, it was still happy hour so the menu was slightly limited especially in terms of their entrees. From it, we chose the crispy brussel sprouts and the baked oyster, both of which were major disappointments.  The brussel sprouts were more oily versus crispy with small portions.  Definitely nothing to justify the $9.50 price tag.... Then the baked oyster was also another major letdown.  More like a clam chowder placed in an oyster that was not really satisfying.

With a little protestation from the wait staff, they allowed us to stay for dinner service.  Thank goodness! If my experience at the restaurant were solely based on the appetizers/starters that I tried, the rating would have been much lower.  Here is what we ordered:

Pork chop: The pork chop was definitely a highlight!  It had nice fatty pieces in the meat giving it a nice juicy bite.  The slivered almonds on top provided a nice contrast along with the slightly salty sweet sauce.  The only thing that I did not enjoy was the cheese dumplings.  While there was nothing wrong with the taste, it did not seem to mesh well with the pork.

Scallop: Although I am not a scallop fan, I definitely liked this dish mainly for the different flavor combinations and textures going on with each bite.  The slightly salty scallops grilled to a nice firm consistency paired well with the sweet crunchy corn salad accompaniment.  With the grilled leeks, it all worked well together.

The service was okay.  As mentioned earlier, the vibe from the staff when we asked to extend our stay into dinner service was not super welcome.  Some street parking available in front or in the neighboring streets.

Overall, Marlowe was far from perfect but only saved with the quality of its entrees (skip the starters...)!
author: Patrick S.

description: This is a really pleasant spot to get some delicious food. We over ate throughout the day, but by dinner time we wanted something small to eat, so that we would have enough not to be super hungry by the next morning. We came here and ordered a bunch of small dishes. Everything was delicious, and everything was perfect. We told our server we were splitting everything, and she was kind enough to separate our soup into two bowls for us!
author: Jane H.

description: We came here for lunch and the foods and drinks were pretty good + desserts were delicious. Nice restaurant with a communal seating table, bar seating area, and private tables as well. Service was attentive and we had a great time here. My favorite was their brussel sprout chips (not the brown sugar butter one). My team really liked their oysters too though I was not a fan of oysters. Everything was pretty good and I'd come back for more.
author: Lena H.

description:
Damn good burger and fries!!!  Marlowe is a mainstay of the top burger lists in SF and it lived up to the hype. The fries were great too - perfectly crispy and went well with the horseradish aioli and ketchup.  Devoured everything on the plate. 

Even though the burger was definitely the highlight of the meal, the other items were also quite good as well - the charred octopus and grilled squid salad, the baked oyster and the dessert (coffee ice cream, meringue, toasted almond and chocolate sauce).  My non-alcoholic pairing for the night was their glitterbomb (raspberry soda) and I would recommend this drink.  No complaints about the food whatsoever and definitely deserves the spot on the top 100 list. 

The service was a bit spotty and the restaurant gets loud and busy.  With tax and tip, this meal was about $75. Not bad at all. I would definitely come back here.
author: Andrew S.

description:
We went there for brunch. It was easy to reserve a table by just calling them.

The French toast soldiers  were very well made, very soft and delicious.
I also like the house made doughnuts, not very sweet and very fresh with a hint of citrus.
Crispy fried chicken was AMAZING, the chicken was very well cooked.

I also tried the smoked salmon bagel which was good as the salmon was fresh and well made. I personally did not like the roasted baby beets in it, will probably get it without the beets next time.

Buttermilk pancakes tasted a lot of butter which I did not like.

Overall the quality of food was great.
author: Supriya L.

description:
Brussel sprouts chips!! Man I could order five of these!
I love brussel sprouts in general but these chips were AMAZING. 

The rest of the food was great too. The oysters were fresh. We got broccoli soup, steak tartare, the shrimp. We decided to just get a bunch of appetizers. The broccoli soup wasn't anything special but the steak tartare was flavorful and a bit tangy. Shrimp was cooked and seasoned well too. But then again, the thing that really stood out was the brussel sprouts chips...
author: Eriko M.

description:
I finally got to try out this restaurant!!

I stopped maybe a year ago(?) and it was closed for a company party. Babe and I decided to call in right before heading over and made reservations the same day for our dinner date.

Friendly waitress and very attentive. I loved the decor and it was pretty loud for a restaurant. We ordered:

Baked oysters- 3/5 flavor was there but nothing too special 

Bone marrow- 5/5 the star of the restaurant! It was by far the best dish and best bone marrow I've had in my life!! 

Octopus salad (forgot the actual name)- 5/5-babe chose this out and was pleasantly surprised with the amount of flavor the salad had! I really enjoyed it!

The baker 4/5 my cocktail of choice for the night and they didn't skimp in the alcohol! I enjoyed it! 

Overall, I will be back to try the burger! Will also be back to order bone marrow. It does get pricy but I thought it was definitely worth it.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Checked out brunch bar side and had a solid meal and good service... 

started with oysters of which they only had one variety (their own) but they were good- medium sized and a little briny...  

to continue the protein fest, had the ribeye and eggs- well seasoned steak served with a chimichurri, fingerling potatoes, and eggs (requested poached)- all were well executed.  Couple draw backs for me was the steak was rather fatty (even for a ribeye) and it would have been great to have some kind of bread to mop up the egg yolk (could have ordered that separately but at that price point just throw in a slice already)... 

Place was cute and would return to check out the rest of the menu...
author: Tazeen L.

description:
After reading reviews for Marlow I added it to my Yelp San Francisco collection of places I had to go to while visiting the city. The location was a little far for me but Ubering was only $4 so after skimming the menu and pictures of food I decided it was worth it - good call on my part!

I arrived around 6 Tuesday evening as it was getting busy. I waited about 10 minutes for a single spot at the bar. I ventured out from my typical glass of vino for The Baker's Wife, again another good call. Highly recommend this drink if you enjoy vodka and champagne! 

Then I ordered their Marlowe Fries because as a huge french fry lover and sauce enthusiast I had to try the horseradish aioli. It was good but not my favorite as I still dipped the fries in ketchup.

I also ordered their grilled asparagus which was so delicious the group of girls next to me asked me what it was! Highly recommend getting this. The combination of flavors went together so well! Definitely a favorite from my San Francisco trip!
author: Callie R.

description:
Honestly nothing exciting. Bummed because many others have had a good experience here, and unfortunately, I can't say the same for myself.

A girlfriend and I came in on a weekday during dinner time and found seats at the bar. It seemed like they were reservation only at that point. 

Service was mostly friendly. Food was average and overpriced. The handful of crispy brussels sprout chips were tasty, but definitely not $10 worth. The grilled asparagus was interesting (not in a good way), and the pork chop was tough and dry.

Could be a lot better.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Welcoming and airy feel to the whole dining experience!

Lovely cocktails and nice bar seating area.  I liked my rye with refreshing grapefruit juice and lemon taste.

This place can be quite packed during the weekdays after working hours!  I can see why!

Baked oysters for the comfort food win with Brussels sprout crispy chips complimenting as bar bites!  They have other delightful small dishes to try out and even full course entrees. 

It's a nice place to be enjoyed with company, especially after what seems like some long and endless hours!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I've come for both brunch and dinner now. My brunch meal wasn't memorable but they took reservations which was nice. Someone in our brunch party got the burger and loved it.

So I came back for dinner and man I do love the marlow burger. I love the ambiance and would come back again.
author: Sophia L.

description:
I wanted to love Marlowe. You can't go wrong with over 2000 Yelp reviews right? We were in town and was looking for a restaurant for dinner. 

Marlowe isn't bad at all. The service was great, we sat at the window on the high chairs and our waitress was super cool. I swear we ordered the wrong items off the menu. Baked oyster ($3.50 for a piece), it was just okay. Brussel Sprouts appetizer was good but was something I could have made at home with a lot of butter. My friend also order the Little Gem salad....ugh. My first taste of the salad was pretty decent, but after my friend cooked it up, I got some bites of overpowering greens and bitterness. I love greens and salad, but the Gem was just okay. My Polenta was also just okay. Super rich, no meat, overpowering truffle cheese and had a hint of sour, and thick polenta at the bottom. Lastly, the Deviled Eggs ($1.50 per half piece) was just okay. The bacon was super salty and the egg wasn't all that. 

I think I totally ordered the wrong items, I so wanted the scallops but went with the polenta. I also should have ordered the steak but passed on that as well. 

The restaurant was super packed but they were able to seat us without a reservation, parking is horrendous, special event night, it's $7 per hour at the meter. Loved their service....!
author: Ticha B.

description: Marlowe may soon be my go-to brunch whenever I'm in SF! Arriving at noon, the restaurant was packed but we were seated in the patio area quickly. We ordered the Eggs Benedict and French Toast Pieces - both were delicious. Service and decor was great as well! Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for brunch in SF!
author: Allan L.

description: Love this place. The burrata appetizer and the polenta entree were both memorably good. There is a back private room behind the kitchen for larger parties who need space to talk.
author: Morris R.

description: This was a great place for brunch. It was very crowded but we managed a couple seats at the bar. I love the airy white space and all the quirky decor. I started with the bakers wife cocktail with vodka and elderflower which was super refreshing and perfect as a citrusy brunch cocktail. I got the smoked cod and shrimp Benedict which I thought was an interesting spin on the usual salmon / ham benny. They mashed the shrimp and cod into this fried fritter form with the poached eggs on top. It was interesting and good if you want a lighter brunch meal!
author: Jen L.

description:
After having this place on my radar for quite some time, I was left disappointed. 

Came here for lunch in a group of 6. Place got crowded by lunch, and it was claustrophobic. People were constantly walking behind me and it was just loud.

I wouldn't mind the loud and crowd if the food was great, but unfortunately, it was a let down. 

~Glitterbomb. Okay, I have no idea why I ordered this but for some stupid reason I was expecting glitter in my juice. There was no glitter in my juice. It was sour. Where was the sugar?
~Crispy brussels sprout chips. $10 for a handful of sprouts? Where's the rest of it? This was highly recommended by a friend so I tried it. The brussels sprouts were cooked perfect, but overly salted.
~Baked oyster. It was tasty and I wanted more!
~Salads that came with the sandwiches were drenched in dressing and was inedible.
~Warm rock shrimp roll. Do Not order this. Flavorless and bland. 

I hear mixed reviews, but after experiencing myself, I'm going to pass. Not sure if the food was off due to the busy lunch rush, but the food was just either bland or overdone.
author: Erica C.

description:
This place is on our rotation for take out, as it is conveniently located across the street from the hubby's office. We probably eat here on average once a month.

We both always get the burgers!!! We absolutely adore the burgers here. During brunch one weekend I got the fried chicken sandwich which was decent. We have also tried the deviled eggs and steak tartar which are good. Also if you aren't particularly hungry and want to split your burger they will totally do that for you which is super sweet of them :) I also feel like they gave us the same amount of fries on the side when we split our orders compared to a full order!

Take out is super easy; even if there is a wait you can ask the hostess to put in your order. It takes about 20 minutes for them to make your food.
author: Michele L.

description:
Came here for brunch, it was good, but I've definitely have had better .

We got the burrata, french toast soldiers, and the deviled eggs to start. 

I got the cod & shrimp benedict, it was mediocre. Two eggs on one tiny smoked cod & shrimp patty on a bed of herbs/mixed green. If we hadn't ordered the appetizers I would have still been hungry, and the benedict dish was $18...

Overpriced and average. This place is a skip for me.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Love, love, love! Yum! 

My friend and I loved our dining experience here! Our first time eating here, great location on the corner of 4th and Brannan. Easy street parking in the eve-loads of meter parking. Also, there is a nearby parking garage. The location is just a couple blocks from ATT Park, so be mindful of game times because this area can get super busy with traffic. We came on a non-game night, easy drive in/out of the area. 

The restaurant is small and tables are close together but that can be fun in making new friends and ogling other's food orders like I do! Ahhhhh!! My secret is out! I love looking at all the different dishes making their way to the eager diners. 

We had planned on ordering every dish on the menu but then decided to narrow down to our top picks! We started with restaurant created drinks first, I had the Pimms Cup and my friend had the Baker's Wife. Mine was very refreshing and crisp tasting. I milked it which was wrong of me, you shouldn't let it sit for long as the contents will settle and not be as crisp. My error. My friend guzzled her's speedily (I took a swig, too) love the grapefruit and vodka mix. I've always been a fan of those two mixed, goes well with my chemical makeup, agrees with the bod. She had one of the Pinot Noirs next and loved it!

We had a few bites next, warmed deviled eggs, baked oyster, steak tartare and wild mushroom soup. Yeah, just a few bites...my god we were ravenous wild animals! The eggs! The oysters! The tartare! Omg that soup is wildly shroomy and flipping amazing! One of the best I've ever had, so much so that I really wasn't even acknowledging my friend while I was eating it. She kept saying, are you listening?! Ha!! No. 

The entrees we chose were the angus rib eye and wild mushroom polenta accompanied by a side of healthy, baked cauliflower! The rib eye was a perfect medium and juicy AF, presented sliced in half then stacked! The shroom polenta is a must! MF'er is creamy and heartier than the heartiest with baby criminis strew about in the mix! The cauliflower is such a nice side and super farm-fresh veggie-tasting and cooked perfect with a bit of crunch. 

We finished with the chocolate peanut butter bites, yeah just those...what?! They're made with local Guittard chocolate, crispy corn flakes and peanuts. They spread that mixture out onto a baking sheet then chill to harden then cut up into cubes for service, presented cubed in a small mason jar on a small plate! We loved this dessert! Creamy, crispy, sweet, salty! Ahhhhh!! 

All of this would not have been possible without the outstanding service from the host to our server and the table staff! Thank you all! Really made our evening memorable. Our server knew everything about the menu items and was the reason we ordered the dishes we did on his expert recommendations. 

I definitely will return here and try out the other SF restaurants these folks own. FYI, everything was so amazing I totally bypassed taking pics of our food and drinks, that's how great it was!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Came by for a team dinner the other night and was surprised that we were able to be seated around 5:15 pm without a reservation! Staff was friendly throughout the meal, but the food itself was lackluster.

Ordered the Angus Ribeye medium rare and it came out medium well...bummer. More importantly, the dish was heavily salted, the steak, potatoes, and broccoli...bummer.

...even the brussel sprouts were too salty...
author: Derek S.

description: Wish I could say I'd recommend this place. Came for lunch. Sat at the bar. Ordered egg sandwich without bacon (vegetarian here), and bartender was beyond rude about not offering substitutes (heck, I would have been fine with a piece of lettuce). Apparently, it's the restaurant's policy (ok, fine, but let's communicate that better to your guests..I had to call the restaurant to find this out....or how about offer vegetarian lunch options, maybe?). She (the bartender) ruined the experience for us. Never even followed up with us once food was delivered. Was not busy, either. Drinks were good (carrot ginger mezcal cocktail). Fries were also good.
author: Rob M.

description:
The Fanny bay oysters were awesome. Great way to start and then the deep fried brussel sprouts were just as good. I had the burger which is their signature dish was great, Very juicy and tasty. 

Fun place to dine but the place gets crowded due to the popularity, great food and friendly service. Definitely a good place to meet people. A hipsters hangout good drinks and appetizers.
author: Andrew M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came in a lil bit earlier than our reservation time. However, our host was very accommodating and she sat us down immediately. She was really friendly. Our waitress was also really sweet and informative. 
This place is really good for a date night. The ambiance is loud and energetic if you're fine with that. The food was good. Nothing that was amazing. But overall we enjoyed it. We got baked oysters, steak tartare, grilled pork chop, and angus ribeye. I wasn't a fan of the baked oysters. However, the angus ribeye and grilled pork chop were amazing. I liked the angus ribeye more. It was really juicy and packed with flavors. The portions were huge. We couldn't finish the pork chop so we decided not to get the bone marrow and brussels sprout chips
author: Jenny L.

description:
3.5 stars. I had high hope but I am disappointed. My boyfriend and I visited on a Friday at 6:30pm and got seated right away at communal table. We ordered the beef tartare for appetizer. It was very good and good portion for two people. My pork chop came next after 20 minutes. To my disappointment, it was dry and lacked flavor. For $32, I expected better. 

Food aside, I think Marlowe would be a great place to grab a drink and catch up with friends. But I wouldn't come back for the food.
author: Angela T.

description: Went on my birthday w a reservation. Packed at 8pm on a Sunday. Truthfully I walk past all the time and it's always packed, every day of the week. Had the Brussels sprout chips which were really tasty and were quite chewy as well as crunchy. Also had the scallops which were also very tasty. Olive oil cake for dessert which was not as memorable by taste, but still nice.
author: Neil S.

description:
Lunch review.

5 - Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips
3 - Steak Tartare
4 - Marlowe Burger

Overall, "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
I am a little upset they no longer make Foir Gras anymore. A friend of mind recommended it to me a couple of days ago.

Wine: Grenache was fair. I'm so use to sticking to either Pinot or Cabernet, but it's finally time for something different.

Their food menu is extremely small compared to their drink and cocktail menu. It seems though items are picked off whether or not they might have  them listed. I called in advance for reservation for 1 person no need. 

There is literally no more than ten items on the food menu. My waitress was very : with a good sense of humor. 

($16) Steak tartar, waiter stated that the chef would recommend me breaking the egg incorporating it into the dish infusing the flavors. The egg pouched on top was go

Last thing the warm devil eggs. One egg is $3. That's outrageous.  The waiter chuckled when she saw my mouth animately hit the floor. When I asked her how much for $3. Her response, "1."  It made me upset because the egg was actually good. Tt

The is one bite size, very delicious. Jalapeño  cheese, bacon and egg. 
 
And the upsetting part is I'm not full at all. It felt like a SNACK!
author: Elijajuan F.

description:
I went with my friend. And I was attracted by the Benedict, this Benedict is not using a English muffin , instead, it is a combine of smoked cod and crab meat!!! Very tasty and fresh!!
The restaurant is also beautiful. The location is near downtown sf and you can even walk from the market street to the restaurant (about 15-20mins walk)
Also the donuts indeed is the best donuts I've ever tried, lemon flavor not super sweet!
And you'd better make a reservation ~
author: 语夷

description:
Stopped by for a quick dinner after work. Interior is so cute and aesthetically pleasing - loved the marble countertops and all of the animal-themed pieces. 

Food was great! Highly recommend the Deviled Eggs (surprisingly) and the Octopus Salad for starters. Baked Oysters were a no go for me though. The clam chowder made it too rich for my taste. The Marlowe burger was cooked perfectly and the fries that came with it were awesome. Plus, I mentioned that my friend and I would be sharing everything so they even took the time to split the burger for us without being asked to... which is super nice and convenient :') Servers were very attentive and constantly checking up on us. 

Solid dinner spot in SoMa!!
author: Caroline K.

description:
I mean, this place is oooookay. 

We started out with the Di Stefano BURRATA, which was tasty, but it was nothing spectacular. I mean, what can you expect? Anything with burrata tastes good. Really. 

We also ordered the Warm Open Faced Deviled Egg Sandwich and Smoked Cod & Shrimp Benedict. These two were a bit disappointing. I came to brunch extremely excited and hungry, but I didn't even end up finishing my meal. 

I probably won't come back, but it was a good experience and the waiter was extremely friendly/nice!
author: Angelina H.

description:
The service was good and food was ok. The tables are super small and super close to each other. Place is very cramped, only one bathroom for one person at the time and it wasn't to clean either.
The food is on a pricey side and after spending $133.00 for two people without alcohol and having two burgers, 4 appetizers and a dessert I still left hungry.
author: Artur T.

description:
Marlowe is a 5 star rating all around.  I went there for dinner with my mom and it exceeded all our expectations in terms of food, service, and ambiance.  It is a small but popular place, therefore, I recommend making a reservation before going.

When we sat down the waiter came promptly to our table. We started with the crispy brussel sprout chips.  They were eaten quite quickly.  It brussel sprout skins doused in olive oil and crisped to perfection.  A great light start to the meal.  My mom got the polenta, which as Marlowe describes it, is as good as crack.  And that polenta was amazing.  It was  the consistency of a porridge, easy to eat, with a poached egg sitting perfectly on top. I got the Pan Seared Scallops, which was also a phenomenal dish. The scallops were complimented nicely by this sweet sauce on the dish. 

We were so full which meant no room for dessert, but that also means I'll be back soon to get some :)
author: Christina T.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for SO long and i'm disappointed it took me this long to come around to Marlowe for brunch. The interior is very nice: white, light and airy with great decor. I had a late brunch reservation for saturday brunch at 1:30 and it was still super packed. The place and food were amazing though!
I ordered the west bay sparrow which is one of their non-alcoholic cocktails with pineapple juice, lemonade and hibiscus - it was super refreshing and the pineapple taste was quite strong, but I didn't mind. Our server was such a sweetheart, very attentive and helpful! I ordered the smoked salmon bagel and for $16 i think it was a little expensive but the flavors were incredible and it tasted fantastic I would highly recommend this! My brother ordered the Marlowe burger w/ fingerling potatoes and a side of eggs over easy and he also really enjoyed his whole meal. 
This place is a must for brunch and parking is pretty simple, there's usually a lot of street parking around!
author: Noor H.

description:
I reallllllly liked Marlowe. I took a client here for lunch and I have to say -- the pictures on yelp and opentable weren't very good. Yes, I can see how it would be a sexy and sleek place in the evening but in the daytime it's just a fresh and bright place to go with colleagues or clients. 

Brussell Sprout chips were fantastic -- I would definitely recommend for a couple of folks to nosh on while waiting for your food. Coffee was good, thick and caffeinated :) Lunch was delish -- my boss and client got the same thing: a fried chicken sando. I got the steak salad. Nothing disappointing -- and everything was cooked perfectly. 

I will be back -- and with different clients this time :)
author: Melzie C.

description:
So disappointed, as this is a sister restaurant of the fabulous Park Tavern. First taste of the menu was a gin cocktail with Serrano and lime. Sounded amazing, but it was so incredibly spicy that it blew my palate and made my stomach almost instantly burn. Although I liked the general flavor, I had to send back. I like all the spice usually, but this was far too much. I tried another with whiskey and it was ok. The last drink I tried had gin and lavender, and was served up. This was the only drink I would have ordered again. 

Food wise, everything was mediocre and lacking great flavor and that "it factor". Ordered the burrata with toast, octopus salad, pork chop, fries, and Brussels sprouts. The pork chop was dry, the fries were average, the sprouts were soggy and tasted strongly of lime, and the salad was bitter. 

Lastly, ambiance was not overly welcoming or comfortable. It's a small restaurant, tables are very packed together so you're basically fully overhearing the conversations next to you, and the door was open allowing a cold SF breeze to take over our table. 

Really glad I went because I've been meaning to see what Park Tavern's sister restaurant was all about, but have no need to return. If you know and love Park Tavern, think of Marlow as Park Tavern's ugly step sister.
author: Lauren N.

description:
Yea, definitely will be back.. 
This is nice place to have some drinks and food.
The ambiance is a little tight, but that's because it's good. 

The Good... 
The food is delicious. Bone Marrow was ok. 
The pork chop was on point! 
The Brussels sprouts where very flavorful... Drinks are good. 

The Bad...
Be careful where you park your car on the streets. 
We parked across the street and got a $87 parking ticket
and the car in front of us was broken into. 
Window smashed. 
In a matter of one hour of eating. 

Just be careful, Might have to take Uber next time. lol :P
but for the restaurant Morlowe... 
Great spot! Thumbs up!
author: Joseph J.

description:
Discovered this spot while looking for a place to dine around 4pm as we were really hungry. Unfortunately, there were very limited items to choose from due to the time. We decided to order the burger. It was good. And the stars are for the burger and the very friendly host that greeted us as we walked in. 

Service was slow even though there was maybe 2 other parties only dining. And the cocktails were not good at all. 

I wouldn't recommend going here in their down time. It's possible they have better options for dinner.
author: Poupie B.

description:
Overall we had a great time at Marlowe. Our service started out really horrible but eventually the food and the change in waitresses saved the night. It is an easy 4-5 stars if not for our experience 

We had a surprise bday with 8 people at the table. 4 of us got there early and wanted to wait for the rest before we ordered. Our original waitress asked if we are gonna wait or not. We said yes. 

5 min later she asked the thing and we said yes we are waiting

She came again all within the 15 minutes, and when we said yes she rolled her eyes and sped off, seeing how upset she was she should have realized it's her fault. She could have just waited for our party to get there - and if that is a problem do not seat us next time until we are all there. You can't have both. 

Eventually she talked to the hostess and we suddenly had a way nicer waitress. She made up in niceness and was great with us. Our original waiter kept working with the new one and not until we mentioned something to someone working there until she starting trying to be nice. 

Now for the food:
Highlights : Poulet vert (very tasty), their burgers , crispy kale chips and duck liver mouse 
The burratta was good too 
Salad designs are good but nothing too spectacular with the ingredients 

Ambiance and decor are great too
author: Jad A.

description:
It's a cute restaurant on the corner of Brannan St. The restaurant accepts reservations by phone or through OpenTable, so definitely reserve your spot before it gets crowded! It was quite crowed the night I went. I was late for my reservation, however, they were able to place me in another table within 10-15mins. Gotta say - it was some good services 

I ordered a few dishes for my table: pork chop, baked oyster, chicken, and yasss THE BONE MARROW!!! The bone marrow was good, def. worth a try!! The pork chop and chicken were good and tasted right. Overall the food was good! I guess the dessert was a little disappointing. The dessert menu did not have much to choose from other than the different flavors of ice cream. I chose the Olive Oil Cake, hoping it would be something surprising. Yes, the cake or perhaps I should call it a muffin, surprised me. The food was great, the 'muffin' marked my disappointment, however I will come back again since the food was pretty good.
author: Michelle H.

description: Excellent hamburger! You must try this. It's different from the typical American hamburger. The meat is fresh and the burger is cooked at the perfect requested temperature.
author: Lisa F.

description:
OVERALL: I finally got to come back for dinner! I was impressed. Food, and especially cocktails, were great.

RESERVATIONS: Made online a week in advance (dinner for 2 on a Saturday at 7pm). Plenty of openings still at that point. 

THE COST: $163 total for a very filling dinner for two (2 drinks, 2 starters, 1 side, 1 huge entree, 1 dessert). A small splurge, but it was worth it for my birthday dinner. 

SERVICE: Heather was super enthusiastic and had this amazing laugh. She described a couple dishes as basically "heaven" and we couldn't help but order them. She also comp'ed one dish, the Grilled Asparagus, which came out at room temp. 

MUST-HAVES: Baked Oyster, Angus Ribeye/

THE FOOD:
BITES
* Baked Oyster ($3.5 each) - 4.5 stars
Incredible, loved the lightly crisped bacon, baked on cheese.

STARTERS
* Grilled Asparagus ($15) - 4 stars
Tasty dish (we got this because our server raved about it), but it came out room temp. They took it back to the kitchen and we were comp'ed the dish.

* Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp ($18) - 4 stars
Nicely done, great texture, love the sauce with a kick of spice.

MAINS
* Angus Ribeye ($39) - 4.5 stars
They split this dish in half for easier sharing, and even half seemed like a ton of food. Not to mention, the meat was fantastic! Very tender, cooked perfectly.

SIDES
* Brown Butter Brussels Sprouts ($9) - 3 stars
So much butter. SO much butter. Also, I prefer more crispy brussels sprouts, and these were very soft & soggy.

DESSERT
* Apple Crisp ($10) - 4 stars
We were stuffed but this was still great. Not too heavy, but still a great crisp mixed in with apple slices. The apple could have been a little more cooked through. 

COCKTAILS
* The Florist ($15) - 4.5 stars
Fanstastic, well-balanced, just the froth could have been thicker and more homogeneous. 

* The Baker ($14) - 4 stars
Not my usual type of drink, but I tried a sip and this wasn't overly strong, had great flavor.

NON-ALCOHOLIC COCKTAILS
* West Bay Sparrow ($7) - 4 stars
Very tasty, refreshing, loved the herby flavors!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
SOOO FREAKN GOOD!! And such a cute quaint ambiance as well! This yummy place sits right at the corner, super easy to find IF the large crowds and herd of ppl don't already get your attention. I've heard of this place for a while and know DINNER gets packed, with reservations usually put out weeks in advance. So we were hoping we'd luck out with happy hour vs. dinner...AND we did! Service was amazing and luckily the beau/I stumbled in around the perfect off-time...therefore had NO wait AND also got to hit multiple items on their happy hour menu!! 


Food talk:

(1) Deviled eggs - one of the best freakn deviled eggs I've ever had. And yes, I maybe be biased - bc I love EGGS, buttttt they were really soooo good!! Nice and warm, perfectly creamy then topped with aged provolone + pickled Jalapeño for a little kick + crispy fatty bacon bits for some meaty flavahhhh!

(2) Brussel sprout chips - crispy, tasty, & so easy to eat!! Lightly salted and seasoned, also somehow perfectly crispy yet not super oily at all! Comes out in a cute little container & pretty much taste just as good as it looks!

(3) Baked oysters - comes out piping hot on a bed of sea salt, 2 tiny oysters but with such big flavor! There was a tad bit too much sauce and seasoning to oyster ratio, but it was still good and not overwhelming. 

(4) Jumbo prawns - BOMB!!! & freakn huge!!! They were not joking about the JUMBO part yooooo...and it comes with 5 juicy pieces, lightly charred to perfection, PLUS a yummy tangy house sauce.

(5) Steak tartare - this was simple and yet also very tasty from all the different components. The steak tartare itself was lightly seasoned and nice tender pieces. The tiny quail egg on top was perfectly poached + arugula for a nice bitterness + tasty olive oil toasty mini baguettes as the perfect eatable spoon. 

(6) Burger - a solid Burger, done clean and simple yet so beautiful. No excessive layers of other meats or fancy traits, just simple quality beef cooked perfectly medium rare and juicy, minced lettuce/caramelized onions/bacon bits + cheese + unique horseradish aioli = a solid banging Burger.

Liabations:

(1) The Baker's wife - super refreshing and def. not light in alchy - just the way I like it!! Really easy to drink and then want to order again & again!
author: Saleen L.

description:
We stopped in here for a quick cocktail before the final Giants game of the season (Booooo Dodgers!) and we were very impressed!

We had The Butcher (a Bloody Mary variant basically) and it was probably the best version of this drink that I've had. Typical Bloody Mary mixes, commercial or prepared in house, tend to have too much of one ingredient or other, but this one was very harmonious without being dull. It's a damn fine drink and it helped us survive what turned out to be kind of a bummer day!
author: Eric B.

description:
How lucky was I to be walking around the area with some time to kill on a random Tuesday and stumble into this place!

The natural lighting, white counter tops, tables, and floor provide an awesome and welcoming vibe from the start. 

The menu was tough, because I was eating by myself. I went with the beef tartare (tartare on any menu seems to have a gravitational pull for me) and the tempura squash dish. Both were nothing short of phenomenal. 

I was riding solo, so I sat at the bar and had a lovely conversation with the bartender Drew. Not only did he constantly make beautiful drinks while answering my incessant questions, but also provided awesome stories, insights, and fun facts about Marlowe and all things foodie. 

Definitely looking forward to exploring more of the menu, and enjoying Marlowe again soon.
author: Michael S.

description:
This place is always busy for good reason! Their food and service are excellent. Whether we are sitting at a table with a group of 6 or at the bar just the 2 of us - the experience is always great. 

Fave food - Brussels chips, boozy shrimp, burger, pork chop

The food is consistent and delicious. Love having Marlowe in the neighborhood!
author: Nic S.

description:
Finally stopped here for brunch after months of hearing great things. I have to say, I'm disappointed. There was nothing particularly interesting or high quality about this rejoined spot. From the menu options to the flavors to the interior design to the service, everything was very mediocre. 

What we ordered: 
The Omelette : while large, it was at best decent. Very standard in terms of the egg base and all the filling were in giant hunks just lazily plopped in between the fold of eggs. 
Grapefruit juice : decent but it didn't taste very fresh. 
Fried egg sandwich : again, solid but nothing to write home about. 

Overall pretty disappointed. Definitely does not deserve the reputation in my option.
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. I was able to make a reservation a week before through OpenTable. I've been to Marlowe one other time for brunch and thought it was pretty good. The restaurant itself was very small, so the tables were super close to each other. However, their candlelight setting did help make the experience a little more intimate. Service was just okay, nothing to complain or praise about. 

We ordered half a dozen oysters to share, and for $3 a piece (market price), these were sad, little oysters. For a fraction of the price, I've had better quality, in terms of size and freshness, elsewhere. The brussel sprout chips (with lemon juice & sea salt) was also a miss; the chips were burnt and bitter. It was also not mixed well enough, some parts were too salty, while others were to sour. The steak tartare was really good. The arugula added a nice kick. I got the pan roasted cod for my main entree, and felt like it was nothing special. It was a little dry in my opinion. My friends got the burger and angus ribeye. The burger was just ok. The ribeye was AMAZING. It was juicy and flavorful; I stole a few pieces off my friend's plate and regret not ordering it myself. 

Also, my friend ordered their Juicer cocktail, without knowing Serrano is a pepper. Boyyyy were we in for surprise. That drink is SPICY. I preferred the Baker's Wife, a more refreshing cocktail with a hint of citrus. 

After factoring in their mediocre, overpriced dishes and average service.. I don't think I'll be back for dinner. However, I'll probably give brunch another try.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I went for both brunch & dinner and this is what i loved about Marlowe!

Dinner menu:
- squid & octopus salad (good portion of the seafood compared to other place's seafood salad)
- baked oysters (regular oysters are also good!)
- jumbo shrimp
- marlowe burger
- cauliflower (served with grilled cheese covered)
- i didn't like the porkchop too much 

Brunch menu:
- french toast (one of the best french toasts i had! Comes in pieces so easy to share :))
- deviled egg sandwich
- marlowe burger 

Notes:
- high ceiling
- not too quiet 
- clean restroom
- some menus overlap but some are totally different
author: Eli K.

description:
Wow, I finally got to try this place over the weekend and left so happy! We arrived around 2pm on Saturday and this place was almost a full house. Unfortunately, they don't have their full menu during this time, but we were only "snacking" anyway. 

Ordered:
x Crispy Brussel Sprout Chips - not as crispy as we were expecting, but SO good. I'd recommend these to anyone.
x Baked Oysters - My boyfie was skeptical about ordering these, but once I read that they were made with clam chowder, I couldn't say no. We both enjoyed 2 each and agreed it tasted like mashed potatoes. But who doesn't like mashed potatoes (I actually know someone who doesn't...)? 
x Little Gem Salad - Perfect amount of crunch. Light, flavorful, and hits the spot. Great salad. 
x Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp - FAVE!!!!! Really enjoyed dipping these in the sauce it came with. So very tender. Savory goodness... please order these! 

We were in an out within 1 hour. Service was quick and friendly. I think it's a GREAT place for drinks/snacks. Loved all the natural lighting and casual vibes. Would come back again if I'm taking Caltrain and need to kill some time :)
author: Anna M.

description:
Marlowe has become a go-to for me in the city. The food is good, I love the decor, and because they take reservations, I tend to bring friends who are visiting to avoid long waits. I've been here for brunch and dinner, and both have been good. 
For brunch, the French toast soldiers are a must. The sauces go well with the French toast, although it can get a bit too sweet so be careful to not dip too much. The doughnuts were delicious and had a good balance of flavors. I love bread so I also ordered the toasted levain, but it was pretty average and wasn't very warm and toasty. For my main I got the Anson Mills Polenta. It was very good for the first half, but then it started to get too heavy with the mushrooms and truffle so I wasn't able to finish it. I also didn't know it would be covered with arugula, which I don't like. 
For dinner, I love the crispy brussels sprout chips and the roasted bone marrow. The chips are addictive and I love the crispiness on the edges of the leaves while still a bit soft in the middle. The bone marrow was so flavorful and delicious paired with the bread. The ribeye was pretty good, but nothing too memorable. 
Although there are some dishes I didn't like or could've been been better, I can't wait to try the other dishes they have to offer. Overall the food is great and I would definitely come here again.
author: Annie L.

description:
I knew Marlowe had to be pretty fantastic considering that there were never any available tables every time I tried to book a reservation. I was excited just to finally get in right at the end of the workday on a Thursday evening.

Service at Marlowe is perfection. The servers practically read your mind. Thinking you may need some more crostini? Before even asking, it's on the table. Food and drinks come out almost too fast, which is about the only negative I can think of. It makes the experience feel a little rushed. 

Food is delicious. My friend and I shared the Crispy Brussels Sprouts Chips, Steak Tartare, Warm Deviled Egg, Mushroom Soup, and Duck Liver Mousse, so got a nice sampling of their menu along with some very good Sangiovese. It's hard to decide what I liked best although I'm already craving those Brussels Sprouts Chips. Taking the time to separate all those Brussels Sprouts leaves makes all the difference in the world, but the process of doing so probably contributes to the heftier prices. I already have cravings for the Warm Deviled Egg as well, which cost $3 for a single half. I probably would have eaten a dozen otherwise!

Although on the pricy side, Marlowe is worth it for the quality of food and service they provide, along with a comfortable and casual decor. I'm hooked and look forward to going back soon.
author: Sheri W.

description: Had high expectations of this restaurant for the amount of reviews it had. We came in and waited about an hour for our food. :/ it wasn't crowded at all and what really made my friends and I upset was that people who came way after us were getting served first. We never complain about food but today was a little outrageous lol. 2 stars since they finally started checking up on us AFTER our food was served.
author: Priscilla J.

description:
Marlowe has yet to disappoint. This is a staple lunch spot as it's walking distance from work.

The brussel sprout chips are a must order. To be healthy I've ordered the chicken dish but I hear that their burgers are one of the "best."  Just don't get the shrimpe sandwich, not good at all.
author: Jerrica N.

description: LEGIT. Walked in for lunch with a party of 6, we got lucky to get seated right away, but were asked if we had reservations so I am guessing they get packed here. Started off by ordering some cocktails, which were nicely crafted with the right amount of alcohol. Half a dozen of oysters which were also good. I ordered the chicken sandwich with a salad and my hubby ordered the burger... we split so we can have a taste of each and I'm glad we did. They were BOTH SO GOOD! Cute establishment here.
author: Nin J.

description: Got together with friends and went to have dinner and from the moment you enter it's super cute decor and chill vibe will have you wondering about the menu and it did not disappoint the food was good I had the deviled eggs and bone marrow and let me tell you it was delish!! Our waiter was patient with our large group and even though all I drink nowadays is vodka presses my friends enjoyed the drinks I enjoyed the names lol if in San Francisco you must try this place
author: Ines F.

description:
You can never go wrong with the Marlowe burger and brussels sprout chips! 

The newer location is a little bit cold in terms of ambiance but the food never disappoints.
author: Farinaz Z.

description: Four of us had dinner on a Saturday night, so we had an opportunity to try a number of different things.  Everything we ordered was excellent.  Service was particularly helpful and accommodating, without being overbearing.  The space is relatively small, so reservations are probably a good idea.
author: Ollie D.

description:
Lucked out and secured a last minute reservation for a business lunch. 

Went for the Marlowe burger which is my go-to with fries and an Anchor Steam Lager. As always, it was amazing.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Ugh this place was just that good! 

Called in first on a Tuesday night to see what the earliest reservation for two was around 6pm. Guess what their earliest was 9:30pm!!! Trust me I believe the hype. 

Decided to walk in and do bar seating since it's on a first come first serve basis. 

Order some wine and beer! Riesling and that wheat based beer is amazing! 

For appetizers, we ordered the Brussels sprout chips and boy were they delicious! Fried and nicely salted with a hint of lemon. Simple but delicious!

Next we order the special oysters! Omg so good. I'll just start this off by saying I've never had oysters prepared with the sauces they provided. Very different but seriously amazing. 

We couldn't resist not ordering their fries and it was just as yummy. 

Now for the BONE MARROW! It was soooooooo good! It was nice a buttery and it paired well with the small pieces of bread, capers, and seasoned cilantro. Amazing! If you do visit, order the bone Marrow!!!

And for the entree we ordered the cod dish and it was delicious. Never had cod prepared with pork belly. But it worked and it tasted super delicious. Def some Asian flavors were coming thru from the pork belly. Tasted like a nice braised pork belly and topped with the cod was making my taste buds dance. 

You can ask them to spilt the portions out for you to share. 

Overall was def a pricey meal but we left super full and happy!
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
I've been to this place once during lunch and once at night. Night time is definitely more poppin and I love the ambience! The music was pleasant and perfect for a trendy but still classy vibe. I got one of their seasonal drinks and it was absolutely delish.

We got the oysters and tbh they were okay. The oysters were a bit small. We got Tartar as well which was pretty good though! The beef was prepared very nicely. Finally, the star...the burger! There's nothin like a Marlowe burger. It's like the "extra burger"...like the huge upgrade from Five Guys or In n out (which I still love cuz it's the best easy classic). The meat is thick (medium rare) and the buns are big and toasty that you need a fork and knife for. The fries are also addicting. 

Overall, food is great, customer service is on point, and ambience is chill and trendy!
author: Megan U.

description:
LOVE this place!

I came here for brunch with a friend for the first time and I was far from disappointed! We sat in their patio area, which was super cute and kind of secluded from the restaurant. Our server was very friendly and timely. We ordered our cocktails: Pimms Cup and the Bakers Wife - both were delicious. For food, I ordered the crab cake benedict and my friend ordered the fried chicken sandwich. We usually split our entrees so we can try more off of the menu and I'm so glad we did! The fried chicken sandwich was beyond words! The chicken was juicy and tender, but had a great crunch on the outside. The benedict was very tasteful also, but I thought the serving was rather small. Besides that, loved the ambience and staff!

Looking at the other reviews, I'd like to come back and try the roasted bone marrow and the brussel sprout chips.
author: Trina N.

description:
I came here on a Saturday evening with a party of 10. The tables were small but intimate so we didn't have to shout to talk to each other. Our server was nice the general service was very good. 

We ordered 4 orders of bone marrow and two orders of brussel sprout chips. I've got to say they were both very good but expensive because the portions were small. Most of our party got the burger and some of us got the pork chop, polenta and chicken. I had the polenta and it was delicious. It was topped with tons of mushroom, arugula and parm. They do not have a large selection on their menu so it was a bit difficult to pick what to eat. I guess its a good thing because a smaller menu means they can do really well on those dishes! They have a bigger selection of drinks than food!

Overall, I'm glad I came to try our their food. The ambiance is really nice and intimate.
author: Joyce S.

description:
I absolutely loved this place! I tried it for the first time for dinner during my recent visit to SF. I showed up without a reservation but they were very accommodating despite being packed. I ended up getting a spot at the bar. Service was wonderful and so was my meal. I didn't think polenta could be ever be this delicious. And The Florist was delightful too. 

Overall, this place is wonderful. If you're staying in the area, this should be your first stop without a question!
author: Macleod R.

description:
Both my boyfriend and I had the day off, and so my present to him prior to Christmas 2016 was a whole day of dates in the city. But then he had to do some work calls in the morning despite his day off so all the plans I had was pushed back. Initially, we planned to head over to Marlowe's for lunch at 11am, but we ended up getting here at 2pm right before they close of lunch. This place is well known for their Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich. So we went ahead and ordered the Chicken Sandwich with a side of salad and another side of fries. The staff here was very sweet to split this simple dish into two. We were not going to order another plate since we had another reservation that evening at 5:30pm prior to the showing of the Nutcracker. 

Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich w/ Salad - $17, the bread/bun was light, fluffy and tasty. The fried chicken was crispy, not oily, and the chicken meat was tender and moist on the inside.
Fries - $7, always a good bet to order!!!
author: Catherine N.

description: It is not far away from where I live, staffs are really friendly and the meal is beyond my expectation. I definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Gabriel C.

description: The hostess and wait staff could not have been nicer. The food was yummy, beautifully prepared and presented. Lovely layering of flavors, surprisingly bold and delicious from start (squash blossom salad) to main course (scallops, corn) to finish (pear crumble), shared by two. Good wine list and knowledgeable waiter. The only problem was the noise. Wow, it was loud on a Weds. nite.The tables are exceptionally close--we had lovely folks at the neighboring table, but when the waiter stopped to talk to them, the waiter's derriere was almost in my face (and it was not a big derriere so you get the idea of how slim the spaces are between tables). There's a thin line between cozy and claustrophobic.
author: Hilarie F.

description:
Marlowe does not disappoint with its meat focused menu, ranging from fresh octopus and scallops to steak and pork. Although price-y, each dish balances its star meat with sides and vinaigrettes perfectly. While the beef burger is complimented by horseradish, the charred octopus and squid salad bursts with freshness complimented by a citrus vinaigrette. 

And to top it off, Marlowe's butcher shop interior somehow makes the meat taste even fresher and juicier. 

I definitely recommend the octopus salad and the seared scallops.
author: Seerat J.

description: Best burger. I always feel bad for going so simple while dining there but it's too good. Also, I highly recommend The Baker cocktail. This is a very cool and always consistent spot if you're in or near the SOMA area.
author: Ian C.

description: Although the hostess was bothered by the fact that we didn't have a lunch reservation for six people at 2pm, we got seated right away. After that silliness, everything from the service to the food was legit. Had the oysters for appetizer, oh so good. Had the marlowe burger and fried chicken sandwich- the best. Their fries are delicious too. They also have a great cocktail menu. This place is legit. Make a reservation if you want to please the hostess but get here.
author: Jay H.

description: Brussels sprout chips, oh how I love you. Simple but delicious. The servers here have always been friendly. Their burger is one of my favorites. These are my favorites, I've tried several other dishes on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. The cocktails are always tasty.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Ordered: bone marrow, beef tartare, raw oysters, Brussels sprouts, pork chop, ribeye, apple crisp

Food: Everything was good but nothing really stood out to me. My favorite dish that we ordered was the raw oysters. They were super fresh and sweet. My least favorite were the Brussels sprouts since it was a little on the burnt side to me. 

Service: Service was attentive and friendly. Food came out at a good pace (not too long and not everything at once)
author: Chelsea H.

description: Bright and trendy restaurant located in SOMA off Brannan.  Wonderful innovative cocktail menu, delicious combinations of ingredients and booze!  Great selection of small plates and appetizers, fresh oysters were great, grilled octopus and squid salad was delicious and fresh/lemony, grilled prawns were seasoned perfectly and grilled to perfection. Brusselsprouts chips were crunchy and delish with a hint of lemon and sea salt. Asparagus was a great dish. Service was excellent
author: Rhondi S.

description:
This place was so awesome. Is small but you still don't feel cramped. It is nice and bright inside. The staff and host were very nice and the manager actually replaced one of our meals with another and did not charge use because there was some small bones in the chicken. 

The burger was delicious  and had excellent flavor and so did the daily special which was a spanish dish with a crunchy shell and beef (see picture). I will definable come back and recommended anyone to come and try.
author: Douglas H.

description:
This establishment exceeded my expectations with their service. The burgers were amazing, and the staff was very accommodating.

Both managers made sure we were taken care of and the staff, including Sarah and Shannon, was very kind.

Thank you :-)
author: Semani Y.

description: I've been going to Marlowe for years now, and find the food, service, and the overall experience fantastic.  I have always recommended this restaurant to friends and family and will continue to do so.
author: Miriam K.

description:
I really wanted to LOVE everything i ate here but was a tad disappointed with the foood. I've been wanting to eat here since forever. Finally came here on Tuesday and was a bit disappointed with the taste of the food. There was no wow factor to anything. 

My bf and I got the baked oysters, Brussels sprouts chips, fries, bone marrrow, and fish entree. Food wasn't bad, it was just mediocre, nothing too special. My favorite was the baked oysters and then the bone marrow.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots in Mission Bay! The menu is constantly changing and it is super fun to go with friends and just share the appetizers or entrees so that you can try it all. 

The oysters are fantastic as is the burrata bruschetta. I also love love love their brussel sprout chips! The cocktails are fun and delicious and they have a nice wine selection. It is definitely a nice spot to just go have a nice dinner by yourself as well. The bartenders and wait staff are always super friendly. 

The restaurant itself is super cute and not hard to find. Definitely worth checking out if you are in the area.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I came here for an early bday dinner with my friends.  We had a small fiasco regarding seating because i had booked for 9 ppl, but an extra 3 people came so we needed a table for 12. 

They were able to accommodate us and we only had to wait about 30 min.  The restaurant is tiny, it looked alot larger in the pictures.  We were seated in the patio outside which was great because it was alot more private. 

I ordered a (the baker) rye cocktail which was fruity and sweet. We all ordered different dishes so I was able to try almost their entire menu. My favorite was the polenta, and the pork chop. The polenta was cheesy and a great portion sized. The pork chop was massive and had a bunch of fatty pieces which I loved!!!!!! Usually pork chops are so dry and gross. The fat made it extra yummy. 

We also ordered the burrata, steak tartare, and bone marrow. I liked the bone marrow the best, the burrata was already spread on the bread which I didnt like. The steak tartare was way too salty. 

Get the pork chop && polenta & must make reservations.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Had an amazing experience at Marlowe this Saturday!
We went here for brunch - we had made a reservation in advance and were a big group of 10! 

The service was impeccable and very accommodating. We had a number of cocktails and they were all very delicious and balanced.

Food was awesome as well. Had the citrus appetizer, pancakes and polenta main course - everything was fantastic.

Will definitely we coming back!
author: Namrata J.

description: Mmmmmmm-arlowe. Yup, starts with that yummy goodness. I walked in and was instantly impressed and enveloped into the low lighting mystique of it all. Felt like my Monday evening got a lot more enchanting quickly. I sat at the bar as I was traveling solo for biz and did a quick intake of things being ordered and the polenta made me do a double take. I walked in fully intending on ordering a meat dish of some kind and scraped that idea in a flash once I laid my eyes on bowl of polenta perfection, aptly dressed by a broken poached egg yolk and getting chummy with wild mushrooms, Parmesan cheese, and peppery arugula to keep things bright. Damn. This was goooooood. And I have to say, the Brussels sprouts chips may have been the best I've ever had. I wish I order a double batch. Sheesh. This place is freaking tasty. Wish I could justify all my meals here in one trip, but alas, gotta try some other wonders. But I'll be back next time I'm in town!
author: Alicia C.

description:
Made reservations for a group dinner and we were seated promptly. The place was smaller than we expected and dimly lit, but looked cute and classy.

For drinks, I liked the Baker's Wife - really refreshing and sweet! Also tried the Lavender Gin Fizz (which has egg whites in it!), but wasn't a huge fan since it started tasting more and more like soap with each sip.

For food:
- the Sweet Corn Soup was surprisingly good! I didn't think corn soup could be so tasty, but the creamy consistency and slight sweetness was a dream.
- the Crispy Brussel Sprout Chips are addicting and almost melts in your mouth.
- the Marlowe Burger is a must-try, something about their horseradish aioli takes the burger up a notch. It comes with a side of salad or fries, and both are really good as well.

Despite the good food, I was a bit disappointed in the service. Servers weren't very friendly and seemed irked that a couple people from our group arrived late.
author: Winnie N.

description:
Marlowe is my jam and I can't believe I'm just now reviewing it. I've been coming here regularly whenever I'm craving delicious, French-American style food and Marlowe is consistently good. It's the total package-nice ambiance, solid food and cocktails and good service, and this place is my go to restaurant for any any visitors/friends. They get really busy but you can usually get in with a short wait and they have abundant reservations. 

My favorites-
Bone marrow-so indulgent with toasted bread, the fresh herbs and salsa verde cut the richness

Marlowe burger and fries-one of my favorite burgers in SF. Get the horseradish on the side if you want to control the level of fire in your nose and sinus clearing. Fries are thin and crispy, like upgraded McDonald's. 

Crispy brussels sprout chips are tasty.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Omg love the bartender Drew is bad ass.  Friday lunch.  Drew's custom cocktails!!!!   We come for Drew
author: May M.

description:
We went here for brunch before a Giants game and it was the perfect choice! We had a reservation but the wait didn't seem too long for Sunday early afternoon. As far as drinks go, the juicer and pimms cup were both great. I loved the jalapeño in the juicer. We started with the deviled eggs and french toast soldiers. Both are a must! The polenta was great, it's nice that it comes with lots of greens. The cod and shrimp Benedict was also amazing! Perfectly crispy. This amount of food was perfect for two people and we'll definitely be back! 

Ps my SF food instagram is @anctheory
author: Lauren A.

description: Came here for brunch on Sunday around 1 and loved it!! The food and ambiance are both great. The only thing was that we waited a bit long for our food (~30min) but it was worth it
author: Megan H.

description:
Great hamburgers but lunch time service was unacceptably slow and the prices were too high. 
4 regular hamburgers and 4 sodas took 1 and half hours since we sit down until we left and it costed 121 dollars.
author: Tomas A.

description:
I liked this place before. My recent visit though, not so much. 

We ordered: 
Brussel sprout chips - too greasy and very little substance
Deviled eggs - great flavor 
Baked oysters - more potato like than oyster flavored
Hamachi crudo - definitely tried too hard to make this a fusion, dislike
Marlowe burger (medium rare) - very little meat and almost soggy like texture 

Definitely not a place I would recommend again.
author: Marlene T.

description:
Yum, very solid new American restaurant right down the street from my house!

Maybe that's influencing my review a little, but the food has always been great every visit.  Marlowe has a great selection of smaller dishes that are perfect for sharing, like the duck liver mousse or the bone marrow.  The sides are hard not to order, I always end up getting brussel sprouts and fries.  And the entrees are tasty too, you pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the dinner menu.  

Service is top notch, the hostess offered me a seat outside but when I said I was worried about the cold she told me she'd take me there to try it out first and would re-seat me any time I got too cold.  I'm a weather weenie, so I appreciated the gesture!  (The outside patio is covered and has a pretty strong heater going, so I was able to bear the cold.)

Tips and Tricks
-Maybe walk to another place for desserts, what I've had (apple crisp and cookies) hasn't really impressed me
-Really great options for vegetarians
-Went at 6pm on a Saturday and was able to snag a table for 2
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here for my friends birthday brunch. Greatttttt experience. The food was very good. I split the chicken sandwich, the Marlowe burger and the juevos ranchero. I enjoyed them in that order as well. The chicken sandwich was very good. Top 5 I have had. The burger was also very good. The meat was tender and it was a good combination of flavors. Top 15 burgers I have had.

The drinks were 10-15 dollars but generous portions (see pics). A wide variety for many different taste preferences.

The service is also really good--friendly and efficient. We had Matthew and he was a great waiter. Definitely recommend requesting him if you can.

Negatives are that it is a little pricey and that they don't give a complimentary desert for a birthday...
author: Ezra B.

description:
I have been meaning to come to Marlowe since I moved to SF 2 years ago and finally had the opportunity to go for brunch this past Sunday with a friend. We were lucky to get in without a wait and to sit at the bar at 11AM on Sunday. This restaurant is very cute and minimalist with every aesthetic detail thought out. While I was waiting for my friend, I ordered a cup of coffee (which is steep at $5) which came in a Le Cruset mug that I didn't even know existed.

When my friend finally arrived, we ordered the following off of their Brunch menu:

-Housemade Doughnuts ($10): These came in a huge portion and were REALLY good, even after they had cooled a bit. They came with this delicious house made jam (perhaps raspberry?) that complimented the cinnamon sugar really well. This was definitely the favorite item of Brunch though I am not sure how hard this is to actually prepare...

-Pork Shank and Potato Hash ($15): This was mine and it was pretty good. The portion was also substantial but the flavors felt very boring. I have had better but overall, solid.

-Marlowe Burger ($18): This is what my friend got and she subbed the fries for a salad. I tried the burger and it was good. My friend seemed happy with the salad however she wasn't thrilled that the burger had Horseradish on it (she missed it on the menu). Portion was also large.

In addition to this, we each had a Mimosa ($13) which was good but again, I think the price is steep considering some of their "speciality" brunch cocktails are that much or a dollar more. 

All in all, Marlowe was good but didn't blow my mind. When all was said and done, we ended up sending $40pp on Brunch which is somewhat steep but not unheard of. The portions were large and the food was well-prepared. Sitting at the bar, I can't really comment on service. I think Marlowe is a great option if you need to be near Caltrain for some reason but I am not running back. There are too many other good options in town, especially at the price point.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Swung by for a late lunch/early dinner and had a GREAT experience here. The service was spot on - the food was AMAZING and the entire experience reminds me of why we love places like Marlowe. 

We had the Marlowe Burger and it was tasty, cooked properly and came with yummy fries. The bar menu Prawns.. so good. The Corn Soup .. probably the best soup I've EVER had. 

Cocktails were well balanced, bar service was terrific and the desserts were the perfect end to a  great experience. 

If you like a neighborhood bar feel - with top notch food.. GO HERE!
author: Marilyn D.

description: Marlowe was great for brunch! My friend and I made a reservation a couple hours in advance on a Saturday and had no problems getting a reasonable time. The service and food was great! We ordered the crispy chicken sandwich that came with an amazing aioli sauce as well as the cod and shrimp Benedict! It would be great if the Benedict came with some type of bread. Also the regular coffee and cup of pineapple juice seemed a bit overpriced -- $5 each. Other than that, the prices for the dishes seemed reasonable and the quality of the food was great!
author: Piyali B.

description:
When it comes to aesthetic, service, and of course the menu Marlow is a solid spot for brunch on a Saturday morning, or probably any other day too. I came about 15 minutes early than my reservation, but once I checked in they seated me right away and brought me menus/water to look over while I was waiting for my friend. 

I like how their menu is simple and limited to one page. It's always tough for me when there's too many options haha. But even though the menu is simple everything looks so tasty that it's still hard to decide!

| AMBIANCE | 

It was my first time here and I thought it did get a little loud, but wasn't too loud to the point where I couldn't have a conversation with the person across from me. This place gets packed on the weekend but as you wait you can hit up the bar for some drinks to pass the time and grab a seat at one of their benches outside. 

| WE GOT | 

- Pimms Cup - SO REFRESHING. I've been a fan of Pimms since I studied abroad and I will always get Pimms if it's on the menu. For $13 it does seem a little steep, but the cup is huge and the one drink lasted the entire brunch. It pairs so well with the ginger beer, cucumber, and lemon that it doesn't even taste like alcohol. Dangerous? Probably. 

- Doughnuts - Lemon/ricotta over everything. There's something about this combo that is soo good to me that I try anything that has the two paired together. Lucky for me it seems like many people do the same because these doughnuts were brought to almost every table that was around me which was a good sign. The doughnuts were denser than what you would expect out of one, but it wasn't too heavy or oily either. It had a nice balance and paired great with the tartness of the jam. They come 5 to an order and were perfect to share between 2 people. 

- Potato Hash - My friend really enjoyed this dish because the meat was so tender and potatoes crispy. I'm not sure if this is something that i'd order for myself because i'm not a huge fan of the greens on the side but it's a good option to try. 

- Marlowe Burger - Def try this! The burger was cooked medium and the onions caramelized to perfection. They had a ton of bacon but my only peeve was that it was overcooked and tasted a little dry. Other than that the fries were crispy and paired well with the burger. 

***The doughnuts came out within 10 minutes, but the food took a while longer to get to the table so if you order them I would say to tell them to bring it to the table as it's ready vs when everything else is cooked. 

| SERVICE | 

The staff here is so friendly! Throughout our entire meal they always made sure we had what we needed and made sure our waters were filled. It was easy to get their attention and the check so no complaints here. But other than that they were open to sharing their recommendations and chatting it up with me as I was waiting for my friend.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Amazing! I've sampled most items from the dinner menu. Favorites:
(1) Burger: got it medium rare and was so juicy
(2) Chicken dinner: tender, flavorful and the side greens are so rich
(3) Fruit juice mixtures

Not as keen about the polenta because it was a bit tart for my taste buds.

Beautiful and romantic atmosphere, fast/friendly service, & the price-to-portion size ratio is great for an SF restaurant of this quality.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I cannot with this place anymore and their exorbitant prices. I also hated the previous CoCo500 that used to be here. I came here for lunch one day and had a great time. Came here for dinner again and honestly it was a little too much. $150 for dinner for two is just sooooo extra. There is just nothing special that stands out about this place to justify the cost, there are a lot of other restaurants I'd rather spend my money on and have the time of my life.
