Finally, we had the bone marrow, which came with grilled baguettes, salsa verde, and cilantro. While I'm not the hugest bone marrow fan, I did appreciate this dish for its decadent, silky texture and deep flavor.

For the main course, I ordered the famous Marlowe burger, and it was definitely my favorite dish of the night! The burger came on a soft bun and had the perfect amount of crispy bacon and creamy aioli on the inside; this was perhaps one of the best gourmet burgers I've had, and the fries that came on the side were also unbelievably crispy and flavorful (though make sure to eat them when they're still warm!). We told the waiter that three of us were splitting the burger, and it was even cut up for us before it was brought to our table! Such a nice touch. In addition to the burger, I also had the black cod entrée--the fish was nice and flaky, and the accompanying vegetables and potatoes were delicious as well, but the real kicker was the coconut broth the dish came with, which had great flavor and was perfect for dipping with bread.

Nothing on the dessert menu jumped out at me, so I skipped, but overall, Marlowe was a fantastic restaurant with well-prepared, well-executed dishes. The service was quick, but my only complaint was that our waiter didn't seem to know the menu particularly well. Nevertheless, I would highly recommend this restaurant if you're in the area.
author: David K.

description: It was perfect for the moment. My boyfriend loved the Rye Bay steak Salad. It was a good portion, fresh and healthy.
author: Rosmery S.

description:
Food was delicious and service excellent. I had the rock shrimp roll with fries and "the butcher's wife" cocktail. Fries were hot and crispy, shrimp roll was bursting with fresh and savory flavor. The cocktail, although no my intention, really complimented the roll- very light summer sweet with citrus- thumbs up to mixologist.

To be honest, I could easily repeat that whole meal right now!
author: V R.

description: Cute tiny place. It wasn't super busy when my boyfriend and I went. We were quickly seated at the bar. The bartender was fantastic! Friendly and quick. We ordered the non alcoholic beverages which were amazing, I could've sat at the bar and drank that all day. I ordered the burger and the boyfriend ordered the chicken sandwich. It looked like it was cooked to perfection, as he said "crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside." He loves his sandwich and fries so much he practically inhaled it. As for my burger, it was so delicious! The meat was cooked perfectly and every bite was like butter. The bun was not soggy, perfect amount of greens so it did not come spilling out, and the meat was just the perfect size. I might say it might be the best burger iced tasted so far.
author: Mey S.

description:
Hip environment and even at 9 PM on a Sunday night the place was sprawling. Started off with a dozen of oyster that my friend and I shared; although I loved the oysters themselves coming straight from Washington, they were served with a horseradish vinaigrette that had this smokey flavor which took away from the oysters.

Next, wanted to have some of that lovely burrata and so we did. However, it turned out it wasn't served straight up like one with think of a traditional burrata but instead it was spread on f.o.u.r. slices of thick bread. This made the portion massive and for my friend who never had burrata before there was no chance he got to experience how the inside would run down on the plate when making a cut on the soft cheese...

As a main, we went with black cod. Chef had prepared it with plenty of cream in the sauce and that was also where all the flavors were. It was alright. We had it with a serving of brussels crisps which again was tasty but way too greasy.

In summary, this is not a good place for food. If you're after a cocktail and some people watching, I'd consider. Staff was lovely and although we placed our wrong order with asparagus instead of brussels sprouts (yes my friend cannot seem to differentiate between the two...), they without questioning came out with the brussels sprouts which was what we originally wanted.
author: Linn L.

description:
This review is solely based on brunch. The burger and fried chicken sandwich here unfortunately just didn't live up to the hype. The burger patty was thin and at medium rare, not particularly juicy or flavorful. The fried chicken sandwich also wasn't as crispy on the outside and as tender on the inside as a place like this (i.e., with this level of hype and this price point) should deliver. Was also disappointed that the bun tasted a bit cold and stale - lightly buttered toasted buns should be mandated with all fried chicken sandwiches.

The upsides though - Marlowe is able to accommodate reservations for large groups for brunch, a rarity in SF.  The ambience (bright lighting, open space, rustic décor, white tiled walls) and service (attentive, accommodating, and didn't rush us despite being a very large group during prime brunch time) are great.
author: Jen H.

description: Came back after seven years for brunch and the food continues to be amazing both sweet and savory. Got the deviled egg, the cod benedict, a non alcoholic cocktail and for sweets we got the doughnuts and the bread with butter. Everything was perfect, excellent service. The coffee was really good too.
author: Guillermo M.

description:
Solid 4.5 stars for wonderful food and very good and friendly service. 

I had read so much about this place and it showed up on everyone's recommended places to eat list for this area that we had to get to it fast. So, we decided to go here at the first reason for celebration that we could think of, and we walked back home satisfied and happy. I would recommend making reservations as this place might be full even on a weekday, and especially on weekends and days when there is a Giants game. 

Nearly everything that we tried was amazing and I already have a list of things to try next time around. Amongst the things that we tried these are the ones that I would recommend without a doubt:
Drink: 
The Baker: Rye Whisky, aperol, grapefruit, lemon and honey.... amazing drink. Very refreshing and wonderful for preparing for the meal. 
Food:
Deviled Eggs: amazing flavors... these are a must try if you can eat and enjoy the bacon. I think it will always be on my order when I go here. 
Roasted Bone marrow: scrumptious and heavy but worth every bite. Use the sauce and greens to make the taste complete. Also, get some extra bread to enjoy the oil that drips down from the marrow. Dip it and enjoy..
Marlowe Burger: their namesake burger is very tasty and well made. Both of us were sharing the burger so they actually cut the burger into halves as they brought it to us. As others have mentioned, it was slightly on the saltier side for me also. But, if you like it slightly salty then this is definitely for you. The fries with the burger were very good, thin cut and crispy. 
Beer Battered Asparagus: deep fried asparagus with spicy aioli. You can't go wrong with it. I would recommend having this before the dishes with so much flavor as it is more basic in taste. If you don't want to eat too much you can even skip this one as the other dishes are slightly better than this one. 

The server, Johnny, was also amazing and made wonderful recommendations. Enjoy the nice ambience and wonderful food.
author: Nipun S.

description:
All I will say about this place is... BONE MARROW. Omg the BONE MARROW is amazing. The other food was good as well, but in comparison to the bone marrow, nothing compares. 
I know its not worth coming here just for the bone marrow, and I had the burger for the main meal, but i would just sit talk and munch on bone marrow if I could :) They also give you the bone to go if you ask nicely!
author: Justin S.

description:
Finally made it to Marlowe after having plans fall through at least twice.

We made a reservation for 5:30pm on Sunday the day before. Service was super friendly! We didn't get our waitress's name but she was SO lovely and attentive and definitely contributed to a great dinner experience.

I came with a friend and we got the steak tartare and burrata to start, and shared the eponymous Marlowe burger. 

The steak tartare had a nice texture and had a subtle kick to it. It was topped with a poached egg, which was fine, but it was difficult to mix together since the whites were cooked. Still tasty all around but not exceptional compared to other places.

We loved the burrata and burger! Firstly, the burrata was BEAUTIFUL. It was more like a tartine than a ball of burrata that most restaurants serve. The crusty wheat bread that was surprisingly savory, topped with really creamy and fresh burrata, beautiful heirloom tomatoes, a balsamic reduction, some microgreens, and sea beans. The seabeans seemed a bit disjointed from the dish but it was still SO GOOD.

The burger was phenomenal--the bun looked a bit weirdly like Safeway bakery bread but it worked well with the burger. Didn't notice too much of the cheese and onions (definitely saw they were there) but maybe the flavors just paired well together? Fries were delicious (but I mean, all fries are), and the garlic aoli was really addictive.

We split the blueberry trifle for dessert. The cream element was subtly moscato flavored but was a bit runny for my liking. Flavors were good but I wish the consistency was less liquidly. There was some nice crunch from the cookie crumble topping and I just wish there was more of it.

For drinks, they had a nice sweeter white option (the chenin blanc) which was fruity and floral. The cocktails looked beautiful too, especially the lavender one!
author: Tina X.

description:
In 2 words: thoroughly impressed. From start to finish, I have nothing but great things to say about this gem of a place. Having been bookmarked for ages, I FINALLY got a chance to come thru w/my bf for dinner for our 3.5 year anni! Initially nervous that I needed reservations, I was surprised that we got seated right away. It was a bustling weeknight for a restaurant that's hidden in a corner of a rather silent neighborhood. (That's how you know it must be good!) 

Atmosphere - Intimate, the type of place to have a niiiice dinner with a friend or a date (a little on the loud side, but not ridiculous) The bar area was beautifully lit and I love the decor. The lights may be leftover from Christmas but it's still very pretty. I love the imprint of the cows w/the type of cuts in the bathroom haha.

Service - Incomparable! Our server (and the servers in general) are all so attentive and great. Between each meal, they change the plates and utensils and give the table a wipe down. Water is always filled. You'll never be thirsty and you'll never have to flag someone down. Such service, much happy.

Fo0o0od! - Reasonable and Delicious! We ordered Steak Tartare, Bone Marrow, Ribeye steaks, and Vanterin (?) Are the starters worth it? Absolutely! You can tell they put a lot of thought in their food. Passionate chefs make amazing food. Steak Tartare is served with a poached quail egg on top a bed of arugula and crisp crostini. You get 2 bone marrows with a side of seasoned cilantro, capers, and fresh, warm crostini. Bone marrow, melt in your mouth buttery. Most of it has dripped onto the little cast iron bowl, but just soak it up with the bread. Ribeye, Holy Proportion! Huge, tender, moist piece of perfect medium rare steak atop a bed of greens and porcini mushrooms and 2 small truffled baked potatoettes. You can immediately smell the umami from the dish and everything complemented each other well. Whatever dessert was, was also muy bueno. Originally wanting the apple crisp, (they ran out), I was not disappointed w/this choice. Coffee ice cream on top of a light meringue crisp drowned in chocolate and almonds. My stomach thanks me.

TL; DR why are you still reading? GO! :)
author: Emily M.

description:
This place is awesome!!!!!

It doesn't matter if you come here of brunch or for dinner. The food is always delicious, and drinks and wine is even better. What a great place for either date night or just with friends.

Thank you for making me a happy Jew!!
author: David F.

description: Amazing customer service! Ana made sure that my reservations was set for only 2 ppl. Hrs later I decided to make it 5 person reservation and she made that happen! I was celebrating my girlfriends birthday and made everything simple and warming! They greeted her with a birthday greeting and just had an amazing service from everyone! Bone marrow on point! Ribeye was delicious! You definitely will see us again! Thank you so much Ana and team!
author: Jordan M.

description:
The brussels sprout chips
Can still taste it, so tasty
Like everything else
author: Haiku Revue X.

description: I live in the neighborhood and am consistently disappointed by the service at Marlowe. Yesterday I  walked in to grab drinks and snacks around 4:30 pm- it was not busy at all yet the host gave me a hard time about sitting at a table and finishing up before 6pm reservations. We were on our way out around then anyway, but the server rushed us out by simply bringing us the check without asking if we were done. I've also tried to pop in for food on off hours during the week night and I consistently get attitude at the host stand. Burgers and food are decent, but not worth the sub par rude service.
author: Hannah P.

description:
Excellent chicken sandwich. Great service. 10/10 - Highly recommend.

The also play Lauryn Hill - so they also have excellent taste in music.
author: Daniel B.

description: Great burger and mushroom soup. It's the bomb!!! I don't know what is their trick to make the bun so soft and chewy and the patty to be juicy. My one complaint is that the patty needs a little of salt. Definitely will come back again!!
author: Willy S.

description: I went here today for a company lunch and really enjoyed my experience. My waiter was really nice and the wait staff always refilled my water seconds after I finished it. The food was tasty too and had a very unique flavor. It is pretty pricey though so be ready to spend around $30 per person if you want to leave full. Overall good experience just wish the music was louder since the talking / echoing in the room is pretty loud.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Such good food and the cutest atmosphere!  I've been here twice and the waitstaff has always been very accommodating of large groups. I would recommend trying to make a reservation though because they can get quite busy. 

I've had the burger and one of the scrambles - both great!
author: Rachel W.

description: Bright and friendly restaurant with innovative menu. Very impressed with the wait staff. Absolutely loved the clam chowder baked oysters and fried butternut squash in particular. I would skip the cauliflower side dish. Way more cheese than cauliflower and it congealed super quickly.
author: Joanne L.

description:
Visited San Francisco over a weekend. It was a late Saturday evening and we had no reservations. Came here on a whim with my boyfriend fully expecting to be turned away. Surprisingly we only waited for 10 minutes before a spot opened up. Unfortunately, the tables are REALLLLY tight and cramped next to each other. It's so awkward because you can hear every conversation next to you. My advice if you're bringing a date here? Sit at the bar. 

The food here isn't fine dining. I wold describe it as casual food with a nice presentation. Some items were either a hit or miss. Expect prices on the higher end. We ordered the cripsy brussel sprouts since everyone recommended it on Yelp. It had a nice crispy texture but the bitter aftertaste was not my favorite. The baked oysters were also highly recommended but was on the saltier side. I did not particularly enjoy it even though I normally love any kind of of oyster dish. However, I enjoyed the duck liver mousse and Poulet vert. 

We skipped dessert. 

The ambience was nice but on the louder side just fyi. It was a nice place to try out once but I don't think I hurry back anytime soon.
author: Ida C.

description:
Let me start off by saying I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience, food ambiance and all. But what made this dinner extra memorable was the 10-12 year old boy sitting next to us with his grandiose taste for food. He ordered bone marrow and sent it back because it wasn't cooked correctly, it was such a kick to watch this entire transaction! Ok, back to the food. 

Food:
Angus Ribeye- excellent in flavor but was a bit fatty. I'd give it a 4/5 

Grilled Marin sun farm pork chop- my God! I absolutely loved this pork chop, this has got to be one of my favorite dishes I've ever order. Everything was so delicious and cooked to perfection!  5/5

I went for my birthday and the waitress brought out a cookie with a candle, such a sweet gesture. And the cookies was also very good. 

Ambiance: 
I was able to have an intimate dinner, the place is dimly lit giving it a sexy, sleek feel. I loved the all white tiles, very clean and modern. Great for date nights, birthdays, anniversaries, or drinks!
author: Jesus L.

description:
Enjoyed beer with tasty dishes at this little amazing restaurant
.it has got good sitting space and ot makes and enlightning view at night with dim lights in restaurant.
Dishes which i ordered were sprouts chips, burger,pork chop with beer.
Good place to meet up and socialise..but can be more better .
author: Eva G.

description: Meh. This is an overhyped place you can skip. We ordered oysters, eggs Benedict, chicken sandwich, and veg omelette. Here's a tip to the shucker: if you tear the oyster into 3 pieces and they're small babies to begin with, toss it and serve another. The Benny was totally disappointing, with the shrimp and smoked cod totally lost in breading and a fully cooked egg. The chicken sandwich was alright. The veg omelette look curiously deep fried. The bacon should have a warning--it's more pork belly than bacon with a soft texture, my dining mate took one bite and was done. The service was sorely lacking--it should've been taken off the bill, it wasn't. The drinks were the only high point. This place is way over priced. And, don't look up. The after thought sound proofing is disgusting. Pass.
author: James S.

description: Classy white interior. Friendly service. Everything we tried was great. That includes brussels sprouts chips, fava bean hummus, zucchini flower salad, the polenta, and definitely the burger. Good selection of cocktails, wines, and beers.
author: Richard K.

description: Marlowe was a great atmosphere, a small establishment with a friendly staff and excellent service. It seemed a little less touristy than some of the other places we visited and we really enjoyed that. Being pregnant, it was an extra touch that they had a few non-alcoholic cocktails to choose from. We each had a deviled egg and shared the bone marrow for an appetizer. The deviled eggs were different than any we'd ever had, in a good way. Served warm, the cheese, bacon and filling complimented each other well. Neither of us had ever had bone marrow, and we weren't disappointed. It was a rich flavor and paired perfectly with the salsa verde and herbs. My husband had the Blacksmith and it was a very good mixture of flavors. You could taste the sweet and the pepper. For an entree, we shared the burger. The fries were perfectly crisp and the burger was juicy.
author: Ciara D.

description:
Came here for dinner with friends around the holidays. We arrived in time, but we still had to wait for a bit. Sat at the bar, got a couple drinks while waiting for out table. Small menu, thanks for limiting my choices :) since we wanted to try almost the entire menu, we decided to share everything. The tables are a little small to accommodate all of the dishes and our own plates. The staff was great, very attentive! Since the restaurant is on the small side, and very full (bc the food is great) it was a little loud. 

I forget what exactly we ordered, but my favorite by far was the polenta! Other dishes included the bone marrow (it was still a little pink, which the waitress said it was normal), the duck (or chicken?) liver, burger, Brussel sprout chips (was burned), burrata, deviled eggs, and the pork chop. We were so full after dinner that we did not have space for dessert, unfortunately.
author: Anna Y.

description:
We decided to join our new friends here for lunch. Luckily, they were able to change the reservations and add us to their table since we were running a bit late. The decor is very clean and modern! This restaurant wasn't too busy, but once we started eating, a lot of people were trickling in during their lunch break. 

We shared the crispy brussel sprout chips, poulet vert, deviled egg sandwich, and the smokey baked cauliflower. Everything was very tasty! The brussel chips were perfect for snacking on before the rest of our food arrived. The chicken was not dry at all and I loved the green sauce it came with. The baked cauliflower was similar to a mac and cheese dish and was yummy as well. The sandwich was pretty small and my least favorite out of all the items we ordered. Service was fast and friendly too! I wouldn't mind coming back to try their other dishes!
author: Dung N.

description:
Have been waiting to try this place in my quest to find the best burger in town and this one is pretty darn close! We started off with some kale chips which were delicious and then got right to our Marlowe burger! I subbed my side of fries for the smoked baked cauliflower and we also got a side of Brussels sprouts. 
The cauliflower was so delicious and tasted just like a mac and cheese! The Brussels sprouts were just ok and the fries were a little too salty for my taste. 
The burger itself was delicious! With a brioche bun which I wish was toasted, perfectly cooked patty and delicious aioli! They are pretty heavy handed with the aioli so if you're not a fan I would ask for them to go light. 

We finished off our meal with the strawberry shortcake which was good and the coffee ice cream which was just delightful with the best meringue I have ever had! 

I take away one star for the salty fries, small tables and price point but great place to come for a special occasion or if you are on a burger quest like me!
author: Rachel N.

description:
I've loved this place for quite a while.  The burrata prosciutto toast, the french toast dumplings, the burgers....they are all mouth watering; however, what has happened to the service? 

We most recently came in on Sunday, and the waitress was lackluster, for lack of a better word.  About 5 minutes after receiving the French toast, I was clearly still eating, but she started clearing the plates.  I let her know I'm still working on it and she took the serving plate but left me with the syrup cups... pretty tacky if I say so myself.

Seemed a little too busy for us despite making a reservation... maybe we ought to try somewhere else moving forward.
author: Meaghan H.

description: The praise and crowd never seems to die down for Marlowe, but for good reason. They have kept up the quality and service, and the menu is sheer perfection. We were lucky to get a reservation for our group of friends, but it should be easier as a couple (great date night resto), and is highly recommended. The burger is their calling card, but I would recommend coming with a group to be able to get every single one of their delicious starters. The cocktails are also well-crafted to go with the food, but pricey at $14 or $15 each. Marlowe is more of a treat than a regular destination, as you're probably spending $50 - $60 for a starter/main/tip, but you won't be disappointed.
author: Cat N.

description:
I came here for lunch with a friend and it was relatively packed. We were seated at the bar, and was attended to relatively quickly. Service was pretty good, although our server knocked over my water glass and spilt water all over the bar top including on the iPhone of the person sitting next to me. (Hoping her phone is ok!) She didn't seem too apologetic and another server had to apologize for her. 

Let's talk about the food:
We had the brussel sprouts for a starter (not the brussel sprouts chips) and they were tasty, I enjoyed and approved. I order the shrimp roll and this was terrible. Flavors weren't bad but there was so much juice from the slaw that my bread started to fall apart. Quarter way through my meal, I had a pool of juice that was drenching my side of fries and made my meal so so unpleasant. Minus one star for my food. My friend ordered the rib eye salad and I wish I had gotten that instead. I had a bite and I loved it. 

Overall, not too impressed but I'll probably come back to try their happy hour and give them another chance.
author: Susan P.

description:
Came for lunch around 2pm on a Friday right before game time. No real wait even though the place was packed.

The drinks were strong, service was solid, and food hit the spot. My girlfriend is gluten free, and there were many options. We had the baked oysters, Brussel sprout chips, fries, and burrata. All yummy.
author: Michael S.

description:
Service: excellent! 

Wine selection: excellent! A good still Rosé is all I require. 

Appetizer: excellent! The burrata starter is so good. 

Burger: Meh. Extremely salty. Would have sent it back but I just thinking the next bite would be better. Had such high hopes for the horseradish aioli, but it tasted like salt in spreadable form. Fries were better, but nothing to write home about. 

Dessert: excellent! The apple crisp was delightful and perfectly portioned for 2-3 people.
author: Farrah V.

description:
I had been trying to eat at the place forever when I finally got a late brunch reservation one day. As soon as we entered the restaurant, they told us that they were getting our table ready and took us to the side to order and enjoy drinks while we waited. My boyfriend got a Sculpin and I was about to follow suit until the  West Bay Sparrow caught my eye. The drink (non-alcoholic) was SO refreshing and gorgeous! Multiple people popped over and asked what I ordered! For brunch we ate:

- French Toast Soldiers: the buttered rum maple syrup was incredible and complimented the sweetness of the toast well, wasn't too into the chocolate sauce dip though
- Anson Mills Polenta: I wish there was more of the truffled salsa verde, but other than that the dish was near perfect. Definitely recommend! 
-Smoked Dungeness Crab and Rock Shrimp Benedict: the crab and shrimo were delicious but I couldn't really taste the jalapeños, it could be because I have a high spice tolerance though!

Next time I want to come back for dinner, but I definitely recommend this as a good brunch spot. Great service and  stylish aesthetic.
author: Divleen B.

description:
I came to Marlowe to try the fried chicken sandwich because it was the belle of the ball apparently. The place itself was cute, very minimally decorated but I probably had too high of expectations because my coworkers had hyped this place up so much.

The fried chicken  sandwich was tasty--don't get me wrong! But it was nothing spectacular in my opinion. Everything was just really greasy and dense and I have yet to find a restaurant that rivals that of the Chick Fil A chicken sandwich! Chick Fil A always gets it right.

I'd probably pay this place another visit to try their burgers but probably not because I can find equally tasty meals at less boujee places.

Yes, I had to incorporate boujee in there.
author: Connie M.

description: The host seemed checked out on our arrival for a dinner reservation recently. Burger was good but overpriced. And it was definitely overcooked. Drinks were good but took 20 minutes+ to arrive. Server was nice but seemed uninformed of basic menu items. Would try it again to try other dishes.
author: Johnny V.

description:
Friends and I made a reservation here for dinner, and once we got there a lot of the tables would not leave for a while after they've finished eating. So the hostess was super apologetic even though it wasn't the restaurants fault and even gave us a free appetizer on the house!
While waiting we ordered some drinks and there were a few seats by the door, and the hostess also took our coats to hang. So, service was bomb.

we ordered the beef tartare (decent. nothing super special but good), brussel sprout chips (huge fan. Makes you feel healthy), pork chop, and some other plates I can't remember. food was overall pretty good! there aren't any menu items that really stand out or look like anything crazy different but it's just a solid and classic choice for a meal. 

gotta come back for their brunch which I also hear is amazing!
author: Grace P.

description: I loved my desert here. I ordered chocolate peanut butter bites, it was sweet and crispy as I like. It empowered me like a battery! So I am very that I have tried it in Marlowe, now I know where I will eat deserts!
author: Anna C.

description: Neighbor-recommended, and absolutely a gem of a restaurant. We ate in the back room. The burgers were easily top 5 lifetime best. The wait staff was friendly, attentive, and professional.
author: Noah C.

description: Great place I stumbled upon in SF. Turned out to be a really hopping, bright place with amazing American cuisine. One of the best burgers I've ever had and the homemade doughnuts were devoured.  Deviled egg is explosion in the mouth.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Great food, great ambiance, great service!

Appetizers: We tried the deviled eggs (2.5/5), the bone marrow (4/5), and brussels sprouts (5/5). The deviled eggs are not worth the price, and I really couldn't taste much of a difference from this deviled egg and a regular boiled egg. The bone marrow was tasty and I would recommend trying it if you've never tried their bone marrow before, but I don't know if I would get it again just because I'm not a big bone marrow fan. The brussels sprouts were FANTASTIC. I love the way they were prepared, and they made a great appetizer to munch on while waiting for the entrees to come out. 

Entrees: I got the black cod (4/5) that was very tender and tasty. It came in a light coconut milk-base and a bed of mushrooms/veggies, but the fish itself wasn't a large portion. My friend ordered a side of bread to dip into the coconut milk, which is a great idea if you're not quite full yet. Other dishes I tried were the Rib Eye and the pork chop. The Rib Eye was tender and well cooked, but I tend to like my steak to have more texture to the crust than they way they had it. The pork chop was very flavorful which surprised me, not dry either. The portion of the steak and pork chop were bigger than the black cod. 

Ambiance: Dimly-lit, with a bar area. There's another seating area in the back that was really cutely decorated. People are dressed up and looking good, but then again, it's SF on a Saturday night. 

Service: Our waitress was very courteous and gave us a run-down of their specials of the day. She made everything sound delicious, including their drink of the night called "Butcher's Mistress," that we ended up getting...It tasted a lot like a mimosa. Moral of the story: Our waitress should be a saleswoman. 

I would definitely go back!
author: Cindy H.

description:
Marlowe is merely a shell of what it once was. I truly used to enjoy the consistently delicious experience that was Marlowe circa 3 years ago. Unfortunately after attempting to come back not once, but twice, I will not return. The quality is just not there anymore, especially for the price.

The ONLY reason I would recommend going is if you have a hankering for brussel sprout chips as theirs are the best I've had.

Otherwise, hold onto your money & save your taste buds.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Service at Marlowe was amazing and the starters really left an impression on me.

We ordered:
- bakers wife cocktail
- deviled egg
- burrata
- pork chop
- cauliflower cheese side

The deviled egg and burrata were both flavorful and different from any deviled egg or burrata I've had at other restaurants. Plus, both dishes looked extremely good on camera so I had no complaints.

When we got to the pork chop I was already pretty full, but still liked everything. The pork chop was like 1/3 fat though, not sure if that was intentional.

The cauliflower mac and cheese was recommended to us but that was my least favorite dish of all. It just seemed like a bed of cheese on top of crunchy cauliflower. Maybe all this time I was craving the fattier version of this dish, mac and cheese, and the cauliflower just didn't have the same carby chewiness to it?

Overall, loved the atmosphere, service, and food :)
author: Vivian W.

description:
Wow. I asked to throw advacado on the Marlowe burger... got shut down, and I am glad because it was delicious. The head chef perfected the burger, so no one is allowed to alter it in any way. 

Bloody Mary's are a little spicy.

Service was good. Cute little trendy spot.

Make a reservation for brunch.

French toast sliders were delicious
author: Porter F.

description:
Marlowe is always one of my recommendations when it comes to brunch in the city. Why? Because you can make reservations and parking isn't completely terrible. Don't get me wrong, the food is good, but it wouldn't be the reason I'd recommend it.

The food isn't necessarily mind-blowing but I do like that the menu offerings aren't heavy. Brunch in SF can often be pretty heavy with waffles, pancakes, and French toast. At Marlowe, you've got some lighter options that are great such as the crab and shrimp Benedict or the polenta.

The burger is pretty popular (which used to be a restaurant all on its own) but I suggest sticking with their brunch options. It's a fine burger, but if you're coming for brunch, get brunch.
author: Charles L.

description: My friend and I visited Marlowe's last week, because Michael Bauer had such nice things to say about their hamburgers, and he was not wrong. They have the best burgers ever - and the best, crispy well-seasoned fries. They also have this dessert with strawberries that is to die for. We went for lunch on a Thursday at 1:30, and we had made a reservation, but we didn't need it. There was plenty of seating available. The menu is pretty small at lunch. There are 6 starters, 4 sandwiches, 2 main dishes and 1 dessert. My only problem with this place is that they are stingy with their catsup and their Sweet and Low. The wait staff was attentive and brought us out additional catsup 3 times. Also, the tables are extremely close together, and it is quite difficult to get in and out. But the burgers are so good that I will be back again.
author: Gail E.

description:
Oh man.. I don't know..
I came here for the lunch menu. The steak tartar and tomato soup were good and I would have given a 4.5 star rating if I had just those two dishes.

But.. I ordered the shrimp roll for lunch.. And it was near garbage. I couldn't go beyond the first bite, and I can't recall the last time I left food at a restaurant. I don't know who came up with the idea of combining shrimp with salty cabbage in a bun, but it was a very bad idea indeed. It's top 3 worst dishes I have ever had in my life, to the point it was inedible.
 
If you are coming, just get the appetizers or the burger. 

Also note that everything is super salty in general. I don't understand the restaurant's love for salt.
author: Ji Hwan S.

description: You're feeling like a good ass burger? This place has one of the best burgers in the city! The restaurant is small and it might get really loud when busy, but the burger quality is amazing. All the beers are good too, and the service is on point. Love than it os one block away from my house
author: Sophie E.

description: Super cute restaurant to check out. Food is a bit pricy, but definitely worth a visit. I got the hash brown benedict! So good. Perfect place for brunch.
author: April C.

description: Such a good spot for breakfast! The deviled eggs and chocolate toast satisfied me for the rest of my morning.
author: Olivia S.

description:
The food was ok, the bone marrow was very salty; nice environment, clean, well-decorated, romantic 

Make a reservation, don't put too high expectation, it would be good.

Foie Gras was ok, wine was good, dessert was delicious
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I'm giving this a 2 star rating with a heavy heart. The two gentlemen that greeted myself and my children at the entrance were very polite. We didn't have a reservation on a Sunday night that was a game night and also Pride Parade night. They were nice enough to get us drinks and an appetizer while we waited to be seated. My kids shared the cheeseburger and I had the appetizer salad. It sounded light and had avocado on it so I thought it would be lovely. When it came out I mentioned that it was not to my liking and I asked if I could please get some cheese to add to it. The woman helping up behind the bar was DEFINITELY OFFENDED. She scoffed and let me know SHE MIGHT BE ABLE TO SCRAMBLE TOGETHER SOME GOAT CHEESE. She went straight back to the kitchen, which was in my direct line of sight, and bickered with the kitchen staff about how absurd I was within earshot of myself, my kids and everyone at the bar. 
Mind you this seems to be a cute, upscale, hipster place that by all other accounts I loved. Between the three of us we had 7 drinks, 1 app, 1 app salad and 1 meal. Overall it was a 3-4 out of 5. But the way the bartender had such an attitude when I said I didn't care for the salad was surprising. I was in the business for 15 yrs. The first thing you do is say no problem. Let me take care of that for you. Can I get you something else?? I was so hungry. I would have tried another salad or a steak. She could have upsold me anything!!!!! I could have stayed and spent another $200. Instead, I tipped 35% told her I didn't care for it at all and I left. I had tried to rectify the salad with some simple parmesan cheese slices and that sent her into offended red rashes all over. It was as if how dare I question the menu?!?!?! Newsflash dolls I think you can be fabulous but never underestimate your client. It's not hard to make someone happy. Most of the time they don't care what it costs. 100% lifetime customers 100% perfect reviews
author: Heidi P.

description: The food was good and the service was fast! I will come back again and try something new. Keep it up, thank you!
author: Mya E.

description:
Good spot. 

This location, part of a small sf chain, delivers. 

It's location may seem a little odd -- certainly not a cute little road or neighbourhood, but there are actually loads of well off folks living just near by in many a high rise looking for food like Marlowe has.

Inside, its high end, slightly stuffy, with classic old world restaurant decor feel -- and it's tasty with a large bar and decent service.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Brunch review and ALMOST all good things to say. The brunch cocktails were excellent, especially their take on a spicy bloody.

The sides were delicious, both the Brussels sprouts chips and the Nueske bacon. The best thing though, by far, was the grilled asparagus. The chorizo, the poached egg, the texture of the asparagus - great combination.

The big fail though, and the reason this isn't five stars, was the polenta. If you read the Yelp reviews or listen to the servers, the polenta is the thing to get. In reality, it was a plate of bland polenta with over-truffled toppings. Seriously, so much truffle. It's the risk with truffles these days - everyone does it, and often way too heavily.

All in all though, an excellent brunch spot. The cocktails and food were delicious, just skip the polenta unless you're looking for a (heavy) truffle fix.
author: Mike M.

description:
Very good!!!!
We had brunch for father day. 
I was not the celebrated but the paying guy :)
Everything was really good. We had savory and sweet dishes, all of them were really delicious.
The host and the waitresses were very nice and friendly. the place was a little too noisy but you could still talk and hear fairly well.
Overall, a very nice experience and would love to go back.
author: Luca R.

description: yes, get the house made donuts...we split an order between 4 people + we each had an entree.  All of the entrees were delicious.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
This place is great for brunch/lunch! Their menu is on point with lots of unique options. Their ingredients are fresh and served on time. 

The atmosphere is awesome; white walls, simple table seating, fully stocked bar, a cow's head on mounted on the wall, and friendly staff. I noticed the servers checking frequently on their guests. 

I ordered their crispy fried chicken burger which was fantastic! The bacon was super crispy and the fried chicken coating had so much crispy snap to them. The horseradish aioli complimented the fries perfectly! Go ahead and spread it on the buns as well! This goes for $15

I also suggest ordering the French toast soldiers which are simple bars of rectangle shaped French toast with two dipping sauces; maple syrup and Mexican chocolate. This is for $9

For a cocktail, I recommend the Baker or Baker's wife. Both have grapefruit juice but have different sugars and bitters. These make the perfect pair along with your lunch/brunch. 

I like this place a lot and would love to come back!
author: Allister D.

description: Came here for brunch, and really everything was amazing.  Even getting reservations here was not that bad, they try to help accommodate you.  I had the fried chicken sandwich, which was so good, and it came with fries which may have been the best fries ever.  We also got the jumbo shrimp appetizer which came with a super spicy, awesome sauce, and the apple crisp which was solid.
author: Salini N.

description:
Loved the place. Had their french toast, devilled egg, potato shank & hash, and crab & shrimp benedict.

The french toast was easy to eat, came in bite sized pieces with two dips that weren't overly sweet. One was nutty (couldn't quite tell what it was?) and another honey.

Devilled egg was good, best eaten in one bite. I was a little disappointed at the quantity for the price ($3 for half an egg) but I enjoyed it nevertheless.

Potato shank & hash was really great, the pork was very tender and not so greasy.

Crab & shrimp benedict was A-MA-ZING. Highly recommend it.

Heavy construction going on around it but the place itself is great. Nice walk to Ferry Building or Westfield tops off the brunch.
author: Hye Rhin K.

description: I had a lovely lunch here with a friend.  It is a bustling restaurant, so if you're looking for something quiet, this probably isn't the first choice (at least at lunchtime).  The menu is limited, but everything offered was lovely.  There was a nice variety of selections.  The drinks is where they aced it for me.  A great Pimm's cup made the visit worth while.  I fully enjoyed it and would likely visit again in the future for dinner next go around.
author: Ivy C.

description:
Inside decor is hip and interesting. The dim lighting at night complement well with the bar lighting and countertops. Decided to come here on a saturday night. The wait was not long at all as I was expecting something much longer. Got seated in about 15 minutes at the bar. Not sure whether the tables require reservations or not, but the host said that only bar seating was available although I saw many tables open. 

The bartender was extremely friendly and professional. Generally, I expect less service when sitting at the bar due to the sheer volume of duties bar tenders are required to complete, however, our bar tender was extremely attentive. 

Food however, has room for improvement. The burger was decent, but portion sizes are a bit small. The pork chop size was decent, but was on the dry side. 

Marlowe is a nice joint if you just want to get some drinks and socialize in a place with pretty decor, but I probably wouldn't recommend getting the food here as it's pretty overpriced and small portioned.
author: Scott K.

description:
This is a beautiful restaurant near AT&T park. It's a great choice for a fancy meal before the game- if that's what you're into. Sometimes could seem rather expensive. Also wish the menu in between meals had more options! Cute place tho definitely.
Maybe slightly expensive.
author: Lux B.

description: Loved the burger here- super high quality ingredients and perfectly cooked patty. Also, the custom cocktails were delicious. Good service to boot. Stop in for a good meal.
author: Geraud G.

description:
Best burger in the Bay! 

I first heard about Marlowe from a Lyft Line conversation. My driver was new in town in the hunt for the best burgers in the Bay. Another passenger without hesitation said, "Marlowe, hands down." 

So when my friend recommended eating dinner at Marlowe a few weeks later, I did not hesitate. I ordered The Gardener--a nice cocktail that pairs well with meat, a perfect compliment. 

I ordered my burger ($16) medium rare. When it arrived it had it all--perfectly cooked bacon, toasted bun, melted cheese, a bit of shredded lettuce, and aioli. I prefer mayo on burgers instead of ketchup, so it was quickly winning me over. I took one bite and the burger melted in my mouth. Best life decision I've ever made. 

The meal is on the high end, especially for a burger, but it was delicious! My friend was in a rush to go home, so I took half of the burger to go. It heated up well in the microwave (25 second). 

I highly recommend Marlowe. It's in a rougher part of Brannan St., so just be aware when traveling there. Great place to go with a friend or date. Mains are in the $16-$35 range.
author: Joanna S.

description: The ambiance at Marlowe is one of my favorite parts of going there. It's always busy but it feels like a cozy European pub. The deviled eggs here are a must if you are a fan. The duck liver mousse is also a great starter to share. The bone marrow is one of my favorites as well, so definitely try that. I've tried several of their main dishes, and I highly recommend the burger. It's what they are known for. If you want to explore something else, try to pork chop or the poulet vert. They have a great cocktail menu as well.
author: Carol Ann V.

description:
Heard a lot about this restaurant, and aspects were great, but overall I thought it was just ok.

The good:  
1) the brussel sprout chips!  So good I ordered them as my "starter", after demolishing a bowl when we first sat down.
2) Apple crips:  amazing vanilla ice cream, and a decent amount of "crisp" (since that's the part we all really like anyway)
3) the "scene" -- decent people watching since it was really crowded

The "meh"
1) the food -- it was "good" but not great.  Not sure it was worth the price.  I originally wanted to get the burger,  since i"d heard so much about it, but they only serve it with one kind of aioli, and it's a HORSERADISH aioli, which is not a flavor I like whatsoever.  No option for plain mayo (what they hell do they make their aioli with then??)

2) Noise -- Because it's so crowded it's also really really noisy. You basically have to yell to be heard.

3) Space -- they pack you in, so i hope you don't mind being knocked by people packing big purses as they pass by.  Also, the staff puts your wine bottle on the edge of the table which made me nervous it'd be knocked off he entire time.

All in all, can't say i'd rush back for a sit down meal, but I'd go back for a drink at the bar.
author: Tobin S.

description:
Hosted my 30th bday brunch here - can't say enough great things about the staff and hostesses. They accommodated my last minute party of 28 with the communal table, and it couldn't have worked out more perfectly. The ambiance, the cool-chic interior, and hip / cozy vibe makes for a perfect venue. It's become one of my go-to spots in SOMA along with ROOH.

The food is incredible, well-done, and healthy: 
- Oysters (like any other oysters, a bit smaller than I thought) 
- Warm Deviled Eggs - 5
- House-made doughnuts - 5 (Lemon/ricotta over everything such a standout)
- House-made ricotta toast - 5
- Huevos Racheros - 5 (we ordered 4 of these)
- Hash - 4 (we ordered 2 of these)
- Brut Champagne -- fantastic!
author: Rashi K.

description:
Probably because we had a 930pm reservations but the place is sooo dark. I could not see what I was eating. 
Polenta is really good and rich. Bone marrow is ok. 
The server was really nice to be able to accommodate my small request by having the poached egg cooked well done since I am expecting. 
Music, ambience is great for first dates, night outs or small celebrations. Definitely not for meetings, with kids or something more serious.
author: Mari A.

description: I've been here 2-3 times in the last few years and it never disappoints. My favorite and go to is always the bone marrow appetizer, it's probably one of the best bone marrow I've had. The last time I was here, we were seated outside in the patio area with a large party of about 10-15 people, so it was a bit loud. I wasn't feeling too well so I asked to leave early and to get our food in boxes to go, and the waiter thought it was due to the loud party and ended up comping one of our entrees. I can definitely say the service is great to have taken that into consideration. The food is on the pricier side, but it's good quality food. I highly recommend trying this place at least once.
author: Latonia L.

description: Under cooked burger, simple syrup left out of cocktail leaving it undrinkable. Inattentive service, save your money and go elsewhere.
author: Gaynol F.

description:
Service here was great! Our server was so patient in helping me find the right wine! He even offered to bring a couple wines for me to taste to help me make a decision! Bless his heart! 

Food here was UHMazing! My husband and I ordered corn soup, baked oysters, bone marrow, burger and the chicken plate. Everything was tasty. Very unique flavors that just made my tastebuds happy. Just writing this review is making me want to go back asap! Will definitely being coming back here! 

Minus one star for cramped space but other than that I walked out with a satisfied tummy
author: C O.

description:
Came here for a birthday celebration for my mom.

PARKING: Found a pretty good spot on the street, they don't have valet but if you circle enough you should find something.

WAIT: We made reservations online about a month in advance.  Otherwise, it wasn't super crowded but the restaurant is small so you might have to eat at the bar if you don't want to wait for a table.

ATMOSPHERE: It's fairly narrow, when you walk in there's a few communal high tables on the right hand side and then the bar area.  There are regular tables for 2 or 4 people that either have marble tops or regular tops.  There must be a room in the back because we saw people going back there, they probably have a private room available.  The tables are fairly close together so be prepared for that.  The inside reminds me of something you would see in Boston or somewhere in New England.  It definitely has a trendy vibe, bright, casual but still able to be fancy if you want to dress up.  

FOOD: Got the deviled egg appetizer and the brussels sprout chips. 

DEVILED EGG - pretty good, I'm not the hugest fan of deviled eggs but it had a nice taste to it. It was a little salty though.

BRUSSEL SPROUT CHIPS - you know when you get brussel sprouts and they have the really good oily pieces that are super tasty? Those are pretty much the brussell sprout chips.  If you don't like greasy veggies then you won't like it.  But for me it was really tasty, they aren't as crispy as chips but do have a crisp texture to them.  

PORK CHOP - I'm beginning to realize that I'm not a fan of pork chop.  First of all this dish was HUGE, they pretty much give you 2 large pieces of pork chop plus the mashed potatoes underneath and the veggies.  The veggies were these sprouts almost like a salad.  The other good thing was the avocado sauce/blend that they put on top to help cut through the heaviness of the pork chop.

My sister got the steak, which was really good and she said it was one of the better steaks she's had in a while.

If I didn't get the pork chop I would've tried the burger - it was simple, a classic with basic toppings but very tasty.  The fries were also on the skinnier side and very very good.  Slightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  

Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for a special occasion.
author: Brittany T.

description:
A cute little bar/restaurant near the SF Caltrain station

The decor inside is very refreshing, with a black-and-white tile theme that makes you feel like you're back in the 60s--very retro. The doors/windows are wide open so it feels very roomy. The inside is quite loud, which is a good thing since everyone seems to be enjoying themselves and chatting with drinks.

The food quality is ok. I got the Dungeon Crab Crepes which was served on a hot pan and tasted pretty good. The greens on top in particular was a nice touch, and the lightness complemented the heavy sauce inside the crepes pretty well. The portions were a bit on the minor side. The park wheat beer was awesome--cold, refreshing, and smooth.

Overall, a good place to go for Happy Hour with a group.
author: Henry L.

description: Solid place for brunch and dinner in Soma. Make reservations before coming! Enjoyed the polenta here for dinner, and was satisfied by most of the choices for brunch. Felt like portions were filling, but food was a bit oily. The hamburgers seem good here, but I've never tried.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Three of us had dinner here one night based on the recommendation of a local Yelp Elite friend. Tables were close together. We decided to split everything so we could try more dishes. We started with the Brussels sprout chips based on the numerous reviews. I thought they were ok- a little overdone and greasy. Then we split a small salad, the burrata, and the cauliflower gratin. The salad was light and refreshing. Someone had fun with the mandolin- everything was ribbons! Very crunchy. The burrata was like bruschetta and a heavy appetizer, not what I imagined. The gratin was cheesy deliciousness. But one bite had crystals of salt. Otherwise perfect. I would get this again for sure.
For the main course, we all got burgers. They were good but not the best I've ever had. I ordered mine medium rare and it seemed more rare. Flavors were yummy. And we could have split two burgers! Good portion. 
They should be bragging about the cauliflower gratin- that's the best dish here! 
The menu is hard to access via my iPhone.
author: Maria-Elena T.

description: Was really looking forward to Marlowe. My daughter and girlfriend were both excited as well. Overall our food was good (burgers, pan fried cod) but our server experience cast a shadow over our meal. Not sure what was up with it.  Simply unfriendly, dropping plates and drinks down and walking off.  Really strange. We kept wondering if we had said or done something to offend. Good food but lackluster service that really did affect our enjoyment.
author: Derek H.

description:
I came here for lunch in the hopes of getting some delicious food, especially when this place has gotten so many rave reviews from magazines, Yelpers, etc.

Maybe it's just because it's weekday lunch, but I'm not sure it's really worth all that hype. I got the deviled egg open face sandwich -- but it was small (really a small half sandwich), with some really lightly dressed lettuce on the side that looked really shabby. It didn't taste like anything special either -- in fact, it was a bit bland. I felt like I overpaid for scraps, especially when service was super spotty too. I know, I know, we are in SF and everything is super expensive, except this is not the best part of town and there are plenty of other delicious places around here.

That said, maybe I should just come here for brunch to really taste for myself. Meanwhile, I'll probably not come back here for a weekday lunch...
author: Alice C.

description: The service was good and the food was amazing! We are from Knoxville, TN and were looking for a quick place to eat before our flight. It was fast and delicious. We ordered the Brussels sprouts which were truly excellent. We got two entrees, the polenta and the burger. Both were good, but the burger did have a substantial amount of horseradish aioli. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Had such a great dining experience here! So my bf and I had tried making reservations online for Friday night but according to OpenTable, they were all booked out. This was for Friday evening, btw. However, my bf tried calling them the day of and it turns out they still had tables available in their outdoor patio area. So always try calling even if you have no luck with the online reservations! We actually really enjoyed the patio area. It's a small patio in the back of the restaurant, away from the noisiness of the main dining area. We got there at 6:15pm, and we had the whole place to ourselves until 7pm when other parties started rolling in. It's pretty quiet back there (only 4 tables or so), and the whole area has a garden-like vibe. Super cute!

Our waitress did a great job walking us through the menu. They had a special cocktail in honor of SF Pride, so I went with that, and it was delicious! Can't remember the name, but it was very citrus-y, light, and refreshing. 

As for food:

- Deviled Eggs: These come at $3 a pop, but it's so worth it, trust me! The egg yolk is seasoned perfectly, and combined with that bacon wrap, mmm mmm, so good! Eat it all in one bite so you really get a taste of all the flavors combined. Great appetizer to start off your meal.

- Bone Marrow: This was another appetizer dish, and omg I loved it!! The bone marrow had so much flavor, and went perfectly with the bread/sauce/greens that came with the dish. Highly recommend this dish as well.

- Salted pistachios: So we didn't actually order these. It was a gift on the house because they had forgotten to put in our order. Wait time wasn't too bad, but we appreciated the thought! These were....salty, lol. My bf really liked them. Said they had good flavor but he agreed that they were on the salty side. I'd pass on these...

- Burger: So our waitress told us that this burger is the best in the city...Not sure if I agree with that, but it's definitely up there. The meat was perfectly medium rare and had a ton of flavor. Really liked the sauce they used on the burger as well. The fries were great--they had just the right texture. Solid dish overall. Not my favorite, but it was good.

- Polenta: My bf decided to go with this vegetarian entrée. It was surprisingly filling! A very hearty dish. There's no meat, but the mushrooms that they use in this dish are quite...meaty, haha. The poached egg on top of the dish adds the perfect touch--be sure to break it right away so that the yolk can blend in with the rest of the dish. So good! I'd choose this over the burger any day. 

Our final bill came out to be around $85 or so, which really isn't bad considering all the food that we ordered. The service here is great and the food is fantastic. Will definitely be returning.
author: Ashley Y.

description: I had friends in town from LA. I looked up burgers and Marlowe was #1. Went for lunch, didn't have a reservation, wasn't a problem. The   is delicious! The vibe in there is very nice. Great service and great staff. Awesome selection of spirits, wine, and beer. They serve the High Life . I can't wait to go back!
author: Patrick H.

description:
I've had Marlowe bookmarked since FOREVER! I'm glad I finally had a chance to come here last night. 

We had a reservation for 6 and were seated at the communal table. Our server was really attentive, checking up on us and asking if we needed anything while waiting for Vy N.'s lagging ass lol. 

Drinks: 
+ Butcher's Mistress - super refreshing, a bit fizzy, 10/10, highly recommend! This was on the butcher paper for specials. 
+ Baker's Wife

Bites:
+ Chicken Fried Okra - Recommend!
+ Brussel Sprouts Chips - Preferred this over the other brussel sprouts.
+ Baked Oyster - for $3.50 I thought this would be a bit bigger, but it was a dinky oyster. Pass. 

Starters: 
+ Roasted Bone Marrow - This was recommended by a friend. Shawn C. said this was good but overhyped.

Mains:
+ Stuffed Patrale Sole - Our sever knew we were sharing this and they were nice enough to split it into two plates for us! Risotto was super creamy and I really enjoyed the crispy kale. 

Sides:
+ Brown Butter Brussel Sprouts - Very whatever. They seemed soggy. Pass. 

I don't have any particular favorites from the night, but overall everything was pretty good. Can get pricey real quick though if you go overboard (like us). So stuffed, I'm surprised I made it out of there without being carried out. 

Oh yeah, I couldn't take pictures like I normally do. It was pretty dark. I'm sure Shawn C. was happy he could eat the food right when it came out though.
author: Laverne N.

description:
Absolutely superb all around.   Very professional service on all fronts...from the team work of the servers to keep your glasses full, to the creation of the bartenders to the suggestions of our server.  

I ordered the burger, which I always feel is a cop out at a restaurant with such a great menu...but I wasn't let down.  The fries were perfect, and the burger juicy and messy, just like you'd want it.   My buddy ordered the pork chops...which were enough to feed a family!   Seriously tasty though, but I might recommend sharing this dish if you aren't starving.  

Food came out quick, and our server was always within range to help us with anything we needed.  

overall, this place is well worth a visit.  Make sure you make reservations, as we would not have gotten in (at 6) if we didn't have them!
author: Matt V.

description:
Excellent restaurant, one of the coolest bars in the city.  This place is close to the Cal Train station on Califonia, and how I stumbled upon this gem.  Be prepared to wait, and trust me, this place is definitely worth the wait.  
The food is unique, every dish is eloquently displayed, and the taste is exceptional.
A couple of items that I highly recommend:
1.  Bone marrow- huge bone charred, sliced in half, leaving a smokey, jelly-like spread.  Smear some of this treat on the baked garlic bread and you will die and go to heaven!  Or stuff a scoop of it directly in your mouth 
2.  Deviled eggs:  they mix the yolk with a little mustard and spices for a delicious treat!
3.  Oyster Rockefeller- perfectly baked pacific oyster with spinach and cheese.  
Very expensive, but worth a try!
author: Richard H.

description: Marlowe is a beautiful casual dining spot. Absolutely exquisite cuisine. Probably one of the best burgers in the city. Great staff and really cool decor.
author: Riley S.

description: Picked based on reviews. Out of town business college in for a meeting and we were hungry. This place was great and the food was even better. Between the two, we had the brown butter brussel sprouts, little gem salad and the warm rock shrimp roll. The west bay sparrow, non alcoholic, is very refreshing.
author: Lulu d.

description: Although we didn't eat here (food presentation was on point, and it smelled amazing btw) I am grateful for the lovely and caring staff. My friends and I were assaulted by a homeless man on our walk back from pride and the front-of- house staff came running out to fend him off/ notify the authorities. One employee, dressed in a red button-up at the time, reassured us that everything would be alright and allowed us to use the bathrooms. They also brought out water and let us re-group with some more folks. I would hope that every restaurant strives to reach the same level of service Marlowe provides. Furthermore, new developments surrounding the venue indicates that the area isn't a "bad place" per se, and it is highly likely that it was a fluke incident and that with due time the area will be a thriving high-maintenance location just blocks away from Caltrain. Either way, thank you @ Marlowe staff.
author: Khaled H.

description: We were here for dinner. Had a great time at Marlowe.Overall, presentation and taste were on point.
author: Noel C.

description:
My first experience dining at Marlowe was a few years back, which I barely remember now so I'm unable to share the details of my dinner experience. Luckily, my mission to find the best burger in the bay has offered a new opportunity to review Marlowe's raved about sandwich and weekend brunch experience!

For context, my BF and I have two burger joints that we love: Hopdoddy Burger Bar (Austin) and Shake Shack (NY). So, we're basing our ratings off those flavor experiences and we're starting from scratch (as some of our favorites have changed over the years). If you're not a fan of either of those, you should probably stop reading this review as I don't want to waste your time.

We ordered:
TWO Marlowe burgers
Anchor for me
Sculpin IPA for him

We're rating the following 5 criteria on a scale of 1 to 5 (low to high) and only including the cheeseburger.

Overall consistency: 5
The biggest challenge of a big, juicy cheeseburger is holding everything together bite after bite. The bread that Marlowe uses for their burger is surprisingly able to accomplish this (see photo of my last bite... hehe) The bread is soft and the burger is easy to hold. It's not so huge that I can't take a solid bite from top to bottom but it's a mouthful (that's what she said... beat you to it) Every bite is perfect because it's able to maintain its structure and hold all the ingredients in.

Burger meat: 5
Medium rare and cooked to perfection. Thick but manageable meat patty that's juicy and flavorful without too much of a mess. The flavor of the meat is dang delicious.

Overall flavor: 5
We think having bacon in anything is a major hack but in this case, it wasn't too overpowering. It added a nice crunchy yet chewy texture that complimented the squishiness of the bread and meat. The caramelized onions were a perfect flavor addition as was the side of horseradish aioli (which it didn't need but it sure as hell was a party in my mouth with it)

Price: 4
I get that it's a gourmet burger in an ever-increasingly expensive town. In comparison to places like Hopdoddy's or even Godfather's where their huge portions help justify the price, it's about $2-$3 more expensive. Take the deviled eggs for instance. They are DANG GOOD but it's $3 for half an egg. Just some context of price to portion at this joint. It's more upscale, for sure.

Presentation: 5
Classic. A perfectly put-together burger with a side of french fries and ketchup. There's nothing intimidating about it and it's very easy to manage. The sad part is... the final bite. All good things must come to an end.

We're still early on our burger hunt but we can say with confidence that the Marlowe burger is our winner thus far.

NOTE: On the weekends, they stop serving brunch at 2:30. Their bar menu goes from 2:30-5:30 and then dinner goes from then until closing. If you're coming for the burger, you have nothing to worry about. It's on every menu! We were getting rushed to order before brunch ended but later realized that it didn't matter. :-)
author: Kat C.

description: I came here on a whim after looking through reviews for restaurants around my hotel. I decided to walk bc it was day time. I'm not from San Francisco so I didn't realize that here was a huge homeless population here. I experienced that walking to Marlowe for lunch on Sunday. Homeless people were everywhere, even in tents along the side walks getting to Marlowe. So my first impression was that this restaurant was really small but cozy. I would estimate that they can handle about 40-60 customers at a time. It seems as though this was one of those places that your would need reservations ahead of time due to he limited seating. We just walked in and asked for a table for 4, hostess told us that we could either sit at the bar (which only had 3 seats open at that time and they weren't all together...) or wait. Then she said all of their tables have reservations and that it was booked :/ that time. Well I guess they had an opening or something bc we ended up getting a table for 4. And we are sooooo thankful. The food here is awesome. I loved everything that I had. The fries were all seasoned perfectly and crunchy. I would def order the poached egg with crab salad again.
author: Ciara N.

description:
Everything I tried here was pretty good. I can't say the burger was anything fabulous. Apparently that's what they're known for? But I feel like they're only know for that because it's the only somewhat reasonably priced entree item. I mean, that's why I got it. I wasn't about to drop $20+ on a meal.

I really like the cheesy cauliflower. The brussel sprouts chips were pretty good but pretty salty/greasy.

Pretty small and loud.
author: Kelly G.

description: We had a group dinner for 8 here, and wow it was as crowded. They need more floor space, every table was a tight fit, and people backed up to each other. It must be horrible for the servers to maneuver. Despite that, our server did a great job keeping up with us in our the middle of the pandemonium, and even kept smiling the whole time!  We sampled many of the appetizers, but nothing really stood out as spectacular.   I had the Artic Char, which was good, and the presentation of all of he dishes we had was nice.
author: Stewart G.

description:
It's good. Not great. We were told to come here for the burger but if you skip that part on the menu then you're not missing out. 
We ordered: brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, pork chops, and of course the genius burger. 
We left loving everything we ordered except the burger. I mean it's good but not a reason to come here. 
The ambience is romantic and perfect fit dates and couples but it gets crowded so you do have to talk a bit loud. 
All in all I would recommend coming here if you have friends in town or need a go to date spot. But it's not local and you won't need missing much in terms of burgers.
author: Miguel E.

description:
Highly recommend reservations if you come here. Food is good, ambiance is nice, and parking is limited to either the street or the lot across the street ($15 on a Saturday night).

We tried:
-crispy Brussels sprouts chips: deeeelicious, I definitely recommend
-baked mussels
-polenta: very rich
-pork chop: good flavors, cooked well
-fries

The menu is limited, so I think one visit was enough for me to try everything I wanted. Also wanted to add that our server, Brandon, was AWESOME and totally turned the night around for us. Between the hostesses and the bartender, some patrons and I were given the impression that we weren't welcome and our presence was a greater nuisance than anything. Brandon quickly stepped in and turned the night around for us.
author: Michelle N.

description: A popular place for brunch, if a little pricey. Doughnuts were a hit, and the burger was perfectly cooked.  reat restaurant.  All the food we had was great.  The shrimps for appetizers and the pork chops for the main dish were amazing.  The service was good.  The process are not too expensive.
author: Alanna S.

description:
I came here with a group of friends specifically to try the burger.  Our group is trying to find the best burger in Sam Francisco.  This place got really good reviews from the entire table: 7.5-8.5. The horseradish sauce is what made the burger and the bun was delicious.  Consensus was there could have been more veggie toppings. 

All in all amazing ambiance, great service and great food.  Would definitely recommend and go back!
author: Shelby N.

description:
I took 6 other friends to Marlowe before the holidays, and it could not have been better. All of us loved it. The table was set and ready upon our arrival (Open Table reservation), and the server staff was incredibly attentive, passionate and knowledgeable throughout the evening.

We chose the fried okra for our appetizer. Being a southerner, I loved it. The brussel sprout chips also were addicting. Being a burger connoisseur, I had to have the famous burger. It perhaps was my favorite burger of 2016. It was the perfect blend of meats, charcoal grilled goodness and simple condiments. 

My only gripe -- and please just go ahead and call me unclassy or a fatty -- is that I love mayo with my burgers, and they would not accommodate my request. It was their homemade aioli or nothing (one of my huge pet peeves because it feels snobby to me, and not customer-centric). 

The cocktails and the wine were excellent too -- I particularly loved the Hot Toddy, but of course, my name is Todd. The bill was reasonable for our group, and we all went away happy.
author: Todd B.

description:
3.5 star rating.

Marlowe has been on my radar for a long time, so I was super excited to drop by today (4/27) for lunch. I was able to get 12:30 p.m. reservations via their site on Monday, which was great because the place was packed when we arrived. It was also Giants game day, so that probably boosted business just a tad.

I arrived a couple minutes early, but they seated me even though my friend was still finding parking. Very nice; although I understand the idea of having the whole party there before seating, it's also annoying. So props to Marlowe!

The restaurant is so bright and welcoming thanks to all the huge windows, love it! The decor is nice and clean, too. As soon as I sat down, someone came around to offer me water. It's also superrrrrrr loud inside since everyone's all into their conversations. The tables are pretty close to one another, which means you will hear your neighbors and they will hear you. 

Service was average, but it could've been because they were so busy. The server came by to see if I wanted to get anything to drink when I sat down, but my friend wasn't there yet so I said I'd wait. When my friend arrived, it took 10+ minutes for someone to come by and get him some water. (After that though, they were very attentive with water.) Then it was a couple more minutes before the server came by to take our order. I understand that it was partially our fault since not everyone was there, but still. =/

So the food. Food food food. We shared the crispy Brussels sprout chips, which came out super quick. I'm not sure if the chips are supposed to be so bitter, but they were. The lemon and sea salt was a great combo, but the bitterness was a bit too much. It might've been that they were ordered over-fried =/ I had the Marlowe Burger, medium, with fries. Oh man, that horseradish aioli! So good! Fries were also good. As for the burger, it was good -- nothing super special in my opinion. The patty was good perfectly medium, so it was good. There's so much hype around the burger, but I felt like it was just a burger. Yes, other restaurants have shittier burgers, but I'm not sure what warrants a $16 price tag on the Marlowe one. 

My friend has the Open Faced Deviled Egg Sandwich, and he had such a hard time eating it haha The provolone on top was so hard from being toasted that he couldn't cut it. He tried eating it as is rather than cutting into it, and the egg salad was falling out all over the place. I personally thought it was a very small portion -- you get one slice of bread that's maybe 3x3 inches topped with what's essentially egg salad. I don't know about you, but that's very meh to me. 

I'm not down on Marlowe, but I was expecting something more wow? Maybe a dinner experience will be different.
author: Doris K.

description:
I finally made it to Marlowe for a friend's birthday. I've seen Marlowe on so many lists of places to eat in San Francisco and yelpers raving about this place.

The verdict? I can honestly say the Marlowe burger is one of the best things I have eaten in San Francisco so far.

With a party of four, the hostess said there was a 2 hour wait for regular seating, but she let us know that there was no wait at outdoor patio seating. It was cold outside so we were a little hesitant. We thought we would check it out anyway because of the...No wait? Dope. She led us to the back to a cozy little room. It was more illuminated than the main seating and with more elbow room. The whole restaurant was quite dim. I like the ambience in this back room as it was very earthy and comfortable. They had space heaters so the temperature was fine.

Service was great, the waiter was very informed about the menu. He gave his suggestions and let us know what were the most popular items. A plus is the observant water service. Again, I'm so glad I got the famous Marlowe burger with fries and that amazing horseradish-aioli dip. We also ordered the bone marrow with baguette, duck liver mousse, deviled eggs, and pork chop. There is no other word to describe the bone marrow than exquisite (that's as classy as it gets). It was my first time eating bone marrow and it has a a delicious and rich flavor on the saltier side. The mousse had interesting texture (also my first time trying this) but it was good. I couldn't eat too much of it though. Deviled eggs were excellent. The pork chops were a huge portion and came with collard greens and grits-- all the flavors married. We split everything in fours so we could try everything. Great idea to make the most of this dining experience. 

I will definitely come back some time for the lunch menu. I highly recommended Marlowe. (Try the burger!)
author: Jaime F.

description:
Tonight I had a nice time at Marlowe. We had 5:45pm reservations but the traffic from Apple's WDC getting out around the same time was insane. We called to let them know we would be about 5-10 minutes late and when we go there our table was ready and being held.

The wait staff was great and our drink orders were taken immediately after we sat down. Everyone had beer as well as the Brussel Sprout chips (addicting!), the liver mouse, the burrata and the deviled eggs. The eggs were fantastic with a nice jalapeño on top some thick cut bacon (just an awesome combination with a deviled egg).

For the main courses (see photos) we had the ribeye steak which was very flavorful and cooked medium rare per our order, and the pork chop.  Both were very good.  The place was completely full by 6:30pm.

We decided to go for the peanut butter bites for dessert which were little frozen squares of peanut butter and chocolate goodness (almost like a Reese's peanut butter cup flavor.  Since I love Reese's and anything chocolate with peanut butter, this was a good score for dessert.

The espresso was good, served very hot like it should be.  If you want to eat at a place with a good vibe, good food with unique starters (next time I am getting the bone marrow!), then this is a place to definitely put on the list to check out.

4 stars.
author: Jay G.

description: My husband and I lived in the lofts next to Marlow for a year and we went at least once a week. We've moved so Southern California since then, but we still reminisce about our many great meals and drinks here. We would walk to Whole Foods on weekends, and could never resist popping in for "just one drink" (which was never the case).
