My favorite thing after a long day of work was going in to get the oysters and a martini, both simple items, but easy to mess up-- Marlow never does! My husband is crazy about the burger. We compare all our new spots in our new neighborhood to Marlow, and of course, every place let's us down. Marlow, we miss you and we love you.
author: Kiiya S.

description:
I recently had 5 meals on 3 Saturdays here. No shame. Never disappoints. 
I love their polenta, steak, appetizers, etc. they also have some good cook tails and wine options.
author: Yuxiao X.

description:
Food and drinks here are great! Only complaint is that the Benedict has only 1 egg but comes with a lot of salad

Also expect a wait!
author: Ivan C.

description: We had a reservation at a nearby restaurant, but we were starving so we decided to pop in for a couple drinks and appetizers. I've been meaning to try this place so it was the perfect opportunity. We ordered the scallops, cured hamachi, and foie gras to share. They were delicious! The scallops were huge, sweet, and perfectly cooked. The foie gras was like butter. Our cocktails were just as great. Definitely an amazing way to start the night and we'll be back to dine here soon. Cheers!
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
aesthetic, yes. great, no. 

I came for brunch and ordered their crab crepe, which was a special. It was bland and poor. The crepe was soggy, not sure if that's what they were going for. It was thin and doughy, instead of crispy like I would have imagined it. The filling was ehh. 

Aside for the beautiful interior, I didn't see much that was worth coming again. I think that if you do come to try, you should order the very generic items because those are receiving great reviews. It also seems that dinner is better. 

Anyway, it didn't wow me enough for a second chance. I tried though. *shrug*
author: Tina Y.

description: Tasty polenta and amazing Glitter-bomb. Back seating is cozy and full of beautiful plants. The staff here is really attentive and kind.
author: Mayra Lizzette Y.

description:
Came here with my bf and friend on a rainy night. Surprisingly ITS SO CLOSE TO THE GRAND!! Party time! Jk. I asked the server what was a sweet drink and she wasn't too confident in answering. Eventually she told me to get the candlestick which was pretty good. Although the burgers took a LONG LONG time, we had to sit for awhile. We ordered the duck liver mouse on toast. My bf and friend thought it was great. I didn't enjoy it. To begin with, I'm not a duck liver person, nor a mousse type of person. We all ordered the pizza, the duration just took way way way too long. 

When it finally came out, the burger was okay.I didn't think it was that great! Try Eureka people. It's my fave burger spot. Fries were okay - they have aioli on the side for dipping. 

Parking, hard to find.
author: Amy Y.

description: Went there Tuesday for a special dinner with a friend. No reservation and we were nicely seated at the bar and quickly. My companion had been before and knew what we were going to order but I loved the menu and atmosphere. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable in a range tasty bites and tasty drinks just strike up a conversation. Loved the burger and the Brussel sprout chips
author: Dominick R.

description: A solid four stars! Great cocktails, tasty food, nice decor, friendly waitstaff. Overall a great choice for lunch :)
author: Mith R.

description: This review is only for the bar food selection as this is what they had when we walked in. We had wine (a tasty pinot, $15), brussel sprout chips, tartare with arugula and a burger. While all good quality, only the tartare stood out for me, while the chips were ok a bit too salty, burger was a solid offering but nothing fancy, which in all decency it should be given the price tag. All in all a solid place but only 3 stars for price/quality and uniqueness ratio. Might be back if around the area.
author: Aga K.

description: I think this is even too many stars for this place but the service was too good compared to the food. It was all SALT, my tongue is numb from eating the polenta. I was disappointed that such good quality mushrooms were soaked in salty polenta and covered with salty greens... could not taste any of the variety of mushrooms... and they are otherwise very fragrant and delicious. The duck liver mousse was ok , I had much better. The prices are outrageous for this kind of setting and food quality.  Over crowded and loud, just forget about a normal conversation. It feels like you are on same table with everyone in the restaurant as everything is overly squished. My partner had the Angus ribeye and he liked it. Plate seemed large, hope he didn't taste the salt as I did in my meal. I didn't want to say anything as it was his birthday dinner  and based on the amazing reviews I picked the place. Server was super nice and friendly. We didn't get a desert, I usually always do but I was scared it could be salty as well...
author: Gergana N.

description: Hands down best burger, but we already know that about Marlowe. I had 8:45 reservations for 3, one cancelled, the hostess was a little annoyed that we were booked at a four-top and tried to move us, but no other 2-tops were available.  Aside from her unprofessionalism in handling the change, the other staff was incredibly friendly. My friend and I had the deviled eggs, the butter lettuce salad, the burger and the Brussels sprouts. All were delicious! It gets crazy busy and is not a big place, so I'd book in advance or go off hours.  But seriously, get that burger.
author: Hayley H.

description:
Delicious food and superb service! The deviled eggs, crab and shrimp crepe, and the ricotta donuts are not to be missed. The signature hamburger was a bit underwhelming, but the accompanying fries were SO good (reminiscent of McD...that being a compliment). 

Our waiter was seriously on point as was the other staff. Our waters were constantly refilled, our table cleaned and reset between dishes, and the recommendations solid. They even refilled the husband's coffee.

Plenty of street parking in the area too! Definitely worthy of return visits.
author: Jan P.

description:
3.5 stars... 

The bar is great. The wine was delicious, even on an empty stomach, slightly hungover :)

The food was OK. I got the ribeye salad, and I found it to be just OK. I was starving so if my stomach were giving this review, it'd scream "it was amazing!!!" But alas the dressing was loose, the plate was haphazardly pulled together and there was enough hanging fat off the ribeye that made me want to cringe. 

If in the area, I'd give it one more shot to try the rest of the menu... In the meantime I'll round up.
author: Sau y.

description: What a delicious, beautiful late might place. Found it after a Giants night game, delicious food & great selection of drinks. Want to come back during a regular lunch or dinner time.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Really well made food.  Gorgeous waitresses and hostess.  Our waitress looked just like Jessica Alba.  

I had the burrata at lunch and it was perfect.  I wasn't a fan of the fried chicken sandwich, but the fries were great.  

I would come back here again and do all the side dishes!
author: Vi Y.

description:
Must get the Marlowe burger and deviled eggs. 

Great place for weekend brunch. I love how the sun gets in and lights up the whole place. Makes it an even happier experience.

The burger is a must get. Probably one of the best burgers in brunch restos. The fried chicken sandwich was also really good but not as good as the one at Rove Kitchen. 

The deviled eggs were also awesome especially since they had a jalapeño on top! We also got the doughnuts to share, but it wasn't too special so won't be getting that next time.
author: Rohenne L.

description:
I bet this place is fantastic, but I do have to preface it with the fact that I did order something that wasn't so great. However, all of my coworkers ordered things that looked and smelled great. So I will definitely be back here to try their dinner menu and their Marlowe Burger and Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich.

Now don't get me wrong, the ambience, decor and service were all spot on. The only thing that sets it back for me was the Warm Rock Shrimp Roll (served with napa cabbage slaw, basil, mint, citrus aioli, smoke and chili). When all of our food came out, everyone had a nice meaty portion and when my food came out it was a dinky little bun. So I thought that it would be packed full of flavor since it was so small, but it ended up tasting just too salty and greasy. I was expecting for it to be more smoky or spicy, but I was sadly mistaken. Also, the bun was like a plain hot dog bun, nothing too special about it either.

Overall, I really liked Marlowe, just not the shrimp roll. I will definitely be back though to try some of their other items.
author: Theo T.

description: Excellent service and good food, delicious appetizers. As a main course we ordered burgers and they were great, fries were a little bit over cooked tho. Awesome cocktails. The noise level was fine. Prices are fair. Definitely coming back again to check out other plates.
author: Regina D.

description:
Get the burger, get the burger get the burger. The first bite was like heaven.

A little pricey for what you get but you'll leave satisfied. We tried the fried brussel sprouts and broccolini with romesco and both were good.

It's pretty cramped and always packed so try to make reservations if you can. But it's well worth the trip an d the $16 for the burger!
author: Jess A.

description: Nice vibe. Fun place to hangout. It can get crowded and has a long line. A little pricy
author: Chiao-Yu T.

description: Last time I was in SF we had the worst service. The staff was completely unwelcoming and the food was over priced. The staff was beyond stuck up and had an attitude because we didn't have a reservation. It's located in an inaccessible area and not worth your effort to go there. The place was not busy at all and it still took a long time to get service. Not a good reflection of the Bay Area. This is one of the places when people ask me about SF I tell them not to go to.
author: David L.

description: Over hyped and over priced. Marlowe Burger..... save your self 10 bucks and go to SuperDuper
author: Margarita S.

description:
I was the most impressed by our waitress, who was so good at explaining the dishes and trying to get us to buy some wine. We were seated in the back area that had heating and cute hipster decorations that pleased my eyes. Try to reserve in advance bc it does get pretty crowded.

I ordered the burger, which was just okay actually. I don't think I like burgers very much to begin with. I was not very hungry that night. I also had a deviled egg, which I ironically thought was heavenly.
author: Juliana P.

description: Excellent spot. The Marlowe burger and some Brussels sprouts! Call ahead for reservations though you will not get seated right away otherwise
author: Tig A.

description:
One of my favorite to come to in the city did lunch or dinner. 

I usually get dropped off by Uber/Lyft so I can't really talk about parking. 

Getting a seat can be hard. Seating at the bar usually works out. 

I tend to order the burger. Chicken sandwich is okay. 
Love the ambiance and vibe. 

I'm a fan. 

- miss yelp 2016
author: Jewelyn T.

description:
We decided to eat at Marlowe based on the high praised reviews on Yelp. To me time is money and very valuable, but I was disappointed with this place from the get go, not entirely to their fault but mostly because of lack of info at Yelp.

1. Bar menu vs full menu
Yelp only tells us they are open for service. We arrived there at 3 pm. It was bad because we didn't know they'd only serve the bar menu, which is limited in choice until 5.30. We ate nick nacks and waited for whopping 2.5 hours to eat what we came for, which was the bone marrow. 

2. Food was not good
I think this restaurant is doing some sort of social experiment. They charge high prices for not really edible food just to see whether you'd pretend to like it because you wanna look hip or cultured.
Let me explain this using 1 dish they have. During that long 2.5 hours, we tried literally everything they offered on their bar menu, so I feel
Qualified to draw conclusions since I at least tried everything they offered. 

- crispy Brussels sprout chips 
I like Roasted Brussels sprouts in general and I wasn't sure what to expect of the chips though. 
They serve it with the little dessert fork. Good luck picking those chips with that!
Even your fingers can hardly pick it. This dish is salty as hell, burnt as hell and can only be eaten if you literally let the "chips" stick to your tongue,'yes I mean you need to lick it off of your plate or let it stick.

- oysters: okay this dish was good unlike the burnt aka crispy Brussels sprouts. 

- warm deviled egg: we ordered two and guess what we got? 1 egg!!! They cut it in half and call it two and charge like $3 per half an egg! 
Told you they were doing a social experiment, really trying to see how you'd react! 

- jumbo shrimp: it was just meh, I tried better ones and this place really like to burn things. Won't recommend.

- burger: for $16 is it wrong of me to expect to get a decent burger, at least not half of a burger? Who ate the other half of my burger? 

3. Actual food from the real menu

Bone marrow: this was the very item we came for and after waiting for long we finally got it.
It's served with as much as 6 pieces of bread. Guess what? You won't need 5 of those. 
You just buy one giant bone! Where the hell
Is the bone marrow? Not the bone?! 

A good chef can choose it right so that it'll have enough bone marrow to eat. What a disappointment?! 

4. Cocktails: was okay though. 

5. Service: for whatever reason, our table had 3 different servers. Servers change suddenly.
author: Bella J.

description: Don't waste your time or money there. I had brunch there again today. The second star is for the service: the waiterstaff and manager were attentive and friendly. In all other respects other than the room itself the place has changed significantly and for the worse. The menu is limited and boring. The food is mediocre and ridiculously expensive. Two veggie scrambles, one cup of coffee, toast (they charge extra for the toast), tax and tip came to well over $50.
author: H. G.

description: The food was good and we had a good time until the bill came. Please be aware that the soda drink  ($5) is charged individually, which means it has no refill. I was charged $15 for just regular soda. I know it was part of my fault for not checking if it was refillable, but the way that the staff asked was easily interpreted as the soda refill was free. In addition, the staff forgot about my third refill. By the time they remembered, we were ready to leave. However, the waiter insisted on getting us the refill. It turned out that I ended up paying for all the refill. It just left us with a bitter taste in the end.
author: Maple C.

description: Great place for breakfast on a pride Sunday.  It was busy but reasonable.  Sat and the bar and the two tenders took good care of us.  Food was delicious and came out fast.   Tried the ricotta toast and crab eggs Benedict.  Yum.   That was plenty for the two of us.  Oh, and orange juice was fresh and delicious too.
author: Marcus K.

description:
Food was pretty decent, but I must say the portions are little or I am a hungry beast. 

Started off with brussel sprout chips, which are nicely crisped but nothing too special about them. They just taste like crispy  brussel sprouts.

Next I had the ciopinno, but it was short of fish. The ciopinno dish had small shreds of crab, plenty  of clams and two quarters of a scallop. For this to be a ciopinno dish, it was quite lacking. However, the sauce was delicious and quite flavorful. 

The burger was something people were raving about so we also got that, but the patty wasn't good. It had a gamey taste and it was overly salted. I was pretty disappointed with the burger, but the fries were delicious. 

Overall, I think that this place definitely has potential and I would come back here to try it again. The flavors are there, but it is missing a bit of the execution.
author: Linette F.

description: Had an early dinner at thus restaurant. I'd never eaten octopus before but I was told by friends that I should try the charred octopus which was surprisingly very tasty.  The octopus it self was tender.  And tge drinks were very good as well.  The restaurant it self was very clean and the service was beyond five star service.
author: Emiko S.

description:
I went to Marlowe for dinner with a couple of my friends. I looked through yelp to see what's popular. We've ordered: raw oysters, baked oysters, bone marrow, Brusselsprouts, pork chop, ribeye, and Marlowe burger. Most items ordered tasted basic (like we can order it at another restaurant). Service was great. 

Highly recommend: 
Bone marrow
The Baker (drink)
author: Kim C.

description: Food was flavorful. Waiters were knowledgeable and kind! What a great place to have lunch. Sat at the community table and enjoyed a new experience!
author: Jennel N.

description:
I was really looking forward to Marlowe given the plethora of positive reviews on Yelp. However, it was just plain disappointing. 

The service was slow and unfriendly, the food was in general extremely salty, and the recommended wine pairings were not unsuited. 

I'm a sucker for creamy polenta but I was disheartened with the over-saltiness and the superfluous use of overpowering truffle oil. The burger was very mediocre, dry and lacked any real flavor beyond the caramelized onions. 

In a city filled with a sea of restaurants, don't waste your time on Marlowe.
author: Priya S.

description:
Not your run of the mill brunch spot - you won't be able to find your egg and waffle favorites here. 

That being said, there are fantastic menu items here that are worth trying at least once. Come with a group so you can get dishes to share!

We started with the warm kale salad, which in my opinion is a must! Warm, garlicky, and with a perfectly runny poached egg on top. Enough to split! 

I would probably pass on the French toast soldiers a second time around. It was still good and comes with two dipping sauces - coffee and chocolate. There was something off about the consistency of the chocolate sauce...it was a little bit thicker than desired, almost as if they had added marshmallow or too much corn starch. Still yummy, but a little bit odd. We were debating between the doughnuts and the French toast - there was a little bit regret after we saw doughnuts arrive at the table next door. 

The mushroom polenta was a little bit out of my comfort zone but I've been a sucker for poached eggs lately - it was fantastic! The mushrooms were delicious and I always love a good serving of shaved parmesan. I got a side of bacon for a little serving of meat and a side of maple syrup - which was a great call! Disclaimer, if you are into thick cut chewy bacon, this will not be for you. Lucky for me I dig crunchy bacon, so this was perfect.

Also heard great things about burger! Overall, this place is a little pricier and the menu items are not your traditional brunch options, but I think it was pretty worth it for the experience and I would come back to try more menu items!
author: Sarah N.

description:
I made a reservation via OpenTable for dinner on friday. It's my husband's birthday, and he was craving for a good burger. Verdict is that the marlowe burger didn't disappoint, but he said it's not the best burger he ever had. I am in love with their devil eggs, and baked oysters. Husband killed my polenta when it was served. We both love it. Flavorful and full of texture. A tad salty, but I love it. The service is top notch.  The hostess sat us down immediately though we were 15 mins early. The servers kept checking on us even though they were pretty busy.  They served us with a surprise dessert with a birthday candle on the side when I simply asked for a birthday note on the table when I made the reservation. 
On a separate note, their dinner menu starts at 530pm. Some of the mains are not available before that, but you can still order the Marlowe burger. :)
author: Jasmine H.

description: I rarely give a 5 star rating to places but the food, drink, and service exceed the price.
author: bart f.

description:
If you love seasonal, high quality food and willing to pay a little more, look no further.

The prices are on the higher side, especially for starters (portions are small) but food was very tasty. The combination of different flavors and textures were unique and phenomenal. Also big plus, they serve food while it is still hot.

The selection of wine and cocktails is big and the red wine served by the glass was the perfect temperature.

Only critique: there were too many servers (with no assigned tables). We weren't finished with of the sides but our main dish plates were empty. In the 10 minutes that we needed to finish the side we were asked 3 or 4 times if they can take our food away.
author: Michèle S.

description:
Here are the downsides to eating here and I'm only listing them because others can rave about the food, but I think you should know what you're getting into. 

There is construction happening near the area and I do not think they will be done anytime soon. The space is small. I'm a big girl and I could flip a table trying to get in and out of the booth seating. Since the space is tight, you'll hear other peoples conversations. It's almost like communal dinning. Multiple staff members will help you, pick on and stick with them. You only confuse the entire flow if you ask every one for that thing you thought you got but didn't. 

If you're cool with all the above, then check it out.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Whatever I order here, I never go wrong. Cuz they're good like that.

The deviled egg sammie, loaded with cheez and tiny pickled jalapeño slices? So good! I wish their sister restaurant, Park Tavern, had it too.

Fries? Yummy for my tummy. 

Desserts? I've had a couple here, all amazing.

One of my fave spots in the city.
author: Gabriela W.

description: Brunch time is always my fav! The restaurant is sooo hot that there are many people there. Luckily we have a table in the backyard, which is sooooo chic. We ordered the doughnuts, deviled egg, salmon bagel and Benedict.All of these are pretty much delicious !!! The Benedict is the best in town. It is such an amazing dinning experience I will back soon.
author: Iris S.

description:
While in jury duty, thought I'd treat myself to a nice lunch.   I had room temperature soup and a tiny open faced egg salad sandwich... with a salad of plain greens.  Not only was I disappointed, I think I was robbed.  Oh yeah... more than 30 min between soup and pitiful excuse for a sandwich.   Can't win them all.
I will say the wait staff was charming and attentive.  Not going back.
author: J C.

description:
Marlowe has been one of those restaurants that has been on my list to visit forever! I have a tendency to over-hype restaurants in my mind and get disappointed when I actually go, but this place blew my expectations away! I came on a Saturday for brunch and of course, it was super packed! Luckily there was some open seats at the bar so we didn't have to wait.

We ordered a half dozen oysters (it's never too early for oysters, right?), deviled eggs, and crab toast with poached egg to share. Everything was delicious! For my entree I ordered the burratta tartine. It had candied bacon, which makes anything extra tasty! Then for dessert (because who can go without dessert? Not me, that's for sure!) we got the french toast soldiers which came with two different sauces. I'm all about the coffee creme because I'm the hugest fan of anything coffee flavored, but the Mexican hot chocolate was delicious as well.

After such a delicious brunch experience, we're very excited to make a reservation for dinner some time. Can't wait to be back!
author: Angel K.

description: We loved this little gem! Not in the best area but we found that the best restaurants we went to in San Fran weren't in the best areas. That aside, the food was very tasty and the atmosphere was crisp and inviting. We opted for a fish dish which was a moderately portioned option. It was enough for me but may have been slightly small in general. We also got the Marlowe burger which was delicious! The staff were also great and sat us at a beautiful table after hearing we were on a date and new to the area. Great little spot
author: Michelle G.

description: I was expecting the service and food to be better for the pricing and previous reviews.
author: Jimmy J.

description:
Tldr; Service was good. Food was good. Everything was really salty hence -1 star.

Food
Appetizer: Bone Marrow and Duck Liver Mousse
Bone marrow was good but only decent, not that flavorful. I have had better. 
Duck liver mousse was very tasty. We required more bread to finish up the mousse, which they were happy to provide.

Main: Marlowe Burger and Ribeye Steaks
The Ribeye was medium rare, well presented. The fries were crispy. The burger was juicy.

Sides: Brussel Sprouts and Cheese Cauliflower
The Brussel sprouts were burnt/overcooked. The cheese cauliflower was good, what you would expect for cheese and cauliflower. 

The most important thing was that everything was VERY SALTY. Like overly salty. It was difficult to eat more than 2 fries throughout the entire dinner. I ended up taking my Ribeye to go because it was too salty to finish eating. My water cup was continually refilled as I drained it every 5-10 minutes. Other than the saltiness... no complaints. Would consider going back to give them a second chance in case the chef had an overly heavy hand on the salt that day.

-1 star for the saltiness.
author: Eric P.

description:
We went without reservations, and they did there best to seat us right away.  The food  came out fast, hot the presation was perfect, our food was aboustly  amazing. My husbands burger was cooked a perfect medium  as he request.  I had the fresh fish { salmon}  there was nothing we would change. 
A perfect date place it's very cozy,  small quaint place but no really no leg room.  
My fish plate was £28.00 so not overly priced. 
I will recommend it and we will be returning.
author: Cynthia G.

description: My husband and I came here on a whim after he picked me up from SFO. Went in and was greeted, they offered us a seat at the bar at the window or we could wait 10 minutes for a patio seat. Patio seat sounded awesome as it was a warm Day! We waited outside  (small place), and I thought to myself where is there a patio?? Called us back in and escorted us to their patio (through the kitchen and out the door), soooo cute! We ordered oysters on the half shell and shared a burger. Food was DELICIOUS and service was great!! I highly recommend, if you're in the area
author: Bianca V.

description: Very tasty food and drinks to be had at this popular SOMA spot. Very good service here too!
author: Liam M.

description: I've walked by this gem for years and finally visited last night. From the moment our party of 3 walked in, the experience was relaxing, tasty, and worth every penny. The gem salad was crisp and full of flavor. The mushroom soup was velvety and smooth with a hint of the perfect amount of funk necessary. The burger was off the hook! Perfectly cooked. Juicy. The jumbo shrimp was fresh with a well paired spicy cocktail salad. The French fries were crispy, hot, and the perfect portion.  Dessert included a gingerbread cake that was light, moist, with a lovely warm spice. Also recommended, the chocolate peanut-butter bites. This place met all of our needs. Good service. Good food. Nice ambiance. I have nothing but positive things to say. We ll be going back soon!
author: Darrin D.

description: Came here for date night with my partner and it was great. We had previously been here for drinks only (and the bone marrow appetizer) and decided we had to come back for dinner after seeing some of the plates go by. First of all, definitely make a reservation for dinner. As far as drinks, they have some tasty cocktails- I am a huge fan of "The Juicer" (gin, cilantro, serrano chiles) which has a really nice kick to it if you enjoy spice. For dinner we got the oysters, corn soup (very creamy and delicious), little gem salad, deviled eggs and then split the prime rib. For dessert we got a strawberry shortcake which was just OK.
author: Debra D.

description:
Was looking for a new burger in the SF area, and came upon reviews for the burgers here, so we decided to give it a shot. 

This place is in an industrial area, but no big worries as parking it rather cheap here. A quarter an hour at the meters! Can't beat that. We didn't have reservations and the place was kinda empty, and were told we would have to eat at the bar. I didn't believe her at first, but yeah, this place filled up rather quickly. 

They have a decent selection of specialty drinks that were all quite good. The burger itself while being on the smaller side as well as a bit more on the expensive side was really realy good. I liked it! We didn't order anything else as we have been eating a bit too much recently, but everything was good overall. It's a smaller restaurant, but it's SF, so that's not unexpected. Overall, thumbs up.
author: Benny H.

description:
Came here for brunch with mom before heading to MOMA! There were plenty of street parking :)
Brunch is easy to reserve, if you don't want to wait, reserve! We didn't see too many people waiting when we left though.

Brunch was okay, dinner's menu is more interesting to me, but food in general were pretty good! The highlight has been the polenta! So delicious and refreshing! Recommended if you want something lighter for Brunch. The donuts were also very good.

The service was good (I love their apron!), love the decor!
author: Ya K.

description:
Excelent food!! Enjoyed every bite!! Great ambiance, a little noise. ... food is worth it! Best plate ever POLENTA!!! 
Will go back for sure!!
author: Luz V.

description: Why I love Marlowe: the burger, the brussel sprout chips, the ambience, the service (shout out to our server tonight, Cassandra!), the music, the desserts...you really can't go wrong here.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I went to eat their Poulet Vert, and it was as good as people said. Who knew Roast Chicken could be so juicy and succulent, even after reheating leftovers! The dumpling-like sides that came with the chicken were also phenomenal: a rich, cheesy flavor that bodes well with the juices and leaves you craving for more.

With regards to the atmosphere of the place, it was pretty cozy. Tight corners and somewhat small tables make it hard for a large group meal. However, take a small group of friends there, and you won't be disappointed!
author: Aaron L.

description: I've come here many times, and might even come here again, but the service my mother, girlfriend and I received last night was so terrible that I had to write a review to make you, and Marlowe, aware.
author: Pedro R.

description:
Marlowe is really a place where you should indulge in every bite. Not just because the plates are a tad smaller than usual, but also because each bite is packed with the perfect mix of flavors. Seating is pretty limited for how popular it is, so I'd definitely recommend making a reservation. Service is so friendly and polite yet the ambience definitely creates a yuppy vibe. 

Having heard so much of the Marlowe burger, my dad and I decided to order that along with the warm kale and Brussels sprouts salad. The salad comes with three crisps of crouton bread and slices of Parmesan cheese. I wish I knew the dressing the salad was in but it's creamy and not too overwhelming. The portion is small,  but like I said earlier, I would take the time to indulge in every bite! The Marlowe burger comes with a choice of fries or salad, but I'd recommend getting the fries. Personally, I thought it was fried to the perfect degree and the horseradish aioli is really what it's hyped up to be! That was my dads favorite part of the meal and be found it to be very unique. We ordered the burger medium rare and it was cooked to perfection!

Marlowe caters to all sorts of groups: families, couples, young adults, and definitely the SF foodie seeking out the new "hip" place to go!
author: Hannah C.

description: Marlowe is probably one of the best burgers I've had here in San Francisco. Great staff and really fun decor. Highly recommend checking this place out.
author: Marco J.

description:
I've had Marlowe bookmarked for ages, and I finally got the chance to eat here. We made a reservation and showed up about 30 minutes earlier. The restaurant itself is pretty small and in a squat building that you could totally overlook. It was mostly full, but we got seated immediately at a booth. It's noisy in there, and the tables are very crowded together, so careful where you go in case you knock down some unaware diner's food. 

My friend and I ordered the oysters, bone marrow, brussels sprouts chips, Marlowe burger, and pork chops. I love bone marrow, but I should probably stop ordering it at every restaurant that serves it... Either way, the bone marrow here was delicious. Our waiter recommended scraping our bread along the bottom of the pan to catch the oil that had leaked out, which sounds really gross and unhealthy but is totally worth it. The oysters were yum. They tasted of the sea. Super fresh, so it was okay that market price that day was $18. The brussels sprouts chips were... interesting. They were really heavily salted, and even that wasn't enough to hide the bitterness of the brussels sprouts. The texture was good, but I can confidently say I'm not a fan of brussels sprouts. 

The Marlowe burger was just a burger. If you've read my reviews, you know my opinion towards overpriced burgers and fast food, but I thought we'd give it a try considering the hype. The waiter was nice enough to split it in half for my friend and me without asking. What really stole the show were the pork chops. O M G. Get the pork chops. I've never had pork chops this tender in my life. Seriously. At one point, I was just gnawing meat off the bone. Yes, I'm a savage. Check came out to be around $100.
author: Sophie W.

description:
My new favourite spot in SF!

So me and my man were in the mission bay area which we aren't entirely familiar with and our friend recommended we check out Marlowe! Obviously, being the food freak that I am I decided to check it out on yelp first, duh! Everything checked out, solid 4 stars, 2000 reviews, beautiful food pics, etc. So at that point I was already sold and excited to head there.

It was a Friday night around 7 so of course we called first to see if we needed to reserve a spot and they told us we could try our luck in the next couple minutes for a seat at the bar (all tables were booked). So we rushed there and the bar was actually full but we did get this really cute seat at a sort of window counter near the entrance which I honestly loved, it was really private and we love people watching so it was perfect for us.

We finally got to ordering our wine, apps and mains and as everything came I just kept getting more and more impressed!! I got the Brut Rosé and he got the Syrah and both were amazingly fresh. For appetizers we got the smoked crab and rock shrimp poppers with a spicy hollandaise sauce and it had the nicest crunchiest texture and nicely put together flavours. It IS somewhat filling so if you don't have a huge appetite I'd probably skip it. We also got some baked oysters and seriously they were a delicacy. For our mains, I went with the Anson Mills Polenta and he got the Marlowe Burger cooked medium well. The polenta knocked my socks off, truly. Could not ask for a better blend of flavours and textures. Now I didn't try the burger because I don't eat meat but apparently the patty was real nice and cooked to perfection. However, my man felt like the horseradish sauce was sort of overpowering! He said something that really made me laugh, he has really bad seasonal allergies and he told me "It's great though it's like my nose keeps getting cleared over and over with every single bite!!". Which was funny but let's face it, it can get tiring after a while but I'm glad he kept the humour angle going. 

I was really impressed with our waitress when she provided us with full table service, which I haven't seen often in SF. She did all the Do's and none of the Don't's which I'm very familiar with, as I've worked in 5 star restaurants myself. The only thing that kind of bothered me was that, because we are really young, higher quality restaurants tend to take us less seriously and demonstrate subtle condescending undertones when they speak to us, which I'm really sensitive to and our waitress went there once or twice. I was able to overlook it but I really hope she brings the judgment level down a little notch, as she doesn't know our walk of life... 

Sadly, we couldn't get dessert as we were utterly stuffed! But overall this is a 5 star quality restaurant with 5 star quality service, food, ambiance and cleanliness.

No doubt in my mind we'll be back sooner than later! 

PS: Sorry for the novel :)
author: Emilie P.

description: My visit here was extremely great. The food and service is great. Suggest to make a booking otherwise you will generally wait for a table or seats at the bar.
author: Patricia B.

description: Hands down the best brunch place I've been in a long time! If you're in San Fransisco you have to check this place out! Me and my best friend went there two days in a row. Very charming, cozy, simple and unique interior...they also have a full bar which was awesome since they had really really great drinks! The food was perfection and super tasty! The service was awesome! I can't wait to go back :)!!!
author: Maya J.

description: I had a mushroom soup, it was rich and smooth with small pearl onions. A little pricey but worth it for how great everything was.
author: James G.

description:
I feel like I'm doing the electric slide in this restaurant.  The tables are very close together and the aisles are really narrow that you can't squeeze past each other but rather someone needs to back up and let the other pass by.  And if you need to use the restroom, walk with caution as the servers are back there moving back and forth between the kitchen and another back station (not sure what the correct term is but you know what I mean?!).

Ok enough about the narrow aisles.  The restaurant has a clean white and black color combo going on.  Their menu is written on butcher paper.

I got their burger cooked medium well except it came out more of medium rarish.  Not a huge deal.  It was still dee-li-shus with the horseradish aioli sauce, shoestring fries.  It also comes with a small green salad ($16).  Coffee was also good.  

Would come here again if meeting a friend in the area.
author: Jen S.

description:
I was told there was a burger. I came here for the burger, so I will tell you my experience with the burger. It was good. Nothing too fancy. A flavorful, medium-rare, ground beef burger with a little bit of grease with a simple layer of cheddar cheese, a couple of slices of bacon, some fresh lettuce, and a nice bun that holds it all together. By itself, a good classic burger, but this is different because of its horseradish aioli. It gives you a strong kick, right in the mayonnaise and works very well with the classics. It also works very well with their fries (which are also quite good). My dilemma was actually finding enough of this aioli to fit on each bite of my burger AND my fries. The whole thing is greasy, but not too greasy (I like greasy) with a flavor new to the burger game.

The decor is clean and has its own style. Servers and friendly and attentive. Other parts of the menu also intrigued me like their open faced deviled egg sandwich. I'll come back to try it out at some point. And as long as close to $20 a burger is acceptable to you, then I suggest you try it too.
author: Bryant C.

description:
Torn between 3 and 4 stars, but I'm going to go with three for now. I don't work too far from Marlowe, but had never been there till recently because it always seemed pretty crowded. Recently I was able to grab a seat at the bar though, and had a fairly nice experience though nothing spectacular. 

The menu isn't too big, with a few appetizers, some smaller plates ("bites"), and then a few entrees and sides. A lot of the starters and bites sounded good (the duck liver mousse, warm Caesar toast, steak tartare, roasted bone marrow are all things I definitely considered ordering) but since their burger seems to be pretty popular, I went with that. I did start with the deviled eggs which were okay but not what I consider to be deviled eggs since they were more like just hard boiled eggs with bacon and cheese. 

The burger was good, but not amazing. I did appreciate that they cooked it exactly medium as I asked- a lot of places around San Francisco have seemed incapable of cooking my burger to my preferred temperature so this was a big plus. I love bacon on my burger usually but here I actually found it to take away from the burger a little, especially because the bacon was just a tad overcooked. The horseradish aioli did add a nice tang but it seemed to not be consistently spread and so parts of my burger had more (those parts were definitely better) while other parts had almost none. The burger was definitely on the salty side as well. The fries it came with were really good- crispy and perfectly seasoned. 

I also had a couple cocktails. The cocktails on their menu were not super interesting to me, and I ordered one but was not a big fan of it (they did have a couple of special cocktails of the day which sounded better but I didn't try those). Since nothing on the menu sounded interesting, I also ordered an old fashioned. This was well made and I would definitely order it again. I normally like to try things from a restaurant's cocktail menu, but here, I would probably stick to my usual choices (unless they change the menu in the future, which I have a feeling they do). 

Overall, Marlowe is not a bad option for either just appetizers and drinks or a full meal. I would potentially come back in the future to try more of their menu, especially some of the small plates and starters.
author: Seema U.

description:
Marlowe is one of my favorite places in the city.  Its food is usually interesting and well prepared and the service tends to be spot on.  On this visit, while service was as good as always, there were glitches with the food.

My meal started with burrata that came atop grilled levain on top of which was heirloom tomatoes and a hefty dose of balsamic.  My quibble with this plate, and it is only a quibble as the food tasted wonderful, was how to eat what was served.  Lifting the bread/burrata/tomatoes/balsamic from the plate to my mouth led to my pants getting a good taste of my meal.  But the levain was thickly sliced making it difficult to cut through the crust with a knife.  Sometimes a chef should consider how a patron will deconstruct what is served in order to consume it. 

On the basis of so many positive reviews I tried the polenta with wild mushrooms, a poached egg, parmesan cheese, arugula, and a salsa verde. I'm an outlier, but this was so carbohydrate-rich that I might have been loading for a marathon.   And the plate didn't come together as food for me as the salsa verde gave a bitter taste to the polenta.   I started to think that it would have been better had the bottom of the polenta been crisped to give more texture to what was served; and rather than salsa verde I would have preferred some slices of apple or another fruit to provide sweetness to this earthy dish.

Never mind.  Next time I visit you can be sure that the Marlowe burger will be on my radar.
author: David D.

description: I enjoyed the food (burrata, pistachios, steak tartar) and the wine, service was attentive and the place is a hot spot, very busy. Small space white decor, seating is booths facing chairs, kind of classic American corner spot vibe. I recommend a visit in Sf
author: Shannon D.

description:
Incredible dining experience that can't be described without mentioning the incredible flavours in the food. We took our 13 year old daughter with us so we were a bit sceptical if she would enjoy it, but the quality of presentation and food was second to none! The friend we went with had told us it was one of his favourite restaurants in the world and after dining there, I would now agree. 
In terms of quality, food, taste, service and experience I would rate it above a Nobu restaurant simply on the food itself. While the menu was a complex concoction the flavours worked together perfectly, with not one single dish disappointing us - and we are very fussy diners! It's a 10/10 from us - we can't wait to go back on our next trip to Toronto and have already recommended it our our friends.
author: Chrid G.

description: We didn't have a reservation (party of 4) and it was full, but they were able to squeeze us in after about a short 15min wait. The restaurant was packed, but the staff were amazing and really helpful. We had to have one of the best waiters and he really went out of his way. The food was amazing, the service...all around a great experience! I would def. recommend!
author: Emma W.

description: Burger here is really juicy. Fries are fine too. Definitely one of the better burgers I have had. Tried other things like brussel sprouts and cauliflower, but just get the burger and fries and you will be happy
author: Victor D.

description: Fantastic modern American, from burgers to steak to chicken, it's all exceptional at this extremely popular watering hole.
author: jason c.

description: I attended a lovely group dinner on the patio last month and had a great experience.  The restaurant is so quaint...great decor and atmosphere.  The service was fantastic and the food was quite tasty.  Two friends of mine and I had ordered all of the items on the prix fixe menu, so we could try it all.  We had the gem salad, shrimp and burrata for appetizers, polenta, chicken and ribeye for our entrees and gingerbread, pudding and chocolate peanut butter bites for dessert...way too much food, but oh so good!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Outstanding food service and cocktails!!
Loved the bone marrow deviled eggs  ribeye and lavender gin fizz. 

The chicken was so so and the shortcake was really dry. 

My only gripe is that the appetizers are tinyyyyy.
author: N B.

description:
Fantastic food. Their kale and brussel sprout caesar and steak salad at lunch is encroyable.

The restaurant, team and ambiance is wonderful and very responsive. Thank you.
author: Tina H.

description: One of my favorite brunch spots in SF! The candied grapefruit dish is a must try! Went there on Sunday morning with few of my friends and the atmosphere was great. Amazing service as well. Will definitely come back again!
author: Tina G.

description:
Hello Marlowe...you did me right with your bone marrow. It really hit the spot since I've been craving for bone marrow for a long long while. The spread and bread complimented it very well with the bone marrow.. Definitely coming back for this.

The pork chop was good and I enjoy it with the cherries and grains. Again, when a dish comes together with all the ingredients in place, it makes the dish that much more satisfying.

However, the burger with the bacon was a little salty for me, but my boyfriend enjoys it, so more for him!

Service was good and it was easy to get a table on a Monday night.
author: Mandy D.

description: Wasn't very impressed. The service was nice and friendly but considering the hype of this place I expected something a bit more exciting. The gem salad was good but was missing that special zing I expected from this price range. The roasted pistachios were good but not sure why they were even on the menu... seemed a bit out of place. The Brussel sprouts were mediocre, nothing better than your pan fried grocery store variety. My company was excited over the crab cakes, so maybe those were worth it? The place was extremely crowded and the dim lights seemed to be hiding sanitation issues. Dust everywhere. For four dining at $200, again I expect better quality, not a fan.
author: Melanie S.

description: This is an awesome restaurant the food and the taste is very delicate.  The portions are perfect and not too much awesome location to have breakfast lunch and dinner
author: Paymon G.

description: Amazing. Unfortunately, I was alone and only had 20 minute for lunch. I still managed to be spoiled by their Steak Tartare, Burrata, Brussel Chips, and a cocktail. The service was amazing and the food matched. I will be back. Heard their Burger and Chicken Sandwich are even better. Wow.
author: Abby S.

description: The best burger in the Bay Area. Additionally, they have a good variety of appetizers. The best desert item on the menu is peanut butter chocolate bites. It gets a bit noisy at the place and makes it difficult to have easy conversation, however the food make you forget about that.
author: Hagop H.

description:
Food: delicious! 4/5 stars
Service: 2/5 stars :/ 
We came on a saturday night for a late dinner around 10pm. I would recommend making reservations to avoid waiting but we didn't know so we waited about 25 minutes. 
The restaurant is dimly lit and perfect for a more intimate setting where a couple friends can enjoy some food and drinks :)
I do like that you're welcome to drink while you wait for a table.
We ordered the brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, and bone marrow. 
The bone marrow was so fatty and amazing, but then again-- i've never had bad bone marrow.
I also really enjoyed the brussel sprout chips because they reminded me of potato chips but the bowl was kind of small for the amount you're paying.
Finally, the deviled eggs were good but not anything out of the ordinary.

The reason why I gave this place was because our server just seemed angry most of the time and that kind of dampened the mood on trying this restaurant for the first time. He also told us that we weren't allowed to order more food once the order was put in (I assume this is because they were doing last call?) but didn't explain himself and was mean about it.
author: Christine W.

description: Pretty delicious food. I'm giving it a 4 because it deserves it but I do want to mention it's a bit overrated. Don't get me wrong, it's definitely quality. I just think there are much better places like Cockscomb featured on Anthony Bourdain right around the corner.
author: Diego A.

description:
Kudos to Marlowe for executing a great New Years Eve dinner. Food was phenomenal as always and service was on point. 
Thank you for accommodating our requests we had a wonderful time !!
author: Mitzy P.

description:
Pretty good. Came here for brunch with a friend on a Saturday. We got the deviled eggs which apparently is something they're quite known for, and I had the chorizo with poached eggs and polenta. The deviled eggs were pretty good, and honestly I have no idea why I got chorizo cause I'm normally not a huge fan of it, but it tasted pretty good here as well. The place is a bit loud though -- felt like I was straining to hear my friend talk while we were here, but not a huge deal.

Overall, I enjoyed it enough, but wasn't mindblown or anything. I felt like it was a great experience. May rewrite this review in the future if I come back for dinner which is what I feel like they're more known for.
author: Jasmine X.

description: Perfect brunch spot! We came during the Thanksgiving weekend and it wasn't crowded. We made a reservation thinking it would be packed but we were able to easily change our reservation time. Its a cute place and food was great! It's still kinda typical brunch food but a little twist I'd say? So I ordered the hash that came in like what I would describe as a hash steak with meat and egg on it :) nommmmmm...it was awesome! Our friends ordered the salmon bagel and burger which sound like just any normal place would serve but to my surprise the salmon bagel was pretty amazing! First of all the bagel was crispy and they paired the salmon with a thin size of beet which makes it super refreshing! The burger in the other hand came with loads of fries! Glad she asked for no Patty burger haha! Smart move :) we didn't drink but had coffee which was ok, down to come back for a dinner and maybe another brunch to see if they have items on the menu too!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Beautiful, brightly lit space that is perfect for brunch. The service was polite and attentive. I was surprised there was a table available when we walked in on a weekend for brunch.

I tried the popular marlowe burger ($16). I loved the flavor and juiciness of the patty combined with the caramelized onions. I don't like horseradish but I couldn't really taste it in the aioli which was great for me. I ordered the burger with salad but next time I would get it with fries. The salad vinaigrette was a little too strong for me.

Overall my friends and I really enjoyed our meals and the atmosphere of the restaurant.
author: Linda X.

description: This was without a doubt the best burger I have EVER had in my life. You'd have to be crazy not to come here for yourself and try one.
author: Jon T.

description:
This has been on my friend's bookmarked list for a while. We came for lunch and managed to grab a seat by the bar. I ordered the brussels sprouts, steak and salad and she order the shrimp roll and fries. The only thing that we continue to eat was the French fries. On all the pictures we saw delicious brussel sprouts and instead of chips it was a bowl of small balls-the inside of the sprouts which had no flavor. The steak was just ok not very memorable, salad watered down with a bad vinaigrette. The shrimp was super small and the bread didn't work with it. Afterward, we were still hungry and not satisfied. 

The place was very clean, farm to table look and feel. Service was excellent. However, the food was sub par.
author: Van N.

description: This place is awesome! Great foods like the Brussels sprout chips, shrimp cocktail, beef tartareand burrata as appetizers and it was amazing. We also got a dozen oysters and tasted very fresh. We also ordered the deviled egg sandwich, it was good but nothing special hit home to me. All the other foods were unique and different and tasteful. But the sandwich was just boring after all the appetizers. The best part of this place is the service. It was great. From the host to the bar to the server. We were told a 45 min wait and said that was cool. Sat at the bar and the bartenders were great conversationalist as well as mixologist. Creating drinks for us off menu of their own design. So don't be afraid to ask them a drink. Then when seated our server was knowledge and even split our plates that we wanted to share for us, so very  cool. Overall a great restaurant. The restaurant is quite small so be prepared to not get out of your seat when sat since you have to move the tables to get into your seats
author: Garrett P.

description: Somewhat disappointed with all the hype of this spot. Not sure why everyone is so jazzed over the Brussels chips. Could easily make these at home and have. Ran out of the entree my friend and I wanted to get, cod. I settled for the chicken which was decent - I was hungry and it got the job done. My friend ordered the polenta which was extremely heavy. It's a shame you can't order a half portion. My fiancé enjoyed the pork entree. We loved the octopus starter and our drinks - I would return for those, and to try the cod. The complimentary vacherin dessert provided for not having the entrees we wanted was a nice finish to the meal - highly recommend. I wouldn't rush to come back though.
author: Kristina L.

description: Very expensive for not a lot of food. I got the burger, and honestly, wish I had gone to Louie's instead. It's in a weird location as well. Would recommend if in the area, but if you have to walk here, not worth it.
author: Matt H.

description:
We took our friends here from New York to try Marlowe. Why? Because the Marlowe burger is the talk of the town...and why is it the talk of the town? Because it is that good! Moist patty, two strips of thick bacon, crunchy buns, and crispy fries. Not to mention, the appetizers are good too. And did I mention the place has beers?!?! Had the lager...which goes very well with the burger.

Gotta admit though, the place is quite pricey and the place where it is at is kind of out of place. It is in Brannan Street which is not one of the best places in San Fran. However, if the burger is as good as Marlowe's burger, then it is worth the danger. And like I have said, if you want to know if the place is that good, you gotta try it once...and twice to confirm!
author: Bjorn R.

description:
I've been wanting to check out brunch here, but am always deterred by the wait.  During other times of the day, the food is good.  

People really like the burger, but I didn't care much for it.  You should know that I am not really into burgers, so don't let my opinion sway you from getting it.  Otherwise, the other food I've had has been good, usually bar food- brussel sprouts, bone marrow, oysters, and fries.  I like the ambiance and the service is friendly.  
 
Nice spot, with a name that holds a special place in my heart.
author: Lyn C.

description: Marlowe is one of my go-to places everytime i visit the city. My husband and I go there for the warm atmoshphere, delectable eats, and lovely libations. My favorite drink is the Baker. The prices are a little high but worth every penny. I love Marlowe!
author: Qui K.

description:
I live right across the street from here and that scares me given how good the food is and how large my appetite can be. 

The service is lovely and no one judged us after adding a third additional round of candied bacon to our brunch. On top of that the french toast soldiers were adorable, amazing, and we hung on to the two accompanying sauces (syrup and chocolate) for the duration of the meal. DIP THE BACON IN THE SAUCES. We also got the grilled asparagus with crumbled chorizo and a poached egg on top. There was more than that but those were the stars of the show. 

Happy.
author: DeAnna C.

description:
I've been here a few times now and I have to say, for what they offer, atmosphere, location, etc. this place is pretty solid.

Of course, the burger is one of the musts on the menu. Any time of the day, get a burger! This is not your traditional burger joint, per se, but it is nevertheless an excellent burger and delicious at that.

I thought the chicken sandwich was okay, and I am not too impressed by their fries. The deviled eggs are pretty good but they're now only on the dinner menu. Overall, great place to meet up with a small group of friends (place is tiny!) or a date!
author: Lorrie M.

description:
I was in town for the San Francisco Marathon. My regular meal before a race is a burger and I've heard nothing but great things about this place, so I made a reservation for dinner at 6 pm. My friends and I came here a little before 6 pm and the place was pretty packed. Even though we were a tad early, they were still able to seat us right away. Their menu was pretty concise and simple. I went with their Marlowe Burger.

*Marlowe Burger with a side salad*
Good stuff. This salad was a bit different from the salads that I'm used to eating. It went well with the burger. This burger wasn't the best that I've had, but it was good. I loved the flavors. I also liked that the bread was not flimsy and did not disintegrate as I made my way through the burger. The patty was a bit small for the bread.

Overall, I liked the service, the ambiance, and the food. I would definitely like to come back and try other items on their menu.
author: Emil C.

description:
Love everything about this place. The decor inside was lovely and the atmosphere prompted my date and I to go out for more drinks after our meal. Just wait until you see the patio. Draped with hanging yellow lights and walls adorned with plants, the patio was a quaint, quiet, romantic place to dine. It was a cold summer night (I still love you, San Francisco) but I never felt cold, as it was very well heated. For a walk in on a Friday night, I'd say I got pretty lucky. 


The bone marrow was TDF and definitely lived up to the hype, brussel sprouts were crispy, although I would probably skip out on them next time, and the pork chops were well seasoned, charred on the outside and moist on the inside, garnished with an ample amount of green and red peppers and onions roasted to perfection. Good job Marlowe, you'll be seeing me back for brunch.
author: Alexis Y.

description: My favorite dish here - the lemon and garlic roasted Brussels sprouts chips. I know everyone raves about the burger, and while it's good, I've had better. But the sprout chips make it all worth it! I also really like the gourmet egg salad sandwich, which I've had on two occasions and pleasantly surprised.
author: Bianca E.

description:
After an evening tour to Alcatraz, my fella and I decided to try Marlowe for a late night dinner. 

We arrived about 30 minutes early for our reservation so they seated us at a small bar area for some drinks before dinner. The restaurant is quite small so all the seats and tables are really close together. 

I didn't love my drinks so it took me a while to get through it. Once seated at our table for dinner, it felt like we were on top of the couple at the neighboring table, we were so uncomfortably close to them. 

After perusing the menu, we decided on the brussel sprouts, crab and shrimp crepes and the chicken fried okra. I enjoyed the crispy brussel sprouts and the crab and shrimp crepes although my fella felt the crepes were a little fishy. Neither of us liked the okra. They were flavorless and a little too oily. The "gravy" that came with them was essentially mayonnaise that was disgusting.

For our main courses I ordered the pork chop and my fella ordered the bacon cheeseburger. Both items were good but not particularly memorable or mind-blowing. The meats were well-seasoned and tasty, just not as flavorful as I was hoping for.

Overall, we had a pleasant meal with great service at a decent price point.
author: Emily R.

description: Great burger, been here many times. Had a bad experience once, the buns were hard if that makes any sense. Anyways the burger has a nice balance of everything. Hella flavorful. Fries are just basic shit but burger makes up for it. Service great.
author: Abdul C.

description:
Great food, great brews. Good date night spot. Loved the brussels sprouts. 

One thing to be aware of (not the restaurant's fault) but I got my car broken into across the street from the restaurant. So if driving there, be careful of what you leave in your car.
author: Andrew M.

description: Solid. I only ate apps & had cocktails, but everything was very good. Cauliflower soup, Little Gem Salad, Bruschetta all very good. We also had Artichoke, Okra & Shallot Fritto Misto. It was super tasty, but a bit heavy on the okra which got slimey fast after being served. The other veggies were good for quite a while after. Tasty coating.  Excellent cocktails, especially the Bakers Wife. Great service and very nice decor.
author: M. O.

description:
Loved this place! I came for brunch on a Saturday after finding out about this restaurant in a list of brunch places recommended by Eater sf. I was pleasantly surprised that they take reservations for brunch! I called on Friday evening and was able to make a reservation for 4 people at noon on Saturday the next day. I definitely recommend making reservations to avoid waiting for a table. 

This is not your typical brunch place, so don't expect things like eggs benedict and omelettes. It's a little bit more of an elevated menu. 

For starters we had the French toast soldiers, which were really good! They are basically French toast sticks served with 2 different sauces. One is coffee flavored and one is a Mexican chocolate sauce. Personally I like the coffee flavor more. It was delicious! 

All the reviews talked about the Marlow burger, so I couldn't leave without trying it. I thought it was a really good burger. It was cooked perfectly to a medium rare and was very juicy and flavorful. The carmelized onions added to the flavor as well. The fries were also good, but the best part was the horseradish aioli! I usually don't like horseradish, but this one was sooooo good!  

My boyfriend had the Dungeness crab and rock shrimp crepe. It had a generous amount of Dungeness crab in it and was decently good, but the portion was kind of small. I definitely thought the burger was better, but it was still a good dish. Loved the citrus hollandaise sauce that was on the crepe!

The drinks here are also really good! I had the special of the day, which had peach and grapefruit flavors. I don't remember what it was called, but it was very refreshing. My boyfriend had The Baker and my friends had the Calf which were also really good. I would definitely come here for the drinks! 

Our bill came out to almost $140 for 4 people so it's a bit pricey for brunch but I think it's worth it! 

Side note: it was pretty easy to find street parking.
author: Mai Y.

description:
3.5 stars.

Cute place. been wanting to come for a long time, and heard they recently moved. liked the space and service was great. came with a vegetarian so did not order the burger or bone marrow cause we were sharing a bunch of things and didn't think i could eat it all myself. maybe i should've. 

ordered the brussel sprout chips (meh - i make these all the time and didn't think these were special for $9); warmed deviled eggs (good); baked oysters (really good); broccolini app special (good); caesar toast (okay); little gem salad (i actually hated this.. boring and no flavor) and the dessert with meringue cookie and coffee ice cream (very good). 

all in all.. wasn't wowed by anything but i liked the ambience, service and setting. Would come back again to try non vegetarian dishes.
author: lesley l.

description: Quintessential spot that one must visits when they live in SF. The menu is quite simple, which I love. I've had everything on the menu... impressive I know haha but I would say this is place is a stamp Le. The burger is delicious! So is the steak and the pork chip. Perfectly cooked and well seasoned. Staff is helpful and attentive. The scene is a little more of the romantic side given its dim lighting but it's also a fun place to get dinner and drinks with your close friends. Conveniently located near the cal train station so your friends you can meet there if they are traveling from South Bay!
author: Michelle S.

description: Incredible grilled cheese! Im drooling just thinking about it.
author: J P.

description: I had an good experience here. The service was great! I had the poulet vert with pumpkin gnocchi. It was very salty and didn't like it that much. I also had the crispy Brussels sprouts which were great. The deviled eggs are good if you like bacon.
author: Anna C.

description:
* AMAZINGGG deviled eggs. Crunchy bacon, cheesy eggs. Wow, one of the best I've ever had.
* INCREDIBLEEE brussels sprouts chips. Crispy, buttery leaves. 
* Really tasty and satisfying (but not the best ever) burger. Fries were overly oily IMO.
* Ribeye: Pretty good, but not worth $38.  
* Little Gem Salad: Didn't try it but it was beautiful! Kinda pricey for the portion. 

Cute place, cute cocktails, delicious apps - wish it wasn't so claustrophobic.
author: Jess C.

description:
Not very vegetarian friendly unless you are ok with eating sides (their sides are REALLY good though).

For my main, I had the deviled egg sandwich (without bacon) with a side salad. I didn't enjoy the sandwich that much. The bacon probably makes it better, but I thought the combination of the melted cheese and the deviled egg portion was too heavy. 

Funnily enough, I loved their sides! Everyone at my table praised the salad, fries, and brussels sprout chips! I could literally eat an entire Costco-sized bag of their brussels sprout chips if such a thing existed!
author: Lisa T.

description: A real gem of a brunch place. As with many restaurants in San Fran, there was a line but it was well worth the wait. The eggs benedict was perfectly done and the waitress was very attentive. Wanted to try the Brussels sprout chips but unfortunately that wasn't available, but I'm definitely coming back to check out their dinner menu.
author: Wen-Tao C.

description:
Just finished my meal at Marlowe. This used to be my favorite restaurant at the old location, but can't say my experience was as amazing this time. I'll be back to update my review once more.

The restaurant has no AC. None. I have never sweat so much during a dinner and it was hard to focus on the conversation. The coolest thing in the restaurant was the bathroom sink water. Yeah...

Went with a group of 6 girls, we split several appetizers and two burgers. One burger was to be split 3 ways, but it was awkwardly split and unproportional. I might've preferred to split it on my own. They did split the other burger in half and put it on two plates with an equal amt of fries. Kudos to Marlowe for that!

Also -- kudos to the server and chef because our bone marrow was shallow, so they fired off a new one for us AND still delivered the other one. Price increase from my last review at the old location $13 to $17.

Also, this is not the best place for birthdays. We tried to do something for a friend, but found that we'd have to pay for the dessert and they'd put a candle in, but that also meant we had to pick the dessert. We didn't have enough time when my friend was gone from the table and this place didn't take initiative to give us a menu. Nothing happened.

I think my first two times at Marlowe were so amazing that now, with increased prices, I expect even more.
author: Christina L.

description:
Brunch at Marlowe Saturday.

Originally seated on patio. just enough time to decide the metal chairs were really uncomfortable when a couple sat next to me (tables are close together) and the man was wearing reeking hair gel. I flagged down server and explained I need to move. They found a nice corner table inside with some space around it; and a family with two little boys at next table. Little boys don't wear scented hair glop. Thanks for that.

So, since I was now able to taste food, ordered the non-alcoholic raspberry cocktail (sparkler, I think it's called). They had a special, grilled bread with olive oil & chocolate. I'd heard of this but never ate it. It was fabulous, I'm going to try and construct it at home. They don't, at least at brunch, have any kind of appetizer salad. Got the citrus brulee as a kind of fruit salad, it was very good. I am not a huge burger fan but everyone says the Marlowe burger & fries are so great. Otherwise I'd order huevos rancheros, but also doing brunch Sunday when I knew I'd be eating eggs, so got the burger. Server annoyed when I called their aioli "mayonnaise" (as in, burger without mayonnaise). Burger no more than fair. I asked medium and it was a little more done than that and also a little dry. Moreover the bun (after already having bread) made me feel over-full. Also ordered tea. They brought a cup of water and a tea bag to dunk in it. Lose points over that. Making tea is not rocket science but too many restaurants don't know how! 

Server then asked if I wanted check, um, how about dessert? Check, she repeated. OK, it was noisy, maybe she did not hear me? How about dessert? They really lose points over trying to hustle me out. Yes, it was getting crowded, yes, people were waiting, but I made a reservation, if they offer cocktails and appetizers they need to give people a reasonable amount of time to consume them and I was not dawdling. I got the vacherin. It said meringue, I pictured something liked Baked Alaska, which it was not but it was really good. Simple, but good. A meringue cookie topped with coffee ice cream, pool of chocolate sauce and toasted sliced almonds.

Frankly, though, probably won't return. A long walk from BART, the burger nothing special, I like huevos rancheros but I can get them many other places, mostly, the server asking to bring me check before I'd had a chance to order dessert was very off-putting. As in, get out of here fast so we can seat someone more desirable (not a single lady, in other words).
author: Carol S.

description: Exceptional menu and polite, attentive staff. Can't go wrong with a date night at Marlowe.
author: Brittany F.

description:
Bright, hip, sexy.  It's bustling at lunch time - make a reservation if you want to get in.  Airy and open, the scene is definitely classic bistro.  

The wait staff was pleasant, helpful and professional.  

I ordered a cappucinno while I waited for my lunch date, which was made perfectly and served quickly.  

Angus Steak Salad
The steak was cooked perfectly to order and was delicious.  The salad plentiful and nicely dressed.  Definitely more than enough for a meal.

Warm Open Faced Deviled Egg Sandwich $13
pickled jalapeno, bacon & aged provolone
I ordered at the recommendation of the waitress.  Open face.  Large serving of the deviled egg on a nice sweet bread.  It was absolutely wonderful, rich and filling.  Served with a nice side green salad.

My first trip there in the new location.  I will definitely go again.  Do not miss this hot spot!
author: Colleen B.

description: Umm, not sure what's the fuss about this place.  My prawn was too salty and overwhelmed the cocktail sauce.  The restaurant is cozy enough but pretty loud for a nice conversation.
author: Peaceful S.

description:
Wow! I don't write reviews often, but this restaurant definitely deserves a 5-star and a review. The atmosphere and the food was on point.

I had the Di Stefano Burrata and the Pan Roasted Petrale Sole. Definitely need to try both! I wouldn't have ordered the Burrata, but a nice gentlemen next to me and the server both suggested it. So I did and it was the best decision I made. Also, the Petrale Sole was probably the best Sole I've ever had. I would drive back from LA just to have the it again.

If you're in the area I would definitely make your way to this restaurant.
author: Alec N.

description:
Great food and great service. 

Crispy Brussels sprouts: it was good, liked the lemony taste

Bone marrow: wow so decadent!! Love to splurge on this sometimes. What was really interesting is the parsley on the side that had lemon and salt. Such an interesting taste. 

Ribeye steak: very well cooked, nicely seasoned. I liked the lentils a LOT (and I'm not even normally a fan of lentils). I'm surprised the asparagus ends weren't trimmed off though. 

Note: no free refills on Coke, because it's Mexican Coke bottles 

Tip: make reservations well in advance
author: Amanda P.

description: Been here many times as I stay nearby monthly when doing business in SF. Love the food. My friends and family do too. Have never heard anyone complain. Food is very creative and has always been fresh good quality. Service is good, is hit or miss on the friendly factor. I don't recommend breakfast at the bar as service is slow, unfriendly and evasive-at least it was this morning. I won't hesitate to go back to sit at a table though.
author: John H.

description:
Marlowe is a bustling eatery in the South of Market area. I say bustling because when I went it was right after the Giants' home opener, but don't get me wrong - I thought the noise level and causality made it that much more charming. Be prepared for EXCELLENT service and perfectly prepared American food. 

We ordered a good amount and found that everything was pretty reasonably priced. We ordered the deviled eggs, fried asparagus, little gem salad, crab poppers, duck liver mousse, and the Marlowe Burger. Our server, Johnny (?), offered to bring out certain plates in stages. It was like he was making a playlist of our order and it was AWESOME. I love a man with a plan. Not only was it helpful, but it worked. Let me just say that the fried asparagus was the best asparagus that I've ever had. It was truly cooked PERFECTLY. They are blanched and then fried in an amazing beer batter. You could hear actual crunches when biting into this asparagus, and there was no bitterness. The deviled eggs were a little spicy, which I thought was pretty unique. I regret splitting the burger because it was truly delicious, but I didn't have enough to really say if it was THE BEST in SF, but it was damn good. It came with a horseradish aioli that went well with simple, sweet ketchup. Their fries were perfect (not too thin, but nowhere near the thickness of steak fries). The bitter liver taste in the mousse was way too strong for me, and the marmalade that was put on top did not quite cut it. But my meal partner loved it so... to each their own! 

One thing that I also noticed was that the drinks took a very long time to get to us. The beautiful full bar was in our sight line, and it was not for lack of effort by the bartender that they took a long time. He was simply SLAMMED. But when they arrived they were delicious... almost dangerous. The pimm's cup was the perfect balance between sweet and spicy (from the ginger). 

Get dessert. Just do it. We got a little wild. We used the German chocolate pudding as a spread on the warm cookies. It was a beautiful moment. 

I definitely want to come back, eat an entire Marlowe burger, have Johnny as my server, and take in this lively atmosphere.
author: Isabella G.

description: I've been here once for lunch and another for dinner. The food is great! I've tried their steak salad, bone marrow, baked oysters, and burger. My boyfriend and I were not disappointed in the food. The reason I am giving this place 4 stars is because both times, the service was slow. They are very attentive but somehow when we were were finished with our meal, it took forever to get our check (both times).
author: Trang D.

description: Shit service for poor quality food. The bartenders are very rude and it seems they feel this is an upscale or exclusive place. It's laughable that their attitude is so sour. I've been here three times so this is not based on one experience. I will definitely not return and I'll make sure everyone in my network knows not to visit. Crass.
author: Renee R.

description:
I stopped by here before heading over to the SF Moma. The interior is super hipster. Bar seating area and great wide open windows for those photogenic pictures. Parking is metered and is pretty easy find on the street (We went on a Saturday though).

We got the:
+ Half Dozen Fresh Oysters: Cost more than both of our entree's hah that MP tricking you.. but was totally worth the $16. Fresh and tasty. 
+ Burrata: I didn't even know what a Burrata was until today. I still actually don't really know what it is but it's some mozzarella cheese and cream mixture. They have a lump of Burrata and then some toast covered in Fava Bean. The plating is AMAZING. They have little flowers all over and it's just gorgeous. Oh and the food is absolutely phenomenal.
