+ Scamble: Pretty much some fancy scrambled egg. So delicious as well. 

Normally since I don't live in SF, when I come I just want to try different places to eat. But Marlowe was just so amazing that I would def want to come back and try more of their dishes.
author: Rita Y.

description:
I wanted to take my boyfriend to a place that serves bone marrow so I yelped and Marlowe was on the top list. I was glad we chose this place! We ordered several items on the menu and all were delicious!

Brussels Sprout Chips- So simple yet so delicious. Lemon and salt, boom! Explosion! Too bad it was so little for 2 people. They should add more quantity for the price you're paying.

Warm Deviled Eggs- We ordered 4 eggs. This was super good! In it includes bacon bits, melted cheese, and I forgot the other ingredients. So small though but it was heaven! 

Baked Oysters- This was one of my favorite. I love oysters and having to eat it with some of my favorite ingredients, bacon bits, potato purée, and crumbs on top. It was made into perfection! 

Roasted Bone Marrow- Super yummy! ! My boyfriend loved his bone marrow here at Marlowe's! I highly recommend this item, enough said :p

Marlowe's Burger- I have ate a lot of burgers and this was just okay. I was expecting it to be explosive based on yelp reviews but it was just, again, okay. 

Niman Pork Chop-  This was my boyfriend's favorite dish. It was a long wait but for him it was sooo worth it. I, on the other hand, didn't like the way it tasted. It wasn't my type of dish. The reason why he loved it because it tasted so organic, fresh, farm to table kinda thing. 

Service- Top notch! We ate at Gary Danko last weekend and experienced good service and shockingly enough the servers at Marlowe's can definitely compete. I actually prefer their type of service because the lady who served us was so upbeat and was comfortable to talk with. Everyone was great from the host, the guy who refill our water, to the other guy updating us about our food wait time.

We left the restaurant full and happy. We ate everything! I will definitely come to this place again!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
This place is such a little gem in SoMa.  It's small, but I love that DIY pintrest feel and white painted theme - it's very refreshing and bright, but versatile enough where I can seen it being intimate and romantic at night.  

We had reservations so there was no wait, but there were definitely people in line for an open table at 1:30pm. We had chicken fried okra and brussel sprout chips for appetizers, which were absolutely amazing.  I'm usually not a huge fan of brussel sprouts, but these were full doused in oil and salt so they were super tasty.  The okra was also really good and juicy.  I had ordered the shrimp roll for my main course and words cannot describe how mouthwatering the sauce is.  I think this is the best sandwich I've ever had.  The sauce was so full of cream and flavor while the shrimp was very firm and juicy.  I was very satisfied with my lunch.  Others had ordered the burger and the chicken sandwich, which I heard were also perfect. 

Because we didn't have enough of a food coma, we went ahead and ordered dessert - we got Lortta's Vacherin, Peanut Buffer Pretzel Nuggets, and the house made cookies.  They were also delicious, but my favorite was the vacherin which was coffee ice cream over a cream wafer with toasted almond and chocolate sauce.

I was absolutely stuffed and we left feeling so warm and fuzzy. I definitely would want to come back at night for dinner or hang out by the bar.  The drinks here look like they would be amazing.

Ambiance: 4/5
Food: 5/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 4.5/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Just leaving Marlowe for lunch and couldn't wait to give them a five-star review. What a delightful restaurant! The food was perfection: fresh ingredients in unexpected combinations cooked exactly the right way. The service was impeccable: Alyssa provided thoughtful recommendations without being the least bit pushy, checked-in regularly, offered wine tasting when I couldn't decide what to get, and was overall so friendly and helpful. Additionally, the hostess and management were both exceptionally welcoming. I do a fair amount of solo traveling and therefore dining, and the staff at Marlowe didn't make me feel at all out of place or not worth their time, as is the case often elsewhere. So very glad to have found this spot and look forward to visiting again soon!
author: Emily R.

description: The WORST FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD! My husband and I went to dinner because we were in SF for the night. Worst mistake ever. He ordered the rib eye and I ordered a pork chop. The pork chop was still bloody, didn't have any flavor. The rib eye was so small and thin, didn't even look like a steak. Not to mention it's so expensive. I'm 100 percent sure there are better places to eat than here with a better price. I don't know how this place can possible have so many stars. I wouldn't have even gave it one. I will NEVER be going back!
author: Joanna M.

description:
Delicious! We had a team dinner here and the food, drinks, and service were amazing! 

The place is really busy even on a Tuesday, so I recommend reservations a few days before you want to eat here.

You can't go wrong with anything you order from the menu so feel free to order anything and be assured you'll get something worth the money. 

The place is loud and a bit overwhelming. I recommend this place to anyone that wants good food and not focused on conversation. 

There is not much parking space for cars or bikes so walking or Uber/ Lyft are your best options.
author: Jenner B.

description: This place is always fantastic. The best burgers in town. It's a great menu and cool scene.
author: JT B.

description:
Solid 4 stars. My friend and I made reservations and were seated immediately. We ordered everything to share. What we got from the best to the least best.

POLENTA (5 stars) absolutely exceeded my expectations. All of the flavors married so well together. There is the soft creamy polenta, with el dente hearty mushrooms, nutty parm shavings, truffle oil, argula to balance out the dish, and of course, topped with a poached egg. Would highly recommend this!

BURRATA (4.5 stars) the burrata was great. But what surprised me the most was the sugar snap pea salad with pea tendrils. The flavors were fresh and fragrant, with a hint of sour.

ROASTED BONE MARROW (4 stars) was so bomb. It comes with 2 healthy charred marrows and a tasty shallot caper sauce.

BROWN BUTTER BRUSSELS SPROUT (2.5 stars) this was not crispy at all which was quite unfortunate. I can make better sprouts at home. We ordered the "side" sprouts instead of the "bites" chips thinking they would still be crispy, just not small flakes of Brussels. We were wrong.

Overall, loved the ambiance, the food was solid, and service was friendly. I would come back for dat polenta doe ;)
author: Jessica L.

description: 4 stars..but only because I want more options on the menu. The food is so great I'd like to see what else they conjure up! You will need a reservation any time or day of the week. I've gone on a weekend and was lucky to have 2 spots open at the bar, I've also gone in the middle of the day during the week and was asked if I had a reservation. They were awesome and sat us at a table but we had a time limit before the folks that reserved showed up. No worries..we ordered quickly! A must is the BURGER..its perfectly fresh and filling! The burrata and cheesy cauliflower were a hit too. To drink I tried the classic old fashioned and the holiday old fashioned both great!
author: Cha O.

description:
Pretty pretty good. I deigned to leave bougie ass Tibs and drive into the city. That was a bad choice as traffic in SF seems to get worse by the minute. Really I don't know how you city denizens tolerate it. 

Parking: street parking and a couple of lots 2-3 blocks away, about $15. 

Decor: super cute, black/white/grey aesthetic. I love the hanging pots, especially the vintage colanders. The seating is tight but it works and feels cozy. 

Drinks: bomb ass French 75s that were so nice we had them twice. The cherry at the bottom was a nice touch. I also tried my friends Bloody Mary and that had a really nice kick to it. 

Food: if you don't start with the Brussels sprouts chips then just take your ass home you filthy mudblood. These chips are insane to the point where I was plotting how to make 'em at home. The chicken fried okra was delish. My table had the tartare which they loved. We also had the shrimp but it was disconcerting to be served the whole prawn with the eyes. Very unappetizing. I had the burger which was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had in my life. The fried were basic, I feel like they can do better.
author: Bianca B.

description:
Been wanting to try this place forever. Finally came on a Friday night with a friend and at 5:30PM, there were no available tables because they were all reserved. Since it was just the 2 of us, they squeezed us in between 2 different parties at the communal table. Cozy.

Crispy Brussel Sprout Chips (9) - Tasty and simple, but perhaps too simple. I feel like I can pretty easily recreate this at home at a fraction of the cost.

Roasted Bone Marrow (17) - Delicious! My friend thought that there was too much marrow for how little toast they gave us. I wholeheartedly disagreed bc there's no such thing as too much marrow. It's a one way trip to flavor town!

Anson Mills Polenta (22) - I initially thought they brought me the wrong dish bc at first glance it looked like an salad. Lo and behold, buried under the mountain of arugula, wild mushrooms, parmesan, and egg, was indeed a bed of creamy polenta. There are a lot of different flavors and textures going on, but everything was delicious. Quite filling as well.

Marlowe Burger (16) - Lauded as one of the best burgers in the city, this baby had a lot of live up to. It tried a bite of my friend's and I wasn't impressed. To be fair, I'm not a burger kinda person and this burger didn't make me a believer. The fries, however, were top notch. They were golden and crispy on the outside, but soft and fluffy on the inside. Solid portions too.

Loretta's Vacherin (10) - coffee ice cream w/ almond slivers doused in chocolate sauce. Delightful end to a relatively savory meal. This was both of our favorite part of the meal.

I'll be back to try the pork chop!

[TIP] They cut the burger and divide up the fries for you if you're looking to share. I recommend doing this so that you can try more things. Again, not a burger lover.
Also, they accept reservations so try to grab one if you can.
author: Lucy N.

description:
Brussel chips were over done..
Pistachios were eh..
Deviled eggs were great..but over priced since you get half for $3...
Summertime old fashion was good...
Sea bass was not that great..too saucy and the fish was over done..not worth $30..
Poppers had an acquired taste..
Fries were mediocre and too salty..
Panna cotta was not mind blowing...
Coffee ice cream was good though..

Service was on point..seating arrangement was a bit odd, but just the food wasn't great and a bit over priced.
author: Minerva L.

description:
Delicious and cozy. I've had a business lunch and business dinner here and both times the food was delicious. 

The cauliflower soup with its chili oil garnish is phenomenal; I could eat just that. Of course the burgers are phenomenal too. 

It's a winner!
author: Rohit R.

description:
Extremely unpleasant interaction with the manager/host. We walked in on a Wednesday night, she told us the wait is 45 mins for the outside patio. 45 mins later, she told us she "made a mistake", it's gonna be another 45 mins wait, and there was nothing she could do! A management level personal who was unable not offer naturally acceptable solution for customer and the business, it amazed me that a owner of a popular restaurant could be so arrogant to do so. She probably thinks a couple dissatisfied customers won't hurt her business. 

On a separate note, this place was so loud that we won't be able to talk to each other anywhere.
author: Cissy M.

description: Amazing! Service and food were wonderful. We are in town for the holiday and loved every bite!
author: Brenda S.

description: The ambiance to this place is superb but the food was VERY average.. the service is great but I wish their menu had a bit more of a selection/ variety.. all in all, it was just OK food for the price
author: E T.

description:
Ate here for the first time with a friend and LOVED IT! Excellent service, great location, and overall good dining experience. Definitely coming back here again.

FAVORITES: 
-Warm Caesar toast was SO delicious & tasty! My favorite & bursting with flavors.
-Baked oysters = creamy
-Warm deviled egg melts in your mouth
-Grilled asparagus w/an egg = YUM!
-Marlowe Burger = juicy, perfectly cooked, fresh bun, tasty fries!

SO SO: 
-Brussel sprouts chips were just OK & too dry. I've had better.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
You know a restaurant is that good when they recommend you get reservations for lunch AND dinner! The restaurant itself is modern and very clean. Service is also superb - timing of everything was on point and our water cups were always filled.

- Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips ($9): their famous appetizer really lives up to its name. Even if you don't like brussels sprouts, you will enjoy this dish. It is a little salty for my taste, but I couldn't stop eating...
- Chicken Fried Okra ($7): I'm usually not a fan of okra because of the slimy texture, but these are pretty bomb!
- (special) Flat Bread Appetizer with Three Dips ($6/person): the dips were all pretty light (or bland?). The flatbread didn't taste great when it wasn't warm anymore either...
- Marlowe Burger ($16): sure, it is a little small for its price, but it is a mean burger! People have told me they think it's the best burger in San Francisco, and that's saying a lot!

Marlowe is definitely an ideal place for a drink and light bites or to enjoy a cute date.

NOTE: After Marlowe moved locations, they stopped serving their famous dessert, the Strawberry Crisp. I was pretty sad I didn't get to try it. However they do have a handful of delicious sounding desserts to try!
author: Christine S.

description:
I came here on a Sat evening. There was a Giants game down the street (aka a lot of people). 

1. I was 30mins late for my reservation which I had already asked to reschedule for an hour later than the original. The hostess was great at accommodating me. We (group of 2) were seated immediately at a table! I would've been okay with waiting or being rejected altogether but I was pleasantly surprised and grateful. 

2. Restaurant was ampley staffed. Water was refilled timely and food came quickly. 

3. Turnover is great. The busboy removed my empty plates and changed all my plate settings with each course. When we were done, the busboy had our table cleaned and ready for the next group. It was very efficient, I like it. But despite all this, I never felt rushed to leave. 

4. Food: ordered steak tartare, bone marrow, Marlowe Burger, pork chops. Pork chops were my favorite. Pork chops are normally dry but this was juicy. Second favorite was fries that came with burger. It's crisp cut (like in n out) but obviously flavored 100x better. There's little bacon bits in the fries, therefore, fries were bathed in yummy bacon fat. Bone marrow- buttery, yum. Always wish there was more. Tartare- first dish. Hard to comment if I enjoyed it because of flavor or because I was hungry.
author: Lilliam F.

description: Great brunch! Order the burrata/levin/pear/prosciutto dish, burger, or French toast soldiers. Top it off with the peanut butter bites.
author: Vicki L.

description: 2nd favorite burger in SF. Miss working right next door.
author: Jocelyn G.

description:
As others have said, go for the burger, come back for the polenta! Food and atmosphere are top-notch.

A note for parents of young kids: yes, Marlowe does have high chairs! (Some older reviews claim otherwise.) Obviously this isn't a crayons-and-kids-menu kind of place, but the servers were super nice about accommodating our toddler during the brunch rush.
author: Emma F.

description:
We walked in at 6pm on a Friday night and were seated right away at the bar. 4 stars because their menu has limited options and nothing too special, but also 4 stars because they make those few items really well!

We tried:
- Bone Marrow (oh my God this is the killer!! I'd actually come back for it.)
- Burger (a little too thick for our liking, but the fries was the star of the plate!! Super crispy and tasty)
- Pork chop (also great! Tender, juicy, and flavorful. Won't come back for it though)

Hmmm that's it. The ONE time we didn't order the hell out of a restaurant LOL try their cocktails. They are nice too!
author: Mandy D.

description:
Went here for lunch. Was supposed to be three of us. The third could not make it. Had oysters and other apps. Everything was good. Half way through our third arrived. 

The staff were good accommodating our increase. They were going to get a larger table for us, but we shared a two top with a bench seat. Hat's off the to staff for being so accommodating. 

The food was was just as good!
author: JW S.

description:
I had been meaning to visit Marlowe for the longest time, mostly for their Brussel Sprout Chips. I came here with a friend after making a reservation earlier in the week. Reservations are definitely a MUST, although we still had to wait for a table by the time our reservation came around. The restaurant has a surprising amount of seating for its square footage, but everything is so cramped. People walking by my chair kept hitting me and knocking my coat to the floor. 

The cocktails were quite tasty, which was probably the best part of the whole experience. My friend got the Pim's Cup, and I got The Calf. Would recommend both. Strong and refreshing. 

The food was good but not great. We started with the Brussel Sprout Chips, which were very tasty but nothing special. I've made better at home. Next I was eyeing the Deviled Eggs so we tried those. The flavors just blended together. The last appetizer we ordered was the Di Stefano Burrata Toast. I liked the curry flavors but the whole dish was unbearably greasy. 

My friend said that their Marlowe Burger was supposed to be good so we ordered that. I'm not sure if the other entrees are any better, but I was super disappointed by the burger. There was too much bread compared to the amount of meat, and the whole thing was dry. The fries came with a horseradish dipping sauce, and I had to keep using that for my burger instead. The fries were also tasteless. 

Our meal concluded with the Rum Soaked Nectarine Split which has vanilla ice cream, blueberries, ginger caramel sauce, and coconut. The dessert looked amazing but did not taste that way. There were only three slivers of nectarines, and it just looked like the whole plate was dreched in the sauce. I could not taste anything except the coconut.

In terms of the service, our waitress was super friendly and professional but each time she came to our table, she dashed off a split second after she thought we were done ordering. This slowed down the process of our whole meal because we had to keep waiting for her to come around. They were good about clearing our dishes though. 

Beautifully plated dishes and decent service. Cute but loud date place for future reference. I would recommend Marlowe as a place to check off your list but not rave about it. I'll also probably not be visiting again.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Came here with a reservation for 3 for my sisters birthday. I don't think OpenTable communicates well with their vendors because they didn't see my note about my sisters birthday, so I had to ask for a candle for her dessert. Got seated when we arrived 15 minutes early, but the spacing is really small because tables barely had space for people to come in and out of a table. It took a long time before someone came to take our orders, so we had to ask. Our food also took a really long time to come out. We started with three bites and starters. My mom tried their deviled egg for $3 which came with half a piece, which I felt was overpriced but we tried it anyways. It had a strong jalapeño taste with back on top, Mom thought it was tasty, but not enough to order again. We then had the corn soup (hint of spice, but very deliciously flavored with cheese and a rich corn flavor; recommend ordering), steak tartare (cute quail egg on top, but the portions are a lot smaller than in the pictures on yelp for sure. Decent, but not good enough to reorder again), and the little gem salad (very strong in lemon flavor and the veggies almost tasted pickled. Decent, but also not something I'd order again). For the main entrees, we had pork chops (great in flavor, a little on the dry side, but one of I enjoyed a lot more than the burger), Marlowe burger (everyone suggests this, so I was super excited to try. The fries and burger were overly salty, so I assumed they were having an off day with it, however the beef patty was still juicy), and the steak ribeye (my favorite entree; juicy and flavorful, lots of mushrooms which I tasted in flavoring of the beef so a win for mushroom lovers). We also had two sides: Brussels sprouts (didn't come out as we would hope because it was on the bitter end) and the fried green beans were a hit with that aioli sauce. As for the desserts, we finalized with the nectarine and raspberry crisp (my family all agreed this was the tastier dessert with the fattened from the nectarine and sweet crispy taste from the crisp; temperature of warmth with the ice cream was perfect) and the strawberry shortcake (tasted like a biscuit with strawberries and cream, but I enjoyed the taste of it too; however a little bit on the drier side after having the crisp). I probably wouldn't return because many of the dishes didn't wow me and or meet my expectations. However, I give them 3.5 stars for customer service because they accidentally gave our leftovers to another party upon leaving so they had us sit a little longer to remake all three of the dishes we were bringing home - now that's good service! The bill came out to be around $276 including tips and tax for three people - which was pretty pricey for the quality. Worth a try still if you're interested in giving it a go.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Very busy location. It's packed in the Saturday afternoon.

I ordered their famous burger and a cocktail, royale 500. Burger came with fries, freshly made, very juicy!! Royale 500 is kind of the drink that girls will like, well presentation, easy to drink.

No complaint at all, just little pricey for the burger.
$16 Haha
author: Natasha L.

description:
JUICY BURGER!

Everything looks typical but nothing ordered tasted typical. 

It's infamously known to order the burger here because at one pint it was rated "San Francisco's Best Burger". It's highly recommended to make reservations. Do note on the weekend there are several menus (11-2:30 brunch, 2:30-5:30 afternoon, and 5:30 til closing dinner). Scheduled reservations at 2, get a bit of the brunch and afternoon menu. Again, not a burger person but if a burger can wow me and wow the hardcore burger person I'm out with that should speak volumes. Upon entry you will see almost every table eating burgers.. You should know not to come here without trying one.

MARLOW BURGER - it was smaller than expected when arrived at the table (we shouldn't have split the burger and order our own). I was expecting a giant gourmet burger but the size was decent. it was extremely juicy. For the simple looking burger i can see why the talk of the town is talking. The Patty had a good seer and flavor. Couldn't tell much about the bun as it soaked up the flavor a from the Patty. Highly Recommended.

JUMBO GULF PRAWNS - wow. Don't expect this to be your typical shrimp cocktail. The shrimp (with heads attached) threw my palette into a spin. The cocktail sauce had a twist of heat, the shrimp was grilled and had a good smoked flavor, the shrimps were heavenly.... And I sucked the head because that's where the best juice is. Sounds ridiculous but I'm Asian it's normal. Highly Recommended.

DEVILED EGGS - probably one of the best deviled eggs over ever had. The appearance doesn't look catchy but do not shy away from ordering it. It was a very very very delicate and well prepared devil egg. The yolk was so silky, the egg white was really tender, and the minute you pop it in your mouth it's so soft it feels like it's melting. Highly Recommend.

BRUSSELS SPROUT CHIPS - I love Brussels sprouts and I loved them charred and crispy. There version of it had a nice light lemon coat. Kind of oily at the bottom but still was very delicious. Highly Recommend.

GREEK YOGURT PANNA COTTA - uhm. Unfortunately I was NOT a fan. This was on their brunch item grouped with other brunch items like granola. I was wondering why is panna cotta in that section, it's usually dessert and with the sweets. NOW I KNOW WHY! It was not your typical panna cotta, didn't really taste like panna cotta, and wasn't as good as real panna cotta. The cotta was so bland, it tastes like nothing. The plate was served with reserved jam and nuts - even mixing everything together it wasn't too thrilling. It was really for breakfast and not dessert. after combining everything together of reminded me of a breakfast yogurt parfait with no excitement in flavor. Don't recommend if you are expecting regular panna cotta.

Will I be back? Oh yes! I will definitely be back!

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description: Deviled Egg was amazing; at least get 1! Smoked Crab and Shrimp Benedict was crunchy and tasty, loved it!
author: Alex P.

description: Cool place with a fun vibe.  Fabulous food and drinks!  Tried a little of everything from their bar menu and planning a return trip for brunch.  The baked oysters and brussel sprout chips are phenomenal.  Staff is friendly and attentive.  A great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.
author: Dawn B.

description: The service is amazing and the wine is fabulous. It's not cheap, so come financially prepared (a glass of  wine is $11-$15), but the choices are exquisite. I can't comment on the food, unfortunately.
author: Obichang O.

description: OMG...best meal that I've had in SF in a long time. I stopped in by myself and they were able to seat me at the bar immediately -- a perk to solo dining! I ordered a glass of wine and the wild mushroom + truffle risotto and it was spectacular. The flavor combination was perfect; exactly how truffles should be used. The dish also had some arugula, Parmesan, and a poached egg on top. I would order that dish again and again!
author: Danielle M.

description: Great service all around - from the hostess, to the manager, to our waiter - and delicious food. I definitely recommend the polenta for brunch for gluten-free diners.
author: Tima S.

description:
Nice place to meet up with a friend for dinner. Apparently everyone else thought the same. Good thing we had a reservation (which is recommended).

The cool thing is there is no minimum on how many small appetizers you can order so I got 1 deviled egg, 1 grilled oyster and the burger as my main meal. The deviled egg was really good - soft boiled and had really good flavor. I probably could have eaten a few more. The oyster was really good as well - fresh, plump, juicy and had a good crisp for texture on top. And to finish it off, the burger was really good as well. I got mine medium rare and was cooked perfectly. It was juicy, tender and flavorful even without extra sauce. Sometimes, simplicity is key.

Overall, it was a really good meal. and the atmosphere is upscale, but casual. I wish I had the stomach to eat more.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
We had reservations for a table of 4. We checked in and had to wait, that seems like the norm, not a problem. Finally got seated, this place is on the smaller side so tables are very close to each other, so close to a point that you feel like you know your table neighbors. 

I have a somewhat stressful job and when I have a nice dinner out with friends I want a drink to go with it all. I saw a drink that sounded pretty good on their specials board, so I went with that. The drink that was delivered to the table was NOT the correct drink, and far from it. I let the waiter know and he went to get me the correct drink. The "wrong" drink stayed at the table and I ended up getting charged for the drink in the end even though it remained full on the table the entire night. I wrote to management and they apologized but I'm still pretty p/o by it so I needed to include it in my review. It's just common sense on the waiters part.. obviously he's not aware of it and I hope that he was informed of the situation and won't put any other customers in such an awkward and embarrassing situation again.

The food at marlowe isn't even impressive. I did give it an extra star because the bone marrow was delicious and it was my favorite dish of the night. I even told my friends that I would go back JUST for the bone marrow. So yes, get that. For my main entree I had the smoked cod and it wasn't impressive. Lacked flavor and was a little fishy for my taste. We also had the baked oysters and it was just okay, definitely could have done without.

Overall, like I said I would go back for the bone marrow but that's about it. I wasn't happy with the service and the food was mehhhh..
author: Tiff C.

description:
One of many casual, classy dining spots in San Francisco.

Extensive liquor selection, an amazing bloody mary, and a reasonably decent set of other drinks on the menu, at least over brunch.

Deviled eggs with bacon and jalapeno are a tad bit too fancy, the pancakes are nice and fluffy but the minced bacon doesn't quite succeed. The baked tomato and egg was delicious though, perhaps a bit of a British influence? Chocolate cream pie for dessert was more of a chocolate pudding with an oreo and graham cracker crumb crust. If you're okay with pudding it was pretty damned good.

At least in the summer, it's bright and airy over brunch, service is pretty good, and next time we need to order the bacon... the table next to us had it and it looked friggin' ridiculous.
author: Brian W.

description:
Perfect Sunday brunch spot with your closest girlfriends, dating back 20 odd years ago, when they (we) were young and hovered in Cow Hollow, North Beach and the Marina. Now we are older, responsible adults who discuss children (not babies), work, friends from the past, and the looming middle age over a glass of bubbly, shoving $45 a pop for a leisurely Sunday brunch in a fanciful French country style decor restaurant in South Market. SoMa as a term did not take back in our days. It was South Market, SoMa was so very SoHo wanted to be, if you ask that 20 year old version of me. 

We realized Anna used to live down here, when she moved from her beautiful Pac Height apartment to SoMa in the 90s, we were horrified. Then she met a man down the street at a bar and they got married and bought a fix-upper in Inner Sunset and promptly dropped three babies. Now the babies are school age children.

This is the world we live in, there are always some exciting young people finding this neighborhood, and this restaurant enticing as a gathering spot, but we middle age women like to come here because there are still free parking nearby and it's convenient to drive by here and leaving our children, spouses (assume that's the M.O.) behind for a few hours and pretend that we were still young and hip.

Because Marlowe is hip and cool, we were infected by the charming energy for a few hours on a Sunday morning. Park Tavern is a good spot too but you see that involves brain surgery parking. Mama's Cafe was once our favorites, but that was so very many years ago.

Marlowe has a nicely organized menu to choose from. Get the French toast and enjoy the mole like dipping sauce. Sablefish toast reminds me something I'd get in Zabar's, my one and only Jewish girlfriend at the table winced her nose as she does not do seafood. I joked, "I'm more Jew than you." She agreesd with me. I do make a killer matzo ball soup. Bubblies are aplenty. You can't do wrong with their cocktails. Drink off those tall goblets makes one of the girls, who's very French to begin with, looking even more so French. One girlfriend shows up hastily late from Stanford Hospital, she's among those many professional women in their early to mid 40s attempting to go through the inevitable process for conception. We were reminded how quickly youth passes us by and all of sudden our struggles are no longer the same.

By the time the topic switched to those old boyfriends of ours, the entries arrived. Marlowe burger was stellar. Polenta and mushroom was what I had opted for and it was creamy and vegetarian friendly. Calamari flatbread was very innovative. Stop taking photos and take a look at the pots and pans hanging on the wall, you'd be amazed how much all of sudden you crave for that carara marble for your own kitchen. Oh yes, I do have mine just so for my Victorian home. Thank heavens.  We take our time catching up. Moving topic to topic, ending with schools and upcoming kids birthdays.

Marlowe is a great place to celebrate those rare friendship with your die hard girlfriends on a Sunday morning. Their service was spotless. Their food very tasty. Their space perfectly charming. Load up on coffee please. It's strong and pure, like our friendship.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Second time at Marlow. I don't remember my first time being memorable at all. This second time, however... TOP NOTCH! 

Starting with cocktails... classics, new takes on classics, and innovative concoctions. They have them all. 

Appetizers are simple but tasty. I ordered the cocktail prawns... hUGE! Get ready to get your hands in it. 

For main dish, i ordered rib eye steak. It was cooked to my liking (medium)... Juicy and big. 

For dessert... Panacotta with strawberry sorbet. Yum! 

Service was great and attentive. Place was busy on a Wednesday night. Recommend to make reservation.
author: Rob G.

description:
Honestly, not sure how this place has such high reviews 

Walked in for lunch on a weekday and my first impression was "wow, this place is so cute and cozy". But let's be honest. The customer service is great...the food? Not so much.

Ordered the brussel sprout fries to start, and IT WAS SO DARN SALTY that we had couldnt eat more than just a few! We also ordered the burger and chicken sandwich. Neither one was really impressive for a bill that came out to $60.

Definitely not my go-to place for a good lunch, but totally a cute place if you're going for the ambience on a first date.
author: Allison H.

description:
Sometimes you shouldn't believe everything you read, and Marlowe's reviews on Yelp don't seem to line up to my experience.  In coming here with two girlfriends, there was a lot of hype around Marlowe and we've all been dying to try here for dinner.  To try and cover as much of the menu of possible, we decided to split everything.  Here's what went down:

Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips: A must-get item, all three of us agreed that this definitely ranks amongst the best brussels sprout chips we've had.
Warm Deviled Eggs: Eggs are priced per egg, and I'm so glad that we decided to get this.  I loved the little piece of jalapeño that came on top, and the little piece of bacon was absolutely delicious.
English Pea Pancakes: Mentioned on this year's 7x7 The Big Eat list, I wasn't sure if I would love this, but I think this was my favorite item we had.  The smoked salmon on this is absolutely delicious!
Steak Tartare: This was probably my least favorite item, but I think that's because I've had fabulous steak tartare here in the city and everything else before this was insanely delicious.
Burrata: I was pleasantly surprised that this wasn't just cheese on a plate, but rather served with prosciutto and a delicious fig and onion compote! 
Marlowe Burger: Splitting this three ways was perfect for all of us since we were close to being pretty stuffed by this point.  The french fries were absolutely perfect, and the bacon on the burger was ON POINT. Definitely something I'd considering getting on my own!

Service wise, our server was absolutely fabulous.  He was very enthusiastic with his menu explanations and gave us good guidance on how to navigate the menu since we were sharing. I would love to come back here for brunch when the weather's nice out, their patio area looks enticing and would make for some great food photos!
author: Lisa I.

description:
A great place to stop in for lunch, dinner, or a drink before going to the Giants game.

We came in at 11:30 for a quick lunch for a day game and enjoyed our meal. This is what we ordered:

Brussels Sprouts Chips: I was actually very disappointed with these. It's my favorite vegetable and I love them fried. That said, these were fried a bit too long and had the acrid taste of being burnt. Not just charred, but burnt. Either they were fried or finished in olive oil, and while that was a great flavor choice, the chips were very greasy with it. Since olive oil has a higher smoke point than other oils, it's possible it just wasn't hot enough.

Open-faced Devil's Egg Sandwich: I'm not normally a big deviled egg fan, but this was great! A heap of fluffy eggs mixed with your typical deliver egg seasoning/flavor was heaped onto a piece of delicious toast, topped with Gruyere, and broiled. We were trying to figure out how on earth they got the eggs so fluffy, and our hypothesis is that they separated the raw yolks and whites, whipped the whites, folded the yolks back in with the mustard and seasoning, and then "scrambled" them French-style to get soft, small-curd cooked eggs. It was quite delicious. The side salad of bitter greens was dressed with a delicious vinaigrette and was a great component of the plate.

Poulet Vert: yes! Get this. The chicken thigh was very moist with perfectly crisped skin, and the runny herbal pistou was absolutely wonderful, with notes of what I believe was nasturtium. The chicken came on a small bed of perfectly-cooked farro and broccoli spigarello. Roasted slices of golden turnip were surprisingly delicious side-bites.

Our meal was very enjoyable and the staff was very attentive. While I'm not in a huge rush to return, I certainly expect to come back when attending a future baseball game.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Wow what a difference on the revisit!

First and foremost service was out of this world great.  So friendly, helpful, attentive, and fun!  This time we ate in the main dining room and the atmosphere was elegant and chic.  

On to the food:
-Smoked Crab and Rock Shrimp Poppers were popping!
-The Duck Liver Mousse was rich and delicious.  We received additional crostini twice because we kept going back in for more.
-Chicken Fried Okra was only OK - basically just tasted like any fried okra.  My other dinner companions really liked it though.
-The Burrata was creamy and posed a nice counterpoint to the salty prosciutto but what made the dish were the yummy fig preserves.
-Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp were some of the largest freshest and most delicious shrimp you'll ever find.  Too bad there weren't enough of them (but understandable as a starter!
-Burger was even better than the first time (and it was the highlight of the last meal).  Juicy and delicious. Definitely one of the best in SF.
-Ribeye - oh....you are the main reason I can't give 5*!  As easily the highest priced item on the menu I had high expectations - especially with everything else being great. Unfortunately you were cooked and seasoned unevenly.  It wasn't bad, just underwhelming compared to the rest of the meal.  Potato and gruyere gratin was tasty though.
-German Chocolate Pudding - I'm not normally a dessert guy but I couldn't stop digging at this. Highly recommend.
-Vacherin - Really enjoyed this elegant dessert too.  Even though we were stuffed we managed to finish it all.

Cocktails were well made and there are some good, creative combinations as well as some classics.

Highly recommended!
author: Tarek S.

description:
Visited 8.13.17 - This place is busy! We were lucky to grab a counter seat since reservations had priority and other waiting patrons were told 1.5 hours. 
Servers are great and plentiful. However since we sat so close to the hosts, we could hear their conversations often and their views of who is almost done with their meal or who should be leaving soon. They rushed this couple next to me only to hear from the couple that were staying longer. 
We arrived shortly before dinner time so we were left ordering from the cocktail hour menu. FYI - they don't have a standing bar so only ppl who are seated can order food. Also I think drinks are only served if you're waiting for a table since the restaurant is small and no standing room.
From the cocktail menu we ordered: burger, gem salad, warm deviled egg, and baked oysters. 
The burger was average. The gem salad was very fresh in flavors but the citrus vinaigrette was so over powering that I was unable to finish it due to its tartness. The deviled egg was warm it seems since it was made fresh and still warm from the cooking. The egg had a slice of cheese and jalapeño; the bonus was the jalapeño. The baked oysters were not our favorite; the menu described it as chowder baked in the oysters. There was a bacon topping did not add to the flavors. There was also something that tasted pickled in the chowder that was off putting; I wish it had more of the oyster flavor.
author: Chris C.

description: I dream about the ribeye steak salad from Marlowe. Well, not really, but I've only been to Marlowe 4-5 times over the past year and I always get the salad. I'll mix up the appetizer, recently had the brussell sprout chips which were really good, but the salad is just so great. Everything else always looks so good too so I feel bad for not venturing out. I had a bite of the fried chicken sandwich and fries which were also delicious. It gets a little noisy at prime lunch time and I wouldn't hesitate to make a reservation since I've never been able to walk-in with a group. Certainly one of my favorite spots to eat in SOMA.
author: Candace R.

description:
Marlowe is one of the coolest restaurants around.
Since they moved to their new location at 4th & Brannan, they can host patrons in a bright, white interior space. The decor is old world San Francisco (white washed wood) meets subway (as in white subway tiled walls).
I had a Marlowe burger for lunch and it was oh, so tasty!
The beef is juicy and along with the melted cheddars and two slices of bacon, it's perfect. You can order the burger with the fries or an option for salad - I like that! The location lends itself to those who work in SOMA, those on their way to CALTRAIN or those going to a game at AT&T park.
In either case, Marlowe is a local restaurant with solid food and solid drinks.
Say "Hi" to Gavin the bartender for me ;0) !
author: Joanna T.

description:
Brunch? Prepare to wait.
Deece food, not mind = blown.
Yocksyomb shuckerbro.
author: Dan B.

description: This is cool place to go for a casual night out with a large group of friends. Food is prepared fresh and I thought the price were very good for the quality you received.
author: Nadia H.

description:
Food: 4.5
Service: 2.5

I've been here a handful of times, for both dinner and brunch. The dinner is good but the brunch is solid.  The food is awesome and my only issue is with their service. I like the food so much so that I've come back several times...even after a waiter spilled all his drinks on me and the manager did not even comp my meal! Gave me a card to help pay for my dry-cleaning....which is dumb because they are across town and how was I going to send them the receipt...run around for a $20 meal?  Anyways, I digress...

So, when my sister came to visit, I was excited to take her to brunch. We made reservations for 1:45 pm and we ran late because her newborn was fussing and I called the restaurant to let them know we were running late. We got there at 1:55 pm and the waitress told us we had to rush and order before 2 pm since the kitchen was only going to serve the bar menu if we did not. Needless to say, we quickly told her what we wanted...we both have dietary restrictions so it was a mad glance and the ingredients and the waitress hovering over us! Also, many of the gluten free/vegetarian options we could have were "out." It was a disaster and I was embarrassed to have praised the restaurant.  I feel like we were not treated nicely and there didn't seem to be any understanding on the staff's part. I don't know if I can go back for a while.
author: Maliha Z.

description:
Fancy-looking place with candles and dim lighting. Service was nice and there was always someone on top of water refills. 

Steak was cooked in a perfect medium rare, thank you. Cod wasn't smooth or soft at all except for like 2 bites in the middle. Pork belly was long overcooked and tough I didn't even bother. Sauce wasn't all that great. 
 
Starters, appetizers, and overcooked entree were meh. Nothing really stood out except for the seasoned baked potatoes (came w/ steak) and apple dessert. Maybe just a busy night w/ rushed orders, I dunno.
author: Gloria L.

description:
We had been intrigued by this place because it's always so packed during the evenings. Unfortunately, it was a disappointing experience considering how much we paid.

I think that Marlowe's burger game is kinda weak. I don't understand why it's so highly revered. Made with caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli, it sounded like a solid choice. However, it ended up being second-rate: dry bun and flat flavors. 

We ordered: 

+ Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips (lemon, sea salt): Don't order these; they're difficult to eat and they taste burnt 
+ Stuffed Petrale Sole (spinach, butternut squash risotto, lollipop kale): This dish was tolerable, but flavors were run-of-the-mill
+ Warm Deviled Egg (aged provolone, pickled jalapeño, bacon): These were okay, flavors weren't groundbreaking--it's impossible to unintentionally sabotage a deviled egg

Spotty service--for some reason they kept filling only two out of the four water glasses at our table. Mine stayed half empty during dinner. 

Food was uninspiring and overpriced.
author: Merica S.

description:
I loved everything my friends and I ordered. I love everything we ordered so much I want to come back again and again until I try everything on their menu. 

Brussel sprout chips - every single piece was crispy and well seasoned. It reminds me on salt and vinegar chips. As I was waiting for my food I noticed this dish was continuously coming out from the kitchen - so it seems like it's one of their popular dishes. 

Bone marrow - there's not a lot of bone marrow to eat but the side sauce that it came with was really good. 

Baked oyster - cheesy goodness. I can eat 10 in one sitting! 

Crab and shrimp crepes - big chucks on crab and shrimp. YUMMM

Grilled brocollini - the sauce that it came with was good, and the brocollini wasn't over cooked.

Pork chops - it was very juicy, flavorful, and tender. 

Burger - this is probably the only item I'm not too crazy about. I won't get it again since there wasn't anything special about it. In and Out tasted better then the marlowe burger imo.  

Warm deviled egg - love that it came out warm, it really makes a huge difference.
author: Michelle T.

description:
This is an excellent spot for lunch in Soma. They are famous for their burgers, but should be famous for their cheesy cauliflower with a deep, smokey flavour. Or their perfectly crispy French fries dusted with herbs and served with horseradish aioli. Or the burrata served with heirloom tomatoes and balsamic on toasted country bread. 

There are tons of vegetarian options, and the desserts all looked incredible but we were too full to try them. Service is very good and very friendly. 

You'll need a reservation during peak mealtimes, but if you eat lunch closer to 1, you can just walk in.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I can never go wrong with Marlowe.   I came here for brunch and it was quite busy on the weekend.   I never go wrong here. Everything I have is good.  As I waited from bestie to come, the manager asked if I wanted something to drink.  Expected, but I was quite happy.

My meal was the burger cooked medium rare.   When it came, it was delicious. The burger was cooked perfectly and the fries were exceptional. Nice and crispy.  

A great lunch/brunch place, but I really enjoy the dinner meals here. They are outstanding.
author: Marck N.

description:
Came here for brunch and dinner, and both we're definitely not cheap. 

That aside, if you like good quality drinks, bites, and oysters - this is your spot. 

Dinner: 
The BURGER: definitely very memorable and obviously has some serious hype around it.
It is real, it was tasty, and I would get it again, every time (get the fix ins). 

Cocktails:
Can't remember what I got, but it was good and let's be honest that decor and vibe is destined for some great cocktails.

The Salmon bites topped with caviar and creme fraiche stole the show so if you're getting apps, get them.


Brunch:
Pretty steep, so bring your wallet (as noted above) BUT it was tasty.
I wouldn't put it up there with my TOP TOP brunch spots, but if you can get a reservation/table I recommend definitely  coming in. 
Girlfriend got the salmon bagel, and it was just okay.
I can't remember my dish, so there's that...


Regardless, I left happy both times, but much happier after dinner.
author: Naveed B.

description:
The "new" Marlowe reminds me of a beezie who moves to a new school and thinks she's all that and a bag of flaming hot cheetos and a tub of cream cheese. With their new location and continued popularity, it seems like Marlowe's has let it go to their head. 

To say my experience at their new location was disappointing is an understatement. The food that I once raved about to everyone is now nothing more than mediocrity drenched in salt with shrunk down portions served snail pacingly s-l-o-w by cocky, arrogant staff. And, I'm not alone here as other Yelpers seem to share the same sentiments.
 
Marlowe used to serve the best burger in SF at their old location but not anymore. Now, it's a $16 slider masquerading as a "burger". Look at that monstrous upper bun: http://bit.ly/16aQxwJ! It reminds me of former MTV's Teen Mom turned porn star, Farrah Abraham's botched upper lip job: http://dailym.ai/1CqwOao. See the resemblance? I give Farrah props for finding humor in her mishap though.

Aside from a downturn of their food, service was worse. 
 
My yelp check-ins don't account for all the times I've been to Marlowe's old location (7 times in 3 years) and service has always, always been stellar. The staff there was warm, friendly, attentive, and efficient. This time our waiter bro was "too cool for school" as my friend had stated. He was MIA the entire night and never once bothered to check in on us but surely had time to chop it up with the older group of gentlemen sitting one table over. 

Food service was painfully slow (made worse by the excruciatingly bad acoustics)...we had reservations at 8:30 pm (arrived on time) and didn't leave until 11:15 pm! It shouldn't take nearly 3 hours for 3 courses! I made notes in the reservation that it was my friend's birthday and when confirming the reservations, I was assured that a candle will be placed on the dessert. That NEVER happened. 

My gf, Heather C. and I were really pissed off and intended to email management about service (her review: http://bit.ly/1zPz3nx). After signing the bill, I was looking at our receipt for our server's name when he rudely swiped away the receipt. WTF! That was the fastest thing he did all night.

Sorry, Marlowe...you're now a has-been in my book.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: With a reservation here, had a pretty solid brunch. Not many crazy out there dishes, but lots of brunch staples done well. Also I might add some of the best executed fried chicken I've had in the area (in their sandwich)!
author: Neal B.

description:
I'm late to the Marlowe game, but better late than never!

Awesome ambiance a few blocks away from SOMA CalTrain station and AT&T Park. Service was immaculate, water glass was never empty and waitress came by as frequent as possible without overbearing dinner interference.

Interior decor and layout is right up Chris and Joanna Gaines' alley, straight out of Magnolia Farms but you wouldn't know what I'm talking about unless you're a HGTV Fixer Upper junkie.

Anyhow, who care about ambiance, it's all about the grub. Deviled Egg (topped with bacon) was to die for, and both the Di Stefano Burrata starter and the crab/seafood crepe melted in my mouth as if farm-to-table does exist.

As for entree, went with the burger, medium, extra toasted bun. Came with fries and some sort of mayo-horseradish-aioli dip. All fantastic.

Saving the best review for last - brussel sprout chips. Small bowl full of peeled brussel sprout leaflets that's fried for 15-20 seconds before mixing it with sea salt add lemon. Da Bomb.

Gents, be sure to make it rain with Marlowe's brussel sprout chips at your next gentlemen's club extravaganza. You can thank me later.

*Mic drop*
author: Dave K.

description: I typically get the brussel sprout chips, which are excellent.
author: Ethan S.

description: My meal was fabulous from the horseradish aioli for the crunchy fries to the carmelized onions in the mushroom soup to the truffle and (Parmesan?) cheese in my polenta! I topped it off with some chilled, chocolate, peanut butter bites!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
My friend that wanted to meet me here said he's heard many good things about their burger. So that's what we got and also crispy Brussel sprout chips? We came at a very awkward time for lunch, around 2, so there's a menu short and specific for that in between period of after lunch and before dinner. 

The burger was pretty mediocre to be honest. Nothing special. 

BUT the Brussel sprout chips -- AMAZING. Get it. They're individual leaflets drizzled in oil and baked. The lightness and crispness of it all. Mmm mmm mmm 

Seems like the spot to hit for some day drinking. Haha as I noticed many around sipping on cocktails.
author: Jane K.

description: Bob our server was amazing. This was our 4 year anniversary and it couldn't have gone any better we pretty much ordered 5 courses starting with deviled eggs and oysters then moved into bone marrow which was amazing proceeded into the beef tartar then split the chicken and pork chop (entrees were the least impressive, but still good) and finally a crisp to end the night. Cocktails were great and would highly recommend it. Last thing to mention my girlfriend spilled wine on herself and the staff spread the word quickly to bring her wine remover and it looked like it never happened. They went above and beyond which was great.
author: Anthony V.

description:
Wow! By far one of the most amazingly fabulous dining experiences I've ever had. Marlowe's theme is  "butcher chic" which sounds odd, but has a very cool look and ambience. We got to sit in the fully enclosed patio that has succulent gardens on the walls and lights strung across the ceiling...relaxed, but very nice. Our server, Akeisha, was WONDERFUL! Truly. She was so obviously passionate about making sure her customers had a great experience from the time we walked in to the memories that will last until the next time. She was very knowledgeable about every item on the menu and super cool about my annoying gluten allergy. She had excellent recommendations on food and drink which basically had me planning Marlowe and their perfectly heavenly polenta (with mushrooms, lots of parmesan, arugala, salsa verde truffle oil and a poached egg on top) as my final meal on earth. 

We ordered the brussel sprout chips, the deviled eggs (FYI, they are ordered individually), and the English pea pancakes for appetizers with the Corpse Reviver 2, the Verdejo, chardonney, syrah, and then a bottle of one of the whites which was pricey but well worth it. I couldn't eat either but the pancakes and brussel sprout chips were raved about repeatedly by my friends. For our main course two of us ordered the fabulous polenta and the others ordered the bone marrow and burratta with fava bean toast and the grilled Niman pork chop. All of it was fabulous and as we ate every bite, didn't have room for dessert that I'm certain would have been amazing as well.

I truly CANNOT (and don't want to) wait to go back!! Thank you so much Akeisha!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I visited Marlowe with a group of friends on a Saturday evening. We arrived at 10 pm, and surprisingly, this place was still packed. I was afraid that the restaurant wouldn't be able to accommodate our group of six without a reservation. Luckily, the hostess informed us that the wait would only be about 15 minutes, and a group of very hungry people released a collective sigh of relief.

While waiting, we perused the food menu, where everything looked delicious, and we ordered drinks. They have a healthy selection of wine, beer and cocktail options available. Everyone opted for cocktails -- with all the guys in the group going for The Donkey (aka an Irish Mule) -- and everyone was very pleased with their drink choices. I ordered The Baker later in the evening and I can recommend it as well for your drinking enjoyment. (All the cocktails were $12 or $13.)

In terms of food, we let Yelp reviews direct us to the Deviled Eggs, Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp, Marlowe Burger (with included Marlowe Fries), and Grilled Niman Pork Chop. The Deviled Eggs, Grilled Niman Pork Chop and Marlow Fries (with its addictive horseradish aioli) were all amazing and lived up to expectations. The only disappointment was the famous Marlowe Burger: while definitely a good burger, it was not especially exceptional.

In terms of service, Marlowe also excelled. The entire staff was extremely friendly and seemed genuinely concerned about making sure that we had a great dining experience. While waiting for our table we promptly had our drink orders taken and served. Our server for the evening regularly checked in with our table to make sure we had everything we needed. And, without asking, she already had two billing options prepared for whether we wanted a single bill or multiple bills split among couples. Simply put, the staff here rocks! 

Although this place is currently listed as $$ for price, it really is a $$$ restaurant.

One last interesting observation: note that while dining, you're actually sitting on dozens of bottles of wine. In a nice use of space, the restaurant stores its wine under the seats in the dining area.
author: Rodney G.

description:
Food: 4 stars. Fresh, pretty tasty, reasonably priced (by San Francisco standards)

Ambiance: 4 stars. Open space, comfortable seating (though slightly on the "cozy" side), view of the bar (which provides people watching entertainment), warm lighting. 

Service: 2 stars. Our waiters seemed distracted; one was even defensive when we asked for items that hadn't come out (it was clear he had forgotten to put in the order). I'm not a hyper peppy person who needs everyone around me to act super happy, but this was unsettling. I left feeling blah. 

With so many similar brunch places in this city, service will be the differentiator. I wouldn't choose Marlowe again if I can help it.
author: Christiana L.

description: Amazing meal at Marlowe with great friends. The cocktails were amazing and we especially loved the deviled eggs. Crazy good. Verdi chicken and the cod with pork belly...superb! The coup de gras? Cassandra, our server, was incredibly gracious and helpful. She even convinced me to have a cognac after dinner. Will be back!
author: James A.

description:
I've been eating at Marlowe (consistently) since 2008 and have remained impressed with the menu, staff, and overall atmosphere in the countless times I've been there. It's great for a causal lunch, date spot, pre Giants baseball game, and happy hour. Super versatile. 

My favorite dishes remain the following: 

Baked Oysters
Fried Chicken Sandwhich (no mayo/aioli)
Brussel Sprout Chips
Deviled Eggs

James/Anna (owners) are always SUPER welcoming and have quite the touch when it comes to hospitality and treating their customers right. It's that kind of attitude and hard work that has helped them expand their empire with the other restaurants in their portfolio (Park Tavern/Cavalier/Leo's Oyster Bar). None of this could be accomplished without Sarah (the manager), who is SUPER friendly and the rest of their amazing staff. 

A solid wine list, beers and full bar ranging from old world to new, round out Marlowe's eclectic feel and always wanting me to come back for more.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
We went here at 5.30 pm as that was the only reservation we could get 3 da s before.. interior is really nice with golden lighting and a well stocked bar at the back of the restaurant. the place filled  up quite a bit after 6 and when we left at 7.30 only few spots were un-occupied ; the bar area was full. 
We started with Brüssel sprout chips and goat cheese poppers ( hot sauce!) and Chardonnay.  Well thought through wine selection (prices per glass are insane but that is SF...). Main course pork chops with sweet potato purée and I had the polenta with mushrooms, cheese and poached eggs. I don't think I had yet a similarly great polenta. Dessert was peanut chocolate blocks - waiters' recommendation. In general the staff was very helpful, attentive and always eager to help/ recommend. Great place!
They even had vacherine and merengue- a true Swiss dessert! Too full to try but happy to see it on menu.
author: Mirjam S.

description:
Good place for lunch especially if you're looking for something for your break from work.

The fish burger and Brussel sprout chips are my go to every time I come here.
author: Cm Tú Đ.

description:
A great dining experience.  The bone marrow was excellent and the burger was perfect.  Had to send it back once because it was overcooked but ultimately had it replaced with a great burger.  

The staff were all friendly and did a nice job at accommodating us on a busy night.
author: Don R.

description: Reasonable prices for some pretty tasty food. Came to the table piping hot and service was great.
author: Sydney H.

description: Great atmosphere and menu variety. You can't go wrong stopping at  for lunch or dinner. All food is very tasty.
author: Barrett F.

description: Went for Sunday brunch. Our waiter was rude & unhelpful. He refused to write down our orders (party of 10), but then made several mistakes. He brought nine meals & never apologized for the tenth meal arriving after everyone else was finished eating. When asked if an ingredient could be substituted, he cut us off before we could even finish the question and said "no."  The food was ok, but definitely not worth the price or the experience.
author: Mary J.

description:
Love, love, love this place.  Super tasty inventive food, awesome cocktails, great service, and fun!

I highly recommend:

-- deviled eggs (amazing)
-- steak tartare
-- fries!
-- ribeye
--pork
-- polenta!  A real star!
-- Brussel sprout chips -- can't be missed

Ironically, our least favorite dish was the burger.  I know it gets rave reviews but frankly the other items were more interesting.

Cocktails are yummy. I tried a special called The Butcher's Mistress which was super refreshing.

We wrapped the evening with grappa... very powerful stuff!
author: Tami H.

description: The warm deviled eggs were so tasty and the bartenders were personable. Very busy on a Monday but was able to get a seat in a short amount of time
author: Kara S.

description:
We sat at the bar during the lunch rush.  The bar staff was excellent.

Busy vibe, lots of energy.

The food was amazing.  Everything seems to have a little spice in it that sneaks up on you.  

The only downside would be standing in line.  We skipped it because we sat at the bar, but people without reservations had to wait a long time.

Plan ahead because this place will have a line for a long time!
author: Ty M.

description: My friend did some research for a good dinner restaurant before coming to the Bay Area to visit me and made a reservation for Marlowe after reading all the positive reviews. Our table was immediately ready as soon as we arrived. They are usually booked very quickly so I suggest you call ahead. Our server was really nice and professional. She suggested a few appetizers and entree and drinks (which all turned out to be amazing). This place is very small but cute. They take pride in their food, service, and drinks. I highly recommend this. I am writing this review after 2 weeks and I can still remember the delicious warm deviled eggs, English pea pancakes, crab and shrimp crepes, the fries, and the anson mills polenta.
author: Tran N.

description:
Marlowe is a solid choice when you want consistency and food that doesn't disappoint. 

I've been here quite a few times. Word of advice, make a reservation. Not only will you need one, the seats at the bar are few and far between making it a challenge to actually dine here if you don't have one. 

So, everyone talks about the burger. While it's not the best burger I've had, it's a menu item I've ordered more than once (medium rare of course). I really like that they are happy to nix the bun and give me extra greens. 

My absolute favorite here though, is the Poulet "Vert". Even though they recently changed the base of the dish, the chicken marinade is still the same. 

Some other deliciousness (in no particular order): 

Warm caesar toast
Dungeness crab & rock shrimp crepes
Duck liver mousse
Little gem salad
Steak tartare

The Loretta's Vacherin is the best dessert. I've debated ordering my own to avoid sharing (yes, it's that good).

The patio is super charming, too!  Really, there's no bad seat in the house.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Let's talk about Marlowe for a quick second or a hot minute or a fire hour (I made that last phrase up). My friends and I have a tradition of getting a reunion-brunch of sorts during the summer. Last year, it was Park Tavern and this year it was Marlowe, but I'm guessing you already ascertained that from the fact that I'm doing this review.

I was a little intimidated coming into this place, because I heard they had signs that joked that vegans weren't allowed. Now, I'm not a vegan (and no cross-fit just yet), but I tend to err on the healthier side for brunch options. I was worried they wouldn't be accommodating, but they definitely were!

I chose the Warm Kale & Brussels Sprout Caesar ($13) and I asked for no dressing. Pro-tip: unless you're a MAJOR Caesar dressing fan, it is not necessary for this salad. Get the dressing on the side or not at all. Because the salad is served warm, I'm assuming they prepare the Brussels sprouts and kale in some type of flavored oil. 

My friends got the Marlowe Burger ($16) and the Dungeness Crab & Rock Shrimp Crêpe ($18), which looked delicious! We split the Di Stefano Burrata ($16), which comes with fava bean toast. I think everyone believes it to be avocado toast, but Marlowe isn't basic like that. You go, Marlowe! If you want to be basic, though, get some Rosé (like I did).
author: Gabriela K.

description:
Foie gras and scallops were good here ! Love the atmosphere and shout to Molinda for being a dope bartender . 

Drinks were good as well. The Serrano infused gin had the right amount of kick .
author: Amber H.

description: We went to Marlowe's before the Giant's game and had a splendid early dinner. Good vibe, superior service and a solid menu. We both had their house burger and fries and were not disappointed. Beer prices were fair and $4 cheaper than AT&T.
author: J B.

description:
Update - My overall impression of Marlowe has increased in the past couple of years, but the rate of my increasing happiness has not kept pace with the rate of increasing prices.

There is no way Marlowe is a $$ restaurant - it is squarely in the $$$ definition.

I've really enjoyed all of the food I've had at Marlowe in the past year, but the menu is relatively simple new American food.  Nothing is particularly innovative or surprising.  The seating is very cramped, service is lackluster, and the restaurant is too loud to justify its pricing pricing.  

If truly priced at $$, Marlowe would be a solid 4.5 stars.  At $$$, it's hard to see it above 3.5 stars.

Check out the menu at http://marlowesf.com/menus/.  As you can see, the cheapest main on the menu is the $16 burger (formerly $13).  Second cheapest thing is the vegetarian dish (currently polenta, $22), and the third cheapest main is the chicken (poulet vert) at $28.  Starters are priced at entree pricing - $12 to $17 for starters ranging from broccolini to burrata.   "Bites," which are finger food snacks like a bowl of toasted pistachios or brussel sprout chips, range from $7 to $12.  A conservative meal here will end around $50, and if you add drinks or an extra starter, plan to be near $100.   Like my review noted 4.5 years ago, I still feel that the servers are annoyed if I don't order any alcoholic drinks or load up on bites or starters.
author: Greg B.

description:
100TH REVIEW!

I decided to do my 100th review on Marlowe before I head to Japan today for a week! Stay tuned for my Japan reviews :D

I booked reservations here for dinner for a surprise date for my boyfriend, he has been craving bone marrow and I heard they  have some delicious ones here. The place is pretty small, I expected it to be bigger however the decorations are very nice, very cow themed!

We ordered almost the whole menu haha:

DRINKS:
We ordered their house specials! $12!
The Butchers Mistress: Pressco, very delicious and sparkling and fruity!
Oaxaca Chibcha: It was like a hot chocolate with tequila, pretty tasteful, definitely can taste the tequila!
Barnog: Egg Nog liquor, pretty good, on the sweet side

FOOD:
Baked Oysters: AMAZING, it was baked in sea salt and had cheese and mash potatoes inside. Highly recommend to try!
Devil Eggs: MUST ORDER. People say they have some of the best devil eggs here and I must agree. It was sprinkled with cheese, bacon and jalapeños. The jalapeños gave it a sweet after taste, loved it!
Duck Liver Mousse: This is not your regular duck liver, they complimented with a citrus sauce, basil and chives. Great taste! Comes with beard.
Crab & Shrimp Crepes: Delicious and creamy with your hollandaise sauce topped with fine herbs!
Roasted Bone Marrow: MUST ORDER. Comes with salsa verde and fine herbs and beard. The bone is big, but not much marrow as expected
Steak Tartare: Comes with a poached egg on top, mix it together and has a kick of pepper to it. Recommend for you, comes with beard.
Fries: I wanted to try the fries with their famous horseradish sauce. It was ok, I have had better. Wasn't too crazy about the sauce, maybe better with the burger.
Grilled Niman Pork Chop: This was my least favorite, portion was great. My boyfriend and I shared it and they were super nice and split it in two plates. Pork chop was kind of rough for my taste and not much flavor. Do not recommend. 

Overall, I give this place 5 stars. The service is great, our server had great recommendations and they gave us extra beard when we were running out. Must try place.
author: Natalie L.

description: Deviled eggs, crab & shrimp balls, burger & drinks (had the vodka, grapefruit cocktail) all awesome. One if best burgers of my existence. The Asian bartender was a pure artist making his cocktails. This is 2 min walk from my SF HQ...danger, danger, danger as I might disappear often when in SF. Good job Marlowe!!!!!!!!
author: Alicia P.

description:
One of my best friend's birthday falls on Christmas eve so every year we have brunch to celebrate her birthday and then we spend the rest of the afternoon shopping.  This year, we volunteered with the Salvation Army in the morning and made reservations for lunch at Marlowe.  We were starving by the time we arrived for lunch.  The place was super packed for lunch but we were given a table big enough for all of 7 of us. 

Our waitress was super moody that day because I think they were so busy with people and orders.  We ordered so many things off the menu and shared them amongst the table.

We ordering the following items: 

Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips - this could have been good but it had way too much salt. I was tempted to ask to send it back so we can have less salt on it but didn't want my food spit on so we just ate what we had. 

Little Gem Salad - good but the title is true to form.  It's a "little" as in very small portion of a gem salad but tasty. 

Di Stefano Burrata - this was decent but nothing special about it. 

Warm Open Faced Deviled Egg Sandwich - also decent but again nothing about it stood out. 

Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich - this was delicious; we ended up ordering another one because we devoured the first one. 

Marlowe Burger
(Caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon & horseradish aoli) - Marlowe is well known for their burger and I thought they definitely delivered.  It's good but it's still not my all time fave burger but it's definitely good and worth a try. 

Warm Open Faced Deviled Egg Sandwich 
Pickled jalapeno, bacon & aged provolone - this was just fine.  

Honestly, the food was ok.  A few of the items were overloaded with salt.  The desserts were not good at all so I decided not to even include them in the review.  The service was so so and our waitress was super moody that day.  I won't be back since we had such a mediocre experience.
author: Christine P.

description: The brunch and lunch are pretty good. The dinner is mediocre af. The burger is the best part of all the menus though
author: Martha S.

description:
This place. Love.

I was supposed to go here with friends during the week of Christmas, but ended up going the following Monday...thank goodness for no traffic that evening! 

The streets weren't all that busy, plus we were able to find parking easily...I think we paid $3 more or less for parking...and it was close to the restaurant too!

It's a pretty small restaurant...we arrived around 5:45ish (reservations were for 6:30)...the hostess was nice enough to have us seated early...in less than an hour, the restaurant filled up...man, was that quick...so you're bets are off trying to come in and dine as a walk-in...you could always try your luck at the bar, but even that was filled up end-to-end with a quickness.

The ambience of the restaurant is really nice, but if you ask me, my first thought just by looking at all the decor made me think of "this is more fitting for a steakhouse."

Anyway, everything we tried here was excellent from the cocktail drinks to the desserts.  Oh yeah, customer service is amazing here..can't forget to mention that!

Our orders: 

Cocktails:
The Baker- This must be one of their more popular drinks or something, cuz my friend ordered it, the couple to the left and right of us ordered multiple of these...I tried a sip, but I honestly thought it was just okay...it was fruity and sweet, but I felt the ETOH was on the stronger end for me.

The Pimm's Cup-Ok, I thought it was going to be served in a copper mug or something just cuz the name of this drink had "cup" at the end of it haha.  It's a very refreshing drink, and I liked this drink very much....maybe because it has ginger beer in it haha...i love ginger beer.

The Barnog- In the spirit of the holidays, why the heck not...well actually, we just saw one of the servers handing it to the customer and it just looked interesting...so yeah, basically it's boozy eggnog and then some...this too was very good...

Starters: Half-dozen fresh oysters...I squirted hella lemon on those suckers haha...it's hard for me to get over the taste of "ocean" in my mouth without gagging if you must know lol...the little sauce that goes with it made it taste even better. $18

Small Plates/ Entrees:

-Bone Marrow-Get it and do what some of our fellow Yelpers (including myself) did...just when you thought you were done eating all the marrow off the bone, think again.  In the midst of scraping that yummy, chewy baguette against the marrow, you've let a lot of the flavor and oil drip into the pan...so yes...I HIGHLY SUGGEST YOU TAKE THAT BREAD AND SCRAPE THE OIL FROM THAT PAN!  You know you've fallen in love with the restaurant when you ask the server, "May I have some more bread please?", and then they immediately complete your sentence with, "Some more bread to dip in the oil...you got it."  That was a beautiful moment I tell you.

-The Marlowe Burger-Not the best burger I've ever had, but it's one of the best...doesn't seem like much when you're just reading this off the menu, but once you taste it, I'm almost sure you'll be glad you ordered it...The Marlowe Fries are simple and perfect, the burger itself is simple, but that horseradish aioli  though...that was tasty. I'm not a medium-rare on my meat type of gal, but I'll make it an exception for this burger.

-My entree, the "Poulet Vert"-  Before ordering this, I was already set on the polenta, but when I asked the server what the heck a Poulet Vert was, she said it was a roasted chicken dish...I straight up ditched the polenta and went for the Poulet Vert like a boss haha...roasted chicken always gets me haha...so flavorful, tender, and juicy.  Everything went well together on that dish, especially the grapes.

Dessert:
-I don't even remember the name of the dessert we ordered, but per the server, it was the most popular choice on the menu.  I just remember it starts with a V.  it's coffee-flavored ice cream sitting on a meringue cookie drenched in fudge chocolate and almonds...I'm not really into anything coffee, but damn this was good...down to the very last spoonful.

Last but not least, what totally made my night was this: Because I was enjoying that dessert a little too much, my clumsy butt ended up spilling some of the chocolate onto my top.  I tried patting it down with my napkin and water, but it was hardly working.  I wasn't even paying attention to the staff cleaning up our table up until I heard the magic words, "Would you like some club soda to help remove the stain?" Omg, yes! Omg, how much better can customer service be! I was very thankful, and so was my top...the club soda removed the stain with ease haha.

I definitely recommend this restaurant...it's a good place to be if you want to satisfy your inner foodie.
author: Zerrilyn P.

description:
Marlowe is probably one of the best places for brunch in SOMA, especially considering they take reservations so you don't need to wait. The service is excellent, and the menu has a good selection of sweet and savoury. I went with the ricotta toast, which was very good. My friend got the fall scramble which is one of the most popular brunch items there, and said it was similarly very good. We also ordered their cookies to share after, which were warm and soft.

Overall I would give Marlowe four stars. It's not extraordinary like a Plow for example, but is a very solid option for brunch that you won't need to wait for.
