Everything we ordered was good and a little different and new
At the end he gave us the bill 
Bill was split 3 ways
Then the waiter comes back and gives us attitude and says we under paid by $3 and some change.... and also that that didnt include tip ....really ..... you could of pulled one of us aside and told that person with some class and been professional about it instead of acting that way and throwing a tantrum like a 2 year old.
At that point I didn't want to even leave any tip 
Marlowe you need to train your staff better 

Never will I be a returning client....ever

This review should be zero stars
author: Melanie K.

description: Semi decent drink and food selection (great oysters, steak, deviled eggs)  but just isn't my favorite type of food. Very crowded on a Friday evening. Staff is overall friendly. I like the coat check they're really good about it. Won't mind coming back again.
author: Tiff W.

description:
I had the polenta and ate slowly to savor each bite. So good! 
So many details in the presentation of this restaurant, except I couldn't make sense of the choice in music playing. Michael Jackson, Marvin Gaye, Rick James, etc.
author: Sergio L.

description: We were a little disappointed about this dinning experience. We saw the great reviews and we expected more. Service was ok very difficult to carry on a conversation due to the noise. The seating is very cramped. We shared the burger which was over salted and lacking flavor. The burrata dish was average.
author: Alisson M.

description: The service here is great - people are super friendly,  quick and always come to the table at the best timing. Love it! Great service makes Joyce happy always.  Food, I don't know how to describe it because seeing the great reviews here kinda makes me think maybe I just unfortunately ordered wrong food last time LMAO.  I know the chef tried very hard, but I found interesting (let's say, interesting) the taste he/she was determined to go with. The salad was unbelievably sour. Understanding it was supposed to be a little sour my friend and I were still shocked how sour it was. We couldn't finish it.  Sad. The burger and shrimp roll were fairly good but there was no surprise, and thinking the price we both agreed it was not worth it.  Oh their French Fries was awesome. French Fries is important isn't it?
author: Joyce S.

description:
Had lunch with a friend Tuesday morning. Great service from the moment we walked into Marlowe. 

The atmosphere was so relaxing so we felt right at home. 

I also recommend everything we ordered. Here's how I'd go about selecting it...

1) Deviled egg open-face sandwich
2) Steak tartare
3) Brussels sprouts chips
4) Jumbo shrimp cocktail
author: christina diem p.

description:
Friendly and warm.  It's a casual, easy going place to get tasty food!

Well crafted cocktails, the baked oyster was a perfect combination of crunchy on the outside and creamy on the inside, and the burger lived up to its reputation!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
We had quite a few menu items. Baked Cauliflower and Cheese. Fried Chicken Sandwich. Amazing. 

I will be back for those!

The Calf cocktail was also refreshing and delicious!
author: Natasha D.

description:
We came here on a Saturday for brunch in Dec 2015 before a show at the Orpheum.  Street parking was available within a block.  Glad we had an Open Table reservation, it was fairly crowded.  Nice and bright inside because of the big windows, vibrant young crowd there.

There's a solid menu with lots of interesting choices.  We started a half-dozen oysters (versus the bruleed winter citrus), and they were very good, fresh miyagis with a good mignonette and scallions to go with.  We had heard the burgers were good, but went with the crispy chicken sandwich and the polenta instead.  The chicken sandwich was really good with bacon and aioli.  You can get it with a green salad if you want to pass on the french fries.  The polenta came with a perfect poached egg on top and was very good and gluten-free friendly.

They did a great job on a coffee ice cream with chocolate sauce on a crispy meringue dessert (another gluten-free item!).  The only slightly disappointing thing was the coffee, I ordered an Americano, but it seemed a bit lukewarm and tasted like brewed coffee.

The server Akeisha was really friendly and helpful and well-supported by the rest of the crew.   I would definitely come back for brunch again and perhaps dinner, too.
author: Dan L.

description: Ordered baked oyster, bone marrow, crab & shrimp crepe, steak tartare & deviled eggs. Expected more of the bone marrow - wouldn't order it again. Best was baked oyster - nothing I've tasted before. Wouldn't come back for the rest.
author: Anita Z.

description:
This place is so classy and is a great locale for any occasion! The decor is modern but warm and very chic. 

We came for my fiance's birthday dinner with a group of five. This place is pretty small and gets booked up fast, so a reservation is a must. Don't even try walking in, especially on the weekends. We procrastinated to the last minute and called in the morning of. They were able to fit us in, but not until 8:45 pm. We didn't mind, we just got drinks and appetizers first somewhere else. Even at 8:45, we had to waiting 20 minutes or so for your table, though. 

Best things on the menu include the bone marrow (to die for!) and the steak dish. The steak comes with these mushrooms that I would definitely go back for. The pork chop was okay, but I've had better. One of our party had the burger and liked it a lot. 

This place is a bit on the expensive side, so it's more of a special occasion type of thing. Service is good, nothing exceptional.
author: Jaimie A.

description:
I was craving a fried chicken sandwich a few days ago for lunch and decided to head to Marlowe after hearing a number of great things about them.  And I was not disappointed. 

The restaurant is located directly across from the Cal Trans station, with a relatively small dining room. I was there on the early side (1145am) and sat & was served quickly.  The sandwich was a gem of a fried chicken- more refined than gluttonous, and very flavorful with a nice mix of greens to compliment the chicken.  The fries were a bit lackluster but did the job just fine.  But the sandwich will entice me to eventually return for another someday soon, and I would also like to give the dinner menu a try as well.  See you again, sooner or later, Marlowe!
author: Andy S.

description: Nice space and good food. Mediocre service which upset the mate more than it did me, but it was noticeably negligent. Other than this, I really enjoyed the Marlowe burger. Flavorful and not too greasy. With bacon and horseradish aioli. Amazing fries too. The interior was lovely, as mentioned. Love the taxidermy on the bar wall and black & white rustic theme.
author: Lisa K.

description: Dinner is great, brunch is even better.  Can't get anything here with truffle oil though, I think they use too much.
author: Joey L.

description:
This place was alright - it was a little exp and I think I expected a bit more given the reviews.

I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant, I never went to the old one but I hear this one is much more spacious.  It was nice that they took reservations.

We had a group of 5 and tried a bunch of different things - of course the burger (which I liked), duck liver mousse (pretty good, not that heavy), bone marrow (decent), brussel sprouts (too oily), .. etc.  

Not bad overall, but didn't wow me that much.  I'd still come back though, I think the service was good and also I did like the ambiance.
author: Kay C.

description: Great little spot for lunch! Came here for lunch and was seated immediately. The kale chips are amazing! must order along with the baked oysters.
author: Trang Ashley P.

description: They have a new location next to Bar Basic across from Bank of America.  This place is solid.  Bone marrow, steak tartare and brussel sprouts are a must.  Deviled eggs were ok but not a must.  Pork chop was ok.  Farmer's sundae was ok.  Service was outstanding and I would definitely come back.  Solid dinner place.
author: Chris L.

description:
It's official. I'm in love.

It's really hard to land a spot at Marlowe for lunch without a reservation, but when you do it's pure gold. From the chic atmosphere, super friendly and personable service, the small (easy to manage) menu, to delicious food, I have not had this awesome of an experience in SoMa for lunch in awhile. 

Ordered:
Di Stefano Burrata: Funky pickled? fruit on top of some sort of indian spice inspired topping over soft bread and vinaigrette. I don't even know how to describe it but it was unexpected and absolutely amazing. Highly recommend. 

Steak Tartare: Really easy to share and perfectly seasoned. It had a bite at the end that was not exactly spicy, but left you satisfied after every bite and going back for more. 

Spice Jumbo Gulf Shrimp: So here's the thing. I'm SUPER freaked out by heads and eyeballs on my food. After being thoroughly freaked out, my friend kindly took it apart for me so I could try them. Safely separated and peeled, the shrimp was juicy, sweet, cleaned (some places really do forget to clean their shellfish..ehk, but not Marlowe) and really good.

Marlowe Burger: It came recommended and I didn't have any regrets ordering it. The burger was perfectly cooked to order, super juicy and just disappeared in a second - so fast that I forgot to take a picture.
author: Hannah F.

description:
The thing about Marlowe is this: everybody likes it! So many, in fact, that it can be difficult to get seats without a reservation -- I know from previous experience, when they were completely booked up one early evening. But still, another attempt via agreeing to sit at the bar made it possible for us to enjoy an evening there!

Right off of the last SF Caltrain stop, essentially, is where this place is -- few blocks away, at most. Easy find. No wonder it's so crowded!

Once we were seated, I ordered the following: 
-Warm Deviled Eggs w aged provolone, pickled jalapeño & bacon (2 orders)
-Spiced Gumbo Gulf Shrimp w Hot & Boozy Cocktail Sauce (2 orders)
-Cocktail: The Sow
-Cocktail: More Cowbell

You'll notice them thar Deviled Eggs received two orders, back-to-back. Golly gee o-mighty, they were knock-your-socks-off good! Same thing occurred with the Spiced Gumbo Shrimp, although I also must say that these individual orders were officially either "bites" or "starters" on the menu -- too small for sharing purposes, perhaps even for single servings. Didn't matter, though, as we were HOONNNGRY that night!

So long as I can find the occasion and the time, I would totally return to Marlowe. Great service, the food is a charm, and you've gotta have more cowbell!
author: Garett T.

description: This is the first time I had a lunch in here. Their pork chop is so good!!! Highly recommended!!!!
author: Jackie J.

description:
Pros: We were not rushed and everyone in my group raved about their cocktails.

Cons: The food is very overpriced for what it is. My dishes were also very oily and very salty, such that I still have a stomach ache today. I unfortunately remember this being the case the last time I ate at this restaurant, too.
author: C. K.

description:
Came here for date night with my girlfriend. I have been trying to come here and have their bone marrow for months and I finally got a chance to dine here. Street parking right outside but I'm not sure how it usually is, we just got lucky maybe. 

We have heard that you come here, grab drinks and mostly eat appetizers. That is what they do well here. They have entrees but it's not really their pride and joy. We came a bit early so we sat at the bar and ordered drinks. I got a beer and my girl got the wine mixed drink of the day which she seemed to enjoy. Shortly after receiving our drinks we were ushered to our seats. 

Most of the small restaurant is communal seating so you might be sitting on a picnic table next to complete strangers. They do have normal restaurant seating but it just depends on how big your group is. We were only two so we got a two person table. We ordered the bone marrow, steak tartare, brussel sprout chips and the burger to share.

The sprout chips were very tasty with a lemon zing but after a while it got heavy because the oil starts to collect at the bottom. Can't eat too many on your own or it leaves a bad feeling in your stomach. It is meant to share for sure. The steak tartare was good and came with crostinis. It was good but it lacked seasoning. The bone marrow was so bomb. It comes with two bone halves and crostinis as well as capers to spread together and the whole thing was buttery, fatty, delciousness. I love bone marrow. The burger came and they were nice enough to split it into halves and put the different halves on different plates for us to enjoy. I really liked that. The burger itself was dry but the fries were good and came with a horseradish aioli.

The service was nice, attentive and the appetizers came out quickly. Other than an underachieving steak tartare and burger, everything else was great and the dimly lit atmosphere was perfect for a casual date out with my lady. I would like to come back again to try the baked oysters and get more bone marrow. Maybe order two orders!
author: Jeromy G.

description:
I don't know how on earth this place keeps getting amazing reviews, but I've been twice now and both times been absolutely unimpressed with the food, in fact, I would venture to say there are some appetizers on the menu that are straight up nasty. The burrata, for example.
It's also insssssaaanely overpriced; the cheapest glass of wine is $15 and again, not that good. I really don't recommend.
author: C. P.

description:
Friday night and threw the staff a couple of unintentional curveballs... simple answer they went above and beyond. 

1. Just as we were sitting a friend stopped by and wanted to have a drink with us.  The staff could not have been more understanding and accommodating. 

2. Splitting orders. Noting that two of us were sharing, without us asking not only did they split our pork chop entrée they split a glass of wine. And could not have been nicer about it.

3. Attention. Wait staff and management checked in to see how things were progressing... again above and beyond. 

The food was really really solid. The pancakes and shrimp started us off. Great bites and flavor. The pork chop and potatoes was a really nice plate with deep flavors throughout. 

Will get back there soon. Thanks Marlowe for a great night.
author: C K.

description: Marlowe fries Took a lot of time and were ok in taste.Very slow service.
author: Priyanka L.

description: Very tasty treats. Went here after a work meeting- and it was well worth it. I ordered the prawns and brussels sprouts in a sentence: seasoned well, a little pricy but fulfilling for a quick bite to eat.
author: Michelle F.

description:
We went here on a Saturday evening with friends. The entire experience was wonderful and I highly recommend it!

We had an 8:30 reservation. We arrived a few minuets early and the hostess was warm and welcoming; our table was not yet free, but it opened up around 8:35p. I was impressed that those waiting for tables could order drinks without even needing to go to the bar.

The vibe was great--it's a relatively small place, with the tables pretty close together, and that creates a really nice buzz. The noise level was energetic but not so loud that we could not enjoy each other's company and conversation. The decor was nice--rustic modern. There was enough lighting to see the menus. It just felt like the perfect energy and space for a special dinner out with friends.

Service was top-notch throughout the whole meal: our server was knowledgeable and friendly but not intrusive. She answered questions about the cocktails and menu with complete ease. Our water glasses never went unfilled. Pacing was spot-on and dishes were cleared quickly. A totally seamless evening, just like you want at a nice restaurant.

The cocktails were gorgeous. The Boulevardier was perfectly mixed and served at exactly the right temperature. A negroni used Aperol and this lightened the bitterness a bit for a really smooth drink. The Pimm's Cup was refreshing and well-made. The wine list was also appealing--nice selections and of manageable size. When we ordered a bottle for our main courses, they timed the pouring perfectly.

The food was great--everything was well-executed. The crispy Brussels sprouts chips were a salty, crunchy way to whet the appetite. The burrata, served on tasty bread with fresh figs on top, had wonderful flavor. An squash soup was a perfect way to begin autumn, and the summer squash caesar, perfectly dressed, was a nice take on the kale caesar phenomenon.

Mains impressed, too. The chicken was perfect--moist and juicy, and the sweet potato puree and pancetta/Brussels sprouts hash was a great accompaniment. The pork chop was perfectly cooked--it retained its moisture despite the thickness. The polenta with mushrooms and parmesan, topped with some fresh arugula, was rich and earthy; it was great to have a vegetarian dish of this quality.

Truly perfect execution of every element--service, drinks, atmosphere, food.
author: Craig P.

description:
Not too impressed. I heard a lot of good things about this place over the years and so we decided to meet a friend here for an early dinner and drinks.

First off, the skinny waitress with the glasses and hair pulled up was a complete sour puss. It wouldn't hurt to smile once in a while or come off as less robotic and more human. She was doing her job by stopping by once in a while but let's just say she was a bummer every time she came to the table.

I ended up ordering the steak with fries and it was ok. A bit pricey for the quality and quantity. The lady's veggie dish was a lot better and the deviled eggs with bacon were pretty solid.

And the other bummer is they don't serve cocktails. Really?! I wasn't in the mood for wine so I had to settle for beer. I don't think the waitress liked that either.

I wouldn't say no to an invitation here in the future but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.
author: Art O.

description:
Had lunch here the other day with a few of my colleagues. They raved how great the restaurant was. I have to say the food was alright. It was a bit overhyped for me. We ordered the brussel sprout chips which were delicious though. I'd definitely recommend that and if you're not a fan of brussel sprouts you will be afterwards! I ordered the grilled calamari and chorizo tartine. It was alright. I opted for my choice of french fries instead of the salad, which they gave a generous portion of. The drinks here weren't too bad. I feel that their menu selection wasn't that impressive.

The service was alright. Waitress didn't seem as knowledgeable only to nod to her head and to tell me "yeah, that's good". The decor and ambiance of the restaurant is nice. I'd probably prefer to come here for dinner than lunch again.

If you're around the area then check it out, but not worth going out of my way for. Make sure to make reservations since it is a small place.
author: Connie C.

description:
I've been here many, many times -- and I live in Mountain View. I think that says a lot, right?

Let's talk about everything that makes Marlowe great.
+ The location: it's RIGHT off caltrain with just a couple minutes walking, making it ideal for commuters, travelers, and those coming up to the city for an evening.
+ The polenta: Dear lord, I've never had my heart beat for a dish like it does for the Anson Hills Polenta. It's creamy without being mushy. The mushrooms are al dente and incredibly flavorful. I don't normally like arugula, but it's perfect in this dish. OH MAN I REALLY WANT THE POLENTA RIGHT NOW.
+ The cocktails: Hand-crafted with art. My favorite -- and I've had plenty -- is the Baker. It's sweet but has a bite, and the fresh orange peel makes it pretty. I'm a sucker for a single giant, solid ice cube in a cocktail, too. 
+ The other food: I love the chicken fried okra, though I admit it's a bit saltier than it needs to be. The burger can be satisfying, and the crispy brussels sprout chips are always great. Even the pork chop (which is never my favorite item on a menu) is good. 

The only time I've ever had a bit of a complaint: the bone marrow. It's tasty, but the first time I ordered it, the marrow was burnt on one end and I couldn't even break it out of the bone. When you're paying $17 for a single bone's worth, you want the whole thing. Thankfully the staff brought out another one gratis, but it was the same way! I guess two halves make a whole.

I'm nervous posting this review because I don't want it to be harder to get into Marlowe than it already is -- but it's a necessary post of praise.
author: Amanda D.

description:
Great spot for an intimate dinner, and while the tables/chairs are placed close together, you never feel as if you're trying to talk above any ambient noise.

Came here for dinner and drinks and had:
- Deviled Eggs (Still don't know how to make these but they're amazing here)
- Beef/Steak Tartare (Not the best in the city- but they give you good portions and you can share)
- Brussel Sprout Chips (I'm in Brussel sprout fever mode now. The chips have just the right amount of crisp to them)

I don't think I'll be back for a bit since I don't typically hang out in that area of the city- but it'd be worth a trip as a late evening snack after a night out or even for HH if you don't mind waiting (dinner wait was around 30min)
author: James L.

description:
Awful experience. Never going back.
Had a reservation for 10.30am, the entire party was there and on time. We did not get seat until 20 minutes later. It took them that long to seat us they put us outside on the patio which was not set up when we arrived, even though the restaurant opened at 10am and they called they day before to say we would be on the patio.

The food portions were very small. Far too expensive for what you got. The service was not good. Our server was rude and annoyed with us before she even started asking for our order. 

An entirely unpleasant experience.
author: Holly J.

description:
I've been a fan of Marlowe way back when they were at Townsend.
There new location (well not new anymore) has more room to occupy the high demand of foodies like me. 
STILL heavily in love with their bone marrow, brussels sprouts, deviled eggs, and their burger. Service is always attentive. Greeaaaaaat atmosphere as well.
author: Virginia L.

description: I can honestly say my experience here was not bad and not great. We had to wait for a half hour just to be seated at the bar and this was at 1pm on a Wednesday mind you. The hype on the burger is a little much. Not spectacular and we've had better in the city. And honestly there was nothing else really on the menu that peaked my interest, it was all pretty run of the mill overly hyped and over priced. So I don't know if I'd be back and I don't know if I can recommend it, it was all just kind of meh.
author: Victoria T.

description:
We made a reservation in advance, so we got seated in a very short time. This place is not quite big, but very busy!
Drink: creative! Be sure to try their beer!u can truly feel the root barley taste! High quality!
Food: Super good burger!!! Light but very juicy! Salads are fresh, seafood is just right!

Have not tried their desert yet. Will definitely come back!
author: Nina H.

description:
My boyfriend spoils me all the time, and I decided for once it was my turn to show my appreciation for his many years of support and love, so, I took him to Marlowe.

Made my reservations a week in advance through Open Table. I did not have a tough time getting seats for 2 on a Sunday at 8:30PM.

Parking in the area wasn't too bad this time of night, we found a spot less than a block away.

When we walked in, I was actually a little surprised at how busy the small establishment was this time of night. We were greeted by a friendly hostess who grabbed our name and found our reservation right away. Seated us within moments, menus in hand. She hung my coat on the wall to get it out of the way. At the time, my coat was the only jacket hanging up.

I decided to order for us tonight, and already had an idea of what I wanted to get for the small plates to try. From the reviews here I knew I wanted to order the Brussels Sprout Chips.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Brussel Sprout Chips: Crispy little green peddles with salt and lemon zest which you catch on the later half of the bite. The addition of the course salt as a nice little extra crunch with each bite. The portion is decent and easily feeds 2 to 3 people. We enjoyed them all the way to the bottom of the porcelain white bowl.

Steamed Manila Clams: Oh my, Oh my. These were my FAVORITE part of the meal. Tender, salty gems steamed with a white wine reduction and mirepoix. The garlic flavored broth was a magnificent liquid to slurp (quietly) along with the Clams as well as to dunk the the toast covered in a garlic aioli in. 

Certified Angus 8oz New York Steak w/ Fries: A sometimes tough cut of meat cooked to a near perfect Medium Rare served with very crunchy and garlic-y Frites. My steak was tender and mildly salty, the splash of Red Wine sauce supported the meat while enhancing the smoky undertones. Typically, I am not an eater of fries/ frites, however these were actually pretty tasty, loved the crunch factor, they seemed more light and air-y and the average frie.

Grilled Niman Pork Chop w/ Stinging Nettle Risotto, Figs and Spinach: Pork Chops grilled to a charred perfection. The sweetness of the Figs added a great balance to the salty meat, brining with it an earth flavor. Stinging Nettle Risotto was decent, cooker perfectly, but lacked any big PUNCH, I think a touch of lemon juice or lemon zest would have made the Risotto pop.

Upon completion of a wonderful meal we were given dessert menus, but did not see anything that caught our attention. Our check was given to us promptly and after handing over my debt card, we chatted and finished the last sips of our wine.

When getting ready to leave we noticed many more coats had joined the hooks and asked where our jacket was placed, however no one seemed to know. The servers were very helpful while trying to assist us in finding the jacket, hobbling around in an Air Cast/ Boot in such a tiny space was not easy, but I was thankful for their kindness in helping us locate it. 

In closing, we really enjoyed our meal here and are glad we had an opportunity to try the fares at Marlowe.
author: Meghan L.

description: This place sure hits the spot if you're hungry and need a close place to eat at before a Giants game! I've been here a few times and I've always sat at the bar. The bartenders are nice, drinks are decent, but nothing spectacular. I've tried the jumbo shrimp, deviled eggs, oysters, asparagus, and their steak. The food is good, it definitely hits the spot. I recommend this place if you're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
I only tried the famous Marlowe burger so I can't comment on the rest of the menu.

The Side Salad with the burger - Tasty but drowning in dressing so it was on the salty side.

The Fries with the burger - Very good fries. The best part of the meal!

The Burger itself - Wow what a disappointment! It wasn't a bad burger per se. It just wasn't a good burger. The buns were cold/room temperature and they used chopped lettuce instead of whole pieces of lettuce, which gave a cheap feel to it. The patty was juicy but nothing special. The bacon on the burger however was cooked to a crisp perfection. 

SUMMARY: I have no idea why Marlowe's burger is rated one of the top in SF. There are plenty of better burgers in SF for far cheaper than $16.
author: Alex P.

description:
Seriously one of the best experiences we have had in a long time.  My husband picked me up from the Airport after a VERY LONG flight with a promise of a nice lunch.  

We decided to stop somewhere in San Francisco for a quick bite.  Not having any idea where to go, we were driving, went to Yelp and found Marlowe.

From THE moment we stepped in the door we knew this was exactly what we wanted.  We were ushered to the bar where two seats awaited us.  The ambiance is wonderful.

The bartender helped us navigate the cocktail menu to find just the right mix of yum.  Mine was a twist on a Margarita (big yum) and Hubby had The Butcher.  Perfect balance of sweet/savory.   The wine choices for lunch were also quite nice.  Again, the bartender was ready and willing to help and gave us tastes to make sure we loved them.  We did.

We sampled the OH SO AWESOME deviled eggs with just the right hint of bacon.  Truth be told, we could have eaten 12 more.  We dined on the Shrimp (heads on) with a spicy, tangy sauce and the Burrata.  It was creamy with the right amount of crunch coming from the bread.  Heaven.  

For our entrees we split the risotto (cooked perfectly) and washed it down with another glass of white.  Dessert was the real surprise.  We ordered the Coffee Ice Cream and Meringue cookie dessert.  It was a wonderful combination.  Cool, sweet, Coffee ice cream, a little bit of chocolate syrup and a chewie cookie.  Could not have asked for more. 

The staff was friendly and warm, the food was carefully prepared and overall, it really felt like this place was created just for us, out of a dream. 

Hats off to Marlowe...we'll be back!
author: Stephanie D.

description: With its endearing farm house vibe, Marlowe is the perfect escape from the surrounding construction and concrete that has overtaken SOMA. The burger, made with fresh meat ground in-house, is a must try.  Also the cocktails are fresh and go down oh so smoothly.
author: Nash R.

description: Wow - its amazing to find a neighborhood eatery that takes your breath away - this does it! In spades! The scallops are the best I have ever had! Make sure you order them with the sourdough toast to sop up that amazing broth! It is paired very well with the Gerard Bertrand Brut Rose too! But I would try it with the Dry Riesling as well as suggested by Gavin at the bar - he has a palate that I would follow anytime! This is a must visit in San Francisco.
author: Rick M.

description:
I was so excited to finally try Marlowe due to all the hype, but I have to say I wasn't blown away.  I asked Cherylynn what she thought and she said it's still good, but everything's better your first time!  And I'm like, not everything, especially for a girl/woman...hehe...Oh c'mon ladies, you know what I'm talking about!

Anywho, I was able to snag a reservation for 4 on a Saturday night for a double date with Cherylynn and her bf.  I like the decor, but upon arrival I noticed that it was smaller than I thought it would be.  The four of us shared for an appetizer the Brussel Sprout chips ($9).  Each couple shared their own order of bone marrow ($13) & since he & I weren't that hungry we shared their famous burger ($14), which they were so kind to split it for us at no additional cost.  Brussel sprout chips were a nice starter.  They were seasoned well, but lacked oomph.  I feel like this was the weakest dish of the three that we sampled.  I think Vault 164's brussel sprout chips are better.  Next came the marrow.  I've been craving bone marrow after not having it so long.  This is where the "it's always better your first time" line applies!  I had it in October for the first time and I must say that restaurant's marrow was better.  This one was still probably the star of the dinner, but it looked to be a good hefty portion, but wasn't too much.  It was also a lot oilier than the other one I had.  But I liked the heat from the salsa verde.  The crostinis the marrow was served with was a little burnt.  Finally our split burger came out, Cherylynn did warn us though that it's a little smaller than other similar gourmet burgers you get at restaurants though.  And it was indeed!  There weren't as many fries as I thought there would be either.  The burger was cooked perfect and was super juicy.  And you gotta love how it comes already with caramelized onions, cheese and bacon.  What makes their burger different is the horseradish aioli.  We both love our aioli but I'm not really a horseradish fan, but this one was faint enough where it was offensive.  However, I feel like I could really only taste the horseradish and a little bit of the beef in the burger, not so much the onions or cheese or bacon.  Cherylynn's polenta looked good with the poached egg and wild mushrooms.  Eric's grilled pork chop looked hearty, but the sausage it was served with was burnt looking (though the waitress said it was supposed to be).  

Service was slow and not so attentive, except for when the busboy kept wanting to clear the table of plates.  Parking is fairly easy on the weekend (& cheap) when there's no game or event going on.  Make reservations as Marlowe gets packed (more so on the weekdays though).  Marlowe is a solid 3 - 3.5ish stars in my book.  I'm glad I checked it off my list, but don't see all the hype necessarily in it.  I think for the price too I was expecting a little more. I'm not sure if I'd come back to Marlowe, but I'm curious about the owners' Park Tavern restaurant.
author: Cat C.

description:
I came here about a week ago for dinner. The staff was very accommodating and even though we arrived about thirty minutes early for our reservation, they still managed to find a space for us relatively quickly. 

The food was good but in my opinion a little overpriced for what it was. I got the steak and although it was a well cooked New York steak, I'd say the portion size was not as large as I had expected. 

My brother got the chicken and his girlfriend got the pork. I'd say the chickens is probably the best dish out of the three that we tried. 

Loved the atmosphere though. It's a small restaurant so make a reservation but it's very cozy and a great place to bring a date. Overall a pleasurable experience but probably not one of my top choices based solely on the food.
author: Derek C.

description: The two ladies who devised and run Marlowe's (they now have one or two more places in SF also) totally know what they are doing.  The food, service and drinks are always first rate.  Their brussel sprout chips are oily and delicious.  The hamburger is one of the best in SF and is hard to pass-up if you still eat old school food.  It IS crowded most of the time and can be very noisy.  I am not sure it is a great place for a first date as your neighbors may be able to hear everything and you may have to speak-up to have a conversation.  Otherwise it is a good choice (not cheap though!) for lunch or dinner.
author: Thomas G.

description:
We had a casual birthday lunch for 8 girls at Marlowe. They were very accommodating, easy to make a reservation, and their service was awesome. I know large groups are always more difficult but they were understanding and patient with us. 

I got to try:
*pimms cup: very refreshing for a hot day! I could barely taste the alcohol which is a plus for me personally. The ginger ale and cucumber definitely made it much better.  I wish I had gotten the ginger beer instead though. 
*deviled egg: i am dumb and I thought one order of deviled egg would be one whole egg aka two halves of the egg but one order meant just half the egg and I had to share this with a friend which made us look very sad and pitiful BUT it was still delicious regardless. (Don't judge we were very distracted when we were ordering)
*fried chicken sandwich: OMG SO CRISPY. It was like McChicken on steroids. And dude, McDonald's is awesome. 
*crab crepe: I wish the plating was prettier. It kinda looked like a salad with weird brown stuff on the bottom. But it was actually really delicious plus I appreciated the greens too. The salad was tangy which balanced out the crepe that was smothered in this aioli type of sauce. I would definitely get this again next time. It was a bit on the salty side but it's okay. 

Overall, the decor, ambience, service, and food--basically everything had nothing to complain about! Would definitely come back.
author: Becky M.

description:
Not as good as I remembered. Torn between 3 and 4 stars. The venue is still nice though. The new location is nice and more spacious. The service kind of died on us the other night when we went. And it wasn't like we were being cheap seat warmers. We were eating and drinking and enjoying our birthday girls night out as we normally would. I mentioned birthday on our reservation and at the door and hinted "birthday girl" several times during the meal, but got no recognition. 

We ordered quite a bit. We had our favorites and some dishes we could have definitely done without. Several small dishes and 1 main entree to share. 3 desserts, 3 cocktails, and 1 bottle of wine. 

My drink, the Calf was delicious. It was made with Ginger Beer. The Sow was good too, with egg white, and the other drink, I forget what it is called, was too fruity. We got a Syrah blend for the meal that was tasty. Thought it was $24 but turns out that's the price for a carafe. Menu wasn't clear. The bottle was $44. 

Food:
Devilled eggs - meh. Too lemony

Half Doz oysters - yum! Plump and delish. Hit the spot. 

Brussels Sprout Chips - we almost ordered a second order, they were so good. Must get!

Scallop tartar - too fishy and too spicy, took away from the scallop taste. 

Duck liver pate in fried ball shape - must get! so good! Definitely my favorite. Its just a different way of serving it, and it was really good. Served with a fig sauce to make it even yummier. 

Burrata - mostly salad with hazelnuts, but very good. I might have licked the plate had I been at home. Lol!

Bone marrow - bone marrow is always good in my book. This was good but didn't stick out. A little too garlicky. The first plate they gave us was a little rare inside. We weren't sure if it was okay to eat, so they took it back and gave us another. We night have eaten it anyway, but twice was definitely a plus! I would still get this again. 

Entree was the Steak. It was good enough. We shared it between 3 of us. Typical steak, spinach, shallots. 

Dessert: the chocolate coke was way too rich. The pretzel peanut butter things were OK. It was good to have some salt in our dessert. Our favorite was the coffee ice cream with almonds.
author: Ping N.

description: So good! Friendly staff, and just what I needed after the long drive from LA!
author: Katie M.

description:
I made a reservation for 7:30 on a Wednesday night but did not get seated until 7:40ish? Not too bad. For a Wednesday, the place was packed and there were a good amount of people waiting outside to get seated. First impression: this place must be good! That being said, make a reservation!! 

Other restaurants need to learn a thing or two about customer service because the service here is amazing!! I'm not sure what the server's name is but I believe he is the owner. My cup of water was never empty or half filled. Being a dummy I accidentally left my fork on the plate and some lady came to take the plates away :(. Five minutes later, the server came by to check up on us. I didn't even have to say anything. He took one glance and came back with a fork! Other waiters/waitresses would NOT have noticed such a small detail.

My boyfriend and I ordered the roasted bone marrow, the spiced jumbo gulf shrimp, the Marlowe burger, and the grilled niman pork chop. My favorite dishes are the pork chop and the jumbo gulf shrimp! The cocktail sauce that came with the jumbo gulf shrimp complemented well. Unfortunately, I'm not a fan of horseradish, so the burger wasn't the best thing in the world in my opinion. It also tasted a little burnt. However, the fries were delicious! Perfectly crisp. My boyfriend enjoyed the pork chops. For the bone marrow, I like how it came with crostinis! The bone marrow itself was very creamy. Not as flavorful as I expected, but it was creamier than other bone marrows I've tried. 

I noticed that other tables ordered the Marlowe burger split in half (on diff plates)! A great option if you have a small appetite + you want to share with a friend.
author: Fanny H.

description:
Yes, the Burger is wonderful.

We stepped of the Caltrain and were looking for somewhere with high quality and reasonable (for SF) priced food.

We both had a pimms based cocktail, again it was very very good.

The interior looks like a butcher shop, and the staff are dressed to match. Our server was very helpful and attentive given how busy they were.

5/5 would eat here again....
author: Chris B.

description:
Took my family for a Marlowe burger after finally having had one myself at The Cavalier (see separate review).

Strangely Marlowe isn't as good. The burger was way underdone - pretty much raw- and the fries were the opposite - hard/crunchy and kind of overcooked. My son ordered a shrimp starter and it was really inedible - no one at the table was up for eating it.

Maybe an off night but not auspicious.
author: roger m.

description:
Three words for you: brussels sprouts chips.

I don't know it's never occurred to me that brussels sprouts -- the best vegetable in the world and I will fight you for that -- should be fanned out and roasted thin and turned into amazing, delectable chips, but thank GOODNESS Marlowe had the sense to do so.

These things are something else. Like kale chips, only DELICIOUSER. And I realize that's not a real word, but it's happening anyway.

I really dug the ambiance at Marlowe, with one large communal-style table and a bunch of smaller ones, a fresh raspberry iced tea as one of their drinks of the day, and very nice, laid-back servers.

I had the burger as my main meal, which was indeed very good, but it had nothing on those b.sprout chips. I wish I'd just gotten like 4 orders as my entree. Next time I am in San Fran, I'm sure those delectable, crispy, lemony, salty, delightful little things will be calling my name HARD. And in the meantime, I guess I just have to figure out how to make 'em myself!
author: Gretchen F.

description:
Girlfriend and I enjoyed our experience. Good food and nice environment. Highlights were the Brussel sprout chips and beet pancakes with smoked salmon cream freche and caviar. Bone marrow was bomb too but was expecting more marrow. But like cow bell I could always have more marrow.

One thing I would comment is that the place is a little loud and crammed for the price.
author: Anton G.

description:
Marlowe burger FTW. Everyone has said it, Marlow Burger "nom nom nom." It's not overrated. I have to say that for $15 and for that size...I was like...okay really. That is oh so insignificant. However, first bite in, I realized my "judging a book by its cover" mistake. It is one of the best restaurant burgers. Seriously. No. Joke.

The patty was cooked perfectly. Perfect temperature - medium rare. It was seasoned beautifully and had a great umami flavor.  There was the perfect amount of melty cheese, the bacon was crisp with every might and complimented the patty. There was shredded lettuce, which I thought...really, that's it? But it worked really well. The bun, I didn't even mind that it wasn't toasted. I thought I was really going to mind! 

The horseradish aioli, I thought I wasn't going to like it. We asked for it on the side. I don't like horseradish generally, that includes on prime rib. It was delicious. The horseradish flavor was very subtle. Smear some on the bun, and it is a perfectly assembled burger and the flavors just marry one another deliciously! 

Would return for a $15 burger. That's right. 

(4505 cheese burger is really good as well, but they are two different animals)
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Had a nice dinner at Marlowe with a friend, and resisted the temptation of the Marlowe burger. Why?  Because there were so many things on the menu that looked and tasted really great.

Food:
Started with the English Pea pancakes (fantastic flavor) and the crab and shrimp crepes (really wonderful, light, with just a touch of brine). Went perfect with the Sauvignon Blanc we chose to enjoy with our meal.  Decent wine list overall and I thought there were lots of affordable choices. For my main I had the pork chop and my friend had the scallops.  My pork was the right temp and the charred scallions were a nice accompaniment.  Overall I think the food was great.  We didn't have room left for dessert, which was just fine.  I like it when the appetizers and mains are enough to satisfy.  And I liked so much of the menu that I'll happily try the signature burger next time!

Service:
Reserved through Open Table and were seated right on time.  Server and sommelier were friendly, helpful, and unobtrusive, which was nice since I hadn't seen my friend in a while and wanted to catch up. No complaints about the service whatsoever.

Vibe:
Tile-floors-marble-tables-chic.  Pretty typical hipster hangout.  Not a pejorative, though - hipster hangouts are usually pretty cool (even if I am not as cool as I used to be!).  We sat a two-top, wedged in among other two-tops, and it was intimate but not too tight.  I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the dining room.

Family-friendly:
Maybe, but I wouldn't bother bringing children here.  Save it for a night or day when you don't have the whippersnappers with you.

Service:
I think the hype is well-deserved, and not just about the burger.  I'm glad we chose to eat at Marlowe, and I will definitely come back when I have the chance. Brunch menu seems intriguing...
author: Aneesh B.

description:
Before a lovely musical date with a friend, we came here to grab some drinks and bites. It's a very nice location - close to the CalTrain station.  The location is pretty large, with quite a few seats, but where we ended up, it was not the ideal location.  We sat right next to the bar and bar stool so my friend who was sitting on the outside was getting hit all the time. Honestly, I don't know why they didn't sit us in the actual restaurant portion since there were plenty of seats - even when we left. 

Together we ordered mostly appetizers.
-Brussel sprout chips: These weren't the best I've ever had or anything, but they weren't bad either. 7x7 magazine things to eat. They were crispy, tasty, but again I could probably make something similar.  
-Deviled eggs: These were pretty good.  I enjoyed the toppings (bacon, provolone, japaleno - few of my favorite things). Expensive for a deviled egg though. 
-Di Stefano Burrata Toast: I am in love with burrata, but this was not my preferred method of eating burrata. The curry flavor makes it interesting; however, not great. 
-Burger: The Marlowe burger is pretty well known - based on 7x7 magazine. Decided since my friend and I were here together, we'd try it. There was a bit too much bread for the burger itself. Not too bad, but not amazing either.  Needed more sauce. 
-Rum soaked nectarine split: first off we tried to tell the waitress we had to get somewhere and to make the dessert on the fly. But also there were not enough nectarines to make this a split.  Expected more. 

Overall, our experience here was decent, but could have been a lot better.  It got really loud in the restaurant, but the food was pretty good.  Go there, enjoy the food if you're close to the Caltrain station and want to go to a well known restaurant. 

Protip: get a reservation if you want to sit...or try your luck!p
author: Nina Y.

description:
Lucky to get in within ten mins without reservation for two seats at the bar. 

Every dish is tasty. We had two dishes of small bites:crispy Brussels sprouts, the smoked salmon pancakes, two appetizers: chorizo and squid bruchetta, burrata with salad, and a burger. Personally I think paying 16 dollar for the size of burger is a bit too expensive. But good hamburger. 

The waiter didn't pace the dishes well. Other than that, everything was great. 

We would come back again.
author: Carrie Z.

description: Wow...what an experience of favor. Everything was phenomenal from apps to dessert and drinks of course. My cousin and I came in around 5 on a Saturday. We started off with the brussel sprout chips which were very tangy wild flavor. Then we got the baked oysters....WOW. So I guess I'm a bit bias because it was my first time having oysters but wow these were delightful. Rich flavor and very creamy in texture the melt in your mouth type. Then we got the Marlowe burger just to see if the people that were making a fuss about it were the real deal and once again I was wowed. This one goes on my top 10 for best burger. Also recommend to get the fries instead of the side salad. They were very crispy and not too salty. After that , we got the salmon cucumber salad it was very beautiful with lots of color and very refreshing. Last but probably my favorite (I loveeeee sweets)  was the gingerbread cake!!! It's a must try the cake itself was very moist(also not too dense which i loved) and full of flavor and spice the ice cream was a nice touch and the sauce omg omg the sauce...amazing and brought it all together. Over all absolutely fantastic experience from the food to the service it was all splendid. Oh also ordered two drinks the juicer and the bakers wife. The juicer was my favorite out of the two it had a kick for sure. Highly recommend!!
author: Mari A.

description:
Once in awhile, I will have cravings for a delicious burger. Marlowe had been in my bookmarks since forever, so we finally ventured out to Marlowe on a Friday night. I had read a few reviews about how the restaurant is pretty small and reservations are definitely recommended. So, I made reservations about a week in advance just in case it got pretty packed. And when we arrived, the whole restaurant was packed and there were even people waiting! Lucky us! :) Anyways, the two of us shared the following:

Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips: I really really really like brussels sprouts so when I heard they were made like chips, I knew I was going to like them! AND I did like them! :) The brussels sprout were seasoned in lemon and sea salt. They were so addicting! I ate them like it was nothing! They were very crispy and had that hint of lemon. It wasn't too overly salty. I would definitely order this again!

Roasted Bone Marrow: I think Marlowe's bone marrow might just be my favorite! I have tried bone marrow at a couple other restaurants and nothing compares to Marlowe's. It was flavorful, rich, and buttery. There were very thick chunks, a perfect portion size to put on top of the crostini. I felt like I didn't even really need to put the salsa verde sauce with it. It was good enough on its own.

Marlowe Burger: The kitchen was very nice enough to split the burger and fries in half for us! :) The burger came with caramelized onions, cheddar, and bacon. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare. I really really really liked the burger. It was delicious and one of the better burgers I have had. Each bite melted in my mouth. The burger was very juicy, yet it didn't leak anything onto the plate. I really liked the fries that came along with it. It was very crispy. Mmm.. Everything about this dish was just delicious!

Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta Affogato: The dessert came with amaretto, lemon biscotti. It was a bit bitter when we took our first bite. However, we mixed the espresso that was poured on top of the panna cotta and it made it less bitter. With the mixture, it was light and delicious. It didn't make you feel too heavy after eating it. The biscotti complemented very well with the panna cotta. I only wished there were more than two pieces though. Overall, a really great dessert to end the meal. 

I think I would definitely be back for the exact dish items we ordered that night. Everything was just delicious and prices were very reasonable. It was not expensive at all! Service was great too. Our plates were changed frequently and our water cups were never empty. As for parking, we found meter parking right across the street. Since we came after 6pm, it's only 25 cents per hour! What a deal!! Just make sure in advance that you book reservations to save time from waiting! :)
author: Philana C.

description: Pretty standard upscale American menu, albeit overpriced for the types of standard dishes you see on most menus these days (Brussels, French fries, etc). Drinks were good aside from an extremely hot jalapeño cocktail our server failed to mention would be so spicy. The experience was ruined, however, when we tried to add sliced tomato and onion to the burger and staff refused to bring them based on the chef's claim that the recipe is "intellectual property" and would not be altered. This despite altering other dishes as needed for our vegetarian guests. Would not recommend - the attitude toward this normal request was extremely condescending and pretentious.
author: Hunter O.

description: Not sure what is the hype. I would say overpriced items for the quality and service experience, but typical prices for the SF area. Ribeye had a lot of fat they could have done a better job while cooking it. Dressing had an overpowering taste that ruined the freshness of the rest of the salad ingredients. Service was ok and on time, but the server could work on his personable skills. They don't explain the menu, the items, they don't ask if it is your first time at the location. Just took the order and that was all. They have room for improvement to make a memorable experience on dinner...
author: Marion B.

description: I always pass this place on my way to my friends apartment in SOMA because it is literally right next door.  I love how every time I walk by the atmosphere and the dim lights makes it look inviting, warm, fuzzy and little bit fancy inside haha. We tried the pea pancakes which were different but so fun yum. Also got the burger. I was busy wrapped up in conversation with Elaine..but I remember the burger being pretty good. We sat at the bar because we were a walk in, next time I come I would want to sit at a table to soak up the ambiance. Coming again to try their cocktails, Brussels sprout chips, bone marrow. Will come again!
author: Kristin C.

description: I would normally most definitely give Marlow a higher star rating except for two things that bring it down from a 4 star. Our dishes, the polenta, black cod, pork chop, brussel sprout chips and  burrata were all pretty nice. They would have been exceptional however all of us agreed that our main dishes were just a little on the salty side. Not horribly but enough that we all commented that they would have been better had the salt been held back a bit. The one other thing that brought my star rating for Marlow was that after making a reservation more than a week in advance the table they had set aside for us a party of 3 was the worst table in the house. Next to the bathroom and waiters hallway. I could have said something but resisted as we had a guest with us from Europe and I didn't wish to make a fuss. We gave him the seat which I thought he wouldn't notice our location however after dinner he mentioned how awful he thought it was they gave us that table. For that I am giving one less star. Our cocktails were exceptional! The service was great too.
author: Steven B.

description: Have been in search for a really great burger, and we finally found it at Marlowe's. We got seating at the bar as we didn't have a reservation. But that was just fine, I especially like to see bartenders at work. The bartender at Marlowe was especially good at service. She made suggestions when we asked, offered extra bread, and importantly, made great drinks. Other than the burger we also ordered the bone marrow and Brussel sprout chips (appetizer). Both were great, but the bone marrow, in all its fatty goodness, was absolutely drool inducing.
author: Seema K.

description:
Marlowe takes your Grandmama's meals and slaps them upside the head with a a healthy dose of culinary creativity.

Marlowe, my friend, you are getting a big ol' pat on the back for what might have been one of the best pork chop experiences of my life.

Do you usually order a pork chop? I don't. My mind makes them out to be boring and tough. Not Marlowe though, they work their magic on this under rated slab of pig meat, load it up with blood sausage, pumpkin pudding and maple apples and turn it into something exciting and review worthy!

How many times did granny have to yell at you to eat your brussels sprouts? You won't need to be told twice at Marlowe. You'll down them all as soon as they hit the table. The things are so damn delish.

It's tight in there! Get up to go to the bathroom and you might find yourself playing a game of pacman with the servers trying to find a way around them to get to your seat since there's probably no chance of squeezing past. The sight lines when you're sitting with a group can be a little awkward, but hey, them's the breaks.
author: Dale E.

description:
I am not a Yelper. I read. I do not post. But this place compels me to say great things about it. And so, dear reader, I will. 

My friend and I were in the strange time between the end of a conference and the flight out from SFO--too long to head to the airport and too short to do much of anything outside of eating. 

We had our roll-y bags and looks of desperation as we stumbled into Marlowe that night. Greeted by the warmest of humans, Georgia, she graciously told us that there would be a bit of a wait (understandably, as the place was adorable and completely packed). My companion and I sighed inwardly, ready to eat our own limbs to stave off the hunger. I don't know if Georgia has a sixth sense about hungry humans, or if she is just naturally that beautiful (inside and out), but she slyly figured out a way to stow our bags, whisk us to a table, and smile as if it wasn't any big deal in the whole 5 minutes of our interaction.

Victory has never been sweeter. 

The drinks were divine. The food was outstanding. And the atmosphere was exactly what we needed. 

Thank you, Georgia and Marlowe. I will be back-hopefully with reservations - to properly thank you and enjoy all you have to offer all over again.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Lunch at Marlowe was enjoyable despite a few off-putting aspects.  Good overall but every good point seemed to have a balancing counterpoint.

The interior is airy and bright and I like the decor.  So it should've been relaxing except that the tables are too close together.  There were only about six inches  between ours and the next.  I imagine it'd be especially awkward if you were there on a dinner date.  Having just one less table in each long row would give everyone a little more breathing room without sacrificing too much business.

The food was good.  The shrimp roll was tasty and the shrimp itself was just firm enough.  I also liked the horseradish aioli that came with my fries.  I stole a brussels sprout chip from my lunch buddy and even though I don't like brussels sprouts, I could see myself eating more of these.  I didn't feel like we got our money's worth, though.  I've either had better or cheaper elsewhere in the City.

I didn't order the burger since I'm saving that for a visit to nearby Marlowe Burger.  I saw a lot of burgers ordered by other customers.  That's a good sign.  I can't yet bring myself to pay $16 for a burger, though.  It just feels wrong.

Service was speedy and friendly: seated right away, got drinks and ordered within minutes.  Our server was really helpful and responsive to our questions.  The food came out surprisingly fast.  The flipside was that my plate was almost taken away with half my fries.  Whoa, whoa, woe unto anyone who gets between me and fried potato product!

Yeah, to look at me you'd probably assume correctly that I could do with fewer fries but how else would I maintain my huggable softness?
author: Tin N.

description:
The BEST burger. EVER... 

That's all I have to say; that's all that needs to be said.  Lol

Great place! Prob my fav in SF. Great menu but 4x I've been there and haven't gotten anything else than the burger for main entree.  Baked oysters are okay but sprouts and brocilinni were great. 

Excellent cocktails. Staff is super cool and sit at the bar, scenery is better and helps the drink choices/orders as the bartenders are super cool and willing to help. 

The burger: just enough in size that you dont feel overstuffed from eating a burger but the meat is so tender you don't think you're eating beef. So good and flavorful. And great fries; just well done all around. My test for a good burger is when you cut into it, the juice and fat spill out. This burger never disappoints. You won't be, either.
author: Anthony H.

description: Nice ambience. Food is meh. Service depends on your server. Pricey so you're mainly paying for the decor and atmosphere
author: Sharon Y.

description: We had a delightful dinner here last night and let the waitress guide us. We started off with cocktails that you recommended and they were fabulous. They had a Manhattan special and a grapefruit drink that we would not have normally ordered.we had an appetizer or two that she also recommended and they were really delicious and fun. One was the Barata cheese and the other was a warm develled egg. Our main courses were very tasty and the atmosphere was fun and lively.
author: david m.

description:
Awesome Brunch!!!! Everything tastes familiar but unique, opposite of boring. 
I loved the kale/brussel sprout salad with a poached egg.  The kale is roasted and adds a smokey flavor to the salad, all mixed with a runny egg - doesn't taste like a salad anymore, delicious.   Very crisp and clean inside, white and grayish color scheme.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner here the other night.  Couldn't find much to dislike here.  I wanted to come back as soon as I left, and needless to say I will be back.

We arrived about 45 minutes early for our reservation.  We were greeted by the hostess who informed us that all tables were currently spoken for...she was apologetic and invited us to have a drink at the bar.  No problem at all - we knew we were way early and half expected to have to wait.  We ordered our drinks at the bar, and even before getting the drinks the hostess let us know one of her tables opened up and that we could be seated right away - great news because we were starving!

We ordered: brussels sprout chips, baked oysters, bone marrow, and black cod for her entree and polenta for mine.  I'm fairly certain you can see all of these in the pictures here - all were delicious and were healthy in portion size.  I could say a lot more in detail, but frankly, I think it suffices to say that everything was amazing and I couldn't find fault with any of the food.

Service was very prompt, attentive, and friendly.  The venue was about the only thing I might complain about, and it's a minor complaint at that.  This place is very small - probably only seats 30-40 people for dining with a handful of bar stools at the bar.  The fact that there isn't much space means that you are often very cozy with your neighbors whether you want to be or not.  Such is life in SF restaurants, I guess.  Again - no big deal, it's just the only bad thing I could think of.

Overall, this was a fantastic experience.  We got 3 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 3 drinks for $118 before tip.  Decide not to have drinks and we paid $80 for the food.  Not bad at all when you consider both the portions and the quality of the food/ingredients.  Service was top notch.  Love this place.  It has become one of my favorites after only one visit.
author: Brent T.

description:
What we ordered: deviled egg (good but not great)
                              burrata toast (very good and flavorful)
                              brussel sprout chips (nice little snack)
                              little gem salad (AWESOME)
                              Scallops (Fantastic)
                              Strawberry shortcake (we should have ordered two)

I could not have been happier with my experience this past weekend at Marlowe.  The service was wonderful and not rushed at all! We sat there for close to two hours and our waiter never pushed the typical "you ready for the check (so basically I can move you a long)".  They even gave us complimentary dessert wine.  Excellent service!
author: Amanda P.

description:
Opening:  Pleasant surprise.  Looking for an after-matinee- theater spot, so got to Marlowe at 4:45PM - half full with late afternoon eaters - obviously says something good.  They have a proper bar - everything bar-made, fresh fruit, tons of choices - even asked if I wanted my manhattan with bourbon or rye.

Space:  small spot; very much appreciated when making the reservation the hostess said our table was "near the bar" not the windows.  But space is so small does not matter.

Food:  C'mon.  Really solid and yummy.  Like the bites to appetizers to mains, and the sizes were perfect.  Brussels sprouts leaves, deviled eggs and pea pancaks with salmon and creme freche.  Burgers all around.  Then pretzel bites with peanut butter and dark chocolate and chocolate mousse cake.  Great dinner.

Not that expensive.  Not that loud.  Great service.  Yup..go to place.
author: Colloton R.

description:
Went here before a bachelorette night on the town. Yelp lists this place as $$, but I would definitely give it $$$. The place itself is cozy and the service is good. I wasn't overwhelmed by a unique ambiance or stellar service, but, like I said, it was good. Five of us went here for my best friend's bach party and personally I was a little disappointed they didn't give her a complimentary drink or small dessert. They knew why we were there, but I guess they have a lot of special occasions; however, when you have a $400 bill, it's nice to get some special attention for the guest of honor.
 
Now, on to the food. For the appetizers: portions small, taste BIG (hence, the 4 stars). Amazing decadent, rich flavors abounded. The five of us shared 4 appetizers- a salad, the (small) crap crepes, burrata toast, and Brussel crisps (just the outside leaves flash fried). The flavors of all of them, even the simple salad, were extraordinary. However, everyone's favorite seemed to be the burrata toast. The portion was slightly larger than other starters, which was nice for sharing, but the dish itself was just exquisite and flavorful. I would also get the crab crepes again (they were small, but special). I'd skip the Brussels and salad- you can get great Brussels sprouts and quality salads a lot of places.
 
For an entrée I ordered the scallops with white beans. They were good, but slightly overcooked, and I wasn't wowed by the overall flavor pairing with the white beans (a bit bland). Both of the people who had the steak entrée had small issues too- the medium was undercooked (pink meat) and the medium rare was overcooked (no pink meat). Most likely, they got switched. I wouldn't get the scallops again, but I was happy to try them once.
 
The cuchilla tequila cocktail was lovely. Great drink for tequila lovers!

Overall, we really enjoyed our time here; however, I would try some place else before coming back. I REALLY wanted to love it, but the hands-off service approach coupled with the high price tag and non-stellar entrees made it a pre-dinner appetizers/cocktails place to me. Thanks Marlowe, but next time, I'm going somewhere else...
author: Christine F.

description:
Food: 4 stars. 
-The Baker: really refreshing cocktail, the grapefruit was great.
-French toast soldiers: super cute french toast sticks to dip in either a coffee cream or chocolate dip- I loved that neither dips were too sweet. 
-Marlowe burger: amazing! I loved the fries and the burger was cooked perfectly. 

Service: 1 star. 
We made a reservation for 11:30 bc we knew it would be busy from game day/marathon. Headed in, got seated, and Laura was really attentive at first. We ordered a drink, appetizer, and our burgers. 20 minutes pass by, and our appetizer is served but the drink is nowhere to be found. Everyone around us who came in after us already had their drinks. When we asked her where it was, she said "oh, you ordered one? I didn't hear you." Uhh yes, we did for sure because you confirmed "okay, one baker" and then after, we joked about how we could report you because you didn't card us. After that, she was nowhere to be found. Different people brought out our appetizer, our drink (eventually, 30 min after we sat down), our entrees, and our check. Jake cleared our table and took our check away as well. She never once filled my water, asked how we were doing, or checked on our food for us. We saw her attending to literally everybody else but us- asking how their food was, if they needed anything, filling up waters, etc. She did not acknowledge us as she walked by, even though she made eye contact and saw my empty water glass, our empty plates, and my wallet out and ready to pay. 

I loved my food but honestly got so annoyed with her that I won't be coming back.
author: Shelley K.

description: Just go here and order anything you won't regret it. First we made reservations but for the wrong day, woops! Well they sat us within minutes. The tables are close but that is fine by me. We shared an awesome bottle of wine, some bites, dinner and a not tooooo sweet dessert. I has the polenta and it was the best thing I have had in a long time. I'm currently trying to plan my next visit to this very yummy restaurant. Worth a wait if you have to and if you are lucky like us and get in fast then high five and have fun eating some good grub.
author: Ryan P.

description: Very SF clean ambience. Great lunch place. Love the devil eggs, bone marrow. Burger is great. Price to value not quite there for me. Solid pick
author: Christopher K.

description:
Disclaimer: I didn't eat here.

The reason we chose to finish our drinks and leave was the incredibly rude staff.  There was a redhead waiter who seemed like a total angel but the other wait staff was extremely rude.  We were given a table sandwiched between a pillar and a group when there were other open tables.  I went to use the bathroom and I felt super uncomfortable because a waiter acted annoyed because he needed to clean it and he hovered outside the door while I went.  I felt super unwelcome in this restaurant and would not go back.  

The decor is pretty tacky, definitely trying too hard.  Looks like it's out of an ikea magazine, not an authentic vibe at all.
author: Camille T.

description:
Definitely a cute date spot or a great hang out place to catch up with a good friend. Place was packed when we arrived..good thing r had a reservation!... and it was nice and cozy inside. A little too cozy...I felt like I knew the people sitting next to us wayy to well from their conversations. I want intentionally trying to listen but then were just that close that I heard everything. And it was hard to get out off the booths. I felt like I was trapped and couldn't get out. Besides that the good was really good.
Started off with the bone marrow. Perfectly made and really straight forward. Really can't mess up bone marrow? Maybe I've been lucky but really good start.
I got the poultry "vert". Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. It was the perfect portion. Wasn't very fond of the veggies that it came with but it gave it nice flavor.
I didn't have the marlowe burger but from what I saw it was cooked to order which is always nice. Not very fond of the bun which I did try...
Closed off the night with dessert. Loretta. It woke me up and gave it a great closing statement to Marlowes. The meringue was good but what really topped it off was the almonds. It really brought out the coffee I've cream.
Thank you for a great evening.
author: Fanny C.

description:
What a good place this is...

We looking for that a relaxing meal set off by good food and wine after a long flight. This place delivered admirably.

A glass each of Pinot Grigio and a Grenache Syrah set the night off very nicely. We had the Grilled Niman Pork chop and the Chicken special....simply, they were better than we could have wished for, and in the middle of the table we shared the brown butter brussel sprouts..so good!

Lovely people, a tad noisey but then nothing is perfect....a great experience.
author: Mick A.

description: Had a business meeting in the area, and needed lunch.  Thanks to Yelp found this restaurant, and popped in.  Efficient service, food was very good!  I had a grilled rib eye steak salad with greens, asparagus, and a very nice, salty cheese.  Perfectly dressed, meat was perfect.  Really superior salad.  I would definitely come back to try the other food ... the burger looked great, and everyone seemed to be eating it except for me.
author: Frank W.

description:
I tried this place for the first time yesterday, and I came here solely for the Marlowe burger. Considering my love for burgers and what I've read on Thrillst, I had to make a point to come here. 

I came in around 2 so that there was no large crowds, and the place is smaller than I thought. It is a very intimate space though, and trendy as well. Seems like a great place for a date or a business lunch. 

My waitress was very friendly and attentive. She checked on me to make sure things were well, and kept my water glass full. I waited about 7 minutes or so until my burger came out. Not bad. 

Overall, the burger is a reasonable size that will leave you satisfied with your meal. Why of course I ordered the patty to be medium rare. That's the way to go when it comes to burgers. I enjoyed the taste of each bite, with the bacon nicely placed into each bite. The horseradish aioli also makes a great spread on the burger.

I actually liked the fries a lot. Out of the premium burgers I have had (Mission Bowling Club, Cavalier), Marlowe has the best fries to come with the burger. It has some great seasoning to it, and the amount of fries are just right. 

I cannot say its THE best burger I have had in the city, but I'd say its a darn good burger worth trying! The price went up to $16, which is a little bit pricier than Cavalier's or MBC's, but I'd say that's fair. 

Delicious burger, but it's time to give Blue Stem and NOPA a shot! I'd come back here though.
author: Loren John B.

description:
Just ok. Didn't blow me away...I expected more from the average 4 star rating but found it lacking. The burger was pretty nondescript (the bun especially wasn't fantastic...a brioche bun would have been awesome instead), even though they claimed it was one of their best dishes. The Poulet Vert was good though, and the beef tartare and deviled eggs were also good. 

Service was friendly, albeit slow.
author: Joyce Y.

description:
Small cozy restaurant located directly across from the SF Caltrain station.  We came here on a double date. Pro-tip: This is a great way to feel out how socially savvy (or inept) your date is in a group and let your friends meet a potential SO.  I find myself getting bored with insignificant others these days. Very little reward in that type of interaction. 

We arrived ahead of our reservation as the server/hostess told us she might be able to seat us earlier.  We could not be seated earlier, but enjoyed some nice drinks by the entrance and then by the bar.  The space is quite small, so get ready to be cozy.

Upon being seated at the long communal table (and acquiring one additional diner to our group from a lady who was by herself) we were delighted at menu.  Our appetizers included:
Brussels sprout chips: Salty, crispy and with a citrus punch. 
Deviled eggs: Mine was sans bacon and quite good. 
Burrata with endive salad: I didn't see any huckleberries, but this was a nice palette cleanser after the other heavier items. 
Steak Tartar: I didn't eat any, but my fellow dinner companions enjoyed it. 
Steamed Mussels: I didn't eat any because it came with bacon. 
Roasted Bone Marrow: Incredible!
Spiced Gulf Shrimp: Very tasty alone. Others like the "boozy sauce". 
Duck Liver Toast: This was the least favorite on the left side of the menu

Main course: 
Polenta: One of the most creamy and smooth polentas I've ever had. Fabulous comfort food! Farm egg was delightful.
Petrale Sole: Flaky and nuanced. Very good
Brown Butter Brussels Sprouts: Tongue twister aside, this made our mouths very happy. 
Smokey Baked Cauliflower: Like a healthier version of Mac and Cheese. 

Marlowe is definitely a great find in SOMA.
author: Zak R.

description:
I usually go to Victory Hall and Parlor/Little Skillet when I miss my Caltrain.  After reading about Marlowe having one of the top burgers in the City, well, I had a hour and some change to order my dinner and literally take ten steps to my train.  

It was a Monday night after 7:30pm and the place was absolutely rammed and packed.  You know the scene of nice restaurants that are usually less than packed on weeknights when it's "slower"?  Not at Marlowe.  This place was operating at full capacity with a hectic and frenzied dining room environment.  

I had to wait even for a single stool to be open at the bar area.  Once I sat there, the main order expeditor guy was busily doing this thing in front of the food delivery area while he also tried to take orders for us at the bar.  While I had his brief attention, I asked him for a burger and a bottled beer.

For anyone who hasn't been here, the place is pretty dark inside.  It's so dark that you can't even see your food clearly that sits right in front of you.  When I got my burger, I could not even fully see all the ingredients in my burger.  I'm not saying that this was like "dining in the dark" restaurants but it certainly felt a little bit like that.

My burger and beer were great!  I can't complain about tasty food and it is a $16 burger and fries but it was definitely delicious and worth trying.  I'm not sure if my experience at the bar is different from those parties seated at the tables but I just didn't get any sort of welcome from this place.  Yes they have a lot of tasty delicious things on their menu but sitting at the bar, there's really nobody who talks to you to check on you unless you grab their attention because you need something.  

I sincerely wish and hope for the best for Marlowe as they move from their Townsend location to 4th and Brannan.  My only advice is that I hope that your bar guests get as much attention as your seated guests.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Enjoyed a great meal and wonderful service for a Saturday dinner at Marlowe. Reservations seem to be a Saturday must since the restaurant was packed from 6pm to 9 when we left. This is a great place for a date or dinner with friends.
