description: Went there for brunch on a Sunday. What an amazing find! We ordered the candied bacon and french toast soldiers as appetizers. They were both really good. The french toast soldiers chocolate dipping sauce was a great change of pace. We had the crispy chicken sandwich and the burger. The chicken sandwich is a MUST get if you go there. The waitress suggested the burger and I went with it. It was good, but not amazing. It's the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. Definitely would go back without hesitation!!!
author: Paul H.

description:
Had a good brunch with a group of 4 at Marlowe.

We ordered some deviled eggs, some drinks, 2 burgers, 1 tomato baked eggs, 1 burratta and bacon dish. 
The burger and fries were good. The cheese was sharp, the buns were soft but didnt get soggy, the meat was cooked nicely at medium rare.
The tomato baked eggs were..ok, nothing too mind blowing.

The burratta and bacon dish was a piece of bread, a thick slice of pork belly, dashes of burratta and some greens. It was definitely good, but very hard to eat.

Overall, it was a good experience, but the bill was about $140, and I honestly expect a better meal for that price. Definitely will be back to try some of the other dishes that are recommended by other yelpers.
author: Ronny D.

description:
When this place first opened, I was excited to check it out! So I went in there after work one day to check it out.  I was seated at the bar, but after 15 minutes no one ever came around to take my order. The entire staff seemed like they were in their own world. So I decided to leave....

They were pretty packed that day so recently I decided to give it another try.  The same thing happened!  I walked out for the second and final time!

I decided to give them a pass the first time, but the second time??  Come on people!!

I wonder if it has something to do with going solo both of these times?  But doesn't every customer matter??

The sad part of all this is that I been here twice and still haven't tried the food!!

I never been to a restaurant in my life where I was never tended to until now!!

I hope they take care of this problem soon for their own sake.
author: Norbert D.

description:
Stopped by here for lunch one day with a friend. We did not have a reservation, didn't realize that we needed one for lunch, so we ended up sitting at the bar.

To share we ordered the brussel sprout chips. The chips were super tasty. Covered in salt and lemon and cooked to perfection. 

For lunch I had the fried chicken sandwich. It was served with a caeser aioli, bacon, and field greens. This was a slightly fancier fried chicken sandwich than I am used to, and I liked it. A lot. 

I will be back to Marlowe, but I will make sure I have reservations first.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Just OK for what they charge. The staff was also just Ok. I was expecting more from the hype. The gentrification that occurred in the area had me expecting much more than I experienced.
author: Dr. Col C.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Friday and boy was it crowded.  Definitely come before noon if you don't want to wait for a table.

I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, and it was quite tasty.  My lunch buddy ordered a burger and said it was divine.  The sandwich comes with a choice of side salad or fries.  

Street parking is easy, as long as there is nothing going on at the ballpark.
author: Jack L.

description: Very good food. Awesome atmosphere.  What can I say?  TN is was worth the wait and worth the money i paid. The staff was wonderful!
author: Pastor-GAvery W.

description: Fantastic burgers! So juicy and tasty. Best burger I have had in a long time. Will definetly go back for more.
author: Sepas K.

description: Nice ambience and decor. Excellent service also but unfortunately what was in our plate was deceiving..Food is too simple for the price and it miss the refining.. good wine though!
author: Proulx C.

description: Always enjoy eating here when I'm SF. Off the beaten path with excellent food, drinks and ambiance. It can get loud but the food is worth it
author: John M.

description:
I'll skip the foreplay and get right down to the point...yes, yes, yes, the Marlowe Burger lives up to the hype.  I won't argue with folks like Michael Bauer and yelp reviewers who rave about the Marlowe Burger as the best in San Francisco.  More on the burger after these messages...

Before I continue, I can't overlook the fries.  I don't recall having better  fries elsewhere.  The thin cut fries were perfectly fried and stayed warm and crispy throughout the entire meal, plus they were flavorful, with a hint of garlic flavor and just enough salt to make the taste alive.  My only qualm is that they don't give you nearly enough fries with the burger.  Mine had less than a handful.  Puh-leaze folks, it's a $13 burger, you can't add a few more fries? 

By the way, I hate brussel sprouts with a passion - hated em since I was a kid.  So a restaurant that successfully feeds me these bastardly little critters deserves seriously big ups in my book.  Granted, they did it by stripping the brussel sprouts of all nutritional value and by deep frying them to a crisp, and squeezing lemon and adding sea salt.  In other words, Marlowe made brussel sprouts edible.  I highly recommend this appetizer.

The only dish that fell short for me was the roasted bone marrow.  I know, I know...sacrilegious to say that since the bone marrow seems universally loved.  I just thought it was 99% bone, 1% marrow, and 100% eleven dollars.  What little I got was delicious, but the flavor comes more from the salsa verde on the side.  

Okay, back to the Marlowe burger (sorry, no pics, my camera ran out of batteries).  It's the kind of burger that will make you close your eyes at the first bite.  The grilled burger patty is infused with lamb meat for the earthy and bold taste, and with that, you can hardly go wrong with horseradish aioli, bacon, cheddar cheese, and caramelized onions.  To wit, Marlowe first masters the basics with ground beef packed perfectly, grilled to perfection, and tender, juicy, moist, then they innovate things.  Best in SF in my book?  I don't know yet, but I seem to leaning that way.

My criticisms about Marlowe, save a few, have nothing to do with the food.  It's a small and very popular place, which means you're eating in close proximity to others, plus it can get pretty loud.  The lady next to me kept looking at us and made me feel like she was listening in on our conversation (can't blame her since our conversation was more interesting than hers)...plus she had this judgmental look because I was taking pictures of my food.  Lucky for us, I couldn't care less.  Also, what's with the "bread served upon request" as a fine print on the corner of the menu?   Can you just serve the bread without having to be asked?

These are qualms that do not warrant a downgrade in my rating, but factors to consider nonetheless.  Other than that, service was nothing short of excellent.  Our server was attentive but not intrusive.  I can see why Christine C. has about two million check ins here.  Marlowe burger, we shall meat again.
author: Angel S.

description:
Marlowe sounds like the name of a retro-40's era fern bar with Bogie flipping a coin waiting for his baby to whistle. OK, I mixed up my Warner Bros classics, but it doesn't matter since it turns out to be the name of owner Anna Weinberg's great-grandfather's butcher shop in Boston. The decor is classic SoMa - dark lighting amid industrial chic touches and uncommonly small for its across-the-tracks warehouse office building setting. It's a loudish, California-style bistro with one long communal table and a few smaller ones surrounding it. Space is definitely at a premium here. 

I was immediately drawn to the 3 B's on the menu - the burger, the bone marrow and the Brussels sprout chips. Yes, the $6 Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips are an intriguing starter doused with Meyer lemon and sea salt (see photo). Even if the flavor was somewhat negligible, I liked the lightly crisp texture even if the oil residue on the butcher paper was rather concerning. Next up was the $11 Roasted Bone Marrow with Salsa Verde and Fine Herbs, an acquired taste I agree, but that's what I always try to suck up when I get a good lamb shank.

Two big bone cavities filled with greasy goodness were served in a scorching hot cast-iron tray and accompanied with toasted, buttered wedges and a minced salsa (see photo). Liked it even if it did taste like I was eating gristle. The $13 Marlowe Burger was the clincher though. It's a well-executed burger with a taste of lamb on a toasted Acme bun slathered with a horseradish aioli. Melted cheddar, shredded lettuce and a couple of thick-cut bacon strips complete the mix (see photo).

The bun was a little burnt on the edges, but the quality of the meat definitely puts this one a cut above similarly priced burgers. It came with steaming hot fries with more aioli for dipping. We were bummed that they were out of the Upside Down Pear Crisp, so we decided to end the meal with the TCHO Chocolate Cream Pie in a Jar, a sweet-mousse concoction sprinkled with cocoa nibs (see photo). The place was crowding up as we ate, but it never got too overwhelming. Now that I've done the burger, I can graduate to the adult food next time.

FOOD - 4 stars...good urban burger worth a bite and some interesting appetizers to start
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...dark and compact but space is well thought out considering 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...officious 
TOTAL - 4 stars...will need to try something beyond the burger to get my Marlowe mojo up a notch
author: Ed U.

description:
SO TRENDY. 

My friend and I tried to get in here for dinner but didn't want to wait the 40+ minutes so we went elsewhere, then came back here for a post-dinner snack. That's normal right?? We had the brussels sprouts chips and the chocolate pie dessert in the mason jar. Both were good. I'm not dying to go back but they had other appealing things on the menu so I may go back.

The brussels were flaky and crispy.  The tcho chocolate pie was so so so so sweeeeet!!! My word I had to take the tiniest bites to handle it.  But it was great. Glad we shared it because it would have been way to sweet for just me. 

Service was fine. 

I wouldn't recommend coming without a reservation, which I think you need a couple of weeks in advance to secure an actual table.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
South shut it's doors last year and the replacement is going anywhere but South. (sorry, I just had to do it!)

Marlowe has that great neighborhood restaurant feel and almost has the right ambiance for a date place. Except it gets too loud in here. 

Don't miss the daily specials written on a long butcher paper hanging on the wall. We tried the their bite-sized duck liver crostini with grapes and it was fabulous!

Since everyone and their mama has been talking about the burger, ordering was an easy choice for me.  I requested mine sans bacon (I know, who does that?!?) I wanted to be able to fully taste the flavor of the beef/lamp patty without the enhancement of the bacon. Also, you'll probably kill me for this but knowing that this wasn't grass fed beef I'm eating, I ordered my burger medium well. It was cooked as I requested and even at this state my burger wasn't dry. The Acme bun however was too soft for me because I'm used to the toasted bun version. But the horseradish aioli and caramelized onion combination works. While I thought this was a good burger, my praise goes to the french fries. It was perfection. Thin, crispy and well salted with just the right sprinkling of herbs, it's definitely on my top ten list.

Other fantastic dishes include the wild mushroom polenta, roasted bone marrow and ribeye. The TCHO chocolate pot de creme should be your only choice for dessert, especially if you're into the chocolate/sea salt combination.

Service was middle of the road but the kitchen did a great job of pacing the dishes.  Servings are just right for one person and the prices are fair for the quality you get. We enjoyed our dinner here and the menu is enticing enough to have me come back a second time.
author: Janice C.

description: A friend was raving about it so that she decided to bring me here when I came to SF for a business trip. It's pretty good especially the bone marrow appetizer.  I had the rib eye and that was cooked precisely how I ordered-between rare and well done. Definitely next time I am back to the City, I will come back.
author: Chris J.

description:
Came here with my wife, mother-in-law, and cousin-in-law and had a great meal.  The fried brussel sprout leaves were very good, and the bone marrow was excellent.  If you've never had bone marrow, just a warning that it may not be up your alley.  However, if you do like it, this was excellent with the salsa verde and cilantro to top it off.  The flavors blended well together.  I also got the burger, which was very good, but nothing super special.  Maybe a little salty?  The truffle fries were very good.  Oh, and we split the 3 desserts.  The chocolate, vanilla, and apple crisp pots were all very good.  Out of the three, I surprisingly liked the apple crisp the best, which is strange for me since I always gravitate towards chocolate or vanilla desserts.

All in all, a very good place.  I'll gladly come back whenever we visit SF since my mother-in-law lives 2 blocks away.
author: Fernando A.

description: Came here for our one year wedding anniversary. The atmosphere is very welcoming and comfortable. The food was incredible. I had the tomato soup and polenta, and my husband had the steak tartare and pork chop. The meal was fantastic and the service was spot on. Will definitely be back to try some of the small bites!
author: Lindsay J.

description:
Really nice and very good! Met a friend for brunch, just how  I like it it... simple menu but very good flavors. Server was on point, she was upbeat, suggestive but not pushy and paid close attention to our needs. 

I would for sure go back for brunch and dying to try Marlow for dinner!
author: Brook M.

description:
Pros: great service- attentive, helpful, professional.  The space is quite pleasant; warm and comforting,  I like the way they write the specials on a sheet of hanging butcher paper- it's clever and a nice touch.

Cons: food is Over-Rated (clap clap clapclapclap).  Brussel sprout chips are interesting, but after the Mister and I had a few of them each we were over it.  The burger, supposed to be the 'best in SF',  is good, but not fantastic. We shared a dessert, and I chose some chocolate-coffee thing that tasted like those malted milk balls the cheap people used to give out at Halloween.  Not so good.  (The Mister still hasn't let me forget it.) And it ain't cheap- shared app, 2 burgers, 2 drinks each, shared dessert: $100 + tax + tip, so $130 out the door.   

My suggestion: go there to check it out and explore the space.  ("Really explore the space, baby".)  Have the burger so you can cross it off the list, and move on....
author: Catherine F.

description: Came here for lunch with girlfriends on a Sunday. We had reservations so we were immediately seated. The tables are a little crammed together, but considering the space is pretty small, you have to work with it. The food is phenomenal, literally. I ordered a deviled egg as an appetizer, and the crab stuffed crepes topped with a mixed green salad, which was exceptional. The kale Caesar salad is TO DIE FOR. I was absolutely impressed with the menu. I highly recommend this to anyone who is adventurous with their food, and wiling to share plates with their group to really benefit from the tasting the menu.
author: Karina P.

description: Went in for a random visit for lunch.  Really nice bartender who kept the kitchen open so we could order our late lunch.   Yummy chicken sandwich.
author: Brian W.

description:
REAL RATING: 3.5 stars

My girlfriend and I went to Marlowe for the first time this past Saturday for our anniversary. No, we never dined at their old location. Yes, I was a little skeptical seeing the dip in approval after Marlowe relocated. However, we still had to go. 

SERVICE: Excellent. No complaints at all. A+ in this department. 

CRISPY BRUSSELS SPROUT CHIPS ~ 3 stars: Yeah, these were good. But there's no way to justify a $9-bowl of brussels sprout leaves. And I'm talking about a small bowl. Maybe the size of a medium coffee cup. I wouldn't get these again. 

MUSHROOM SOUP ~ 5 stars: This might have been the best thing we had all night. Seasoning was on-point. The texture was creamy but not too heavy, it did a great job coating your tongue and giving you a cozy feeling. This soup was excellent all the way around. I can't think of one thing that could have made it better... maybe a little bit of bacon. ;) 

STEAK TARTARE ~ 4 stars: Often times places will either over or under season their tartare. But not Marlowe. Just enough mustardy flavor mixed with a little bit of zest. The quail egg really mellows everything out and gives it a velvety texture. 

MARLOWE BURGER ~ 3 stars: A bit disappointing. So many people crowned this the best burger in SF. However, I didn't think it was anything special. Don't get me wrong, the flavor was good. The burger held up well. But it doesn't deserve the title as the best. Honestly, the burger I had at The Corner Store for brunch the next day was light years better than Marlowe's. 

GRILLED NIMAN PORK CHOP ~ 4 stars: No joke, this was probably the most perfectly cooked pork chop I've ever had. It was moist, tender, melted in our mouths. However, it was pretty under seasoned. Shame on Marlowe for allowing this to happen. It was just a couple pinches of salt away from being complete nirvana. But I'll still give it 4 stars for the masterful job they did on grilling and cooking it. 

MEYER LEMON CREME BRULEE ~ 3.5 stars: It totally tastes like meyer lemons. The curd is creamy and silky. I'm not a fan of desserts so don't take my 3.5-star rating too seriously. I could have done without it. Oh! I have to give mad props to Marlowe for comping us dessert. They knew it was our anniversary so it was their gift to us. Nice little touch! 

One thing that really struck me about Marlowe was how inexpensive their menu items are. I was a bit shocked that we only ran up a $105 tab. Ok fine, make it like $113 if you count the comped dessert. However, for two apps, one soup, two entrees and one dessert, $113 pre-tip isn't bad at all. That made me feel a little better about the somewhat disappointing meal. I'm not saying Marlowe is cheap by any standards and I don't want to sound like I wipe my @ss with $100 bills but for what Marlowe is, their prices are very reasonable.
author: Bruce C.

description:
Went here for a (surprise) engagement shower for one of my best friends in San Francisco! 

Such a decor dream, with its Pinterest-like interior. I wish I could decorate my apartment the same way. The food - although via limited menu choices - was pretty good. I ordered the Marlowe burger, and I enjoyed every bite. 

The service was amazing for our group! I had read previous reviews about iffy servers, but ours was warm and accommodating. She even went the extra mile when she didn't mind taking all the pictures we wanted of our group of six and brought out the cupcakes for dessert, brought by the maid of honor. I must mention that she packed the leftover cupcakes with great care, which I really appreciate. 

My only qualm was that seating is terribly limited. Luckily, all of us girls didn't mind being pretty close to each other, but the same couldn't be said of everyone else. Other groups were elbowing our faces, and it felt really cramped. We also had a hard time hearing each other, as the restaurant is very loud. 

The verdict: Good to try at least once, good for groups, but the space issue should be addressed. Don't come here for a first date, but come during off hours! Which is basically anytime but dinner.
author: Dorothy G.

description: The polenta dish is amazing, and I didn't even know I could like polenta that much! The staff are so so friendly, I got there early to meet my friend and the hostesses and servers went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and taken care of! This place is awesome.
author: Steph K.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon to enjoy Brunch with my husband.  Thank goodness we had reservations because the place was very busy.  The food was amazing, Service was on point, and the ambiance was very warm and welcoming.  The food was so delicious that it had inspired the rest of our meal prep for that week. We will definitely be back the next time we are in the city.
author: Reyna M.

description:
Really enjoyed the ambiance here, esp. with the holiday decorations. Small, chill, yet cozy and warm.

The food was good, but consistently SALTY! Presentation was great and portions are decent - most stuff is share-able.

We ordered:
-Brussel spout chips: crispy, flavorful, great starter
-Bone marrow: you get 2 halves, not much marrow, was delish minus those salt sprinkles...
-Baked oysters: flavorful and new (for me). would recommend trying this.
-Burger: nothing particularly special, but most affordable entree. fries are good.
-Pork shop: shared this with a friend. actual meat was substantial and well-cooked. got an assortment of sides (spinach, pumpkin pudding, salty sausage balls - ours were charred and black!)

Soooo... at the end of the night, we were adequately satisfied and incredibly thirsty. The sodium content was just out of this world.
author: Suji C.

description:
Bone marrow! Enough said! I've been wanting to try this place and finally did by chance. We were originally going to another spot in the Mission but they called and said their power went out and couldn't accommodate us. I was a little bummed since it was for a girl that I was just starting to date and it was her birthday! So instead, we decided to try another place on Fillmore in the inner Richmond. Well that didn't work out either since it's so well-known and getting a table was impossible that night. Mind you, this was on a Tuesday night and raining. It was looking like this date didn't want to happen! She was cool about the whole thing and totally understood!  

We decided to keep it local and head back to SOMA and go to Marlowe. Glad we did! We ordered up a few dishes, specifically the brussel sprout chips and bone marrow and a few other small plates. Our waiter was great and gave him an extra good tip for taking care of us throughout the night. The wine selection was good and overall it was a great experience! 

I'd definitely come back again and try their burger. I hear its signature and a must try! As for the date? Well, it turned out great and after some courting, we're officially together!
author: Andrew S.

description: I reiterate my commitment to the Country Lawyer plus the burger plus the Brussels sprouts. Now the interior seems perfect. Evolution!!!
author: Laurel B.

description:
I love this place! My friends and I decided to come here too late to make reservations. The hostess was nice enough to find us space at the bar, however, and let us keep a stool open for our friend who wasn't able to join us until an hour after we arrived. What great service!

While we waited we took advantage of the extensive wine list and had the toasted pistachios and brussel sprout chips. Both were amazing! The pistachios were toasted with maple syrup and sea salt, and the brussel sprout chips were crispy with lemon flavoring. The two dishes went very quickly. 

For dinner we split several dishes. The baked oysters and burger were delicious! The duo of ahi tuna was alright - I didn't read the description very well and didn't realize there was cooked tuna in addition to the raw tuna. I'm not a huge fan of cooked tuna. 

For dessert we split the chocolate mousse and panna cotta - both were worth the calories!
author: Sungeeta A.

description:
Fantastically tasty and fresh food in a lovely atmosphere. Great place to take a date.

Also, the bartender is fantastic and charming, be sure to say hello. 

Get the Brussels sprouts and the burger!
author: Adam F.

description:
You know the whole Leeroy Jenkins meme? Where he goes rushing in headlong using his own name as a battle cry? "Leeeeeeeroy Jenkins!"

That's kinda how I feel about Marlowe's steak frites. "Steaaaaaaaaaaaak Frites!"
author: Robert M.

description:
Nice vibe at this small, off the beaten path, Aussie-themed resto-bar. I remember the ambiance more than the food, not to say that the food wasn't good, but the dim lighting, shared tables, and 80s music really did it for me. 

The hostess was super nice (or was it just that chipper Aussie accent?) and squeezed us in for a last-minute dinner rez. We felt a little left out because everyone was ordering the brussel spout chips and we went straight to entrees. This is definitely a place to sit and linger over wine and apps. 

If I worked in the area, this would be a great post-work cocktail spot. Feels like a neighborhood joint, small enough to feel noticed and taken care of.
author: Nique F.

description: Sunday night dinner, easy to get reservation via OpenTable. Seated quickly, great vibe and decor on inside. Really friendly and prompt service. Drinks a bit pricey but delicious. Burger was outstanding. The chicken main with sweet potato was disappointing--too sweet. Cookies for dessert were fine. 3 drinks, 1 app, 2 mains, 1 dessert = $115
author: A K.

description: There are a few places in SF that I feel are over-hyped. This is one of them. Service is OK. The food leaves way more to be desired, especially for the price. I ordered the sole - it smelled and tasted fishy, sour, and over-salted. I couldn't finish half my plate and had to box the rest but ended up throwing it away because I couldn't bring myself to eat it again. Would not return.
author: Wei W.

description: This is for the front of the house "Jose". Thanks so much for managing to get a table for us on such a short notice. We knew Marlowe would be busy on a Thursday night. We were a party of 4 that was going to go for the bar corner, but Jose managed to fit us in. On top of that the food was awesome and the service was great! Try the brussel sprouts chips its a 10/10. We will certainly be back.
author: Mek S.

description:
Marlowe is a solid restaurant run by a husband and wife dynamic duo. They serve contemporary "new american" faire with classic ingredients whipped up with a twist. 

Must try:
Brussel sprout chips - cooked perfectly where the veggies have a sweet torched coating on the edges. 

Bone Marrow - prepared very straight forward.

Pork chop - pretty good sized serving.. as tender and juicy as a pork chop could be.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
3.5 stars for this place, rounded up.

This place is awesome on the inside. Love the style, staff was friendly, and the people were generally hip and trendy. If you like that kind of thing.

Started with the steak tartare, and finished with the scallops. Tartare was good, not the best in the city (BIX), but certainly competitive. The scallops were really good, but pretty cold! Seems like maybe they were ready first, and they waited to bring them out while my friend's dinner finished cooking. The flavors were so good though, I would order them again and hope they come out right.

Generally would recommend to locals, but not to out of towners. Solid food and service, but there are better in city.
author: Sarah B.

description: I came here with couple of friends on a Saturday night. The wait was decent, we waited like 30 minutes or so.  The food was really good, I ordered the Marlowe burger and my favorite was the Brussels sprout chips.  We all loved our food.  The ambiance was nice and relax.  I would definitely come back.
author: Tracy T.

description: 4 stars? no way. I think people like the ambience but the food is just meh. I ordered their Grilled Asparagus, but it had chorizo on it which is basically cheating if your dish is called "Grilled Asparagus," Service was good and they were pretty attentive, but it won't bring it up to 4 stars. I would give it maybe 3.2 stars but it's not worth it for the price. Too many good places in the city to try so I won't go back.
author: Lo F.

description:
We were in SF visiting friends last weekend and were initially really excited to try Marlowe with our group of friends for an 8 pm dinner on Saturday.  It had been raining all day, so the restaurant was still buzzing but relatively quiet, and it was especially surprising that the  servers would be so sloppy in their service.  Unfortunately, this dinner was a disappointment at every turn.  

We started with a round of drinks and appetizers, but had to wait until well past 9 pm for our entrees to arrive.  By this point, we had already finished a second round of drinks and were starving and eager to be fed.  We were seated at the end of a long table by the bar.  To our immediate left, the couple working on dessert when we first sat down had already left and their seats were quickly replaced by a second couple who were already digging into their entrees.  Further down the table, a group of young women celebrating a birthday had arrived some time between our two rounds of drinks, and they were already done taking pictures of their food and were finishing up their entrees.  

Our confused server finally ran over close to 9:20 pm to announce that the kitchen had not forgotten about us and that the entrees should be out shortly but he "could not promise".  When the food finally came, we were already too tired and hungry to appreciate the entrees or to carry on with our conversations.  We didn't even have energy to eat because it was already close to 10 pm by the time the food arrived.   

The maître d'or lady who looked like an owner stopped by to tell us that dessert would be on the house, so we mustered our energy to order a few cakes and cookies with our server.  Thankfully the desserts arrived without too long of a wait.  Nevertheless, to make matters worse, instead of seizing this opportunity to make up for his poor service, our server completely forgot to hand us the pork chops we had asked to be packed.  

All in all, Marlowe was a huge disappointment.  We could have probably felt better had the service improved after the initial lapses, but the service only got worse as our sloppy server became increasingly absent minded.  I eat out all the time in New York and never felt the urge to post on Yelp until this experience.  Will NOT recommend this restaurant at all.
author: JJ C.

description:
Lively, cozy atmosphere, good service, and delicious food all around at Marlowe! 

GET. THE. BRUSSELS SPROUT CHIPS. I can almost guarantee you won't be disappointed and you will want a second helping! Think Pringles slogan: "Once you pop, you can't stop.". Simple ingredients of butter, lemon, and sea salt and ___???___ make these incredibly addicting. I tried to make them at home. Peeling the brussels sprout leaves was tedious. If I lived in San Fran, I would eat these all the time!

I rarely order burgers and when I do, I usually regret not getting something else on the menu. However, my eyes were directed towards some of my favorite fix-ins: bacon, cheddar, horseradish. And...I was craving my occasional dose of ground red meat. Needless to say, I ordered the Marlowe burger and was not one bit disappointed. The burger was cooked perfectly and tasted fantastic! The poulet vert was very juicy and beautifully seasoned--I would recommend it to any oven roasted chicken lover. 

Bottom line: The star of the night were the brussels sprout chips. Kale chips move aside, these brussel sprout chips with lemon and sea salt are TO. DIE. FOR!!!
author: Pamela M.

description:
I just had a food-gasm. 
If you are questioning going here, don't. The ambiance, food, and service was awesome.
Go with people who you will want to share food with and vice versa so you can try as much as you can because everything was exceptional. You don't need salt or pepper at this place.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
I've been wanting to come here forever and a day but of course we always forgot to make reservations weeks in advance :/

We finally planned ahead and were able to get a 6:30PM res (on a Monday) to go try the wonderous SoMa restaurant known as Marlowe. 

First off, the Kale Caesar Toasts are on point. The poached egg was cooked perfectly and paired really nicely with the salad. For dinner we both got the Poulet Vert (it's one of their specialties) and oh man I was not disappointed. Huge portion of chicken and I ate every single bite.

I've also heard the hamburger is BOMB, and there's a rumor flying around that if you get the bone marrow appetizer and ask very nicely the lovely bartender will give you a louge shot of liquor through the bone marrow bone... say what?! I wasn't brave enough to ask.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Holy Yum. Marlowe is delicious. We stopped in before a show while I was home for the holidays. Neither the food nor the service was disappointing. They were very accommodating of our last minute reservations, getting us in when a different restaurant was unexpectedly closed. We were with a party of 6, everything we had was delicious. 

Can't wait to return next time I am in the city!
author: Sarah W.

description:
probably the best brussel sprout chips ive had - well, its the only BS chips ive ever had
the burger was juicy and medium rare meat was juicy and had flavor
overall a lively atmosphere
staff is super busy so be patient if it takes a while but you can at least see the effort
author: Marie r.

description: Nothing to write home about. Had the Brussels sprouts chips, deviled egg, marlowe burger and the donuts, plus a cocktail. Seriously mediocre.
author: Trammi N.

description: I really do love this place. We tried the oysters, hard boiled egg, Bone marrow, beef tartare, the steak and I can't remember what my boyfriend got but oh boy is the beef tartare good! Anytime I am craving beef tartare I will go here!! The bone marrow was a little too fatty for me but I think a lot of people would really love that. Another honorable mention would be the deviled egg it's warm and all the flavors really came together. At the end of the day if you are craving beef tartare you need to come here!
author: Eileen H.

description: The burger is off the chainnnn. Love sitting at the bar and watching the people work. Hope the cook wasn't weirded out cause I was def sending some imma eat you vibes in his direction (but for real, was looking at the food tho)
author: John B.

description: I was disappointed. It did not live up to the reviews. We went for brunch. Good OJ and espresso, the French toast was good, but we ordered two disappointing dishes ... the baked eggs, in a watery and flavorless sauce, and the crab cake benedict, which also was flavorless. The presentation is beautiful, but the food was overrated. The service was ok. The surroundings were hip if a little sterile. In some seats along the window, you sit up against your neighbors.
author: Anthony J.

description: Marlowe has become kind of a go-to spot for us out of proximity; because it's right near our house. We have been there many times and the food is tasty and intriguing.. but nothing ever stood out to me. It's a lovely place but there's no dishes here that I whole heartedly recommend. They are all above average, and the mood of the place is dreamy and nice. Sometime's I get great waiters, but I've also had the worst waiters here. It's a high-end place I'd imagine is good for dates but honestly we were eager to find another place to go regularly. I find this place is just too pricey to go to for slightly above-average cuisine when Cockscomb is right down the street.
author: Rebeka J.

description:
No reason not to give a four.

First, make sure if you make a reservation you ask for the back patio room. It is awesome.

We made a reservation for work for 7 people and they were awesome. We got moved to this secret room in the back through the kitchen. It was mysterious. Very cool. Not sure how many they can accommodate over there.  We got the flat bread and some
Fried okra also. The fried okra was...fried okra. The service was awesome but I think we had special attention. Anyway, the burger was as prescribed. It was pretty unreal. They do a good job. 16$ is pushing it though but I'm a Chicago guy, so the complaint is always there.
author: Matthew A.

description:
This is my go to location near Caltrain. It is just a few blocks away and an easy walk. Dinner time is extremely hectic. Reservations are strongly recommended during dinner hours. They are really well known for their delicious burger. I strongly recommend the brussel sprout chips. They are salty and crunchy just like chips but with all of the antioxidants of brussel sprouts! 

They have a quite decent wine list, but its hard to not try their changing list of specialty cocktails. If you decide to sit at the bar, the bartenders are very friendly and will help you pick out the right drink for you.
author: Kari G.

description:
Came here to celebrate one of my good friends for her birthday.  We absolutely enjoyed our dinner.  The hostess was very friendly and accomodating. Kept checking on my friend if she was doing okay while she wait for my late a** to come.
We ordreded the following dishes:

1) brussel sprouts
2) deviled eggs
3) bone marrow
4) pork belly
5) burger
6) scallops

Plus 5 glasses of wine..
Everything was absolutely delicious. I wanted to order another bowl of the brussel sprouts but ofcourse I was too full.

I would defintiely come back and eat here again and try their other dishes. The service was very fast, friendly and accomodating. There's no valet which sucks but there's lots of parking on the street, $0.25 per hour if there's no GIANT's game.  The place probably fits only 35-40 people so make sure to make reservations ahead of time.
author: Claudine V.

description:
I had dinner with friends at Marlowe and we all greatly enjoyed the experience.

Brussel sprout chips, warm deviled eggs and pistachios make for a unique and delicious round of appetizers.

The table shared poulet verte, pork chop, arctic char and a cheeseburger.  All were delicious.  The char and pork chop were my personal favorites.  The spicy sautéed spinach with peppers served with the pork chop was outstanding.

We all shared a TCHO chocolate pie that was a delicious end to our meal.
author: Lance W.

description: Fantastic space, fantastic staff, fantastic food. This was an amazing night : start to finish. Decor reminded me on a NYC bistro on the UWS, every staff member smiled and was welcoming, not one thing I tasted was below awesome.
author: James W.

description: One of the best burgers in the Bay, hands down. Everything I tried was delicious. Love this place!
author: Jason L.

description: Great atmosphere! The chicken sandwich is to die for! Also ordered the candied bacon and French toast bites. They were delicious! Waitress was super sweet too.
author: Marcella H.

description:
Came with coworkers for dinner. Friendly staff and good recommendation! We ordered the most famous Bone Marrow and it's delicious. Additionally, we also tried their shrimps, which is perfect pairing with their house made sauce. 

For entries, I had cod and my friend had angus beef. Both of them are good! Both are perfectly prepared. All of us like the dishes, giving the fact that everything on table was finished up fast.

Overall, I will definitely come back again!
author: Coco S.

description:
I have been looking forward to visiting Marlowe all week for a special occasion. 

I have a very bad gluten allergy, so when I made the reservation I was pleased to hear they had gluten free options. 

Upon arriving we were greeted by a host in a white dress, and shown to our table by her. I asked if they had a gluten free menu as I had been told on the phone that they had options for this and she then proceeded to screw her face up, abruptly say no, throw the menus down on the table and walk off. Just to clarify I wish I didn't have to live a life without gluten and having to make special choices of where to eat is tough enough! Without being made to feel terrible. I had actually been severely ill for some time and was going to Marlowe to celebrate! I was so taken back by her, my eyes filled with tears and was ready to walk out of the restaurant !!

Had it not been for my husband asking our waitress if it would be possible to make a dish without gluten, she then informed is of what would be possible to eat and safe. She was knowledgeable about the menu and attentive throughout the meal.

One star is for the food - myself and my husband both got steak which was very nice.

Second star for our server.

I will not be returning! Host needs to learn some manners and a lesson in customer service!
author: Jenna B.

description: Reoccurring visit and the food does not disappointment me, nor their attentive services. I love brussels sprouts chips and wherever I go I always like to try out and see how well they making it. Marlowe you make the best brussels sprout chips! We had 4 appetizers, 2 sides, shared a cod and dessert. All done excellent! Baked oysters, okra, brussels sprout, bone marrow, black cod, spinach on the side and cheese cauliflower with closing a creme brûlée. I can go again today....
author: Zici L.

description:
Came here for dinner with reservations, but waited for awhile.  Finally seated.  Nice little restaurant, except the BEAM smack dead in the middle of our section (table) was quite distracting.  I only had the ahi tartare, while my friends indulged on the entree portions.  Looked good, but didnt have an appetite that night.  However, the ahi was good.  

I'd like to make it back here to try something more than the ahi soon.
author: Becky U.

description:
I was at Marlowe at 500 Brannan st. last night for my birthday . 
Food was terrible, shrimp cocktail was sent back, hamburger was sent back, my grand son could not eat his pork chop , ribeye was uncooked and too thin, fish( code) had no flavor and too small, I asked for lemon, she brought three small pieces which one was already squeezed. I asked for cookies and coffe, cookies were as hard as stone and coffe never came.
They served us in a storage room called patio, it was cold then they turned on the heat ,now too hot. the heat could not be set to low, only one choice on or off.  Fake plants , narrow tables, and metal chairs made me so depressed  on my birthday.
author: Akram M.

description: A Sunday menu with a Sunday pre game crowd, didn't diffuse the attentive staff and well appointed plates from arriving at the table.  Apparently known for their burger, no shortage of those being ordered but noteworthy was the chicken sandwich and host of drink offerings as well.
author: cm g.

description:
This is one of the best restaurants I've been to in SoMa and also one of the best date restaurants I can remember.  We made last minute reservations on a Monday and the hostess quickly led us to our seats when we arrived, considerately pulling aside our table so I could get into my comfy booth seat.  The ambiance was very romantic and EVERYONE we encountered was SO. INCREDIBLY. NICE. - our waiter especially! Our main course took a little longer than expected and we were starting to get really hungry. Right when we were about to inquire about our food, the food came but our waiter still apologized and immediately offered to comp us another round of drinks. When we refused, he offered us dessert on the house instead! Did I mention NICE!?

The delicious highlights from our dinner:
-Grilled CALAMARI & CHORIZO Tartine (starter) - will order this again
-MUSHROOM soup (starter) - will come back again for this, loved the two little gougeres (savory creme puff like bread) that came with the soup!!
-Anson Mills POLENTA - DELICIOUS main course (exactly what I wanted for comfort food tonight, a perfect savory & light dish), will have to order again
-lemon creme brûlée - yum.
author: Jenni H.

description:
Absolutely amazing experience second time around. After a disappointing first visit, management and the lovely Anna reached out to discuss and offered to bring me and my group back in. So appreciate their attention to the matter - it really shows how much they care about each of their customers. 

Food and ambiance could not have been better this time around. The deviled eggs were the best I've ever had - and my group agreed. We joked about ordering them for dessert. The burrata app was also much improved - absolutely loved this dish. We also tried one of their appetizer specials, fried smelt, which were outstanding. Not my usual go-to, but I'm so glad we tried. Cooked perfectly, melt in your mouth, and nicely offset by an arugula topping. 

For entrees, the chicken (Poulet Vert) was outstanding. I tend to not order chicken at restaurants, but I'd gotten a few recs, and my research pointed me to it. A flawless dish. 

Stuffed and happy, but couldn't pass up dessert. The table favorite was the banana coconut cake. 

Anna and team, thank you for generously having our group back in and treating us to a flawless dinner experience!
author: Brianna M.

description: Food is decent but service could use some help.   The wait staff are not the friendliest.   I would have to think hard if I would go back.
author: Seth T.

description: We ordered Marlowe burger&steak tartare. Really special experience. It's pity we went there in afternoon time and we couldn't eat some great meals that recommended by Yelp.
author: Ruby C.

description: 5 stars just for the beef tartare that has the perfect seasoning like you'd find in a good bistro in France. The service was fast and waitresses very nice. We've also had the fried chicken sandwich which was extremely tasty. Highly recommended place!
author: Cricri B.

description: This place is a little pricey for every day lunch, but the deviled egg sandwich, brussel sprout chips, and steak tartare were pretty delicious. Service is good and the food comes out in a pretty timely manner!
author: Grace C.

description:
Had dinner at this cute little place after the Yelp 10-Year V. Satturi Wine Tour and can say that it was a pleasant surprise!  Food and service at the place is on point and so damn comforting after that long warm day wine tasting up in Napa.  I was sure that I heard about this place many times on Yelp but never knew anything about the food they had to offer.  Simplistic short menu with lots of seemingly local ingredients.  

The interior vibe of this place screams casual and warm.  Brown and dark wood with lots of space in between tables from what I remember.  We chose to sit more immediately at the bar where we could see the kitchen and converse with the bartender about what to order.  I ate lightly and got a sweet corn soup and my friend had ordered a classic burger which really looked quite delicious.  I believe I ordered something else but can't quite remember what it was now, haha.  Should have taken a photo of it.  

Anyways, I really would come back to this place because I believe I could quite possibly give this place 5 stars.  Judging from the other menu items they have to offer it seems like I'd most likely love the food here.  From my short and limited experience I had with the food here my rating stands strong at 4 stars.  Friendly and cool restaurant staff as well!
author: Kenny P.

description:
Marlowe is my favorite restaurant in SF (that I've tried so far). This was my third visit, and my first at their new 4th & Brannan location. Marlowe combines a beautifully cozy atmosphere with earnest, tasteful New American food. The ingredients are fresh, the preparation is neat and consistent, and the service is absolutely spectacular.

- I love love love the Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips ($9) here. Many places serve up roasted brussels sprouts, but the Marlowe chip-style preparation has a perfect punch of sour-and-sweet flavor, crisped but not burnt. 

- Roasted Bone Marrow ($14) is fatty and succulent, although the portion size is a bit smaller than most restaurants. 

- I wasn't too hungry this time around, so I got the Steak Tartare ($16) as my entree. The seasoning is on point and keeps the raw meat tasting fresh. I'm not sure if this is normal, but I feel like most other steak tartare is too heavy in a caper/acidic flavor, and I lose the subtle meat flavor.

I've had the famous Marlowe burger ($16), which is indeed one of my favorites in SF. My friend ordered the Poulet Vert ($26), which is chicken marinated for 24 hours on a bed of mashed potatoes. The chicken is herby and the tender texture blends well with the potatoes.

The new location is bright and the design alludes to a home kitchen. You should make a reservation unless you plan to come right when it opens, as it does fill up quite quickly. Marlowe can be a bit pricey for dinner, but it is absolutely worth it. I've been to the owners' other two restaurants (Park Tavern and The Cavalier), but Marlowe is still the nearest and dearest to my heart.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Pimm's cup and The baker drink were delicious.

I enjoyed their brussel sprouts and chicken fried okra. Bone marrow dish was tasty. I've never had it that way. Their burger is simple good. I really like their fries.

Banana cake with vanilla ice cream, walnuts, and caramel was pretty sweet to me.

The space reminded me of a big kitchen. Great staff and service. I would come back here again!
author: Ange G.

description:
I was a huge fan of Coco500, but I really like Marlowe's food. So, I was excited when Marlowe expanded to a bigger location. I'm disappointed that owners decided to pack the tables at this new place to the gill. Packed like sardines... just like in the old location... except the food was not as good.

Everything was way too salty. I mean, you could see the salt snow on top of some of the dishes. A lot of the dishes were also way too vinegary. I just feel like the chef got way too heavy handed with everything. Too spicy, too salty and too vinegary. I'm Korean. I like strong/bold flavors, but there was no balance in the flavors of numerous dishes we tried.

Oh, and the interior designer who remodeled this place should be fired. White tile floor and white tile wall? Seriously? I felt like I was in an insane asylum. Oh, it's also a bit dangerous. I stepped on a fried brussels sprout leaf on the floor and slipped a bit. If I had high heels on, I might have fallen. 

We arrived at 5:45 pm and the restaurant was pretty empty. Why did they seat us at the back corner table that was right next to the kitchen so that we were forced to stare at the blank white tile wall, stainless steel door to the kitchen and constant traffic of wait staff going in and out? When we asked to change the table, the server's answer was "I am not sure if you can do that. Let me check." I saw at least 10 other empty tables. Is it because we look young that they decided to shove us in the worst table? 

It's not just the decor that was unpleasant but the harsh tile surface and marble table made the restaurant incredibly noisy. With the terrible acoustics, sitting elbow to elbow with fellow diners and the food tasting mediocre at best, I will not be returning to this restaurant. So long Marlowe... I used to be a fan but I am ready to move on.

Cocktail was yummy.... so I may consider stopping in for a drink, if my friends insisted on this place. But it really is unpleasant to spend any significant time in this all white, insane asylum meet faux ranch vibe of a restaurant.
author: Su K.

description: Good stuff. Crab shrimp crepes excellent. Deviled eggs good. Burger above average. Good service. A bit crowded inside due to layout of tables. About $60 for 2 people
author: Jones T.

description: I stopped in for a light lunch. Had the baked oysters - very nice. And the cauliflower. It was described as like macaroni and cheese but with cauliflower - rich and creamy with several different cheeses - baked and bubbly. I may never go back to macaroni.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
This place looks pretty walking in, black & white decor with hostess at the door. That's it for the positive.

Now let's get into what I ordered. Marlowe burger was not impressive but the $16 price for it was. I'm not cheap and love to spend money on eating great so I was curious and went for it. Yelp reviews & Thrillist really talked up the Marlowe burger, not impressive at all. For $16 it better slap me in the face with awesomeness. I finished it, thinking it wasn't anywhere near great. The great burgers I know are, Gott's Roadside (St Helena, Napa, Ferry Building) or Burgers N' Brews (Davis, Sac). I was on a burger mission that ended with disappointment.

The service was ok and that's after getting bumped in the head with my plate the server brought so I'm being generous. A constant bad smell kept lingering around the bar area. 
This place is down the street from AT&T Park which makes it convenient but I wouldn't recommend to friends or visit again.
author: Ken S.

description:
Heard about how good burgers are at Marlowe.  Went last night right when they opened at 5:30pm and was seated at the bar (there were no open reservations).  

Unfortunately, we had a bad experience when we sat there waiting for about 10 minute w/o any service (the bartender mentioned he'd be right w/us but subsequently went to tend to another couple, chat w/his colleagues, and then fold napkins).  They were not busy at all because they were just opening.  So we got up and left.
author: Ken W.

description:
Loved it!

The deviled eggs were the best I've ever had. We also had a broiled oyster that was fantastic. The atmosphere was lively and fun, felt really great.

The only nit: the New York Steak I ordered was just good. Not great. It was fine, I enjoyed it but after the eggs and oysters I was ready for something impressive and this just wasn't there. I don't mean this as a downer, definitely go and eat here.
author: Paul S.

description:
We were here at weekend brunch time. Even the short brunch/bar menu is full of surprises. The crispy chicken sandwich is crispy and extremely delicious. My crab and shrimp crepe is fabulous too. The chocolate pie has a deceptive name, since it's more like a pudding cup. There's a hint of sea salt in the cream really brings up the flavor. 

The service is a little bit slow because it's crowded. Overall experience is great!
author: Sophia Z.

description:
Even better than the original!!  What a great experience and during the opening weekend to boot -- the staff didn't miss a beat!  The food continues to be stellar -- starters of brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, pea pancakes with salmon and an amazing burratta & heirloom tomato salad were all excellent.  You must order the tomato salad -- it was as if the tomatoes had been picked at the prime of Summer -- here we are in October -- the juices of the tomatoes, mixed with the garlicky croutons and the creamy unctuous burratta was quite an experience.  Kudos to the server for her recommendations and the excellent pacing.  We had asked her to pace our starters; and they arrived in perfect order. 

The main courses of the black cod and always perfect pork chop were greatly enjoyed as well.  I would have enjoyed a bit more of the pumpkin squash accompaniment to the pork chop :o)  -- a very minor quibble as all were cooked perfectly and all plates were perfectly polished off!

The desserts and the cocktails are where the new Marlowe truly shines -- for desserts, the chocolate cake with coconut frosting, the vacherin (meringue with coffee ice cream, chocolate sauce and almonds) and the lemon creme brulee with toasty pistachio biscotti were perfect!!  Creamy, homey, yummy-ness that is an upgrade from the previous desserts in a jar concept -- you will love them!!!   Additionally, the cocktails were a perfect complement to the entire meal -- as it felt too hot to have red wine.  We chose a couple rounds of the refreshing Pimm's Cup and the Calf -- and they worked for the entire meal.

Overall, an amazing experience.  My only complaint is really around the noise level -- it got really loud and it was difficult to carry on a conversation -- hopefully they can do something to absorb the noise -- glad we arrived as early as we did.

Kudos to the entire staff for a great experience; and during an opening weekend- WOW!! We will definitely be back!!!
author: Kevin G.

description:
Very solid restaurant in SF.  Marlowe has a pretty focused menu and they do everything quite well.

We had a late dinner reservation.  The setting is somewhat loud because it's so small, but still quite intimate.  Service was very nice and helpful.  Free street parking is easy to find outside.

We ordered a great bottle of wine to enjoy with:
-Bone marrow
-Deviled eggs
-Crispy Brussels sprout chips
-Roasted chiogga beets
-Pan-seared lingcod
-Grilled pork chop

My favorites were the Brussels sprout chips, chiogga beets, and the Niman Ranch pork chop.  The Brussels sprout chips were the most unique menu item, and I really, really liked them.  I have tried a lot of different gourmet variations on Brussels sprouts, but this was by far my favorite.  All of our dishes were well-executed, with high-quality ingredients.  The price point was also very reasonable.

Overall, I had a delicious meal at Marlowe and would definitely recommend.  They offer a solid, reliable menu that's worth checking out.
author: Amanda N.

description: This place was pretty awesome.  I thought the burger was good but not amazing (au cheval in Chicago still has the best burger in my opinion so maybe it's just preference).  I wasn't a fan of the bun because it was a little dry.  The pork chop, fries, and the deviled eggs were delicious and the highlight of the meal.  They also have solid cocktails.
author: Diana D.

description:
NOISY, PRICEY, Food so-so.

Arrived promptly yesterday for our 5:45pm reservation. The place was already very noisy even though it was not fully occupied. 
Food... wanted to taste the bone marrow that a lot of people were raving about and it was terrible. salty and not much to it. A huge disappointment. Ordered the pork chop and it wasn't even pork chop. some cuts of pork that had no resemblance of pork chops. The only good thing about the meal was the hamburger. it was tasty but at $16, it better be.
Wine... ordered wine by the glass and the Rose i ordered tasted bitter.
This was a huge disappointment.
author: Mary L.

description:
They were not kidding when they said they have a really good burger! yes! it is true! 
We also had the deviled eggs, brussel sprouts and fried oysters.. all were so good! 
Great service, beautiful decor and ambiance. 
They serve their fried chicken sandwich only during lunch, so i will be back! :)
author: C A.

description: Stopped in at Marlowe on our way to the Giants game today. Didn't realize it would help to have a reservation, but the hostess was very nice when we shared we didn't have one. She found us seats at the bar. I'm so glad we stopped in! The oysters and the burger were some of the best we've ever had! The horseradish sauce on the burger and dip for the fries was to die for. The bartender was friendly and made us a delicious bourbon drink. Eating at Marlowe was the highlight of our day! We will be sure to come back- with a reservation to make sure we can get in again!
author: Carrie C.

description:
I was hoping to try their bone marrow, but this was not served on lunch menu. 
The Brussel sprouts chips are really really yummy!
Tried the mushroom soup with white truffle oil, rich and flavorful.
Will definitely come back for the bone marrow next time!
author: Ayin P.

description: Landed at Marlowe on our drive in from L.A. 9/1/16...LOVED IT. Without going on and on with a whole bunch of needless details, the chef was truly fantastic and wait staff was on point! The three of us typically dine out 4-5 times a week. Summary: BRAVO!
author: Mario L.

description:
After an afternoon of bar hopping my friends and I decided it was time to fill our stomach with something other than beer. Thanks to yelp we found this place nearby. It's not exactly a place you picture 24 year old new professionals to go to but we thought, " hey, why not act like yuppies for a day?" 

I love the plethora of boutique restaurants in sf. The places are small and simple, but tastefully decorated. The food is usually fantastic.

We ordered the pork chop, Brussels sprout chips, baked oyster, and salad. The salad was elegantly presented and surprisingly filling. The Brussels sprout chips were interesting... I loved the texture...light and airy. We decided that the flavor actually resembled fruit loops.

The pork chop was perfectly cooked and extremely well seasoned. The sweet potato gratin that came with the dish was phenomenal...I could have skipped the pork chop and just eaten the sweet potato. 

Definitely a great date place!
author: Erin T.

description:
It was okay. I've always wanted to go here, but just never got around to it. When I received a gift certificate here, it pretty much pushed me to finally go. Maybe I just went at the wrong time, but I ended up waiting forever for a table. They told me it was going to be a 45 minute wait, which was completely understandable since I didn't have reservations. An hour and 15 minutes in, no update on what was going on. Finally got a table minutes later. Of course we ordered the burger. Also ordered the brussel sprout chips that everyone raves about. The food took forever to come out, and when it did, they gave us the brown butter sprouts instead. I mean, they were good, but I wanted the chips instead. I assume the waiter heard us incorrectly because it was soooooo loud in there. They accommodated us by giving us free chips. When that finally came out and I tried it, IT WAS SO SALTY. Literally, it was like biting into a block of salt. Oh, the burger was good. But, thats all it was. It was just good. Would I consider it the "best burger in SF"? Probably not. 

It wasn't best experience, but it also wasn't the worst. Would I wait over an hour for their burger again? No. Maybe if I had reservations. But, the restaurant is still out of the way for me, so I don't see myself going back soon. It is worth trying though. Maybe the kitchen was backed up on the day I went.
author: Jennalyn L.

description:
Came here and made reservations ahead of time!

- French toast: Ehhh...nothing too exciting BUT get the Dungeness crab & shrimp crepe For SURE!

I definitely want to come back here and try the rest of the menu.
author: Hey Y.

description: The food is excellent. I've had the burger polenta and crab crepes everything well seasoned and perfect.
author: Allison J.

description: I should have turned around and left as soon as I got attitude from the hostess. Came by at 4pm and was handed a menu with limited items.. Ok whatever.  Ordered the burger and fries.  Fries were good... But the burger... Who the hell puts horseradish on a burger?  Nasty.  And the service sucked too.  Felt like none of the employees wanted to be there.  Never coming here again.
author: David S.

description:
Excellent service, excellent food, and excellent atmosphere! 

My bf and I came here for our 1 year anniversary dinner :) We made reservations using OpenTable but we still had to wait 10 minutes before being seated. Ten minutes isn't a very big deal to us, so we were super surprised when they gave us complimentary brussel sprout chips for making us wait! We both thought that was super nice of them. Our waitress was also helpful when we were trying to figure out what wine to order. She suggested two red wines and let us sample both before choosing! We hadn't even gotten to the food yet and were loving this place so far. And now onto the food!

Brussel Sprout Chips - I HATE brussel sprouts and try to avoid eating them, but these were actually bearable! The flavors, salty and citrusy, and the crispy texture made these edible and addicting. Although it was cool to try these, I probably wouldn't get them again just because I still don't like brussel sprouts. 

Bone Marrow - This was my first time eating bone marrow so I didn't know what to expect. It was very tasty! There isn't a lot of meat though so I'm not sure I would order it again since it was $12. The bread and the salsa verde on the side were also yummy!

Baked Oysters - OMG YUM. This was SO GOOD. We each had one of these and they were sooo tasty! They had so much flavor from the creamy, new england chowder sauce and the oysters had the perfect texture. I highly recommend ordering these! 

Scallops - BOOO only four scallops and cost $27?! No thanks. Definitely don't know what made us order these... the scallops were cooked perfectly but the overall dish was too small and the flavors didn't make up for that. 

Marlowe Burger - DELISH. How did they make a burger that sounded so normal, SO GOOD?! It was seriously heavenly and I even closed my eyes as I took my bites. The patty was juicy and cooked perfectly. The flavors of the cheese, onions, and bacon went so well together with the burger and the bun was soft and toasty! Definitely one of the best burgers I've ever had. I totally wished I ordered one instead of the scallops. Luckily my bf was willing to share his burger :D

The restaurant's small size and dim lighting makes it a bit more intimate, definitely better for smaller groups. Marlowe is a great place to take a date out for dinner or to celebrate with a small group of friends :)
author: Sandra N.

description:
3.5 stars

I came here over the summer on a random night-out with the SO for dinner after work, so this was before Marlowe moved locations a block down. 

We got: 
-brussel sprouts chip: probably the best/most memorable dish of the night. I remember it being really crispy and seasoned well and all in all, flavorful. 
-roasted bone marrow: I remember this was pretty good too, and my partner really enjoyed this. It was cooked well, but it wasn't remarkably any different from another bone marrow dish you would get at another restaurant that might offer it. 
-poulet vert: I ordered this, and the cook on the chicken was perfect, but I don't remember anything significant about the dish. It was just okay and nothing memorable
I forgot what my partner got as his main dish, but I do remember that he didn't find his dish very memorable either. 

The reason I rounded down to 3 stars is because for the price of the meal, the meal wasn't anything spectacular or memorable. I feel like given the price tag, we could've gone elsewhere and enjoyed our meal more, so probably won't be back anytime soon.
author: Judy B.

description:
We enjoyed our night out in the new Marlowe space!  Met some friends we hadn't seen for a long time at the bar and sat at the communal table for dinner.  We had a great night.  It's a perfect place to meet friends and grab a meal or bites from the extensive finger-food menu.  Enjoyed every dish we ordered. 

We didn't get out to the terrace, but it looks great, especially for daytime dining.  I'm excited to see outdoor space in SF.

We'll be back!
author: J. Q. B.

description:
The Good:
-Went in on a Friday night that was pretty busy, did not have a reservation, the host managed to get us a table very quickly. He was awesome.
-The deviled egg from the "bite" menu was a nice mini appetizer (it's literally one bite). Lots of flavor and something I had not tried before elsewhere. I would recommend it if I were to suggest you go there... but I don't.

The Bad:
-I saw an article listing the burger as one of the best in SF, so I had to give it a shot. Irrespective of price, I'd give it a 5/10 (my only modification was asking for no lettuce). As far as I could tell, toppings included a bit of hard (not crispy, actually hard) bacon, cheddar cheese, and a good amount of mayo or aioli. The bun was good, the beef itself was cooked appropriately, but overall the taste was on the bland side--far from what a best burger in SF should be. The fries that came with it were skinny, too salty, and reminded me of a slightly thicker version of In n Out's. Take price into consideration ($16) and the burger drops to a 2/10 at best. Almost feels as if the price justification is only due to it being the cheapest main dish option on the menu.

The Worst:
My friends all got cocktails. I wasn't drinking that night, so I ordered a coke. I can only assume  my glass was filled with a coke tap from the bar, because it tasted like generic brand or a watered down version. I wouldn't have thought much about it... but then the bill came: $4 for this. Never was even offered a refill. I was shocked. Even nicer places that bring you a glass of ice and a tall glass coke bottle charge at most $3 for this. Even the Deviled Egg was priced lower than that. This just pushed me over the edge; I went from being "meh" about this place to deciding to never go back.


I'm willing to pay SF prices for an overall good experience--high quality food and service. I'm not willing to accept insane prices for mediocre food (at best) just because SF is expensive. If you want a $15+ burger that's worth it... go to Nob Hill Grille and get the Old McDonald.
author: Max Z.

description:
I've been here three times now and depending on when you get to Marlowe you will be treated to really quick service or really slow service. Slow service of course refers to a weekend night.

The first time I came here I settled for the Marlowe burger and the sweet corn soup. Both of which were really good. The soup is a must have. More about the burger later...

The second time I visited I got their chicken poulet dish and while it was very good, it wasn't in the category of "great". I fee like with enough effort it could have been a dish that I could recreate in my own kitchen. 

Now the third time I had to get the burger again. That's because the first time I tasted their famous burger I was disappointed by how greasy it was...and to be honest it was still greasy but it definitely tasted better. Now I've had a lot of burgers in my life including Wagyu beef burgers. This would rank again as a very good burger but not the best. I feel like now that it's so popular the quality of the burger has decreased. 

For the most part I give this restaurant 4 starts because it fills me up and the decor and ambiance are great. Definitely go with a group of people if you can!
author: Ray H.

description:
The initial service my friend and I experienced was pretty bad. My friend and I went around 4:45 pm on a Thursday. When we were asked if we made reservations and responded "no", the hostess gave us this "you have to be kidding me" kind of look and said something to the extent of you're lucky we even have a spot for you two. Maybe it was because my friend and I we dressed rather casually, but regardless, you probably shouldn't blow off any customers like that. 

The brussel sprouts chips were good, but nothing spectacular. They were seasoned well, but this was more of an expectation over anything else. The beer was beer. Nothing that blew our minds.

My friend and I came here to catch up on how graduate and dental school were going, but we ended up picking up the tab after a few minutes to head to a more down to earth bar with less pretentious servers. It was an unfortunate first impression. Maybe we'll come back another time, and maybe reservations will provide a better experience.
author: Nate W.

description: Friendly, nice  location, nice people and good service. Food quality and preparation is over the average of SF.
author: Max G.

description: We got the Brussel sprout chips- very good. Both had the Marlowe burger which was just an average burger, disappointing for a $16 burger. Garlic fries good. Side salad was blah, just lettuce and vinaigrette. Service was great. May eat here again but will never get the burger again.
author: Stewart E.

description:
Oh my goodness... Absolutely delicious. Came here with a friend on a Wednesday night to catch up. Tried to come here the week before and it was super busy. Make sure to make a reservation ahead of time. Anyways, for a Wednesday night the place was packed. Who knew it was so popular. We decided to both order a glass of wine and keep to the starters on the menu. 

Crispy brussel sprouts - My fave! So crispy and crunchy salty with a little lemon kick. Yum! 

Dungeness crab crepes - These were super duper crabby (in a good way!) with a hollandaise sauce over the top. Though I must say for $14, the crepes were super tiny. 

Marlowe fries - Fries and fries... Not much to say here. Though the spicy horsradishy sauce was delicious. 

Grilled jumbo prawns with spicy cocktail sauce - Mmm, so good. Shrimp grilled to perfection. 

Burrata toast - Loved this too! Just the right balance of flavor. 

Banana walnut cake with ice cream - This was so so so so good, I can die and go to heaven now. The cake was super duper moist and with the ice cream... I can say no more. Just a head's up, the cake is huge. We were thinking it was going to be a smaller portion, so we ordered another dessert. But this one is definitely enough to share. 

Strawberry shortcake - Nothing super special about this one. It was a straightforward dessert that I felt like I could get elsewhere. 

Overall, such an awesome atmosphere. Very lively, modern, and clean. And the service was on point! All of our food came out super quickly. Definitely coming back!
author: Juvi Anne B.

description:
Cute place with super friendly bartenders. Food was slightly above average, drinks were solid but did not blow me away, however, I'd go just for the comfort this place offers. I came here twice, first time on a Friday night with friend near their closing time, restaurant was quiet and we had a good chat with the two bartenders. Second time was on a weekday night around 8pm, the restaurant was so crowded that I got bumped into a few times sitting at the bar. Because they were so busy I didn't get the personable treatment and it was a very average experience, not worth the price tag to say at the least.

Suggestion - try to avoid peak hours. If you come during a off-peak hours you have much better odds of appreciating what Marlowe has to offer.
author: Heidi B.

description:
I had been dying to come here for a while having heard that their burger was one of the best in the city. 

Marlowe did not disappoint. The wine list was great, the burger with caramelized onions and bacon was delicious, and the polenta with mushrooms and truffle oil was so yummy.
author: Teryll H.

description: So yummy!  Service was great. Food was timely and delicious!!!  I got the burger and it was to die for.
author: Juli P.

description:
This review is only for their burger.

There aren't many things I love enough to take the time to write a review about, but the Marlowe burger makes the cut.

YUM.

Seriously.  And get the brussels sprouts chips thingies too.
author: Bunny F.

description: Trendy little place with great food, drinks, and service. Would definitely recommend Marlowe to someone who hasn't been here before. Great place to go in a smaller group given the setting but I'm sure they can accommodate a larger party as well if you make reservations ahead of time. As for food- burratta toast was a yummy combo of flavors on perfectly baked bread. Roasted tomato soup and Marlowe fries were equally as delicious. Wasn't crazy about the horseradish aoli only because its not my favorite flavor but overall it was good. The stuffed sole was good too but next time we're definitely going to order the burger :)
author: Kob A.

description:
Here's my thought on the dishes we ordered

Signature Crispy Brussels Sprouts - with hints of citrus that makes it additive, a must try!
Baked Oyster - Oyster baked perfectly just barely cooked in bacon fat and topped with crispy bacon bits, one of the best I ever had!
Steak Tartar - a bit tough and a little too tart, not as impressive 
Grilled Pork Belly & Stone Fruit Salad - pretty and yummy dish, pork belly is a little tough
Roasted Bone Marrow - yum (don't think anyone can make a bone marrow taste bad)
Steak & Fries - the red wine sauce reduction is soooo good, it's like gelatin after a while.
Upside Down Strawberry Crisps - bourbon ice cream with salted caramel, a little too sweet for me but the strawberry made it an awesome bite.
author: E C.

description: Ribeye, medium-rare, excellent. Service, excellent. Ambiance is really nice. Relatively reasonable price but still over my budget.
author: Douglas L.

description:
Second visit to Marlowes, but first time at this new location. It was a Friday. We were very confused and had no idea that they had moved so we actually walked to their original location first but thankfully there was a sign posted there directing us to their new location, which was just a short walk away. 

Immediately, you notice a different feel to the new location. The walls are tiled and white, allowing all the sound in the room to bounce off from all sides. The noise levels were VERY high... I don't recall them having this issue at their other spot. I didn't mind the new set up but it is quite a tight fit, especially where we were sat at the tables that lined behind the bar. You literally have to be a size 2 to squeeze between the marble tables that they have jammed together. I do miss the slit they had previously that allowed you to see in to the kitchen. I love an open kitchen.. 

Anyway, on to the food! I wasn't starving but I did want to try a little bit of this and that. We ordered the brussel sprout chips, the roasted bone marrow, and the chicken fried okra. My sister and boyfriend both got an order of the Marlowe Burger. First of all, they are FAMOUS for their brussel sprout chips and you clearly see why. They are ridiculously addicting, and a really great alternative to a typical potato chip! I can't name the zest they put on the chips, but OH MY GOD. Mind blowing! The bone marrow is an absolute favorite of mine, and it is in fact the sole reason why I return to this restaurant. I timidly asked the waitress to make sure the kitchen didn't overcook the marrow because embarrassingly enough last time I was there I ordered it TWICE (not joking) and the second time it was cooked so thoroughly that there was barely any marrow left. Cue the tears.. This time however it was perfection. It is the definition of mother's milk to me! Served with light greens and crustini. The chicken fried okra was good, but I think I may have actually preferred it straight grilled (maybe wrapped in bacon?) rather than deep fried and battered as it was. 

Would I come back? Yes... maybe on a less busy night, so the noise levels will lessen. Perhaps some sound reducers may help but I don't know. It's a great establishment and the bone marrow will always keep me coming back.

What I recommend: Brussel sprout chips and bone marrow FTW!
author: Mariko M.

description: I went there after a Guns and Roses concert at A T & T Park.  The Hostess was nice, but the bartender was slow and inattentive.  I ordered 2 beers and 2 shots of Jamesons and paid with a $50.  He gave me $2 change and I told him that I paid with a $50.  He said well the drinks were $48.  What a rip off for 2 cans of beer and 2 Jamesons.  Oh well, I won't be going back.
author: Phil A.

description:
