Off the menu bone marrow. I almost dropped it twice by not listening to my friend telling me to just scoop the marrow instead of lifting the whole bone to my plate. Thank goodness I didn't. Holy crap. So rich and creamy. It's like the big O when you shake and shiver for a good 15 seconds. Made me forget where I was for a minute and completely blind me to the previous dishes.

Would I come again? Maybe for a one night stand. Come to think of it, do I still have my ex's number?
author: Q L.

description: Went here for lunch. They get really busy so I highly recommend making a reservation. Service was great. Funny enough all three of us ordered the hamburger & all of us absolutely enjoyed it. If I ever come back, most likely I'll order it the burger again.
author: Paige J.

description:
My friend Raf and I tend to lead parallel lives.  Whenever he's going through some girl drama, I'm usually on some bad date.  We got into relationships within about a week of each other.  We both had THE same conversation with our respective bfs/gfs on THE same night (seriously).

Thus, it's no surprise that we're compatible food-wise.  When we decided to meet up and catch up (dating drama again, obv), we mutually decided on Marlowe.  After reading Yelp reviews about their burger, he knew he had to get that.  I decided to go for the steak tartare (it's an appetizer but it's a pretty good size) and two deviled eggs.

Deviled eggs: 5 stars.  If you're a fan of these delicious little nuggets of orgasm, you'll love the ones they have at Marlowe.
Steak tartare: 3 stars.  Not sure what it was about theirs, but I've had much better steak tartare at Cafe Claude.

The best part about my meal was that it was just enough to leave room for dessert, so of course we had to have some.  Our waitress was kind enough to tell us that the desserts were actually pretty small and served in cute little jars, so I went for the Upside-Down Apple Crisp.  And damn, it's small.  With the unique bourbon ice cream and the brown butter caramel sauce, I could've just eaten a huge pot of this for my meal and called it a day.  Seriously.

Overall a good dining experience.  Parking is easy at night, which is a bonus, and everyone there, from the hostess to the bartender to our waitress, was really nice.

And yes, we're both still in a relationship.  Just not with each other.
author: Tori S.

description:
I came here at 5:45pm Wednesday and had no trouble securing 2 seats at the bar. Most empty tables were reserved.

Brussel Sprout Chips -- Good! It has a lemon undertone, but got oily and salty real quick. Note: Eat fast and share generously.

Bone Marrow -- The accompaniments were salted to the moon. Be sure to taste it before putting it on your precious marrow! It's really rich, so be prepared.

Polenta -- Delicious! It's heavy though. There's egg yolk, truffle, and cheese.

Marlowe Burger -- By this time, I'm pretty overwhelmed by the richness and the saltiness of the 2 small plates. I wasn't in the best place to judge how this tasted.

Overall, I felt that we should have just split the bone marrow and polenta. They were a bit too generous with the salt and oil for my taste. It was a heavy and indulgent meal for 2 small ladies.
author: Mimi X.

description: Food was freaking amazing and we didn't wait long for a table or food.  The drinks were delicious. And prices are decent! I'm definitely going here again!!
author: Jules S.

description: This is a beautiful restaurant with exceptional service. I had a 730 pm reservation and arrived early and was seated right away. I ordered the Brussel Sprouts, which was my favorite dish. My main was the polenta and I also ordered a side of the cauliflower mac n cheese, which was way too salty. The polenta was a bit too rich. Food gets 4 stars, but the service knocked it out of the park.
author: Sarah K.

description: Brunch setting - great chicken sandwich, disappointing smoked salmon (with bagel). The reasons for this lower review are, for one, $4.00 for a diet coke seems excessive. If you want a second, no refills. I was a bit surprised to pay $8.00 for two diet cokes. Full disclosure, it is clear on the menu,...but really $4 for a glass of diet coke? Secondly, the service was aloof and absent. At one point, we had to get up to go another drink from the bar.
author: Jason P.

description: Everything I had here was ok, but not great. For the price they were charging, it seemed underwhelming. The final straw was that our dessert had bad fruit and the icecream was glassy from thawing and refreezing.
author: Dave R.

description: Delicious brunch and super cute decor. Drinks were tasty, but the food was the real treat. Highly recommend the deviled eggs with candied bacon & pickled jalapeno, the polenta with poached egg and mushrooms (so cheesy and yum), and the burratta tartine with candied bacon.
author: Mackenzie L.

description:
1 star because zero is not an option.

This restaurant is a total MISS, starting from the decor and overall style of the restaurant not matching the menu whatsoever. Walked into the restaurant and the a/c was "broken", so temperature was quite uncomfortable. A phone call in advance to let us know would've been nice.  Food was horrible. Started with the GEM salad which was doused with cilantro or tarragon and completely overwhelmed the flavor. Next was the burrata toast which was a failed attempt at the chef trying to be creative and elevate a perfect staple of italian cooking. The peanut spread with cumin or coriander was horrible. Marrying middle eastern spices with italian cheese is the worst idea ever. Lastly, was the chicken which happened to be tender though once again laced with middle eastern spices - not at all commensurate with the supposed American theme of the restaurant. 

Our waitress with zero personality did not save the meal either.

Do not go.
author: Todd D.

description:
If you haven't been to Marlowe, then you should go... cause did you know, their brussels sprouts chips are like wow?! (That's fo sho')

- Accessible by Muni (get off at the Ballpark stop)
- Small space
- Menu is a little bit limited 

Brussels sprout chips- 4 stars. I absolutely hate brussels sprouts so I was amazed by the brussels sprout chips. The nasty flavor of brussels sprouts is masked by salt and lemon, giving it a unique taste. I def. recommend trying this.

Steak tartare- 3 stars. Tasted average, I was looking for sauce or seasoning to give it some kick but it wasn't there.

Polenta- 4 stars. I loved the consistency of the dish (not too mushy like grits). The flavors went well together and the mushrooms were delicious.

Tcho Chocolate Cream Pie- 3.5 stars. This was very creamy but super rich (yet not thick/heavy). I liked the seasalt & graham cracker crust. Good for sharing with someone because it can be a bit overwhelming.
author: Emily C.

description:
Marlowe is exactly the happy, beautiful, lovely, perfect neighborhood restaurant that serves the delicious kind of food I want to eat everyday.   

It's EVEN better than before.  BRAVO.
author: J. SOMA S.

description: This place is great and  I would like it better if they used grass fed beef but I guess you can't have it all.   The quality of the food for the price can't be beat.   Hands down best french fries I've had in a loooong time.   I also had the cod in coconut sauce and it was perfect.  Great drinks too!  My boyfriend had the steak and he loved it.
author: Monnia O.

description:
Loved it! 

My friend and I showed up right when they opened so we didn't have to wait but the place was busy within minutes. I ordered the BBQ braised lamb burger and my buddy ordered the crispy chicken sandwich. Both delicious!

I saw some Brussels sprout chips that I wish I ordered cuz they looked real good. Next time!
author: Neek W.

description:
This place is a very nice place to have a good dinner.  I took the GF here for her birthday dinner.  I made reservations a week prior.  It was a good thing I did because it was so crowded.  

Upon entering this establishment, the hostess asked us if we had reservations.  I told her yes, although we were about thirty minutes early.  We were seated in this snug little area.  This place is really small, so I hope you do not mind sitting in close proximity to others.  

We decided to order bone marrow, half a dozen oysters, marlowe fries, polenta, and a wine cocktail.  The food came out in a good amount of time.  The bone marrow and oysters came out first.  The oysters and bone marrow looked very appetizing.  The bone marrow was quite oily and fatty.  I did not care for it that much, but I am sure the GF loved it.  The oysters had a type of filling which was really good.  It resembled mac and cheese.  

After we were done with those, they brought out the polenta and and fries.  The fries were extremely good.  They had a light scent of garlic to them, and they were very crispy.  As for the polenta...wow!  It was absolutely delicious.  The egg yolk gushed out as I slashed it in half.  Yum!  Exactly what you expect from a poached egg.  The plating on the dish was great, and the actual texture of the dish was rich and creamy.  

I definitely loved the atmosphere of the restaurant.  I would not mind coming back here again.  The customer service is the best I have had in a long time.  They make sure everything is superb and check in on how you are doing- not overdoing it, but genuinely showing that they care.
author: Victor L.

description:
I heard a lot of great things about this place, so we were a bit disappointed with our recent dinner.  The place has a great vibe, while it's in SOMA it's actually intimate and fun with a warm and neighborhoody feel like it's been there for a while.  The service was friendly and attentive.

We started with the artichoke chips and crab souffle.  The chips were greasy, salty and not very crispy, so we had a few and pushed the dish away.  A bummer but we were looking forward to the next dish.  When it arrived we were both disappointed that the crab was just sitting on the plate, around the small souffle, it looked dry and just scattered there, I expected that it would be worked into the dish.  The actual souffle was just OK but not great, it tasted more like an omelette, not fluffy and light.

For the entrees we had the burger, pork belly and little gem salad.  The pork belly was nice, well prepared, lean, great flavor and the salad was a perfect pairing, it cut the richness and gave a nice acidic balance to the dish.  The burger was just OK, it was a bit thin and while my husband asked for it to be medium, it was well done when it arrived, the fries were good.

To finish off our meal, I hand an espresso and we ordered the strawberry and rhubarb crisp, which when arrived was basically ice cream with some fruit crisp that in the dark honestly looked like granola.  

I'm not sure what happened here, we tried a lot of dishes and were not impressed, half of them just weren't great at all.  While our bill with tip and two glasses of wine was around $100, it just wasn't a great meal and we expected much better based on the reviews.
author: Inga W.

description: I must say this place was a disappointment. My wife and I went there for lunch, had the devil egg sandwich and the shrimp roll. The devil egg sandwich wasn't bad but wasn't super, nor was it hot. The shrimp roll was like so limed up, it felt like I was eating shrimp lime on a soggy roll. Service and decor was good, our table was well attended. I'll pass on this place even though it's like a block away from my place.
author: Christopher N.

description: Great experience. Was able to score seats even on new years and last minute. First they offered a seat in the back patio (pass kitchen and restrooms and isolated from main restaurant area) but we didnt like it and they graciously changed us to bar area next to door. I had a great fish dish and the rest of group had the burger. All of us liked our meal. I wouls go back anytime. Very cozy and great meal.
author: Susana G.

description:
Brussels sprout chips and Marlowe burger = heaven!

I am not normally a fan of "fancy restaurant burgers". I usually find them too overbearing or unnecessarily large. But Marlowe knows how to whip together a mean burger. The horseradish combo with the burger, and the french fries cooked to perfection... sigh... daydreaming of that burger now.
author: Stephanie L.

description: brussel sprout chips, steak tartare, and okra fries. no additional details needed, and these dishes are the must try in my book. enjoy!
author: Darlene Y.

description:
Just another 5-star review to add to the hype of this Marlowe burger! 

It really, really is drip down your chin juicy with all the layers of flavors that I love from the horseradish aioli, cheddar cheese, caramelized onions AND BACON! Then the crisp, fries with more horseradish fries next to it is just as good.

I am not a veggie person... cheese on Brussels sprouts? Puh-lease, I have never fell for that one. But the Brussels Sprout chips are so light and crisp with just a hint of lemon and sea salt. If you can make me eat Brussels Sprouts, then ya really got something good goin on!

There's something special about a place when you and your coworkers are constantly playing around with the reservation box on Yelp to see what reservations are available for lunch or dinner on any given day!!
author: S Y.

description:
After reading all the great reviews, I had high expectations for this place... however, I was kind of disappointed. Place is located near the caltrain station... plenty of street parking... mostly metered. However, it was 25 cents an hour... so it wasn't too bad. Made reservations for 2 around 7pm. Pretty cool date place, but it can get pretty loud and it's pretty dim inside.

So onto the food... ordered the crispy brussels sprout chips... and wish we ordered another order. It was really good. Had a nice crisp and the lemon juice complimented the chips really well. Got the roasted bone marrow, it was my first time eating bone marrow... so I didn't know what to really expect. I was kind of sad since I'm not sure if it wasn't heated enough but my bone marrow only melted half way... so the other half was still solid and I didn't have enough spread. I was tempted to steal some of my friends spread... but that would be cruel. Oh well! Got the Marlowe Burger and was expecting to be blown away... but I was kind of disappointed because there was a lingering burnt aftertaste. First I thought it was because my bun was over toasted but I looked and it looked fine to me. I looked through each ingredient and couldn't figure out where the burnt taste was... which was driving me crazy. It may have been the caramelized onions... I'm not sure... but it wasn't a pleasant taste... it basically ruined my burger. I had to throw a lot of the aioli sauce to cover the burnt taste... but then my burger just tasted like horseradish aioli. The fries were really good though... had a nice crunch. Extremely good while hot, but it still tasted good and was crunchy even at the end of the meal when it was cold. For dessert, the upside down strawberry crisp looked really good so we shared that. I really liked the ice cream but then I was haunted by the damn burnt taste again... so I'm assuming it was because of the caramel sauce.  Luckily there were some fresh berries that I could eat with it to hide the taste... but then I ran out of berries so I had to stop eating it :(.

Overall, the meal was alright. Service was great and our waitress checked on us multiple times to make sure everything was alright. Maybe next time I'll ask for the caramelized stuff to be excluded or whatever was causing that burnt taste. Not sure if it was an off night or not but the brussel sprout chips are definitely worth coming out for!
author: Johnson S.

description: Came here on a weekday around 6pm. No waiting at the bar. The service was great and the bartender was very attentive. We ordered a few small dishes. The Brussels sprouts were a plus. I loved the crispy taste. Bone marrow tastes the same everywhere. The duck pate was very flavorful. Would definitely recommend the place.
author: Vivian N.

description: Great atmosphere! I ordered the oysters which were delicious but on the smaller side so I would recommend getting another appetizer or dish to pair with them if you're on the hungry side. I loved the wait staff and was pleased with my experience there.
author: Heather P.

description:
{ overall : 4 stars }

{ food : 4 stars }
* brussels sprout chips, 4.5 stars
* baked oysters, 4 stars
* deviled egg, 3.5 stars
* steak tartare, 4.5 stars
* burger, 3.5/4 stars (needs pickles or pickled something)
* pork chop, 4.5/5 stars
* steak, 4.5/5 stars
* char/grill on the meats are perfect, adds so much flavor, great cook temp
^ cauliflower soup, so... it pains me to have to say this, cause i LOVE marlowe... but i'm pretty sure i got food poisoning from the soup/raw oyster.  my husband had the same thing, but his own oyster and didn't get sick... so i think i was the unlucky one.  i will definitely still frequent marlowe, since i love this place and i usually like their oysters too! before this incident, i would've given marlowe 4.5 stars overall

{ atmosphere : 4 stars }
* cute / hipster-ish?
* clean, always a +
* small

{ service : 4 stars }
* staff is always friendly
* staff can get busy at times and service has been slightly slower as a result

{ tips }
* make reservations, not required but definitely a nice to have
* street parking and garage available (garage in the beacon/safeway building, may be others near by as well)
author: Tina F.

description: After all those rave reviews, I was disappointed. I had the burger at the sister restaurant, Cavaliere, and that was mouthwatering. What happened here? What's with all the stuff? I thought it was too much horseradish but that's just me. We ordered a half dozen oysters because that's all we could afford. Wish we could have had more but then again they were just okay so I'm actually glad we saved the money. My friend and I had two mediocre margaritas. The first one was a little higher end than the house for $14 and since it wasn't that great decided to downgrade for the second one to the house for $12. My friend's scallops were awesome-- the winner of the evening. Be careful what you order, you'll pay for your mistakes.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I come here mainly for the appetizers and side dishes, not really a fan of their actual entrees. 

Beef Tartare: SO DELICIOUSLY! 
Brussel Sprout Chips: MUST GET! 
Deviled Eggs: they're okay.
Roasted Bone Marrow: YUMMM 
Marlowe Fries: perfect crispiness! 

Too full from appetizers to even think about the actual entree. But you must try their specialty drink cocktails, YUMZZZ!
author: Lina C.

description:
Came here last week and tried the Marlowe burger after seeing other people's reviews.  It was good, but I'm not sure what the fuss is about.  For just a burger I prefer Brickhouse, which is just a couple blocks away.  I've been here several times though and the grilled pork chop, steak frites, deviled eggs, baked oysters, and bone marrow are all fantastic.  I'm not normally a pork person, but the pork chop was one of the yummiest I've had.

The servers and hostess are all very nice and helpful, and will go out of their way to check on you and do whatever they can to make you feel comfortable.
author: T.J. H.

description:
Loud.

One of the best burgers in San Francisco.
Easy parking.
Great deviled  eggs. They have set a new standard.
Amazing Lamb shank.
Great service and super friendly awesome people.

Come here, its great.
author: Justin S.

description: I ate at Marlow and Kronner Burger in the same week and I have to say that Marlow has a slight edge. Burger was amazing, shrimp po boys  was amazing. Great food! Don't miss this one
author: Jill T.

description:
4.5 stars. Came here for a late dinner on Friday... was heavily buzzed going in so I don't remember much.  Starving.  This place is pretty cool... it's very small and dimly lit... intimate... would be a great date place I think.  We got some BBQ oysters and brussel sprout chips and some cauliflower gratin and a bottle of wine... I don't remember much of everything except that they were all tasty.  I got the burger medium rare.  I liked it a lot.  Very simple and tasty.  Here's what I remember about it and what I can tell from looking at the picture I snapped of it.  
1. It was more bun than patty.  Patty was small (not just thin, but small).
2. But it was juicy and flavorful.
3. No tomato or pickle.  Onions were caramalized.  Just some chopped lettuce.
4. Melted cheddar cheese.
5. Bun was slightly toasted.
6. Two crisp slices of bacon
7. Had both some kind of aoli and I think mayo?

The burger was good.  It was a little small.  I'd rather have a bigger patty than bacon strips.  Having both aoli and mayo definitely makes it tasty.  While it was good it's not the reason I'd come back here... I'd probably order something else...  we also got dessert, but by that time I was too far gone to have any idea what it was...

But overall this place is cool.. hip... trendy...cozy... good service...everything is just done well... a little pricey for what comes down to some pretty simple foods.. but that's to be expected.
author: Easter E.

description: Polenta would be amazing if it was 3/4 polenta and 1/4 of the veggies on top. The veggies were overbearing, and I found myself digging threw it to get to the polenta.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I don't normally like to go for a restaurant where you gave to make your reservation his far in advance, but this time it's worth it. 

Tables are small and crowded but it doesn't feel overstocked or too loud . 

Mushroom soup! So good, delicious thick mushroom broth and hill ice render fresh mushrooms. Not too creamy do you can really taste the shrooms.

Brussels sprout chips! A must, I've had them hooked, grilled, cheesed.. This is tge first time I liked them . Fried to thin  and crispy  perfection. 

Pork chop. The most tender piece if swine I've ever eaten.the generous portion feels more like double chop. Coked to perfection! 

Flour less chocolate tort... Good!
author: Ben L.

description: Good but I was expecting more. The gem salad was fantastic while the fried pistachios were too much. The steak was sub-par. The burrata was good. Service overall was satisfactory.
author: Mert S.

description:
Should I say it?...I'm kinda scared...I don't want to start getting hate mail, broken windows, or slashed tires...But I have to be honest!...I have to let the people know!...Dammit, the people have a right to know!!...Come on, just let it out...everything will be fine...Okay, here goes......

*taking a deep breath*

Everyone...I have something to tell you.....

THE CRISPY FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH IS BETTER THAN THE CHEESEBURGER!

There, I said it!  Whew.  I'm sorry!  I'm sorry!  I know you all love the burger.  And so do I!  But the last 3 times I've been here, I've opted for the chicken sando and I haven't regretted it one bit!  The way the crunchiness of the chicken crust and bacon complement each other, coupled with the savoriness of the aioli sauce make the ingredients of this chicken sandwich such a perfect combination, it's like discovering proof that the world is round or that the sky is blue.  It's eye-opening.  It's awe-inspiring.  And I can truly say, this is the best chicken sandwich I've ever had.

I know, comparing a chicken sandwich to a burger is like comparing apples and oranges.  But that's just what I did.  I had half a Marlowe burger and half the chicken sandwich, side-by-side.  I ate the burger half first.  And while I stll hold the Marlowe burger as one of the best burgers out there, my mouth was really waiting to get ahold of that chicken sandwich.  And when it did....ahhhhhhhh.  Lunchtime bliss.

Finally...I'm so relieved to get that off my chest.  Yes, the fries are still like crack and I like the upside down peach crisp better than the chocolate cream pie or the lemon souffle cake.  Now if only I could find a place to nap from eating so damn much.
author: Joe M.

description:
This was kind of a surprise dinner so I didn't really have time to check out the hype. Consider yourself lucky, cause it is tough to go to a "hot spot" without some kind of perceived notion--not this time though! 
Just to get this out of the way, the area sucks. Really spoils the date looking out the back window and seeing the 7:27pm CAL-Train to Mountainview. 
Anyways, on to the food, brussel sprouts, polenta, bone marrow, and the deviled eggs (not in that order). 
The polenta is unreal. I fantasized about it literally two hours ago. Can't say enough about it. 

Everything else was excellent, all those dishes were extremely well prepared. Each had very interesting flavor profiles. 

For dessert, we had the famous 'TCHO', not for me, too rich. 

When all said and done, the restaurant was excellent, I would return. Just wished it was in a little bit better location.
author: Ben K.

description:
I was more than intrigued when a little brasserie across from the Caltrain depot caused a stir when it opened in 2010 (top 10 best new restaurant in 2010 and top 100 restaurants in the bay area for 2011). I was even more intrigued when I read the rave reviews about its burger and GASP, bone marrow? 

Soft, fatty tissue in the hollow center of an animal leg bone?! 

I'M SO THERE.

We were pleasantly surprised to see that the wine list included carafes.  For the price of 2 glasses, we were able to enjoy about 2.5-3 glasses from a carafe. 

We started off the meal with the brussel sprout chips. I don't know where brussel sprouts got their bad rap. They seem to be universally hated, but here, at Marlowe, they are transformed from bitter mini-cabbages to well, bitter mini-cabbage leaves deep fried and sprinkled with lemon and sea salt.  It's cheating, but I guess anything tastes good deep fried and sprinkled with salt.  My bf couldn't get over the slightly bitter aftertaste of the chips, but I thought they were delicious: salty and citrusy.

Next, the bone marrow. MMMMMM. The soft, rich bone marrow melted easily and tasted almost like butter, with a sweet, nutty flavor and a lighter, more delicate texture. Served on a grilled piece of bread and topped with a tangy, herby salsa verde mixture, it was heart attack heaven. 

At this point, I wasn't sure if I was carafe-wasted or bone marrow-wasted. I also had some of my bf's little gem salad, but I couldn't taste it. It was merely absorbed into my bone marrow-drunken stupor. I was lightheaded and giddy and ready for the main event.

Finally, the infamous Marlowe burger with caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli and french fries. HOLY, this was one good burger. Most burgers fall into one big greasy mess where I can't differentiate any of the components. What impressed me the most about the Marlowe burger was its ability to stay perfectly composed and how each of its components were distinctly unique.  The meat patty was juicy, tender, and perfectly medium rare. The caramelized onions were sweet and slightly gooey mixed with the melted cheese. And the bacon was smoky, salty, and a great contrast to the sharpness of the horseradish aioli. 

And when I thought I had reached the pinnacle of my meal at Marlowe, I had a french fry. Then, all hell broke loose. Seriously, the BEST fries I have had in a very, very long time. Easily, the best fries I have ever had in SF. Double, maybe triple fried, the fries were the perfect crispness on the outside and impossibly soft and airy in the middle.  When I heated up my leftover fries in the toaster oven the next day, they were still impossibly good. I'd venture to say that next-day Marlowe fries were even better than most fresh french fries I've had at restaurants! 

Marlowe is doing alot of things right... A fantastic addition to my "lives up to the hype" list in SF!
author: Monelle A.

description:
Everything here is good, just DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT order more than 2 of any of the the following in one meal like I did:

- Deviled egg - best I've ever had b/c of...fat
- Brussels sprout chips - lemony & crispy due to...fat
- Bone marrow - Average - pure fat
- Burger - Very good (though not the best ever) -  super juicy b/c its basically fat between 2 buns (that are also covered in fat)
- Chocolate cream pie - Addictive salty, sweet, smooth and crunchy - fat (& sugar)

Reservations are a must - gets full within 30 mins of opening. Nice servers, cramped quarters in a relaxed atmosphere, I'd come back for more of the...................[drops dead from a coronary]


****UPDATE****
Brunch at new location - the place looks kinda like a French bistro mated with a bathroom, but thats OK - the portions are small but clean and solid. I'd skip the french toast soldiers, but the polenta and salads are tasty. They also do a damn good soft egg.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Having continuously mourned the lack of quality New American restaurants in SF since leaving Seattle, I stumbled upon this (not-so) little gem last week - and now, at last, I can rest easy knowing that I won't have to wait for my infrequent visits back North for great tasting New American.

My friend and I ordered the Anson Mills polenta and grilled Niman pork chop for entrees, the smoky cauliflower gratin as a side, and the upside-down peach crisp for dessert. The polenta, something I've become a big fan of in recent months, while lacking in meat, was still delicious, albeit a bit salty when not eaten with the polenta itself. The pork chop was also tasty, with a tender interior and a nicely seared and crispy exterior. Likewise, the cauliflower gratin, almost like a mac & cheese, was good as well, tasting mostly of cheese and prosciutto - certainly not a bad thing.

The only thing that was a bit lacking was the peach crisp - served in a mason jar, it was by no means bad, or even mediocre, but the ice cream lacked bourbon flavor, and the caramel sauce easily overwhelmed the rest of the dessert. Oh, and service, while not terrible, could have been a tad more polite/patient. But, overall, a restaurant I'll be coming back to, and with friends in tow!
author: Johnny W.

description:
Marlowe has AMAZING baked oysters! It's a must try! Marlowe advertises them as "New England chowder in a shell", although traditional chowder usually consists of clam. They're very creamy and garnished with bacon bits and green onion. Don't let the fact that they're $3 a piece steer you away from giving at least one a try.

The spiced jumbo gulf shrimp, served with a hot & boozy cocktail sauce, is very flavorful. The shrimp are huge and perfectly seasoned. The heads are included, if you like those (not me though). Again, relatively expensive at $13 for about five shrimps per order.

The burgers/sandwiches are very delicious as well. They're tall, so if you have a small mouth, you might need to squish them before taking a bite. You get to choose between side fries or side salad. Their fries are very fresh, crispy, and addicting (any type of fries is addicting, but Marlowe's is addicting). If you opt for a side salad instead, note that it's only greens, ie: no tomatoes or anything else, served with a light but tasty dressing.

I had the crispy fried chicken sandwich, which was surprisingly very juicy for white meat. The batter was very oily and salty, very reminiscent of fried oysters batter. But next time, I'll definitely try the Marlowe burger. If the restaurant name is in the burger name, must be their specialty, right?
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Brussels spourts were burnt and too lemony. $9

Deviled eggs is half an egg.......... For $2.50 for half a bite

Wait was 1 hour long

Entree still waiting for it 45 mins later....

Most disappointing was the bone marrow, $13, my piece had less than 1/4 a spoonful of marrow.... Wtf 


RIP off

1 hour later i am still sitting here with no entree.. About to walk out

So my steak finally came. ... All i can taste is salt

Worst 65$ spent. Wont be coming back

At least the severs are diligent about filling my water cup. Sad

My bf is very hungry and sad right now.
This meal pissed me off. Worst meal we've had in a long time
author: Juan C.

description:
Everything about this place was just Ok for our group. The Brussel sprouts were nothing special at all- not sure why there are so many positive reviews about them. The deviled eggs were extremely good - highly recommend them. The Marlowe burger..... Was it good? Definitely. Should it be considered in any SF top burger ranking? No. 

And no draft beer?
author: Patrick D.

description:
This will easily become one of my favorite restaurants in SOMA.  Here are three reasons why:

1) It's quaint and decorative.  When you walk in, you feel very festive!

2) It's in a great location, right next to the Caltrain station and right next to my apartment.  If you want a few drinks ahead of time, you can go to 25 Lusk happy hour then walk on over.

3) The food was fantastic.  I ordered the burger and mussels as the appetizer.  You can't really go wrong with what you order here, so try something new!

Overall, a GREAT DATE SPOT.  If you bring a significant other, try to get the corner table so you can sit right next to one another and admire the entire restaurant.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Small place small menu but Marlowe packs a punch, awesome burger you can taste the char on it which I like.
Bone marrow and jumbo shrimp are another must try.
author: Nader F.

description: One of our staples when we lived in SOMA. Great all around, but the burger with a glass of red wine was the norm. The deviled eggs are the best you'll ever have period.
author: Steve M.

description:
Love Marlowe and will definitely be back. Small restaurant and small menu, however the food is delicious with simple, organic ingredients. 
Must have the Roasted Bone Marrow appetizer! 
Dinner I had the Polenta w/ wild mushrooms, arugula, fresh shaved white truffles w/ a farm fresh poached egg on top. Absolutely sublime!
I love living back in San Francisco!!
author: LisaLisa F.

description: Second time here and food is as good as I remember. Was able to get a same day reservation outside on the patio. It wasn't too cold as it had canopy and heater. Highly recommend the shrimp and crab crepe (ahhmazing) and pork chop. We also ordered baked oysters which had great sauce, oysters were a bit small though. The burger was good (cooked to true medium rare but prob looking for more of a special or distinct flavor), fries were perfectly seasoned and crunchy. We were also recommended the caesar toast with poached egg which was a little disappointing - oversalted and a bit boring. Though All in all, great meal!
author: I L.

description:
Marlowe has been bookmarked on my list of restaurants to check out for a while now, and last night I finally got a chance to experience the hype. 

If you're looking for an intimate candle-lit dinner vibe with enough background noise to keep it from being awkward for a first-date spot, then Marlowe caters to that demographic. 

I ordered:
- the Marlowe burger, medium well, which comes with a side of fries and horseradish aoili for dip. 
-the grilled niman pork chop which comes in a generous portion, joins perfect with the pumpkin pudding and sauteed spinach. I didn't have any complaints about this. 
- baked oysters were amazing too, chowdery and flavorful

Marlowe also has an extensive list of sparkling wine, champagne, whites, and reds available for winos to enjoy. I definitely love my reds, and the sangiovese (piancornello) was a hit. Beer is offered, but  no hard  alcohol, which means no mixed drinks.

Great service, superb chefs, & no complaints on the presentation. 

The only thing I have to complain about is that it's too dim for me to take a picture and post it on my instagram.. even with filters. But of course that's just me whining about my first world problems.
author: Jaye C.

description:
Save yourself the hassle and the pretentious chef.  Go to In-N-Out if you want a burger.  It's $3.95 for a double-double and you know what you get.

My burger was salty as hell.  I asked for tomatoes and pickles and was told (a) they have no pickles (which is fine) and (b) The chef won't allow tomatoes on a the burger.  Apparently she is very particular about what she serves.  I then asked for a sliced tomato on the side and was quickly rebuffed.  Apparently customers are not allowed to customize their meals....I had my doubts as to whether they would allow ketchup and mustard, but to my relief, they allowed it.

In short, I wasn't a fan. I did not come in with any pre-conceived notions as I was not familiar with the place.....save yourself the disappointment and patronize another establishment.  The restaurant should kill thyself (figuratively).

My review is a big fat "Thumbs Down"
author: Brian M.

description: I am a  very picky eater and one of my friends suggested that we go here and I was skeptical they have a lot of things on the menu that I have never eaten before. But I loved everything I had from first bite of the chips to the last drop of dip. The only problem was the long wait. I was hungry when we got there but I was starving by the time we was seated.
author: Brittney M.

description: We sat on the patio which was so cute so charming so fun. Service was excellent! Polenta dish was awesome and, though vegetarian, was filling and burger was great too! Deviled eggs were to-die-for! :) Beautiful experience!
author: Breanna K.

description:
Came here twice, didn't get to write a review after the first time before the second time, so I'm going to split up the reviews for both experiences and just let ya'll fine Yelpers decide from there. 

Review 1: 2 stars
Came here for dinner with a reservation at 8:30. Didn't get seated until 9:10. Ordered our food. And it didn't come until 10. So... lots of waiting. No apologies. They didn't even comp our corkage fee or provide any sort of acknowledgement that we nearly waited two hours. 

I ordered the burger medium. Not only did it come out well done, they forgot to put the caramelized onions on the burger. For all the hype that I've heard about the burger, it really did not meet expectations. I couldn't even finish it because it was so dry and unappetizing. I also had a bite of the pork chop, and it was good, I particularly liked the risotto that it came with. The deviled eggs were very good, although expensive. 

Review 2: 4 stars
I only came here because my bf's brother beat me in Yelping about our horrid experience at Marlowe and was contacted by the general manager to try coming in for lunch, on the house. He asked me if I wanted to join, so I did, and this experience was much better, although it could always be because they knew we were Yelpers(?) 

Anyway, we were seated right away. I got the rock shrimp roll, he got the burger, and we also got the cauliflower dish. Cauliflower was really good, like mac'n'cheese but cauliflower. Super yummy. The rock shrimp roll was good, I'd rate it a 4/5. And he said the burger was delicious. (Maybe I just have to give the burger another shot). We also ended with the strawberry crisp which was delicious. 

The food did still take a long time to come out after we placed our order, but maybe that's just a Marlowe thing, I'm guessing everything is made to order. 

Wow, long review. Would I come back? Yes. I live right around the corner, they do have good food overall, and I do really like the atmosphere. Next things to try: the slow braised bbq lamb sandwich, the mushroom side dish, and I'd take another shot at the burger too.
author: Tiffany C.

description: If yer looking for superb bartending and food ask Gavine the Irish who will prepare for u any cocktail and recommend best items in the menu
author: Eleonora M.

description:
What a fun meal! 

We arrived a little after opening and they were able to seat us within 30 minutes at the bar. 

The bartender was friendly and fairly attentive. The only downfall throughout my experience was the slowness of food delivery. We felt like we were there forever. 

Even though the courses came slowly, they were spectacular. We had the brussel sprout chips and they were tasty, but not worth the price. We also ordered the deviled egg and that was simply delicious! It had everything, salt, tart, spice and everything nice.

Then we ordered their bone marrow, we always order the bone marrow, and they were good. They place on the top three of all the ones we've ever tasted. The chile verde-ish topping completely balances the salty, fatty, umami flavor of the marrow. We loved it.

I ordered the sweet corn soup. It was delicious and tasted liked butter popcorn. I could have used a bit more chili oil but it was good as is. 

I tasted my boyfriend's dish, I cannot recall what it was, but the meat was super tender and the flavor was divine. I stole a few bites to his dismay. 

Finally, we had the dessert. GET THEM!!! We ordered the strawberry one and the chocolate salted one with bourbon ice cream, both were simply amazing. The strawberry one was the best!!! We were licking the bottom of the jars for the morsel! Also, the flavor of the bourbon was pronounced in a good way! 

I cannot wait to come back. Try it, you won't regret it.
author: Elsvette B.

description:
This place just oozes hip coziness.  Came here with a man friend with an expense account so we went to town.  Everything is dark and sexy but comfortable, in a not trying too hard kind of way - I like.  However, it was raining (I know, cue the violins) that night, and there is not much in the way of a front waiting area, so I kind of felt like I was in the way of everyone as I tried to shove myself in a corner while sipping on my seasonal cocktail.  I digress...

Brussels sprouts chips - Amaze.  Do it.  The lemon is really what elevates this dish.

Deviled eggs - If you do not like deviled eggs, I can not be your friend.  I am sorry. Pretty hard to mess these up, but they make me smile and hard to be mad at bacon and jalapeno.

Day Boat Scallops - I have had the famed burger before (delish), and if I am not a Brussels sprouts whore, then surely I am a scallops whore.  That's right.  Whore.  They are sexy and meaty and delicious and make me feel like I might be eating something healthy. The porcini crusting was a delight.

I didn't have the dessert, I prefer to get my calories from protein, fat, and liquor over carbs.  However, I've always been bad at saying no, so indulged in a few bites of the upside down strawberry crisp.  Bourbon ice cream.  Caramel brown butter.  Okay, so maaaaybe I had more than a couple of bites.
author: Michelle M.

description: Marlowe is one of my fav places to eat.  The food tastes great every time.  The staff is great too and service is excellent.  I always get the brussel chips with lemon zest.  They are amazing.  The deviled eggs are amazing too.  The coffee is delish!!!
author: Liz M.

description:
Dangit.

I had you bookmarked on Yelp since 3/19/2010.

I waited 2+ years to visit you and enjoy your goodness.

I've heard so many great things about you... the burger that was on the 7x7 list of best SF burgers.

The many times I thought, "oh, let's (finally) go try Marlowe. Oh wait, no reservations available? Maybe next time."

FINALLY came here last week. Had the burger.

Walked away semi-sad face. Maybe I made up in my mind that this was going to be the best burger ever before I got there, so I was either going to be "just satisfied" or terribly disappointed... Either way... the latter is how I felt as I walked out the door.

It was a sad drive home.
author: Victor C.

description:
I haven't been back to Marlowe since my birthday awhile ago, and I have to say they definitely worked out their kinks.

Park Tavern didn't have any reservations until late, so we opted to celebrate a friend's birthday at Marlowe.  

To order:
Brussel Sprout Chips
Fries with Aioli Sauce
Porkchops (came with Polenta)
Poule Vert

The cake cutting service was a little slow, but overall a much better experience than the previous one.  I will definitely be back for the burger!
author: Carli F.

description: I was told Marlowe is a must when in SF and now I see why :) I had the marrow and asapragus, with a few drinks. Great ambiance and decor - I loved the marble bar. I recommend this place and would definitely come back again to try the rest of the menu!
author: Janell M.

description: I'm a regular patron of Park Tavern and Cavalier, I've been a long time supporter of Marlowe as well however I feel like it's time to breakup with the overrated snotty attitude that has become the new norm at my once beloved Marlowe. News flash your burgers aren't that AHH-MAZING to the point you need to become defensive when a customer asks for avocado. I was really embarrassed during my most recent visit. I suggested a quick bite at Marlowe with 2 friends that had not been I was talking it up quite a bit. We entered around 6pm, it was empty we must have been the only ones in the restaurant and had to ask to be seated, the hostess replied in an annoyed tone, "yeah sure I guess I can seat you at a table....but we are going to need it back in about 45 minutes" slightly taken back and confused we agreed and sat down, mind you the place is EMPTY (I guess I know why) when it came time to order I requested avocado for my burger and the server's response was our burgers are famous just as they are we can not support any modifications what so ever! So I asked simply for a side of avocado to place it on the burger myself, that request was also also refused despite stating they had avocado in the kitchen, it's not like they were out. I understand that there are limited places to dine in the area however I would of gladly trekked across town and ordered a burger at SPRUCE with a side of avocado and not been given an attitude or felt rushed to eat.
author: Samantha E.

description: Burger only: this place has a decent burger. It's juicy, delicious and the bread is good. The service was top notch and they were always a little behind but for their amount of rush I thought the service was great. They screwed up my order and gave me fries instead of a salad and they just gave me both instead for their mistake.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Super tasty, super trendy spot in soma neighborhood.  I had the braised lamb sandwich and my friend had the burger, both were great!
The place has a great decor, the wall of quotes on the storefront are a great way to entertain yourself while waiting.
author: stephen N.

description: Loved the food so much. Every dish was wonderful. The noise level made it impossible to talk without almost yelling.  Also, what's with the heavy duty plastic take-home bag.  Aren't we trying to get rid of plastic and save the planet.  Come'on, use paper!
author: Susan B.

description: The redesign makes this place more efficient without sacrificing on the quality of food. The Marlowe Burger is still one of the best burgers in town, no doubt. I'd like to see more variety in the menu, but everything here is good so you can't go wrong.
author: Darius T.

description:
Found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out because of the good ratings.
Here's my review summary:

Service= okay
The server was knowledgable with wine choices but didn't check with us in a timely manner.  
Wine= good, the list was pretty interesting.
Food= it was okay.  Nothing really stood out.  Menu was limited. No interesting seafood choices.
Place/ambiance= i like how casual it is.

Someone asked if how that place was.  My answer "it was aight".
author: Learnee L.

description: Management reached out to address my anti-climatic experience and offered a complimentary meal. Additional star for CRM.
author: Tee N.

description:
Quite the hot spot. Came here after a Giants' game on Saturday. Place was packed by 5:45pm. The restaurant is not that big. There is a huge beam that goes through a table, so it's not that great for large groups. But otherwise the decor was nice and simple. 

The appetizers and salads looked nice, particularly the shrimp plate. 

I got the cod. It was good but on the saltier side. 

Overall a nice joint. Good for a slightly fancier hang out or date night type of place.
author: Judy L.

description: Great dinner chicken with olive and grapes was excellent. The artichoke chips was also delicious
author: Ralph M.

description:
Items selected:  
Baked Oysters - New England Clam Chowder in a Shell
Sauteed Wild Mushrooms with Grilled Bread, Truffle, Poached Egg
Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich with Caesar Aioli, Bacon, Field Greens
Upside Down Strawberry Crisp with Bourbon Ice Cream and Brown Butter Caramel Sauce

Unbeknownst to me it was National Bourbon Day when I visited Marlowe and with folks celebrating heavily even at 2:00pm on a Friday I found the small restaurant packed on my arrival, a lone seat at the bar waiting in one of SoMA's hottest restaurants where a young bartender named Tanessa, stood mixing cocktails and slinging shots while also serving up great recommendations from the small menu of reimagined and refined comfort foods.  Bustling but never loud and kitschy yet comfortable the majority of my visit focused on Chef Jennifer Puccio's classic dishes and working from the best oyster preparation I've had outside of 'Oysters and Pearls' to an umami-bomb of mushrooms and egg tamed by a tangle of greens before finally taking on a veritable fried chicken Caesar salad on a light, airy roll it would be difficult to call any of the savories anything less than entirely satisfying; the effect of great ingredients placed in very skilled hands and a trend that carried over to dessert when I too celebrated the holiday with an oaky, smoky jar of slowly melting strawberry crisp.
author: Michael U.

description:
I definitely recommend dinner at Marlowe if you are with a small group. We ordered brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, bone marrow, and baked oysters for appetizers. All appetizers were delicious, especially the deviled eggs! They top the deviled eggs with bacon bits for a meaty touch. 

I would not order two appetizers if returning; baked oysters were over-salted and portion size of the bone marrow was very small. I occasionally roast bone marrows at home and the ones I purchase for roasting are triple the size and half the price compared to Marlowe's. The main dish of the "Marlowe Burger" cooked medium was also a hit and the combination of fries+horseradish dip was the best complement!   

I would definitely return with reservations since parking was easy and at a very reasonable price (I think $.50/hr) after 6pm.
author: Winnie L.

description:
I was staying in SoMa, and looking for a quick, but nice, place to stop in by myself for dinner.  The small bar was quite cramped (as is the whole restaurant).  I was surprised they didn't have a full bar selection, and the beer and wine list is very limited.  I suppose that goes hand in hand with being a small space.

The food was OK, but not memorable.  I got the the deviled egg and duck liver toasts to start.  I got the pork chop as my entree.  The greens didn't have a lot of flavor, but the chop and pesto risotto were quite good.

I could see into the kitchen as staff went in and out, and there were pots and pans sitting on the floor.

Overall, it was good but I was hoping for something a little bit more.
author: Andy M.

description:
Been here twice. Once in 2011 or 2012. And once last week.

Over the years, my only complaint is their menu isn't big enough. Otherwise everything I tried was good - and I sampled a lot the first time I came here.

Nonetheless, get their brussels sprout chips. It's probably their most iconic dish. I believe it's flash-fried and nicely flavored with some lemon - though my description doesn't do it justice. Just get it.
author: Elena C.

description: Hate to say it. We came here for my friend's birthday and it was our first time trying the restaurant. Had reservation at 9:15. Got sat around 9:30. Food came out quick. It was good. Maybe because we were starving already. The restaurant doesn't close until 11 so we were enjoying our drinks and picking at the food. Our waiter Ernesto decides to come by and pretty much wanted to take everything away... even tho there was a fair amount left.... okay rude. We were just unfortunate to have such a mean waiter that night that completely ruined our meal because he couldn't smile one bit. Obviously he thought oh yeah girls aren't gonna tip well. (I read other reviews about him giving shitty service to certain parties). On top of everything, I asked him nicely if they do anything special for birthdays and he rudely replies we put a candle on any dessert you decide to order. Sure so we ordered. Good thing the nice hostess lady came by told us it was on the house. When we asked for the bill we told him cash and the rest on the card. And he had the nerve to ask "is the cash including the tip...??" I've never had anyone ask me that question. I am a server myself. And if the customer wishes to pay cash first and the rest on the card then just settle the amount that way. I honestly did not believe he deserved a single tip with his attitude and service. There is no excuse whether it was the end of the night vs the beginning of the shift. We are paying customers and would like decent service esp since we are celebrating a birthday. If I ever decide to return again I am going to make sure he's not my waiter so my dinner won't be ruined.
author: Cori N.

description:
I was scrambling last minute to find a place for my birthday dinner for a group of 12. It was not easy when my requirements were 1) close to Caltrain or Bart in SF, 2) for a party of 12, 3) at the prime time for dinner, and 3) 2$ with good reviews. So I was ecstatic when Marlowe was able to accommodate me. 

I remember my taste buds were very intrigued by the novel taste in every dish that we ordered... I'd definitely come back here again.
author: Celia W.

description:
4.5 Stars. 

Appetizers: Roasted bone marrow with parsley and some sort of side sauce, and duck liver mousse crostini. Both were decadent and delicious. I'm a huge fan of roasted bone marrow and they split a generous sized bone down the middle length for easy marrow access. It was perfectly cooked. The duck mousse was rich and delicious. 

We shared the steak frites as a main course and the steak was perfectly cooked medium rare and the fries were hot, fresh and extremely tasty. Dessert was Pana Cotta and was fabulous. I had a decent espresso.

Above all, service was friendly, gracious and enthusiastic. Even the bus-boys were engaging and polite. My water glass was kept full. The decor was modern and comfortably homey at the same time.
author: Jordan C.

description:
I love that this place is walking distance from my office. I can get here just in time for happy hour. It's a small place, so you can't have huge parties here. It's a good restaurant for an intimate dinner or just some drinks with a few friends. 

Love their brussels sprouts. Just the right amount of saltiness and crispiness, but not burnt. You get a good portion of it too, not like other places where you get like 4 and have to share each piece with your friends (lame!). Get the burger. It's so juicy and tender. Something about the combination of caramelize onions, aioli and a juicy piece of beef patty. Just delicious. Paired with a glass of red wine. Just heaven.
author: Rosie W.

description: Went here for brunch during Pride and loved it. Had the ricotta toast, and it was so tasty. I really liked the honey on it.
author: Dominique G.

description: This place is fantastic. Had an exceptionally good meal here recently. Will be back again. Lots of traditional meat options.
author: Finbarr T.

description:
As adventurous as I am when it comes to checking out new food stuffs, I often times find myself visiting a restaurant, bar, cafe, etc... for the first time and falling in love with the first thing that touches my chapped lil' lips. Then each subsequent visit results in my sticking to the same order I rolled with during that initial romp, leaving me stuck in a habit of never venturing out of my comfort zone to try something new. Why am I telling you this? Well, it's simple: once again, I've found myself in this same predicament with Marlowe's fantastic warm, open-faced deviled egg sandwich. I just can't quit it!

Even though Marlowe has all sorts of tasty vittles to choose from, including daily specials that always sound absolutely mouth watering, I just can't manage to order anything but their deviled egg sandwich. It's the perfect portion size with a single piece of fresh, crispy bread (about the size of of a square crumpet), topped with their delectable deviled eggs and pickled chil, and blanketed in a slice of aged provolone. It comes with a side of either fries or a salad, and I typically go with the salad to get my greens in for the day, but the fries are always tasty as well. The latter comes with homemade ketchup and homemade horseradish, each of which are leaps and bounds more pleasurable than their processed, store bought counterparts (naturally).  

I've never been for dinner, but for a nice lunch in a warm part of town, you can't beat it. Prices are a little steep if you're looking for a quick meal before heading back to your cubicle, but if you can afford to kick back and enjoy your lunch without stress of rushing back to the office to tackle a deadline, you're bound for a lovely experience.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Marlowe is thi-i-i-is close to amazing! Incomparable brussels sprouts chips, intensely delicious baked bone marrow and the fries were a 10+.

While we were waiting for our food, we were talking about what makes a restaurant experience so good that we go back time and again. We agreed, of course, that the food has to be excellent, but the service is equally important. I'm on Yelp tonight to give a shout out to our waitperson, AKISHA. She doesn't just work hard, she's also friendly, attentive, knowledgable, and patient. Marlowe is lucky to have her!
author: First T.

description:
Came here with a friend after a couple drinks at a local bar. We wanted to just grab an appetizer or a snack or two... but man, have you seen the menu here?! Or smelled the smells?! As soon as I walked in, I knew I was walking into dinner. 

Marlowe is nice because it's got a really trendy vibe. It has the food to match the high expectations the ambiance sets. I really liked the vibe of the restaurant. The communal tables, the sort of rustic but contemporary look... everything about it was perfect for me.

The meal itself was great as well. I ordered the leek and potato soup, which was a lot better than I thought leeks and potatoes could ever be! My friend ordered the burger, which he said was amazing. The fries were great, too.

We also ordered the cocktail they were featuring, which was champagne + blood orange juice + some other stuff. I loved it. Not sure if it was worth $12, but I thoroughly enjoyed it nonetheless.

This place is a little off the beaten path for me (I don't typically walk toward Caltrain), but I would definitely come back. What a great place to bring a date!!
author: Jade R.

description: The deviled eggs are awesome. The ambiance is also pretty great. If you want something quite try getting a seat in the back
author: Chem P.

description: Valentine's set dinner on Sunday 14 February 2016. Food went from delicious (Argentinian inspired sirloin with chimichurri, gingerbread cake) to passable (over salted yet somewhat dull cauliflower despite truffle oil and black truffle shavings, overcooked vegetable risotto). Interior design is lovely, however, and staff very pleasant without being overtly courteous for the required 20% tip. Nota bene, price at USD 85 per head was steep but not unreasonable for a four course dinner. Altogether OK on this review though I will want to return for a "normal" night to see whether the food remains at this level or deserves a better review.
author: Wilson F.

description:
I'll keep it short and sweet:

The brussel sprout chips are something I could eat every day, indefinitely.

The pork chop was great as well, as expected.

My date and I arrived on time, and for whatever reason, our table wasn't ready.  Two seats were available the bar, and we ordered a bottle of wine.  I wasn't upset or impatient, Marlowe is a great place to be.  The hostess apologized profusely and comped wine + appetizers. Totally unnecessary.  

A big tip and great review are the least I could do.

This is the type of restaurant that makes SF great.  Unpretentious. Not exorbitant.  Fantastic food.
author: Scott H.

description:
A friend took me to lunch here today. We had no reservation, but got comfy seats at the bar right away. The service was delightful. I had the fried chicken sandwich, which was scrumptious and not as heavy as, say, a Bakesale Betty's. The dessert was TCHO Chocolate Cream Pie, which is actually served in a jar. Holy cow that was good.

But the thing I want to point out is what happened when I mis-heard the Iced Tea with White Peach Juice special as Lemonade with White Peach Juice. Our server said, "No, but I could make that for you!" She did. It was awesome. I've been promised $0.07 for every one she sells from now on. While I doubt I'll collect, go ahead and order one. It totally needs to be a thing.
author: Craig G.

description:
Came in on a Friday night with the bf and the wait for two was surprisingly only 10 minutes.  I had heard a lot of good things about Marlowe so I guess my expectations were relatively high.  The wine was decent and the food was about 3.5 stars.

We ordered the brussel sprout chips, as recommended by Yelp.  They were good not great.  We also tried the bone marrow which was my favorite, and the burrata appetizer, which was not very good.  The burrata came with melon and prosciutto and I think the chef definitely had a heavy hand with the salt shaker.  The natural saltiness of the prosciutto should complement the burrata, but the burrata and the greens that accompanied it were extremely salty as well.  Salt + more salt = yuck.  The last thing we tried was their arctic char was was good, but nothing to call home about.  

Besides the burrata, the food wasn't bad, but definitely not great.  Even though the staff was very attentive, the food, in my opinion, is extremely overhyped.
author: Juliana K.

description:
excellent scallops, bone marrow, desserts, pork belly. 

great place to grab a few appetizers and drinks before catching caltrain. also an excellent place to meet with friends who are coming up from the south bay via caltrain.

friendly servers, great food, excellent drinks and dessert-- highly recommended.
author: Judy L.

description:
The staff are very very friendly. We were seated immediately and our server as well as everyone else was attentive and made sure our glasses were filled whenever needed.

I ordered the grilled calamari on chorizo flat bread with a poached egg,  It was amazing. 

I wish I could've eaten more... but my appetite wasn't there. I'll be back though because everything on the menu looks amazing!

And I love the decor. So cute and the vibe is great. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: Michelle P.

description:
Marlowe is my #1 second to my husband.
Having been a regular for 4 years, I would recommend starting your dinner off with the Butcher's mistress (or wife) and then a cocktail and some deviled eggs.
The menu changes so try as much as you can when you go, in the event it's not offered during your next visit!
Keep it simple: get the burger!
author: Alex T.

description:
The Burger is definitely NOT the best in the city.  Was highly unimpressed, as the patty was tiny (1/4 pounder with cheese maybe?) and the fixings were sparse.  All I really could really taste was the shear amount of bun.  Was let down through social media.  Stick to NOPA if you want an epic burger to write home about.

The wine list was great, service was slow.
author: Colin M.

description: The burger was very good and cooked perfectly. Fries were good but a bit salty. I didn't like the burrata appetizer- it was too heavy on the balsamic and the toast was soggy from everything being put on it- I prefer burrata to be served whole with the bread separate. The tomatoes were good and it looked pretty however. Service was good, drinks were kept refilled in a timely manner. The French toast soldiers were just ok as were the dipping sauces. I am a chocolate lover so I was suprised when I actually preferred the syrup over the Mexican chocolate. The chocolate cream "pie" is a somewhat deconstructed loose interpretation of a pie- it's the filling in a glass jar on top of a sandy crumble (not a true crust), but the guittard chocolate was delicious as was the cream on top with the cocoa nibs and sea salt. The best thing I tasted there. Would recommend to try at least once if looking for a brunch place and you can make a res which I love.
author: Piper W.

description:
We had dinner there on 12/26/14. The hostess, bartender and waitress were outstanding. Top notch, A+,ect

The food was awesome.

Oysters
Pistachios
The special on the board which was a Pita bread with three dipping sauces
Brussel Sprout Chips
Bone Marrow
Pork Chops

My new go to spot.
author: Shaun E.

description:
I have been trying to make a reservation at Marlowe for quite a while and finally thought about it enough ahead of time to get a reservation.  It was full when we got there and I heard the people in front of us get told that they would have to wait 40 minutes, so not question that we needed one.

My wife and I started out splitting the buttered brussels sprouts as an appetizer, which was really terrific.  They were piping hot, with a combination of butter and lemon that really worked.  That plus some bread (have to ask for it), made a great start to the meal.  For the main course, I had the grilled Niman pork chop, which came with some spicy sauted spinach plus a tomato+vegetable ragout.  The pork chop had a lot of meat, so a very filling entry.  My wife had steak frites, which was a generous helping of meat as well.  We both really liked our entries.  Topped it off with a carafe of wine and had a great meal.

Good ambiance (though the tables are a bit tightly packed) and great service.  Definitely worth the wait!
author: Richard M.

description:
I have started to become quite unoriginal in calling restaurants my "Jack the Horse Tavern" of the ____ (insert region here), but for Brooklynites who love JtH, Marlowe comes closest. 

1. Great bar -- serious wine list including after dinner drinks, and they do mixed drinks well 
2. Best burger in town, as well as the best fries ever (though I can't have them anymore, doctor's orders)
3. Steak!!!
4. Brussels sprouts and cauliflower are now essential comfort foods here
5. Great staff -- they know their food, their wine and their customer service!
6. You're likely to find my husband and me here on any given Saturday night when we are in SF instead of Brooklyn (where you'll find us at JtH!)

The restaurant is bustling just about every night of the week, so reservations are a good idea
author: Claire A.

description:
i am surprised to realize i have not yet Yelp'ed Marlowe?!  i live in the neighborhood and have been going here since it was South (food inspiration from Down Under).  I liked South.  I like Marlowe better.  I've been out of the country for awhile, back now, it was a date night and so we went back to Marlowe.  

The food is really good -- very consistent.  It is rich.  There's a lot of meat on this menu -- all really good quality and well prepared.  OMG the little gems salad -- avocado mixture nestled into little gem lettuce leaves and topped with thinly sliced and delicately dressed market vegetables -- get that to balance out some of the richness of the brussels sprouts chips ...

Do book ahead.  the restaurant is tiny, and popular.  I heard they're moving to a bigger space where Coco500 used to be (and before that Bizou) -- I am looking forward to that.
author: Jaina S.

description:
The dining area is small and cozy with very close table seatings. They don't have a full bar, which is a bit of a downer given the dimly lit rustic ambiance.

Food was very tasty overall. The Brussels sprouts were very flavorful. The burrata on endive was playful but mysterious, with an interesting concerto of flavors and textures. The steak tartare was solid, well balanced with seasoning, with a pleasant twist of the poached egg on top rather than simply an egg yolk. The mussels themselves were very tasty but the broth was overly salted. The cauliflower side dish was cheesy goodness. The burger was very good, but unfortunately it seems a little over hyped at this point. The fries were most excellent.

The service was absent. We didn't see much of our waiter after the plates were brought, and the bill sat on the table as they walked back and forth several times.
author: Michael S.

description:
Close to the Caltrain; friendly, casual but slightly upscale vibe.

Brussel Sprouts: The crispy brussel sprout chips are better than the brown butter brussel sprouts. I thought the brown butter brussel sprouts were a bit soggy. You get a stronger flavor with the brussel sprout chips plus more texture.

Baked Oysters: While well flavored, I thought these were heavy on the cream and light on the oyster. They are supposed to be "New England clam chowder in a shell", but I guess I was expecting more oyster here.

Marlowe Burger: I thoroughly enjoyed the burger, it was juicy and well-seasoned. Well-priced and if you split this with a friend, they will serve the burger on two separate dishes and split the fries as well. Makes for a good appetizer or side dish if you want to order something else.

Grilled Niman Pork Chop: Not only does this dish look epic, it tastes epic as well. Good proportions and very tasty. The first time I went to Marlowe I ordered the scallops (probably would not order again) and saw these pork chops and immediately had entree envy.

Probably my go-to dinner place in Soma if I can get reservations beforehand.
author: Tiffany L.

description: First time at Marlowe's for brunch.  Had the crab and shrimp crepes and the buttermilk pancakes with smoked butter. The crab and shrimp crepes were excellent I wanted to lick the plate until I some of my friends buttermilk pancakes. What makes the pancakes is the smoked butter and bacon on top of the pancakes It was curl your toes and slap your Mother good.
author: Dionne M.

description: really good service but the burger was nothing memorable at all. I would even go as far as too say it didn't taste good. the fries were way better than the burger. I would consider myself kind of an expert in the area of burgers considering that's what I order when I go pretty much anywhere, not to mention I have had some world class burgers( 70 dollar cheeseburger from beau rivage room service in lake Geneva and cheeseburger from the Michelin starred four seasons George v hotel restaurant in Paris, just to name a few) so I think I know a good burger. but this burger was honestly kinda burnt tasting and the bun tasted like a grocery store bun. the meat was good but nothing to write home about, and the bacon that was supposed to be in the burger was practically nonexistent. honestly I could of had a better burger at in n out for way less!I had the Caesar toast as well which was a nice idea and was pretty good, but it's not something that I would actively seek out. I would skip this place and go somewhere else.
author: Taylor M.

description:
For a nice lunch in SoMa, Marlowe is a great place to consider. It's also probably the best option for a sit-down meal in the immediate vicinity of Caltrain.

The brussels sprout chips are amazing, do not overlook them. Everyone recommended I try the burger. I did and found it packed with flavor. They also make a different iced tea each day, also worth checking out.

You probably want to make a reservation, but it's not mandatory.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Have only been here for lunch - but good food! Not to miss - the brussel sprout chips!

I've had the open faced devil egg sandwich and the Marlowe burger. Both were pretty good,  I'd probably get the burger next time (though quite heavy for lunch). Tried their specialty lemonade but wasn't anything memorable - you can probably skip that.
author: Food E.

description: We came in today for a late lunch. My friends boyfriend recommended this place and let me just say that the food was amazing. I ordered the burger which had grilled onions, bacon, and a horseradish aioli. I asked it to be cooked well done and it was still so juicy and flavorful! We also ordered the Brussel sprout chips which were so delicious and crunchy. The topper for me was definitely the deviled egg. It was the best deviled egg I've had in my life. Haha. Overall, everything we ordered was amazing. Service was okay, since there was a little mix up with our drinks. But overall, I would definitely come back!
author: Jeanette D.

description:
The management is on it at Marlowe, and that makes a big difference with the experience. A slight fumble with warm champagne at the beginning of the meal was resolved with the management sending over four glasses of champagne while ours chilled. Nice recovery from an awkward start. 

The excellent pea pancake with salmon and creme fraiche was a great match with the champagne. They increased the order to four pieces for our party for four. I love having a tasty canape before dinner. I hope this trend continues. The stuffed sole was was really good. Looking forward to our next visit. Oh, and you have to love 25 cents per hour for parking nearby!
author: Laurie H.

description: I don't want to forget about this place! Super yummy food. Tables were a little tighter than average, but not unpleasant. I'm adding it here so I remember to go again.
author: Amy F.

description:
Absolutely love this place!

Been here twice already and each time I've left feeling completely satisfied. The restaurant itself isn't too big but I love how they spaced their tables (not too close where you end up feeling cramped). Also, their wait staff was very attentive and polite and of course their food was delicious!

Loved:
- Brussel Sprout chips: Pretty addicting and great for snackin' on when waiting for the rest of your food
- Burgers: Great burger and the fries were right up my alley. Super crispy!
- Pan Seared Day Boat Scallops: The scallops were delicious and it came with bacon wrapped asparagus, mushrooms, and pease in a white cream sauce. The dish was perfectly balanced to me.
- Prices: Superrrr affordable for great food!

Can't wait to come back to try the rest of the menu.
author: Teese N.

description:
We've only eaten there twice and both times food was excellent.  Service across the board--from hosts to managers to servers--is fantastic, some of the best I've encountered in San Francisco.  Professional, attentive, friendly.  

My only complaint is that the tables are very close together and coupled with the lack of noise insulation it makes hearing your dining companion(s) a very difficult task.
author: Thespa D.

description: Came here for lunch and got to try the famous Marlowe burger. It was solid from what I remember, but not the best in SF. I also tried the brussels sprout chips AND the brown buttered brussels and both were great; the chips especially! Although it's no high on my list to come back, I'd definitely recommend it and wouldn't mind another visit. :)
author: Erica L.

description:
This is not a place for those on a diet, but rather for those who truly want to indulge in a very fun, lively (albeit dimly lit) environment.

Everything we ordered was incredible. a HUGE thanks to my brother's girlfriend for making reservations since ever by 8:45 there was still a line on Friday.

We shared everything (some might say "fought over") and even REordered certain items like the Roasted Bone Marrow.

The Anson Mills Polenta was delicious, no question.

And the Marlowe Burger lived up to (and exceeded) it's rep for being one of the five best burgers in the city.

I loved the Steak Tartare. rivaled Bix's. great balance of flavors and a solid portion.

the Warm Marinated Mussels & Monterey Calamari with grilled country bread & green garlic aioli was not at all what I was expecting.  it's definitely more of an appetizer and very very tasty if you prepare it as instructed (ask your server). I would absolutely order it again because despite appearing small in portion, it was very VERY filling.

the Baked Oysters were less than popular at the table. I didn't have one, but people weren't as "thrilled" as with other items.

the Warm Deviled Eggs with aged provolone, pickled jalapeno & bacon are ridiculous and limited in availability. I had two. 

...and I don't feel one bit guilty.

We had a great time, great atmosphere, great for groups of 4-8. the table set up makes larger groups a challenge I'd guess.  Our servers were exceptional and really knew the menu cold.

as for that Roasted Bone Marrow...good lord. words can't describe it.
author: Mike V.

description: There is already over 1700 reviews so you really don't need some snarky reasoning for my five star rating. Just eat there. It is good.
author: Ashlan S.

description:
Highly recommended for weekday business lunch!

Went here with two colleagues I had not reconnected with in a very long time. 

If you work in the area you may be aware there are a shortage of comfortable locations that are amenable both on your ears and budget. Oh, and it offers an out of this world burger and superbly suffice pomegranate iced tea! 

Pia was our server and she was a delight. I have a habit of being one of those "high maintenance" clients that say things like "can I do half fries and half mixed greens, I am watching my waistline today!" and she couldn't have made me feel more special. 

The atmosphore is equally as approachable as it is aesthetic and it has an ambience that just makes you smile and breathe a sigh of relief amidst the hussle and bustle of startups and commuter trains. 

A+
author: Michael K.

description: Wonderful host and servers, very cool atmosphere and bar. Hamburger was amazing and I am only posting this 3 star review because the steak salad was such a disappointment. I would redesign the steak salad. Mine came without goat cheese and the tomato dressing just didn't work. This should be a classic dish there and reason to come back but it's not.
author: Mary W.

description:
Don't care for the quotes on the window (I guess they just don't make sense to me..."Vegans not welcomed here?"  Pleeze).  

For a place that's all about the burger, they do a pretty dang good job with their veggie options.  

Little Gem salad (twice for me already!), roasted pistachios, cauliflower gratin, and can someone say Brussel Sprout Chips!?!  all made the 5-star cut in my book.  (One of the best little gem salads I've had in awhile)

Yes, the food is a little salty, brussels are a LOT oily, but, simplicity says it best.  Easy menu, great drink list, Industrial-esque feel, and great crowd.  They seem to know how to keep the atmosphere fresh and I'm impressed.

Marlowe, love your concept.  A far improvement from the former South.
author: Angella S.

description:
