Used to work above Marlowe so have been there plenty of times; for lunch, dinner, and just drinks. Overall a cozy little spot with a lively atmosphere and solid menu - a very modern dining spot in Soma which doesn't always have the best options in this price range.

Great date spot, or place to go on a not-just-another-night type dinner. Recommend the Marlowe burger for lunch or dinner!
author: Milan T.

description:
Oh god.

We got little gem salad, baked oysters, bone marrow, poulet vert, and duck liver toast. And it was SCRuMPTIOUS. We didn't have to wait for our seats because we sat at the bar, the waiter was absolutely attentive and knowledgable on every piece on the menu. 

The duck liver toast was creamy deliciousness on toast, the bone marrow--oh god I wish I could've sopped up the remaining oily umami fat on the bone with some crostinis and dump everything in my mouth, and the poulet vert (chicken) was super tender falling off the bone and seasoned sooooo differently and well. Salad was ok. Baked oysters were sooo good--little crunch at the too, tart from the lemon, cream from the sauce and slurp from the oyster.  We also tried a brothers mistress drink. Not too sweet, perfect. 

Thanks for the best eating experience, Marlowe. Well be coming back for you!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Marlowe is a great staple. They have expertly prepared seasonal foods. A couple of the best dishes they do:

Poulet Vert (unbelievable)
Marlowe Burger (mostly beef with a touch of lamb)
Fried Chicken Sandwich (lunch only, but worth every penny)
Deviled Eggs (best I have had)

I would avoid the Deviled Egg Sandwich - I am pretty sure they make it out of the previous day's leftover deviled eggs, which is fine, but the one I had did not taste very good.

Make a reservation unless you want to be squeezed in at the bar (or the communal table next to the door), which is fun - don't get me wrong, but the best experience is at a table. It's easy, you can make reservations using OpenTable right here on the Yelp listing.
author: Tala D.

description:
Best meal I've had in quite some time. I went with a large group for dinner before a show in the city. A reservation is a must, the industrial-chic restaurant is small and popular. The service was very good. One main took an especially long time and they comped the item. Overall, a nice vibe in this dimly lit joint right across from the Caltrain station. They got us in and out with plenty of time for our show. 

The food: 
We ordered a wide range of appetizers, mains, and desserts. There was not a single item that we didn't enjoy,  everything was amazing. My top 2 for each category:
Appetizers:
#1: brussel sprout chips (lemony, sea-salt crusted goodness)
A close #2: burrata (perfect, fresh cheese and crispy endive)

Mains:
#1: Marlowe burger (this burger practically melts in your mouth and the horseradish relish adds a nice spin; I suggest substituting cauliflower for fries because the baked cauliflower is incredible!)
#2: Polenta (who would have guessed? this was delicious and a nice blend of polenta and mushrooms)

Dessert:
#1: Upside down strawberry crisp (I could just scrape off the top and eat that! while the bourbon ice cream is good, the crisp is way better)
#2: Chocolate cream pie (comes in a mason jar, tastes like upscale pudding)

Must. go. back.
author: Sarah L.

description:
So good. The truffled mushroom polenta is incredible. the steak is mind blowing, though I'm not a fan of the recent switch to fries from potato purée for the steak's side dish.

The Brussels sprouts chips are really good, but feel overpriced. The burrata is okay but nothing to write home about IMO.

Wines are yummy but no cocktails :( and the desserts are surprisingly bad.
author: Rachel D.

description:
I know most people come here for the egg salad sandwich and the brussles-chips, but I love the burgers here.

The gourmet bun is perfect for the burger.   The bun/condiment/ patty ratio is on point.
I'm not a big fan of horseradish, buit the horseradish-aoioli is amazing on this burger.  Top it off with a healthy helping of caramelized onions and it's to die for.

Definitely one of the better burgers in the City.
author: Anthony L.

description: I came to Marlowe with pretty high expectations. It had good reviews, a strong menu, and a cool ambiance. The only thing that met my expectations, however, was the ambiance. The food was fine but nothing out of this world. I had been told that the Marlowe burger was to-die-for; it was anything but. I don't think I would come back here if it was solely based on the food.
author: Rachael B.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for continuing to impress me.  

I've been here several times and the food is consistently great!  

Start with the brussels sprout chips, baked oyster or the deviled eggs.
Main course I would go with one of the three, burger (so amazing), Chicken (so moist, flavorful with even a little kick), Steak (this is my favorite and you MUST try).

Other likes are, good wine list, friendly & fun staff.
author: Eran B.

description: The 45-minute wait was well worth it! We had the crispy Brussels sprout chips (orgasmic), the Poulet-Vert and the New York steak. All rich in flavor and cooked to perfection. For dessert, the strawberry shortcake was fine, but nothing special. Loretta's Vacherin, on the other hand, was unusual and terrific. We like our old-fashion cocktails so we asked the waiter if they had their own spin on it. He recommended something off the cocktail menu that was similar. Didn't taste some of the exotic ingredients, but it was a fine cocktail nonetheless. Service was knowledgeable, consultative, non-intrusive, prompt and friendly. This was a great find thanks to Yelp.
author: David S.

description: This restaurant is overpriced for the food and overall dining experience. Apparently the CHEF is not willing to accommodate any simple request from his customers. Waitress was very unfriendly! We felt like we were dining with the people next to us because the tables are so close together. Not my idea of an enjoyable 300.00 evening out.
author: Cheryle K.

description: This place is pretty good, we ordered most of the menu and i enjoyed everything i can remember.   I'd go back.
author: Michael E.

description:
Really creative and sophisticated take on pub food! Fun place for small groups and great for a semi-casual date night.

Everything we ordered was delicious: the warm deviled eggs were amazing, i never would have thought that something like this would taste good warm. And the burger tasted perfectly charred on the outside while tender and juicy inside! 

The beer selection is nice, only thing i would suggest is making a reservation a bit ahead of time before popping in, as it is not very big.
author: Milli J.

description:
Although we called ahead about serving food when we arrived there was only a limited bar menu available given it was 3:30pm. The bar menu was fine but strange they wouldn't have mentioned it since we specifically called to ask about it.

There were a ton of people working and a few tables finishing up. Even so it took a long time to get our drink order to our table - like over 10 minutes. Given there was 1 customer at the bar I found it strange that a bottle of sparkling water took that long for the bartender to prepare - for the server to bring.  Secondly why are they not making their own bubbly water in house like everywhere else does? 
All staff were super friendly.

Order:
Brussel chips - tasty but meh - really hard to eat to be satisfying- not really a finger food and yet I think I would need a spoon? 
Spicy Shrimp - these guys came all adorable with their eyeballs in tact in a tiny skillet (my daughter was over the moon) but the flavor was horrendous. I think the kitchen messed these up. They tasted like steamed dirty socks, no amount of lemon could help them.  $16 gets you 4.
Burger - I like my burger med-rare - both came pretty raw (no biggy)but as I don't eat any sauces I am really picky about the flavoring and quality of the meat. Yes it was high quality but it was pretty boring. Cook that baby in some Wagyu oil and add some salt and pepper and we might be in business. For $16 I'd rather make this at home with my butcher's ground meat.
Fries - delicious, perfect in fact. But lets talk about the portion control here. +$7 each gave us a handful of fries next to the burger. We thought they had accidentally only given us 1 order split between us.

No Mayo in the house for my daughter. AT all. I find this strange. If you have aioli - you have mayo but then again maybe they don't make their aioli in house??

Meh. To be offering only a burger as substantial food midday on the menu in this city - you gotta really rock that meat. I liked Coco500's lunchtime burger much better.

The aesthetic is super cute and the staff friendly. 

For $96 with tip I don't think we will be back for the food.
author: AK S.

description: Great atmosphere. Ordered the burger and was not disappointed. Heard great things about the fried chicken sandwich as well. Will definitely be back. Sat at the bar. Staff were friendly. Hostess kept me standing there for quite awhile with plenty of open tables, not exactly sure what she was doing...
author: Eric L.

description:
My friend and I came during lunch and did the Dine About Town menu. We ordered:

* Brussel sprout chips
* Marlowe burger w/ fries
* Mixed greens salad

The brussel sprout chips were really good, although a tad bit too salty. Despite that, the crunchiness of the chips was great and the seasoning really brought out the taste of the brussel sprouts. It was the most unique thing I've had in awhile!

The burger is pretty standard, but pretty good. The bun came a little cold, but otherwise the meat was well-cooked. We had it cooked medium rare per the chef's recommendation. If in the mood for a burger, I would come back to Marlowe for this one.

All in all, great food and warm atmosphere!
author: Catherine C.

description: Delicious food, strong drinks and great service. We came for brunch and had a great time. Make a reservations. I got polenta with mushrooms, arugula and a poached egg. Was delicious. Orange juice is fresh and Bloody Mary was good.
author: Jaclyn W.

description:
Maybe it's because I have the appetite similar to King Louis XIV but after a three course meal and 4 glasses of wine, I was still hungry.  Ok ok, I over exaggerated, it was 3 glasses and I split the dessert with the person I was with.  I tried the warm rock shrimp roll and the open face deviled egg sandwich.  Both of which are excellent.  Also tried the fries but you can't really go wrong with that.  

The presentation of the food was beautifully done and the food was carefully crafted.  A friend of mine complained that everything was salty when she tried the place but I actually been here twice already and I do not find it salty.  I haven't tried the burger yet and I heard from numerous friends that it is the "best thing in the lunch menu" so I will more than likely update this review later.  The place is small and it gets busy so I recommend reserving a table ahead of time.  Dessert is really small and not worth it.  It comes in a small jar.

Anyway, the food is amazing and I do recommend going here.  Just expect to either order more than usual (almost double for me, yikes) or eat a Big Mac at Mcdonald's across the street right after.  Just Kidding.

...or maybe I should just go here for portion control
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
Had a satisfying anniversary dinner here. Loved the vibe here; it was like eating at Restoration Hardware, casual and relaxed luxe environment.

Started with bone marrow and pork belly for apps. Bone marrow was great; be sure to ask for extra bread so you can soak up more of the marrow in the small iron pan. 

My wife and I shared the steak frites and cauliflower. The steak was a little burnt, but it was a generous size. 

We ended the meal with the TCHO chocolate cream pie. I didn't like it, it was oddly salty!

Overall, it's a great place!
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
Fried Chicken Sandwich, reviewed:

I wound up near the Caltrain station, at nearly lunchtime, and wandered over to Marlowe.  What do I find on the menu but a fried chicken sandwich.  And we know I can't pass up a fried chicken sandwich, can we?

Choice of fries or salad, and I went with the fries.  Tiny cut and a little on the heavily salted side, with more crunchies than i would've liked, but they were just fine.

And the sandwich.  Oh the FCS.  Friends, you know how much I love fried chicken sandwiches.  I mean, LOVE.  And I wanted to love this one.  The chicken was beautifully fried, moist, tender.  The bun was lovely.  The greens were nice.  But this FCS is served with Caesar aioli. 

Caesar aioli.

And that Caesar aioli killed the sandwich for me.  The anchovy in a Caesar is meant to be used for umami, but this one had anchovy meant to be fishy.  And fishy DOES NOT WORK with fried chicken!

At least, it didn't work for me.  

Which is a shame, because the restaurant itself is quite lovely, with a nice menu and warm ambiance.  Service was pleasant, and it was plenty busy.  They had an iced tea and cocktail of the day.  The bathroom has a sexy sink. 

In sum:
Fishy aioli + fried chicken = super disappointed :(
author: .caroline. ..

description: Wow. Only good things to say. If I had to describe the flavor of Marlowe I would say "truffley." The physicality of the space is intimate but not claustrophobic.  The aesthetic is very rustic chic. We ordered the brown butter brussels sprouts- AMAZING. Perfectly soft texture with a decadent flavor unlike any other brussels I've ever had. The portion is also very generous as far as sides go, and they are quite filling. So filling, that when our polenta and cod arrived, I wasn't sure how I'd get it all down! The cod, in a coconut broth with mushrooms, peppers, and fingerlings potatoes had subtle Asian fusion flavors which I loved. The polenta was other worldly. It had mushrooms, parmesan, arugula, truffle salsa verde, and a poached farm egg on top!!! The chef recommends poking the egg and letting it ooze out so that the flavor of the yolk seeps into the other flavors. We did. It turned polenta- a simple food- into the most exquisite thing I've ever tasted. We sat at the bar, where we had amazing and attentive service, and couldn't have been happier. Recommend with all my might. Wish I lived in SF so I could go back a lot.
author: Shira P.

description:
Review is mainly for the burger.  At 16$, I'd expect something a bit more enticing.  The patty didn't fit the bun.  Nothing special about the patty.  The meat tasted cheap.  The fries were previously frozen.  At Marlowe, you are paying for the rent, not the food.

The place is ripe for a bar.  Given the bar menu, I did expect a bar.  Beer menu left something to be desired, especially given the surge of craft beer in the area.  Wine was overpriced and not properly stored (warm).
author: Chris S.

description:
Marlowe is a convenient lunch location for those who work near Caltrain. I came by on a weekday for lunch.

Pea soup, sour.
Burger, pretty good. Crispy bacon worked well with the squishy burger. Side salad was sour.

Service -- painfully slow. Expect to wait at least 20 minutes. Don't go here if you have work to do!
author: Ayumi Y.

description: Great place, service, food. Started with oysters, then the pork chops and finished with the I've cream desert with almonds. All great
author: Richard C.

description:
When my lunch arrived at Marlowe, I was this close to doing something so embarrassing, I can only pay proper penance for it by admitting it shamefully:

I was this close to posting a picture of it to Instagram.

If you want to defriend me, I understand.

Marlowe was one of the first restaurant recommendations I received after moving to San Francisco, and I finally managed to find a free lunch to try it out. 

Seriously, the meal looked THAT good. (The fried chicken sandwich with brussel sprout chips, if you're wondering.) I wish I had gotten the waitress' name, she was an impeccable host. The place was surprisingly busy for a rainy Tuesday, but managed to get me right in. If this is what lunch is all about, I'll definitely be back for dinner! Thanks for living up to your reputation, Marlowe!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Great spot next to CalTrain in the Mission Bay area.  We really like the Chicken Verde dish even if I have garlic breathe all night.  An excellent seasonal dish is the Polenta with mushrooms.  Creamy and Earthy.
Restaurant can accommodate about 20+ and so make sure to make a reservation.
author: Veritas V.

description:
Food was delicious and the restaurant has a very cozy atmosphere, better suited for smaller groups. 

Get the steak tartare, it's absolutely amazing and comes in a very generous portion. The brussels sprout chips are what you expect them to be, but still very tasty. However, if you order the side of brussels sprouts, it tastes the same and is just the naked bulbs because all the other leaves were stripped for the chips :( not as satisfying. The baked oysters were soooo yummy, would recommend getting a few of these. I would pass on the warm deviled egg. 

Entrees have surprisingly good portions and everyone was content with our meal! I tried some of their polenta and it's perfectly creamy and hearty. A must try. The servers are all very attentive and kept our water glasses filled and cleared our plates quickly.
author: Maryann S.

description: Everyone is all about the burger. It's ok. Garaje is was better. The fried Brussels sprout leaves are amazing. The burger is just ok. Not sure what is with the Townsend street place, the burger service was only open like a month
author: Jennifer B.

description:
it's a small place located right across the street from the 4th & King Caltrain station. I believe even if you had a reservation, you need to eat quick and get out. Having said that, service is awesome and efficient without the feel of arrangance. They just knew they had to keep the traffic moving so they can turn around those seats a few more time. 

I missed my train and walked in for a burger and a glass of wine and it's by far one of the best "quick" meal I've ever had. Just as I expected, their burger rocks!
author: Maggie C.

description:
Nice little spot with an excellent team of workers. Our servers were such gentlemen and very friendly. Not much of a wait for our food & everything was delicious. Brussels sprout chips are a must! Very simple yet tasty. My boyfriend and I ordered their burger in medium rare, which was cooked perfectly! We had the jumbo shrimp and the steak tartare as well :) 
So sad I came before dinner because I would've loved to try their bone marrow.
author: Rhea C.

description:
Outstanding/Super Delicious/Hella Good:
Anson Mills Polenta,       Poulet Vert

Decent/good but not as good as above:
Pan Seared Moro Bay Black Cod,      Grilled Niman Pork Chop,      Marlowe Burger, Certified Angus New York Steak Frites.      Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta Affogato.

Only down side:
Tcho Chocolate Cream Pie: too sweet, overpowering, struggled to finish it, that is how sweet it was. Maybe just a bad batch.
author: David L.

description:
This quaint restaurant gets packed with a line out the door around 5:30pm on weekdays, so lock up a reservation ahead of time or beat the crowd by going in early. The focus here is classic bistro food, simple menu of simple dishes packed with big flavors. Marlowe is amazing. Serving high quality ingredients and generous sized portions at a low price. I can't get enough of this place!

Decor: Has a simple rustic atmosphere. Community tables, bench and counter seating. The space is compact, not much space between tables and this place gets loud.

Devoured:

Baked oyster New England chowder in a shell $3 each.

SO GOOD! Order a few for yourself because one is just not enough.

Classic steak tartare, poached quail egg, crostini $12

Great flavors, love the poached quail egg... keeps it from getting too slimy in texture.

Marlowe burger, caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli and fries $13

*drum roll* The absolute best burger I've ever had. It is one damn juicy burger, it"s ridiculously fantastic. Great meaty flavors and cooked to medium rare perfection.

Full article and pics, visit http://triplexbexx2.wordpress.com/
author: Rebecca L.

description: Came in an afternoon, just wanted some small dishes and drinks. Everything came in a perfect portion and they were very delicious!! We had oysters, they were fat and juicy! The steak tartare was amazing as well as their dessert with the wine on their dessert menu, perfect match! The interior in the afternoon was enjoyable too! Will def come back and bring more friends!
author: Al L.

description:
OVERRATED.

We came here from multiple recommendations about their burger--most notably from Thrillist. Our party had reservations at 10PM on a Friday night. We arrived on time and were seated promptly. WE DID NOT RECEIVE OUR FOOD UNTIL 11PM. ONE HOUR DOOR TO DOOR. Perhaps for some of you, that is acceptable. Personally, that is not. Not only did our server take a while to take our orders, the food took longer! Two tables to our right, they were seated AFTER us and received their food BEFORE us. What gives? I questioned our server and she got very snappy and defensive claiming they had appetizers and were seated before us. No, B. I SAW THEM GET SEATED WHILE I WAS ALREADY IN MY CHAIR! Then she proceeds to try and play it off by saying she wanted us to finish our appetizers first then have the cook "fire up our entrees." WHAT IS THAT ABOUT!?? Perhaps I am naive but aren't both dishes either cooked concurrently or at least staggered?? You do not wait until the party is completely done with the appetizer THEN start cooking the entree. One of our friends ordered the poulet vert; our server gave ZERO heads up that it would take 30 minutes to prepare during the order. She drops that bombshell on us when I questioned her. A heads-up would've been somewhat helpful. After that, she served the food and did not bother to check up on us until we asked for the check. Even when paying, we had to wait to get her attention. Eye contact was avoided essentially from the beginning. She may have been the only waiter but that is still no excuse for an establishment like Marlowe. 

As for the burger: OVERRATED. Don't get me wrong, it's decent but for something so highly touted, it was definitely not all that it was cracked up to be. Super Duper is a much better burger for less than half the price. The horseradish aioli takes away from the burger because I am not a big fan of horseradish. Even without it, it wasn't as juicy or tasty as Garaje (right around the block). That burger is 10x better. The fries that came with it were fairly good, however, but on the saltier side. We also ordered flat bread w/ 3 different dipping sauces (the best was the anchovies with cheese). 

Next time, there is no next time. One. And. Done.
author: Jimmy D.

description:
What a wonderful restaurant. Why have I not tried Marlowe until now since it is only a 6 min drive from my house to Marlowe. I love Marlowe a whole bunch and it will def be my regular place from now on. 

Had dinner at Marlowe yesterday. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. The dishes we had - 

Baked Oysters - I didn't eat this, but my friend had two at first, then ordered two more afterwards, I could imagine how good it was.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=p-Vue0FhCW5xusHcQax4IQ

Sweet Corn Soup - Yummy, a bit sweeter but still good.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=uotau2hAlkHwgAjc8s7iDQ

Roasted Bone Marrow - Fatty and tasty. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=2qIudwBhgPHDrHKtc4VkHw

Classic Steak Tartare - It was just perfect with the poached quail egg. Thumb up. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=CFHIGTqoA0kaUf05w6smkQ

Marlowe Burger - Perfectly cooked to medium rare. Flavorful and juicy. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=On5FTup9VFyh_3fMhtSy9Q

Grilled Lamb Sirloin - 3 pieces of lamb cooked medium, just right. I loved the sweet potato gratin, delicious. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=mhNMoV3sGXQzijoKytrYtg

Chocolate Cream Pie - I wasn't a fan of it. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=zmt8WeuTy874cIdWh3mN2Q

Just made another reservation for tomorrow. Can't wait to enjoy Friday with the Bone Marrow and Steak Tartare.
author: Chloe B.

description:
You can either (1) make a reservation, or (2) wait for 90 minutes.

If you choose the latter, be prepared to get completely hammered prior to dinner.  Seating hostess (amazingly nice Kiwi) is on top of the wine, and will bring you glass after glass - all you have to do is nod.

Food is OK.  The cheese platter was decent and the brussel sprout chips were unexpectedly delicious (albeit being a tad salty).  My friends seemed to enjoy their meat dishes.  Beware of the communal tables - there are giant pole-like things mid-table - undermining the point of the communal table.  

Overall, I think it was the ambience of this place that did me in.  It is crowded and noisy, but the scarce lighting and atmosphere make it seem like a cool neighborhood spot (bonus points since this is not an easy feat for a restaurant across from Caltrain).  Great place to come to with a group of friends!
author: Gev M.

description: brunch here was good.  the kale and brussels sprouts salad was delicious, as were the crab crepes.  i didn't love the eggs in tomato sauce and harissa, b/c i thought the sauce was a bit watery.  i was eyeing the doughnuts for dessert, but we shared the warm chocolate chip cookies instead.
author: Helen T.

description:
I went with to Marlowe with a friend on a Monday night and the place was fairly full at 6:30pm. I felt in luck when we were easily seated at the large, long communal table next to a gentleman reading a leather bound book and drinking coffee from a gorgeous Le Creuset mug - a pretty good start right?
I was taken by the decor - the ceilings are high, and everything is white including the white beadboard and white subway tile - it feels like an East Coast upscale seafood restaurant and I loved it. 
The food was good, nothing blew my socks off and was slightly disappointing after the decor and ambiance greets you and serves up such a nice first impression. 
We have the burrata toast which had too many flavors that were overwhelming the simple goodness of the burrata and the deviled eggs were good, but needed a little bit of interest. The brussels sprouts and the burger were the best things we ordered but I still think the bun could use some improving and the bun to meat ratio was too high!
author: Allie D.

description: High-end San Francisco restaurants have a style of service that feels like I am at someone's home and they are taking good care of me. I don't get that anywhere else in the world. Marlowe has that quality. The bar tender knows her stuff - recommended a drink after hearing how my day went - the cook knows his stuff - good and hot food with great seasoning built on very fresh ingredients. The location reminds me of the Oyster Bar in Grand Central Station - not a place I'd take a date to but a place I'd stop each time I had an hour before I took the Caltrain.
author: Frank C.

description:
My mouth always watering when my mind remembers marlowe. My favorite items is served in delicious mode, and I have to come here many many times. And also deserves so to be continued...

Specially I always feel a lot of appetite in the name of Bone Marrow , Quite delicious to eat and quality and served in a decent, Delicious manner.

Suggesting you to be a lover of it and come with your dearest one. Wine selection is also great. 

Service is so friendly and attentive. Just always make me superb happy.
author: Jessi H.

description:
4.5 stars. 

Crab Louie lettuce wrap - fun presentation.
Bone Marrow - decadent, also fun presentation.
Poulet Vert - chicken was really juicy and flavorful - even the white meat. best chicken i've had in a long time.
Polenta with wild mushrooms - delicious.
author: Maggie L.

description: We ordered a half dozen oysters (it's never too early for oysters, right?), deviled eggs, and crab toast with poached egg to share. Everything was delicious! For my entree I ordered the burratta tartine. It had candied bacon, which makes anything extra tasty! Then for dessert (because who can go without dessert? Not me, that's for sure!) we got the french toast soldiers which came with two different sauces. I'm all about the coffee creme because I'm the hugest fan of anything coffee flavored, but the Mexican hot chocolate was delicious as well.
author: Jenefer _.

description:
Marlowe is a small, quaint and delicious restaurant that my boyfriend and I went to on a whim for dinner. He's been here before and has had nothing but positive things to say.  Needless to say, I was super excited being a foodie :) 

Everything was so good that we ended up ordering more than we had originally anticipated. We just couldn't help ourselves. 

Starting things off.... 
1.  Deviled Eggs @$2 and my first time having deviled eggs.  These were amazing!!! We ordered 1 each and then after we finished, we added another two orders of these babies. 
2.  Crab cake - it comes with one. I'm not a huge seafood fan, so my boyfriend ate it all.  It was good, but maybe it could have been a bit bigger (or maybe we're just really fat :( )
3.  New York Angus Steak... so good I could die happy T___T // Just a Tip:  Request aioli sauce to go with your fries!! 
4.  Scallop Special something that I forgot but you guys will probably be curious about it since it was delicious  lol 

Overall, Marlowe has been one of my favorite places to eat at since being in SF for a little less than two years now.  My bf and I always talk about going back her for dinner since we live so close and we most likely will be going again. 

Make sure to make reservations especially on a Friday-weekend night. We went without a reservation and waited about 30 minutes, but ordered some wine to help sustain us. 

Amazing food and great service.
author: Suzie B.

description:
The word is out and Marlowe is the most popular kid on the block. The house was packed at lunchtime today, 12:30 to be exact.

After 20 minutes, we were seated at one of the few "normal" tables. I say this because much of Marlowe's seating is either at the bar or at a long, communal table with limited elbow room. So just be prepared to sit in close quarters with other SOMA business professionals surrounded by loud conversation. But don't worry, once your food arrives you won't notice anything but the delectable plate in front of you. 

My hubby and I had:
- Carribean rock shrimp roll on a lightly toasted baguette - DIVINE! Everything about it worked. My husband had food envy. Even the fries were light, crisp and delicious.
- Fried chicken sandwich with bacon and arugula: They did a great job of not overbreading or overfrying the chicken. It was juicy, flavorful and the bacon was a tasty addition.
- Blood orange and mint iced tea - cool, light, refreshing with a mild citrus flavor.
- Total $33. Service moved quickly to accommodate the constant stream of patrons, yet we didn't feel rushed.

I didn't have room for the brussels sprout chips but thats okay because I WILL most definitely be back - perhaps for Marlowe's famous burger?
author: Mariela D.

description:
You must, must order the steak tartare. It is divine. If that was a larger portion, I could just eat that as my entree. 

I had the steak as my main course and it was delicious, although I did try a nibble of the pork chop and liked it better.  The desserts are very rich. I had the peach cobbler ala mode and it was quite buttery and decadent.

The waitstaff is friendly but it was a full house that night and I think they were overwhelmed. This was a quiant little place and I counted 3 servers to serve the entire restaurant, so it took a while for service. We were there for 2.5 hours, which was a bit long I thought.
author: Kenson K.

description: I had brunch here with my son last Saturday, the food was good.  I had the brussel sprout salad, it was a little bland.  the service was excellent.  My son had the bagel with lox it looked great and he said it tasted great.  Not a lot of choices for vegetarians.
author: pochini m.

description:
one word--- delicious!!! 
Great location next to Caltrain, not that I use caltrain all that often but still good for anyone who does. 
We had a few of the starters including the Brussels sprout chips which are lemony and tasty- same as the ones at Park Tavern. Also had the cauliflower cheese dish which looks like mac n cheese and tastes even better. 
I had the burger and it was super tasty. probably one of the better burgers I have ever had. Would love to come back again.
author: Nicole S.

description: My partner and I came here with high expectations because of so many positive reviews, but we left very bitter about our experience. Some of the tables are so close together that I had to move my table each time to get in and out of my seat. I ordered the Marlowe burger while my partner ordered the Warm Rock shrimp roll. We shared two baked oysters. Every item we got was okay but definitely not worth the price that we paid for them!!! Parking near this restaurant on a week day for a late lunch was also insane, but that's San Francisco for you. Will not come here a second time.
author: Minh-Hieu V.

description:
Marlowe to me is like a fat kid and cake.

Love at first sight, or better yet, first bite.

The Brussel Sprout Chips were as I fondly remembered.  Thin, individually fried brussel sprouts saturated heavily with oil then liberally doused with refreshing meyer lemon and huge grains of sea salt for texture.  

The Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich was an absolute beauty to behold.  The ample fried chicken breast was loving lavished with flavorful Caesar aioli and accompanied by salty strips of freshly fried bacon and fresh field greens encapsulated by a warm, toasty round Acme bun.  Each bite was juicily sweet, filled with the comforting crunch and flavor from the meaty breast and fragrant bacon and satisfyingly savory Caesar aoili.  It was truly a party in my mouth.

Not wanting the wonderful meal to end, we concluded with the Upside Down Pear Crisp.  What a gorgeous and decadent dessert it was.  Creamily sweet bourbon ice cream densely topped with thickened brown butter caramel sauce mixed with crispy slices of pear bits. Utter ecstacy.

Living in San Francisco has truly spoiled me; there's no other place quite like it.
author: Lisa W.

description: Best burger in town. Great service, beautiful new space. I'll be back.
author: Cameron C.

description: I stopped in for a quick burger after a show. Quick service the burger was great!! Perfectly medium rare. This will be a regular pre-train stop for me.
author: Mat W.

description: BOMB !!!! Warm kale and shaved Brussel sprout salad and the Fried chicken sandwich wow !
author: Manny K.

description:
Two stars for two things that were...good.
+1: crispy fries
+1: steak was prepared correctly.

That's about it. People make this place packed, the burgers are what patrons rave about and I am still indifferent. I don't think I've ever felt so empty after having a full meal. 

My friend and I had four things:

- Spiced jumbo Gulf shrimp ($13): Shrimp cocktail. 
The shrimp was mushy, the cocktail sauce was supposed to be hot & boozy as it was labeled on the jar (neither of which it boasted to be) and when asked what we thought of the shrimp we weren't quite sure what to say.

- Marlowe burger ($13): Burger with onions, cheese and bacon. 
My friend said it didn't taste what it's worth. Good meat but missing depth in flavor and the extras on the burger didn't compliment the meat either.

- Steak frites ($19): Steak with fries. 
I asked for medium rare and I got what I asked for. I was just shocked at the size of the steak that arrived. It was literally the size of two baby's fists. Sigh.

- Upside down pear...something...served in a jar ($8): Burnt bourbon caramel, chopped pears and ice cream. 
I love dessert but I'm not quite sure what to say about this one. I even mistook the pears for apples. If you were there to see my facial expression after the first bite then that would explain how I felt about it. It wasn't a pretty expression either.

Maybe I'll give Marlowe another chance in the future but for now I'll be staying away.
author: Carol L.

description:
First time there, I immediately loved the place. 

Brussel sprout chips is awesome just like it was heavily rated by anyone has tried. Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp is yummy. 5 Star for the sauce and spice, of course the shrimps taste extremely delicious! I would also highly recommend Lemon soufflé cake. Very very light, but with lots of flavor and texture in it. A dessert brings subtleness. 

Overall ambiance is cool, it's busy, because the food is fantastic!!
author: Shell J.

description: I dined here with a friend this weekend and It was *so* yummy. I got the polenta, which was magnificent, and we shared a delicious burrata and fig starter. The cocktails were delicious. Special shout-out to Akeesha, our server. Her recommendations on food and drinks were spot on and she was a genuinely lovely presence.
author: Julie K.

description: Maverick, Maven, Marlowe?  Used to be South Food and Bar? All I know is darned good meal. Tiny butcher-themed spot with that weird beam in the middle that ain't good for feng shui purposes, but the food was across the board delicious and interesting.  The toasted pistachios, the fries, the crispy brussels sprout chips, the angus New York steak all got thumbs up.  The roasted chicken (poulet vert) was divine - seasoned just right, juicy, tender . . . I could go on and on about this alone.  Top your fabulous meal with some chocolate cream pie or definitely on the strawberry rhubarb crisp - the sweetness and the fresh berry taste just pops out at you and gives you a kiss.  Thanks for the treat & the lovely company R&C!
author: Peg S.

description:
the bf and i have been trying to try this place out for a while after a few friends recommended this place.  I guess i may have went in with my expectations too high because it seemed like all the dishes fell short.

things we ordered:
brussel sprout chips - the first taste was really good but as we continued eating we noticed that it just got saltier and saltier (and oilier and oilier)

bone marrow - this dish was the better of the 3 we tried.. but it's not something i would wait for

marlowe burger - saw tons of reviews on this burger so we decided to give it a try... i guess i'm not a burger person? i dont know but it didn't really taste as spectacular as everyone says it is

chocolate mousse thing - it tasted sooo much like sour cream i couldn't even taste the chocolate. i'm a big dessert person but i made my boyfriend finish this one.
author: JUDY L.

description:
Small spot across from Caltrain with good eats and drinks. 4.4 stars

Food: 4 Atmosphere: 4 Service 4
Cost to worth it rating: 3 (entrees in the 20s)
Eve award: best use of green vegetable as a snack

Highlights:
- Brussels sprout chips: bowl of thin flaky goodness complimented by salt and lemon. I think I let the hub snag just a few as I gobbled them all down 
- Pork chop: tender well-seasoned dual cuts of pork with parmesan cream sauce and bunches of prosciutto 
- Chocolate cream pie: perfect portion in a mini-jar. Balanced not too rich chocolate with a cookie crust and crunchy bits in top
- Champagne cocktail: drink special of the night with pomegranate and blackberry. Light and not too sweet
- Wine list: unique offerings like a German langrien and African options
- Quotes on the window: loved all of the fun food quotes like never trust a girl who doesn't eat her meal, etc
- Location: super easy to get to via train

Midlights:
- Steak: nice medium rare but lacked seasoning to enhance the flavor of the cut of meat 

Lowlights:
- Only beer and wine

Liked our experience here and I'd come back.
author: Eve K.

description:
After seeing all the Check In's Christine C. has made at Marlowe, I've been meaning to find my way down SOMA to check the place out. Unfortunately, every single time I tried, they were closed. Finally, I decided to call them on Tuesday afternoon and made reservations for two. Garland and I arrived a couple minutes after 8:30pm and stood in line with the patrons in front of us. The hostess greeted us and seated us promptly. 

Our waitress, Nico, came over, handed us our menus and briefly went over the special cocktails of the night. We told her we were set on getting a bottle of wine and she recommended to us her favorite on the list: "Quinary" Raka, a Bordeaux blend. Great choice! And being such a "small menu" they have, we were able to try a decent amount of dishes. 

For starters: 
-Baked oysters 
-Crispy Brussels sprout chips 
-Roasted bone marrow 
-Classic steak tartare 

We really enjoyed the baked oysters and the roasted bone marrow. I'm not a big fan of cooked oysters but their dish was delicious! It had a lightly crispy coating with flavors of cheese and pepperoni. Oyster pizza? Interesting but it was a success! The bone marrow was simply a rich and fatty treat that went perfectly with the lightly toasted bread. I was bummed that the steak tartare didn't taste as well as I thought it because I was told great compliments about it. 

For entrees: 
-Marlowe burger 
-Creekstone Ribeye 

Fantastic burger! Juicy and meaty. Loved the fact that Nico split our entree in half so that Garland and I didn't have to go through the trouble of splitting our own entrees. Superb service, Nico!

For desserts: 
-TCHO chocolate cream pie in a jar 
-Upside down pear crisp

Upside down pear crisp brought home the crown. We finished that jar to the pit! Imagine crunch caramel bites, sugared pear and bourbon ice cream all in one bite. Yes, sounds like a little piece of heaven. Chocolate cream pie, however, was a bit too salty for our taste.

Marlowe, you're a great addition to San Francisco!
author: Jenny K.

description:
5 stars for their presentation on the food, the taste, service and ambiance

Lets just say it was ranked as one of the top ten best burgers in the bay area. I can attest and honestly say they do have one of the best that I have had in the bay area. size wise of the burger not large but large on taste. The bread reminded me of ciabatta bread the meat made medium well the mesh of cheese and carmelized onions perfectly done, juicy on every bite. there burgers again are rightfully marked as one of the top ten in the bay area

the steak made medium rare portion wise for the price was not great but had a decent taste to it, the sauce below it flavorful and robust lil tangy not A1ish but again portion wise for me personally too small

we also sampled there bone marrow, deliciousness lil bit to buttery but who doesn't butter with bread and capers

the snacks we sampled the deviled eggs, WOW is all I have to say never had deviled eggs like this, provolone, bacon, hard boiled egg, may not sound great but WOW some sort of sauce also used to give it a lil kick perfectly made. 

food ***** I will definitely be craving one of these folks burgers, marrow and deviled eggs
service ***** reservation at 7 got there at 6:15 seated immediately, next time the specials are definitley a try they made everything sound delicious
price $$
ambiance ***** when the giants play expect long lines and no parking, reservations are a + parking in the city always sucks but to eat here definitely worth driving in circles, lil dark inside but the furniture and tiny tables give it a inviting feeling, spot best for lunch if not for two first date friendly, fairly loud inside, definite would come back for there burgers and almost everything else I tried, I do not recommend the steak.
author: Clarence A.

description:
When we arrived we were seated right away because we made reservations. We ordered baked oysters, steak tartare & deviled eggs as our appetizers. It was really good. I ordered the the Polenta which was a vegetarian dish. I thought my dish was super salty. I didn't enjoy it too much. 

Overall the appetizers were delicious. The chef went a little too crazy with the salt on my entree though.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
First, of they have excellent service.  Our waiter was nothing but short of excellence.  He was friendly, made recommendations, and we never had to wait for them to refill our water glasses and they were never overbearing or pretentious.

Food...



We started with - twice baked dungeness crab souffle (every single word here was perfectly chosen to get your taste buds up.  twice. baked. dungeness. crab. souffle.)

Waiter recommended that we try their "must try" deviled eggs, and Crispy brussels sprout chips and brown butter brussels sprouts.so we got those too.



As we were chatting the Food came surprisingly quickly.  Restaurant was pretty empty when we arrived at 6:00 (a whole hour earlier than our original reservation) but before you know it the whole place was packed! 

Totally would reccommend, the food was delious!!
author: Semira J.

description: If you ever are in the position to actively choose your last meal, make it from The Marlowe. Enough said, one of the best food experiences and tastes I have had in all of SF. Great date night spot. All around amazing.
author: Niall D.

description:
Came here today for lunch. It was really a unique dining experience. I had food here I never had before. 

They started us off with these Brussel Sprout chips. I have never heard of that before, but it was really delicious. Me and my workplace killed two bowls of those easily. They were super flavorful, oily, and had my taste buds really going. I don't remember what the other appetizer dish was, but it was some sort of flavored pistachios. A lot of my co-workers said it tasted like bacon. I couldn't wrap my head on what it reminded me of, but they were just as delicious as the chips.

My main dish was the BBQ lamb sandwich. The sandwich was really easy to eat, I could hold it without difficulty(perfect size) and the chewing of the lamb was very easy. The sandwich wasn't too greasy, or oily either. I really enjoyed it, especially with a side of garlic fries which was both filling and it really hit the spot. 

When I hear American food I think of McDonalds, Burgers, Steak, and giant greasy unhealthy food. I don't know how healthy Marlowe's is, but I know that I will look at American food in a whole new light now. It was burgers and steaks here, but they were damn good burgers and steaks with fancy names and fancy presentation! 

The atmosphere here is also really nice. They have soothing music playing and the place is nice and small so it gives a real home feeling. It's dimly lit, or it felt that way, makes me really wonder about the experience dining at night. 

P.S: I did not have it, but the creative naming of this particular dish had me interested to come back and try it. The dish was called "Butcher's Mistress" sounds really good and sinful.
author: Wells Y.

description: Beyond amazing! The food was so great and the service was impeccable. I can't wait to go back and re-order the same things: grilled asparagus, deviled egg, corn soup, little gems lettuce, burger, and the amazing brussel sprout chips!  SO fun and near the ballpark so you can have everything within walking distance.
author: Amy V.

description:
as i led my friends under the highway underpass, i could tell they were seriously doubting my decision.

the burger, polenta, baked oysters, and brussel sprouts quickly changed their minds. this was the best meal we had in san fran and probably the most affordable.
author: Megan A.

description:
The devilled eggs are amazing!! Best egg anything I've ever had! 

Atmosphere was really nice, service is excellent. I had the burger which was a bit pricey for what it was but it was still pretty good.
author: Sammy L.

description:
I've been meaning to come here for awhile and I'm glad that I finally got to try it out. Definitely make a reservation because it was packed when I came. The good thing about this location is that finding parking wasn't too hard at all. Onto the food...

Brussels sprout chips: good but definitely something you need to share with the table because it tastes super salty after awhile since its basically just a dried salted leaf with the texture of Japanese seaweed wrap 

Deviled eggs: fantastic! it's creamy and it had just enough of a kick to it to make it special. 

Marlowe burger: high quality and well made. Very flavorful beef with the bun toasted just right. 

Panna cotta amazing! It's amongst some of the best panna cotta I've ever had. Trust me on this. Panna cotta is one of my favorite desserts.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Tip: They are always SUPER busy during peak lunch and dinner times, so make a reservation! 

I work about a block away from Marlowe, and my coworker had been raving about it for quite a few months before I finally got a chance to try it for lunch. Needless to say, I had really really high expectations...and therefore, I came out of my lunch experience thinking it wasn't worth the hype.

Fast forward to a few months later, I was getting together with some friends for dinner and one of them suggested Marlowe. So here I was ready to give it a second chance - and I'm so glad I did!!!

Below is what we had:
- Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips: DEEEE-LICIOUS! I also had this when I came for lunch and I do remember it being yummy. But I honestly can't remember what I had for lunch as my main course...Each chip is light and flaky with just the right amount of salt. It almost tastes like dried seaweed if you've ever had that.
- Smokey Baked Cauliflower: *Homer Simpson drool sound* Omg...soooo soooo good. It tasted just like mac-and-cheese but even more delicious. And I didn't have to feel guilty eating it because it was...all veggies right? LOL. You must get this in addition to the brussels sprout chips!!
- Pan Seared Arctic Char: Ok this is embarassing to admit, but I had no idea that an arctic char was salmon. Anyway, I make salmon a lot and so I was a bit disappointed when I saw that I had gotten a salmon dish. However, that disappointment went away as soon as I took a bite. Wow...the sauce...wow. So good. Must get. 

I was also lucky enough to get a taste of the Certified Angus New York Steak Frites and "Poulet Vert" (aka chicken). Both were also very good but I must say that my dish was the best. Tehehehe.

I'll be back for sure! I can't wait to bring my boyfriend here. Maybe not for lunch but for dinner.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I'm a vegetarian, and still thoroughly enjoyed this place. In one sitting I think I tried every option they had, though, so don't expect an endless veg menu.
author: Joey M.

description: The atmosphere is really great but it can get pretty loud. The service was fantastic. I had the polenta and it was one of the best dishes I've ever had! However, the dishes ordered by the rest of my party (pork chop and burger), were pretty disappointing. The cocktails were yummy and interesting. I will probably be back for that polenta in the future!
author: Tristan E.

description:
SALTY SALTY SALTY!

Seems like salt is the main ingredient in each dish. Even the side salads are covered in salt. 

I wanted to like this place because of the decor, hype, and fact that it's a block away from my office but after being let down a fourth time, I won't go back again.

Service wasn't that great either. The bartender was was rude up until he handed over our check...
author: Amanda C.

description: The food was great and so was the service!   Second time here and will come back again! We we're here for Saturday brunch.
author: Richard B.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Monday, party of 4.
Service was good but didn't knock my socks off.

Brussels Sprouts chips were good, but a bit salty for me.

Potato Leek soup and mixed green salad for lunch were delicious.  Salad was incredible, not super fussy, just greens and a tasty dressing.  Soup was creamy and topped with fried leeks (so good).

Sandwiches looked good that my lunch mates ordered, they seemed to enjoy them.

Hip decor although I am not a fan of a communal table (make reservations to avoid sharing your lunch conversation with someone you don't know).
author: Katie S.

description: Great food & cocktails, oysters, and a cool interior - what more could you ask for?
author: Amy S.

description:
This was one of the finest dining experiences I've had in a long time. I went here on a semi last-minute whim with two of my buddies before bar hopping in SoMa. It was a packed house when we arrived around 9:30pm on a Saturday night, but the hostess was very accommodating, only having us wait for about 15 minutes before we got bar seating. During that wait, she kindly offerred us a drink menu and served us some ice-cold brews that we enjoyed out on the patio/waiting area.

I was a little disappointed with the bar seating at first, as there were clearly some open tables the remainder of the night. But had we not sat at the bar, we probably wouldn't have gotten the great service and rapport with staff as we did. Some of the biggest highlights include:

1) They ran out of Bone Marrow. However, they kindly offerred to serve what they could, at no cost to us. We agreed and each of us still had a nice sample of that mouth-watering goodness.
2) We ordered one deviled egg each, but it was so tasty that some of us wanted more. "another round of deviled eggs?" says the hostess. "Sure, why not." She clearly coerced us into ordering more, and even though they were not too expensive, this round was also on the house. Very nice of them!
3)This entire time the bartender (I think his name was Mikey?)  was discussing many of the different bottled beers they had, which we found very informative, but more importantly, delicious! Baba Black Lager, Session Lager, and Trumer Pils...all highly recommended.

We also ordered the steak tartare (uber tasty) and brussel sprout chips (delicious) for our starters that we demolished. My entree was the PORK CHOP which I found to be one of the most succulent pieces of pork I've ever had. Combine that with the spinach and scalloped sweet potatoes and my stomach was clearly satisfied.

Overall this was a solid eatery, and if I sat anywhere else, I probably would have just given it 4 stars. But thanks to the friendly staff, and additional perks to the delicious meal, I give them 5. Thanks, Marlowe & co!
author: Matthew D.

description:
Ate here for the second time recently, and was as equally impressed as on the first visit. The location is great, right near Caltrain off Townsend in SoMa. Be forewarned that the place is a little small, and despite reservations, you might be directed to the communal bench (avoid this... call ahead).  Appetizers like the Brussel Sprout Chips and the Deviled Eggs are not to be missed.  There are also a variety of "snacks", small plates of delicious little things that are great if you want to order a bunch and share amongst a group.  Main dishes are truly inventive "New American" cuisine.  Although this is already a pretty well saturated category in SF, somehow these guys manage to stand out.

Overall, it's probably my favorite restaurant in the city right now! Can't wait to try Park Tavern and their other new place!
author: James P.

description:
Marlowe was good but not astounding, and I need to be stingier with my 4 star ratings.  I ordered the burger, little gem salad, brussel sprout chips, bone marrow and my friend ordered the scallops.  Everything was quite heavy except for the salad, which was very tart, came in little gem cups that had guac and shavings of radishes and pickled veggies on top.  The salad was my least favorite, with its tart and otherwise bland flavor.  The brussel sprout chips were great in texture and flavor but were very oily.  My friend ate only half the scallops and kept pulling the bacon off the bacon-wrapped asparagus. The marrow was good and came with toast and olive tapenade, but it wasn't anything special.  The burger, however, is excellent.  It's flavorful, the patty is well constructed and juicy, and the bun is awesome.

Conclusion: I'd come back for the burger and try different things next time.
author: Terry K.

description:
Came at 8pm on a Friday night with a party of 4. Good thing we had a reservation. Place was packed. 

mozzarella salad was - ok
brussel sprouts - ok
mussels - really liked the broth. would order again. 
duck liver toast - this was fine. i think i could have done without the grapes. made it a little too sweet for my liking. 
burger - meat had good flavor. a lot of char flavor on the bun that i'm not used to. this came together ok. 
chicken - wish this was my entree. ate about a half of my wife's. she was the real winner.
author: J A.

description: Who knew Brussel Sprouts could be so tasty? My husband and I were given a Date Night package from the kids for Christmas - dinner at Marlowe and then to Cavalia. Dinner was great! We had excellent hands on service, dinner was stellar. The one thing I really want to bring up is this: We don't drink and it's impossible to go anywhere in the city and find a good non alcoholic beverage. Well, our server got together with the bartender and created a couple of amazing concoctions to start off our evening! It helped make the evening truly a special time for us and really festive. As for the food - sublime! The brussel sprout chips and deviled egg, through the bone marrow and spicy shrimp first course and burger and mushroom polenta entrees to the beyond amazing dessert with the coffee ice cream served on a meringue cookie.(yes, we had to bring at least half of the entrees home - our eyes were way bigger than our stomachs) - all were their own taste sensation. - thank you for a lovely evening
author: Denise S.

description:
I liked their appetizers a lot. They were all quite tasty. I have to especially point out the bone marrow =) Although they all came in super small portions =/ So if you're super hungry, might want to consider other options. The main dishes were just okay. The appetizers were definitely better. 

The setting of this restaurant was interesting. Everyone's put on three long tables so you're placed next to other dining parties. Sometimes that's a cool thing, you can meet other random foodies. There are some giant diagonal poles that run in the middle of the tables which may get in the way at times. I'd definitely go back again regardless of these minor nuances.
author: Annie Z.

description: Everything about my brunch here was awesome. The bloody Mary, brussel sprout chips, and marlowe burger were all on point. A little pricey for brunch but definitely worth it.
author: Ryan C.

description: Ordered way too much food when I came here, but I'm so glad I did. Toasted pistachios were a tasty snack. Also had the brussels sprout chips and deviled eggs which didn't disappoint. Shared the steak tartare, the Marlowe burger and the "Poulet Vert", all of which had and amazing balance of textures and flavors. Probably one of the most satisfying dinners I've eaten...ever.
author: Tim G.

description: I agree with other reviewers who wrote that this place is good, but not all that.  I came here for brunch with a big group, so tried most of the items on the menu.  Food was tasty but forgettable. Portions were small.  Service was OK, but not great.  There was a general snobby attitude here that I didn't appreciate.
author: JJ M.

description:
Had a b-day dinner with the lady bunkmate. Nicely lit small joint, that serves great to sometimes above average food. Some portions are huge while others are more expected. Loved the head-still-on grilled shrimp and the fries, while small, were a great addition to the steak, though not necessary since it's a large entree. 

Service was a bit late (everyone must have lost their watches or iPhones) but we weren't in a rush. We had to cancel one of the dishes because it was so late. They comped us some desserts. All good.

I'd go back to try out some of the other dishes.
author: t t.

description:
Hands down, absolutely 100% worth going for that darned hyped burger. It totally lives up to the hype, especially if you order it medium rare. Juicy, tasty, melts-in-yer-mouth, totally sinful.

Bonus for fun appetizers. We had the baked brussels leaves (or however they call 'em) and couldn't stop munchin' em - great portions for apps, too.

Fun champagne cocktails and an impressive beer list to boot.

Hello, Marlowe. Good times.
author: Meredith R.

description: The polenta is insanely good. The burger is excellent but skip that and go to the polenta. Mind blown.
author: Jason M.

description:
The Brussel sprout chips are amazing!  
We had several small bites to share and really enjoyed all of them. 
The service was also very fast, knowledgeable, and friendly.  I would come back here again.  It's not exactly "family friendly" as there isn't much space for a stroller or anything.  Even still, I really liked it and will try it out for a full dinner next time.
author: Min M.

description:
Came in with a group of 5 after a show in the City. The service was great! We were too cheap to buy water at the show so we were all quite thirsty when we arrived. Our glasses were never empty. The waitress must have refilled our glasses at least 10 times throughout our meal. We ordered and ate family-styled. Yes, not very classy, but we all wanted to try a little bit of everything.

Crispy Brussel Sprout Chips - These were very light and airy. It reminded me of dried salted seaweed and tasted nothing like brussel sprouts. A little bit too salty for my taste. (3/5)

Baked Oysters - We each got one oyster. It was filled with creamy New England chowder sprinkled with some bacon bits. It was a little hard to see the actual oyster, which is quite small, but overall, the flavors were excellent together. (5/5)

Roasted Bone Marrow - We were sort of hesitant to order bone marrow, but since it was highly recommended on Yelp, we decided to beast it and try it. The marrow itself is quite slimy, but tastes quite delicious paired on top of a toasted bread. Use the salsa verde sauce generously! (4/5)

Marlowe Burger (2) - We ordered 2 burgers. I thought they were just okay? Nothing too special in my opinion. The fries were nice and crispy though. (3/5)

Poulet Vert - Chicken dish. It was nicely seasoned and the meat fell right off the bone. However, be a little careful. This dish came with 3 pieces of chicken and one of ours was quite pink. (3/5)

As a lover of sweets, it is hard to pass on dessert especially if we come to a fancier restaurant. I was looking forward to trying the TCHO Chocolate Cream Pie, but unfortunately they were out! :( but we did try the other 2 options they had.

Upside Down Strawberry Crisp - Nothing too special. Not worth the $8 in my opinion.

Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta - Out of the two desserts we ordered, I would recommend this one. The panna cotta was delicious and the flavors paired well together.

Overall a great dinner out in the City.
author: Crystal M.

description:
Ooh La La!

Last night was my boyfriend's birthday and he was eager to try Marlowe, as a friend had recommended it. Despite lacking reservations, we were quickly seated (though the seats are all VERY close so we were wedged in betwixt two other couples.)

The wine list immediately grabbed our attention. Diverse in origin and varietal, there was an impeccable selection.

The menu wasn't well laid out, alas, and half the menu is appetizers and "snacks" as they say. We each ordered a glass of wine and I ordered the duck liver pate. The wine came quickly, and the appetizer shortly after. It was served in a darling arrangement with the pate in a little jar and freshly crisped bread slices heaped next to it alongside mustard seeds and jellied grapes. Creamy, a little salty, and flavorful, it was a unique blend of flavors - very tasty. Curiosity drove my boyfriend to order the roasted bone marrow, which was too much "weird meat jelly" for me, but he enjoyed the hearty flavor. 

For my main course, I had the sole stuffed with crab, which was DIVINE if you are half the seafood lover I am. It was coated in a wonderful garlic butter reduction and absolutely incredible. Flaked apart in tasty bites of heaven. 

My boyfriend ordered the burger and fries - looked very "meh" to me. 

When I finished off my first glass of wine, the waitress made an excellent recommendation of a different variety that paired beautifully with my sole. 

There were about 8 members of the waitstaff constantly circling - delivering food, refilling water, clearing empty dishes, etc. It gave the restaurant a very "bustling" feel, though I loved feeling so attended to. 

Altogether, a wonderful experience. I plan to return when my boyfriend is away and just sit at the bar with a drink and main course.

3 glasses of wine, 2 appetizers, and two main dishes ran about $110 - not bad for such quality and service.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
Marlowe may be pretty overpriced, and sometimes you have to wait beyond your reservation time for a table during lunch, but it's also pretty damn tasty. And they have this salad with a sharp vinaigrette dressing which absolutely kills me every time.

I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for a private conversation though--the tables are pretty close together. It can also get pretty loud.
author: Paul C.

description: Great food! We had the deviled eggs, oysters, the steak entree and the polenta (which, surprisingly, was my favorite dish of all!). We brought a bottle of wine and they have reasonable corkage ($15 i think?). I give 4 stars because it is a pretty loud restaraunt (although we did go on a Friday night prior to a concert at At&t) and very crowded. However, I would definitely go back. Best part is it is in walking distance to the stadium...great prior to games and concerts!
author: Greta U.

description: We met some friends who were visiting town for brunch on a saturday and were able to make reservations, which is a huge plus. The restaurant can easily accommodate groups of 6-8. We are vegetarians and ordered the polenta with mushrooms and a poached egg as well as the soft scramble with a side of levain toast. The polenta dish was flavorful, with perfectly cooked mushrooms and was delicious - the arugula and shaved cheese was a nice touch. The soft scramble was executed well and tasty -- the side order of the toast was a must to compliment this dish, and really should be included with it. All in all, the food was good and we enjoyed our experience. If we were to come back, we would probably order the house made donuts or maybe consider the ricotta toast.
author: T K.

description: So Yelp asked, what keeps me coming back here and the answer is simple, their "Poulet Vert" among the other dishes of course, like Oysters, Scallops, Burrata! All so very YUM. It seems like they have mastered the art in roasting chicken, and this is the best one I have had after trying this dish at a number of places. This place is always packed so better to make reservations ahead of time.
author: Shweta M.

description: There is a reason they were voted best burger!!!! Get their early or snag a seat at the bar. Their cocktails make it a hotspot for a less aggressive evening but you'll likely stay for the burger (the smells will suck you in)...
author: Amy V.

description:
I am not sure how I have not written a review of this place considering I eat here weekly. 

The short review: Best burger in all of San Francisco. 

Long review-- This place is always packed so if you can make reservations that will be most helpful to you enjoying the amazing food. There has not been a single menu item I have been disappointed with. Bone Marrow, Steak, Brussels Sprouts chips, you really cannot go wrong. Lastly the service is fantastic. The bartenders are amazing at suggesting the right wine with your meal. I love this place.
author: douglas B.

description: Couldn't even eat here. We're turned away at the door with EVERY table open in the restaurant. All reserved for the night. Would not recommend this place based on the way we were treated.
author: Chris S.

description:
Came here for a holiday lunch last week and I have to say, I was really disappointed. We ordered the following:

Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips with lemon and seasalt ($7): This was ok.  Crispy, tangy and salty... issue was, it was a bit TOO salty. 

Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp with hot and boozy cocktail sauce ($13): The spicy sauce tasted really good with the jumbo gulf shrimp. Grilled to perfection. Meat was very juicy. 

Marlowe Burger ($13): I ordered it medium rare and it that is how I got my burger. It was really juicy but lacked flavor to make it worth the price. I want to say the burger was salty, but I wasn't sure if it is the fries that made it taste salty. The downside of the whole thing was that the fries was just too salty. At first I thought it was just me, but my co-worker looks at me and asks me if it was salty and I said yes. I had to use my steak knife to scrape off all the excess salt in order to eat the fries. I was just very disappointed. 

Service was good. We requested a lot of things from the servers and they were very accommodating.  Just sad that most of the things I ate was way too salty!!
author: Erica T.

description:
I love this place; bacon and egg is awesome. I used to eat the chicken a lot, but recently tried the burger. Both are fantastic. Can be a wait, avoid sitting by the door as it's cold.

edit: I totally forgot about the brussels sprout! You have to order them.
author: Russell S.

description:
I took my dad here for his birthday a couple of weeks ago and it was fantastic!!

If you want to have a romantic dinner for 2 or a huge dinner party of 10, Marlowe isn't the place for you.  There's a few small tables for 2 or 4 around and one huge communal table.  They can accommodate big groups, but you'd be spread out down this long cafeteria-type table and it's hard to talk to everyone in the group since the restaurant tends to be very crowded and loud.  

The food here is ahhhh-mazing.  
LOVED the apps. We had: 
- the brussel sprout chips - crisp and delish
- burrata - sooo good. Creamy, fresh, and delicious.  My dad (who isn't a huge fan of cheese loved it)
- Bone marrow - who doesn't love beefy meat fat? (lol)
- Deviled eggs - tasty (mine are better, but best ones I've had in a restaurant)

Between us we had the pork chop, 2 burgers and a little gems salad.

The pork chop was amazing.  Perfectly cooked, tender and juicy.  It was super tasty and weirdly tasted like steak sometimes. The burgers were good, the meat was definitely quality beef.  My only complaint was that there was too much bread in the bun. It felt like bread with some meat on the side.  The little gems salad was great - I'm a sucker for fresh vegetables!

Overall, I'll be back...and I definitely want to try some of their drinks when i'm there next.
author: Cheryl L.

description:
The service is phenomenon. We arrived for our 10 pm reservation a few minutes late, but our table wasn't ready. We waited maybe 10 minutes when the hostess came by to apologize (again) and brought us their toasted pistachios. We got our table right after that and right away they brought us the crispy brussels sprout chips - on the house. I was so used to waiting for food while I was in SF (Mama's and Swan Oyster Depot) that this 15 min wait did not even made a bleep on the bother-scale. In fact, I've never come across a restaurant that would do this.

We ordered roasted bone marrow, chiogga beets, baked oyster, crab cake, and the anson mills polenta. The crab cake was so good! You can taste the huge amount of crab meat instead of just a little meat and tons of breading. The polenta - man, talk about a mouth full of creamy goodness. It was light - not heavy like I expected and the mushrooms...hmmmm I wish I ordered that for myself instead of sharing! hahaha.
author: Jennie L.

description: The Chicken sandwich & brussel sprout chips are to DIE for.  Tables are very close together (you'll basically be sitting right next to your neighbor) and the interior is very decorated in a super chic way. Make reservations!
author: Irin S.

description:
**FAVE AMERICAN RESTAURANT IN SOMA**

I absolutely loved this place. My ideal restaurant hands-down.

It was not big. It was intimate, perfect for a date or a small group at one of the communal tables.

Not too bright, dark modern and rustic. Think Breslin at the Ace Hotel in NYC.

Our server, Ana, was EXCELLENT. She was friendly but not overly. She refilled our waters, took our orders, and asked us if we liked our meals - - all in orderly fashion. 

Now, onto the show:

MUST MUST ORDERS:

(1) Brussel chips ($6) - Addictive as hell. So good. So different. So must have.

(2) Steak Tartare ($12) - Rich, but oh so good. Perfect with the provided bread. Intense flavor.

(3) Roasted Bone Marrow ($11) - Fatty. Beautifully paired with the side garlic.

(4) Burger ($13) - Best burger I've had in a long-ass time. The fries were INCREDIBLE. Perfect burger in every way. Must order MED RARE to appreciate the true beef flavor.

(5) Panna Cotta ($6) - The bourbon on top was KILLER. Genius move. Loved it.

Wow, one of my favorite meals in SF. Will definitely return.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
author: Betty N.

description:
That is my favorite restaurant in town. 
I love the ambience, the friendly staff and the food is amazing! 
I have not tried their burger yet (even though I love meat) but the chicken and the polenta are by far my favorites!
author: Mara B.

description: A really cool place with decent although rather greasy burgers. The atmosphere is bright during the day but still cosy and nice. A good place for a work lunch.
author: Khash S.

description:
Bah... bahh... Buuuurger

It's 10am and I'm thinking about burgers. Don't judge me. I was thinking about my two favorite burgers in San Francisco at NOPA and Marlowe. They're both simple, executed well, and thus eff-ing delicious. The wrinkle is that NOPA uses 100% grass-fed beef and Marlowe... hmm... I forget... Let me look it up. So they add 20% lamb into the predominately beef patty.

Though I think NOPA wins the burger battle I can't start to name all the awesome things about Marlowe. Wait, I will... the brussel sprout chips, bone marrow, deviled eggs, baked oysters... Darn, I'm pretty hungry now...
author: Al L.

description:
BEST BURGER iN TOWN!!

I normally order a burger rare.  Why?  Because when I order a burger rare, it ALWAYS comes out medium rare.  Whenever I used to order a medium rare burger at other restaurants, they always came out medium well, which does NOT fly with me.  Call me a savage, but I like to see a little [or a lot of] blood in my meat.  This is a tried and true technique for me. 

Not with Marlowe!  My burger came out seared, perfectly red and juicy in the middle.  Cradled in a soft bun with caramelized onions, melted cheddar, shredded lettuce, bacon, and horseradish aioli, the Marlowe burger was a tantalizing dream come true!  Every bite was flavorful and delicious!  I`m drooling on my computer just thinking about it LoLx

The Brussels Sprout chips are so ADDiCTiNG!  Crispy fried and flavored with lemon and sea salt, you can't have just one.  The Roasted Bone Marrow with salsa verde is decadent and sinfully delicious.  The Baked Oysters are creamy, smokey, and oh so good!  The Deviled Eggs are small bites of pure heaven.  

Some of the servers are a bit standoffish, but the food more than makes up for it.  The restaurant is small, so it's not a good place to go with a big party.  Also, they do table sharing, so this probably wouldn't be a good place to bring someone on an intimate date.  Since it's a small place, it also gets LOUD when the place fills up.  All in all, I'd definitely recommend this place to all my friends.  Writing about the food here is making me hungry.  Now I want a Marlow burger and roast bone marrow... :x
author: Dee W.

description: Loved almost everything about this place.  Great, bright, french-bistro atmosphere with energy and moderate noise.  We actually decided to dine at the bar instead of our table, and loved the bartender and the vibe.  Hands down the best fresh corn soup I've ever had (and I am quite a foodie). Burger and baked oyster amazing as well.  My only disappointment were the warm chocolate chip cookies, which I got in a box to go. They seriously need to rethink that recipe - very bland in flavor, and at $2.50 a cookie, they should be better.  All in all, service very good and attentive, great atmosphere, and yummy bites! Will definitely go back.
author: Tanya M.

description:
I came back last night with my friend because we were craving a good burger. Although we had reservations for 9PM, we still had to wait about 10 minutes before our table was ready. I would've been fine with that but there is absolutely no room to wait inside the restaurant and it was extremely cold outside. 

We ordered a carafe of red wine, 2 Warm Deviled Eggs, and a medium rare burger each. Our food came out extremely fast but our wine did not. The eggs were surprisingly good, but expensive at $1.50 for 1/2 an egg, not "a" egg like the menu states. The burgers were cooked perfectly but the patties were a bit thin for my taste and the bun also three times as thick. The fries were DELICIOUS though. Fried perfectly and the horseradish aoili that accompanied it was delicious. We ordered the Chocolate Creme Pot for dessert and I was bit disappointd. The sea salt definitely overpowered the chocolate in the dessert. 

Another negative, in my mind, is that there is only one bathroom in the whole restaurant. I just wanted to wash my hands but standing around, waiting for the bathroom to become available was a bit awkward because, as stated before, there is no standing room. 

Overall, after a second try, I am sad to say it wasn't the "BEST" burger I've ever had. It is one of BETTER ones I've had though.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Pretty good place but there are some things about this place that kind of doesn't make sense. Had a reservation here for my family of 10. Like the previous big party review listed here, we were given a limited/smaller menu. We were not told of this which is kind of a bummer. We did not see the bone marrow nor the scallops on the menu, which happened to be the two things we wanted. As the previous post stated, "What's the difference between 5 tables of 2 coming in ordering bone marrow and scallops and our table of ten?" Well, the difference is that in situation 1, there would never be a moment where ALL 5 tables would be sat at the same time. Front of house will stagger those tables out so that the kitchen doesn't get overwhelmed with the orders. I'm guessing the scallops and bone marrow are very long and task heavy dishes that would halt the kitchen. I just wish they would've told us.

The food overall was pretty good. For starters, we had the ahi tuna, steak tartare, brussel sprout chips, and baked oysters. The ahi tuna was OK. The tuna salad thing that came with ahi was mediocre.
