The brussel sprout chips were tasty. Baked oysters... well didn't really taste the oyster. It was just all cheese and bread crumbs. For entree, I got the pork chop. It was delicious. Props to the chef. I got some steak from my mom's dish and that was also incredibly tasty as well.

Overall, I'd definitely come back here but I wouldn't say that every item on this menu is worth getting.
author: edward k.

description:
I came here with a party of 5 on a Friday night. We mistakenly booked a reservation for the following night and even though it was packed the wait staff were kind enough to seat us anyway. 

I loved the dark ambiance and the food was delicious! I'm going to mention what everyone else has probably already said - the brussel sprout chips are heavenly. For the main course I had the Poulet Vert which was very moist and seasoned well.

Overall Marlowe created a great dining experience.
author: Rachel M.

description: Had an excellent lunch with girlfriends. At 11:15 AM on a Wednesday, there was already line! We were lucky to get in without a reservation. Brussel sprout chips are out of  this world!
author: Maxine D.

description: I don't always trust Yelp reviews, and I don't often review restaurants. Dined at Marlowe for the first time this week and the whole experience was excellent. Very friendly and attentive service for such a hip joint - from hostesses, to runners, to waiter. Brussels sprout chips are worth the hype. I've never been served such a gorgeous, flavorful little gem salad in my life. The poulet vert was out of this world. And excellent cocktails, to boot. We didn't try any of the more adventurous animal parts on the menu, but this is probably the place to do that. Thumbs up all around.
author: Buffy T.

description:
Ok, so I found Marlowe thanks to a Yelp search for brussel sprouts. Hey, I like veggies! I came in on a Monday around 830pm, and it definitely crowded and lively. I decided to sit at the bar since I was traveling solo for work. The bartender was very friendly and super helpful. I had a few questions and she was very knowledgeable. Naturally I didn't hesitate to get the brussel sprout chips, and I was not disappointed! I ate them so fast, and they were delicious. I decided against a large meal, and went for the ahi tuna duo, which was good, but not out of this world. I also had a side of the roasted cauliflower, which is more like mac and cheese without the noodles. She warned me it was rich, but I had to try it. It was pretty decadently yummy. 

All in all I really enjoyed my experience here, I have even recommended it to a few of my friends that live closer to the area. 

I also found street parking really easily, a plus!
author: Afton S.

description:
Came here for date night with my boo! Cute and cozy spot. We couldn't make a reservation - but happily sat off to the side and devoured a carafe of wine and 2 espressos. :)

The hostess sat us up at the bar and the bartender kindly reviewed the menu with us. Everything looked amazing. 

Apps were about $10-$15 and entrees were near $26 for each. 

We started with bone marrow. Yep, i did it. And it was amazing i must say. Then we had the beet salad (ehhh ok) and the pumpkin bacon soup - AMAZING!

Then ordered the new york steak and the scallops. The steak was smaller than it should have been and the scallops had a cold olive tapenade on top...sort of weird? I'll eat any type of scallop. This was good but not amazing. Also ordered a side of brussel sprouts - too much butter/salt - not crispy how i like them. 

I'l be back to try more! I've heard the brussel sprout chips and shrimp is excellent!

My recoommendation: Make a rezzie or be prepared to wait! NO BOOZE! Only ber and wine!
author: Heather H.

description: Neat hidden gem in Mission Bay across from the Caltrain station. The atmosphere has a cool industrial, simplistic feel. They have some awesome drinks! Airs a bit loud at lunch but not that you won't enjoy. Healthy selections and tasty appetizers. Coming back for  dinner..Try the Brussel sprout chips! Staff is friendly too!!
author: Marie P.

description: Not sure what all the fuss is about... food is good but not amazing. The burger is very good, but why would you come to a place like this for a burger for dinner? Also, the server kept confusing me and my friend and ended up forgetting a couple things throughout the course of the night. I know we're both Asian but come on...
author: Amy Y.

description: This is the pinnacle of neo-American dining. Everything is modern, from the food to the atmosphere. I highly reccomend the roasted bone marrow. One of the most fantastic and unique dishes I've have the pleasure of eating. For dessert, go for the chocolate cream pie. It's rich and the oreo-grahm cracker crust is the cherry on top (or bottom in this case). The service was friendly and good. Definitely earned a 5 star rating.
author: Zane D.

description:
I'm not really good at comparing burgers to each other mainly because I'm pretty easy when it comes to burgers. Well, comparatively so compared to the LA foodies who have 10+ gourmet burger places to choose from. What I look for in a burger:

- A good toasted bun which can retain its form even when the juices from the beef patty leak out. Usually I find that it helps to burn the inner end of each side of the bun a little because this forms a shield of sorts which is not easily permeable by liquid. Additionally, a good burger bun should never be chewy. That's what the bun is there for.
- As far as the beef patty goes, the typical rules for good beef apply. On top of that all you want is a good crispy sear on the edges of the patty after a medium rare grilling.
- A nice slice of cheese that stays gooey and melty while you eat the burger.

I would say that Marlowe's burger gets the patty and cheese close to right but I wasn't totally sold on the bun. While it was easy to bite through, there wasn't much else to it.

And have some perspective, it's $12 or more to have it. There's something not right about a beef patty, buns, cheese and fries breaking the double-digit barrier. (Though moving to NYC I am sure I will have to change my thinking on this or go hungry.)

Marlowe's burger was good, just not poetry in motion. So it doesn't get my top marks.
author: Josh K.

description: The new location in the old Coco 500 space is absolutely gorgeous. They opened it up, and now use white tiles everywhere for an airy & clean feel without being sterile. The food has improved immensely, with a lot more diversity of texture on the plate. Their burger still kills it, and is my second-favorite in SF next to Citizens Band. The black cod entree was amazing, and the pea / salmon pancakes good but a little mushy. I asked for a non-sweet cocktail, and was served one perfectly made.
author: Ben G.

description:
Two words:

Bone marrow.

It's worth the wait or sitting at one of those ridiculous high tables or one of those communal tables that force you to be friendly, even if you're on a date.

Brussels sprouts chips are a non-healthy alt because they have more oil on them than the Exxon Valzdez spill.

Pork chop was not dry, as many of them can be.  It's the other white meat that's not chicken, thank goodness.  The sole was good, but not as good as my chop.  Have also had a burger and fries here, which are top notch.

Have the duck liver on toast....good going.
author: Dina F.

description:
Nice atmosphere, but we were disappointed in the food. We made a reservation because we saw the burger on the front of the San Francisco Magazine and it looked amazing!! 
The burger my husband ordered didn't look anything like that picture and it was just bland tasting.
We shared the bone marrow, deviled eggs, brussel sprout chips...none of them were that special. Our entrees were chicken and burger...just not that great.
The kicker is that we had told the hostess that it was my husband's birthday and at the end of the meal our waiter showed up with the bill in a little dish with a candle on it!! Maybe throw in a dessert next time if you're lighting a candle.
author: Cheryl R.

description: The burger is yummy not greasy and just the right amount of flavor. The fries are good also.  As for a few of the other dishes, those haven't been bad either (pork chops.  The deviled eggs are awesome.
author: Cia C.

description:
The best pork chop ever. Make sure someone in your party orders the pork chop so you can share. We also had the burger. The french fries were excellent - exactly how french fries are suppose to be served, hot, crispy, delicious!
The service was outstanding.
author: Erin L.

description: Ho hum...another trendy urban restaurant. The space felt cramped and the noise level reflecting off all those cold, white walls and marble tables was deafening. Service was slow at first. I'm not sure who eventually came to our table to finally get a drink order but it wasn't a server. Maybe she felt sorry for us. Eventually our server wasn't so slammed, and she was very pleasant. I had the burger: small but tasty, but the bun was dry. Yeah I know it wasn't an adventurous order but I didn't feel like dropping $100 for dinner. My friend liked the bone marrow. We ordered a nectarine dessert but had to send it back. They never should have sent out those hard underripe nectarines. Overall, if I want that kind of food or that kind of experience I'll stick with places like Frances.
author: Denis B.

description: Wonderful vibe, great for group dinners. Service was good and the burgers are definitely medium rare good! You'll have a fun evening out with friends here.
author: Angie B.

description:
10.13.10

I've been dying to try Marlowe since they took over South.  Finally got a chance today for a department lunch.

They had a daily special drink: blood orange mint iced tea ($5) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=K7e49s3cWVuNVisjaAll6g.  Less than stellar, save your dollars and drink the water instead.

We had the little gem salad ($8) for the table to start - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=AQ2fm3Nw6xt0SxyxpfX8zw.  Avocado, veggies, citrus vinaigrette.  Pretty awesome, and definitely refreshing.

I moved on to the sweet corn soup ($9) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=iOt-8X4HDgYLpYeTzxD_OQ.  I'm a sucker for anything with corn, and this dish did not disappoint.  I slurped it down to the last drop, and really wanted to lick the bowl, but I was in work company, so I held back.

We also had the must have brussels sprouts chips ($6) for the table - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=kJXZA2N7_VqCIPqF1WiGlQ.  Believe the hype.  This isn't the brussels sprouts you put in your mouth as a kid only to spit it out into a napkin when your mom isn't looking.  I'll trick myself to believe that it's good for me, too.

By the time the entrees came I was already more than half full.  Then I saw my burger ($12) - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=YtTz8CKWrqrEYdZ7_0SY1g.  Not going to lie, it was monstrous.  Caramelized onions AND bacon on top of a medium rare patty?  Sign me up.  The fries were crunchy and flavorful to boot.

The others had the $12 steak tartare (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=M3HLkajsMmWLgKpPqLHaCQ) and the $11 pulled pork sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/c0WpyZFR3EoEBKcoY2LZ3Q?select=tcrmd53iXpu2xEXoWEFS3w).  Both were A-OK, but I would definitely suggest the burger over either.

Total tab: $105.
author: Jenny L.

description: Loved our experience here.  I came out for a work trip and this was one of the most enjoyable parts.  I had the Bone Marrow and Burrata to start and the burger which was amazing. All I would recommend!
author: Josh A.

description: First day in San Fransisco. Came upon this place and checked out the menu. My guys love burgers, so it was a top choice for them. Go here and order a burger and roasted brussle sprouts!!! Delicious!!!!!!!
author: Lynn B.

description: I guess everyone likes a different kind of burger. I was surprised at just how greasy and not so flavorful Marlowe's famous burger was -- couldn't finish even half. I went to Morton's instead for their secret dry-aged burger (only served at the bar fyi). So much better. Like butter, but not greasy. Nice choice of toppings on the Morton's burger, too. Subjective preference.
author: Dennis W.

description:
I went to Marlowe for DAT Lunch Friday 1/21/11.  It's a long walk from Market Street, but I did it.  Across from Caltrain Station, on Townsend between 4th & 5th.

Got there later than I usually eat lunch around Noon.  It's a small restaurant and other people had reserved tables, but I was able to eat at the bar.  The bar can fit 6 people and 2-3 on the little counter at the end.

Got FREE iced tap water.

You can pick a starter (soup or little gem salad) & a sandwich (burger or shrimp roll) for $17.95 for DAT Lunch.  My picks:

Jerusalem artichoke soup - I thought it was ok, very creamy.  Green artichoke soup w/ cream fraiche,  & some crispy sunchoke chips - I took out the crispy stuff & mixed in the cream fraiche.  Tasty enough.

Burger w/ side of greens or fries.  I requested a medium rare burger & side of greens.  Burger was tasty enough, it was medium rare, cheddar cheese & some bacon inside.  Greens were average.

My bill:
$7.95 DAT soup (reg. $9)
$10 DAT Burger (reg. $12)
+.72 SF Healthy Tax
$1.78 sales tax

$20.45 before tip & tax.

One unisex bathroom left side of bar.
author: Ann L.

description:
Friday night, party of 4, no reservation= big mistake and a 1.5 hour wait. Do yourself a favor, the restaurant is tiny, make a reservation!

This restaurant is cozy and definitely has a neighborhood feel.  The hostess (possibly owner/manager) is from New Zealand and tries her best to get everyone drinks while they wait.

We were finally seated at a communal table (almost picnic style) but there was a huge beam in between my friends and I. A little strange seating seat up.

We ordered a variety of items. I had the burger (great), the hubs had the roasted chicken (very flavorful, better than NOPA, also yummy), and we shared the brussell chips (not a fan-too bitter and too salty).  We also ordered a dessert, some kind of fruit crisp and were disappointed with the flavors in that.
author: Betty C.

description: Knowledgeable staff. Busy neighborhood vibe. Seemed like the place had many regulars, which is always a good sign. Ordered a perfectly cooked steak...which my server paired nicely with a Bordeaux that was nicely balanced. Oysters were remarkably fresh and full of flavor. Will definitely return!
author: Sandra A.

description: Great addition to San Francisco's culinary scene.  Friendly staff, hip ambiance and particularly noteworthy service from Akeisha (who made our evening's dining experience fun and very memorable).  Unfortunately, with the exception of my black Cod plate, all the dishes were excellent.
author: Paul C.

description:
Love this place.  We live right down the street and came in after work for a quick bite.  Sat at the bar area, since it would be a long wait for tables.  I know prefer to sit up there.  The man running the bar is so nice and engaging.  The crab cakes and burger are KILLER, and the fun cocktails (with no liquor, only wine and champagne) are so fun and unique.  There is a White Wine Port Mint Julep that they  made up, and I'm Obsessed. 

They always say its a 30 - 45 min wait, but you can have wine/cocktails while you wait, and we seem to get in within 20 or so min. 

Highly recommend, great staff, and great ambiance!
author: Cara C.

description: Dinner is amazing! Like the pork and cocktails! It'll be better if you book a table first because there's always a long line everyday
author: Xi L.

description: Small and cute. The Brussels sprouts are great and the burger was pretty good too. I liked their other location better, but will come again.
author: Natasha M.

description:
I ate at Marlowe with my aunt and my brother on Dec11. The menu online seemed promising (ie they got me with the usage of a good few "key words"). I called on Dec10 to make a reservation for 7PM on Dec11. The person who answered the phone was quite nice... but there was nothing available that evening unless I wanted to go in at 630PM or 1030PM.

I said I would take the 630PM... but I might need to cancel it later if I could find another place that had 7PM open. She was kind and said that would not be a problem. The same lady called to confirm my reservation sometime in the afternoon and I confirmed since other places in the area were also booked.

When we arrived at the Marlowe, I could see why reservations filled up so quickly. The place is very small, but it has an intimate feeling to it. Cute! Our party was actually a bit late to the restaurant... but we called them and asked if it was ok or not. They said it was fine since they had budgeted a certain amount of time for us to eat and the next reservation for our table was at 8PM. Very good for them (a little bad on us...).

We ordered...

Brussel sprout chips : Hmm. I think these are a little overhyped on yelp for me. Yes, they are good. They were also on the oily side (yes I know they're fried... but still!). I liked the citrus they used to season the chips... but the salt was unevenly distributed. Some chips were fine and some were unbearably salty.

Baked oysters: I was amazed at the bed of sea salt these were served on. It looked cool... kinda like how raw oysters are served on ice. I was also amazed that they were so so so salty! The reason they were so salty was because of the bacon bits and additional sea salt on top of the oysters. Salt does bring out the flavor of certain foods... but one must be careful with sea salt. Its huge chunks can lead to overseasoning. The oyster however was fresh and nice... I just think the preparation and flavor profile of this dish was too heavy handed.

Baked bone marrow: It was good.... but again, very very salty. I don't know how people can enjoy this dish when all I tasted was salt and fat. I also could've used a few more slices of bread to eat it with. I'm glad this appetizer was shared... there's no way I could have eaten this salty dish all on my own. Though a chick at a table to my right had no problem doing so. Hmm...

With these salty appetizers, I made a request to one of the servers.... our entrees HAD to be cooked with less salt!

And they delivered... sort of.

My aunt ordered the stuffed sole with dungeness crab. It was cooked well... the flavor was light. Just the sort of thing my aunt likes... except she eats blander than bland food and she still thought the dish was salty. I thought it was fine though?

My brother ordered their famous burger with bacon, carmelized onions, and fries. The fries were good... but the aioli was just so-so. The aioli didn't have enough punch (or in this case... wasabi flavor). I didn't try the burger, though my brother said the bacon was pretty salty. But it's bacon... it's supposed to be salty... but I can't say since I didn't try it.

I ordered the pork chop... which was just okay. I liked the sauce they used... it was a bit sweet and mustardy... yum! The pork chop I got was just OK... some parts were very fatty. Some parts were cooked all right... some parts seemed over cooked. The sides were excellent, the potato things they had on the side were very good and rich. I believe they are called "parmesean dumplings" on the menu. The applies also went well with the sweet taste of the pork chop.

 should also add that their portions are quite generous. After eating my entree I was REALLY stuffed. But yes... there was a bit of room for dessert. ;) For dessert, we ordered the pear crisp with bourbon ice cream. It was good, though the sauce they used in it was a little too sweet for my tastes. I'm sure most people will like it though. I didn't like the presentation of the dessert in the jar though... for $8 the jar just kind of screams "cheap." Part of why I like dessert is the nice plating. However I noticed this places likes "jars" since the deviled ham special was also in a jar... Maybe it's just their thing.

Overall rating is a solid 3. It's ok... there are better places out there. However their service is quite good as I mentioned. Our beverages were also constantly refilled without asking, excellent. One piece of advice: their kitchen is kind of slow... so keep that in mind. If you're looking for a "quick dinner"... Marlowe isn't it. But if you have some time to spare... it might be worth a try if you have a higher salt tolerance than I do. ;)

Will I return? Maybe to try the burger... but there are so many other places to check out that this will need to wait.
author: michelle l.

description:
I was introduced to Marlowe on a random day and told that it was hard to get a table.  I walked in with my friend and put on a little charm and luckily they were able to seat us pretty quick knowing that we just came for the burger and would be out in 40mins or so.

We started off with the Steak Tartar even though we were about to get our week's worth of beef for the evening - great start.  Then the burger came and we got a side of Brussel Sprouts.   Not the best sprouts I've ever had but I do have to say that the burger was one of the best in the city, and I've had quite a few.  Go on the early side with a party of 2-4 and you'll be sure to get in.
author: Kevin J.

description: I was informed that this place was known for its burger, information also gained from the waitress. After ordering it, I asked myself what the big deal was. Ordered a few more items/appetizers and didn't really quite enjoy it either, now do I remember exactly what it was, no I don't, and maybe that's not a good sign that I don't remember it. Either I have bad memory or it was less than favorable. None the less, would I go here for their *HIGHLY RATED BURGER,* most likely not. Would I go and recommend this spot to someone, also, most likely not. Oh wait, I would recommend it to folks who are in the general area who want to go out and be in a loud, social setting and plan on having drinks, but then again, there are bars for that.
author: BA C.

description:
Easily my favorite American restaurant in SOMA.

Baked Oysters and Brussel Sprout Chips are a must order. MUST!
I haven't had the chance to try the lunch menu, but I haven't been disappointed by any of the dinner entrees. Fresh seafoods or braised lamb and pork... YUM!

Make sure to book this place early, as the wait could be 30-60 min long if you fail to make a reservation.
author: Rui R.

description:
The Steak Tartare is TO DIE FOR!  

Ok with that being said, I love this place.  The intimate setting is great for a drink out with a few friends or a date.  Communal style tables, so if that's not REALLY your thing (it's not for everyone) then it could be a con, however they're not all like that.  

Went for lunch with a friend mid week and it was still fairly crowded (which says a lot).  Had the poached egg sandwich and it was heaven.  

Service is great, but I believe it would be best for reservations!
author: Daniella J.

description: Went here for brunch,  food was good,  flavorful however portions were small,  if it wasn't for the bad service I would give this place a 4
author: Yousef A.

description:
Oh man! I think I set myself up! I was so excited about this place and had expectations that were just too high.

We had the famous burger, chicken, bone marrow, brussels sprout chips, baked oysters, deviled eggs, tcho chocolate cream pie, and panna cotta. 

Nothing was outstanding. Don't get me wrong, the food was not bad at all. I just expected to be blown away by the reviews, pictures, etc. 
The service was great, very friendly. Atmosphere was cool and had a good vibe.
author: Charlene R.

description: My mom and I sat for 17 minutes without any service. We left the place, without even been offered water.
author: Aniuska A.

description:
Fantastic service.
Recommend: brussel sprout chips, bone marrow, burger, roast chicken

Service: our reservation table was running a few minutes late (only 10!), so they gave us all glasses of champagne(!).  We also ordered entrees to share, and without us even asking, they brought it out pre-divided / cut for everyone.

Food: the brussel sprout chips are a really cool take on sprouts -- really similar to kale chips, the burger was cooked just right at medium rare, and the roast chicken was both flavorful and tender.
author: Sean L.

description:
OMG...definitely was blown away by the Marlowe burger.  Had read the reviews and was expecting a fairly good burger - but had my expectations exceeded!  Tried the brussel sprouts chips and that also left a smile on my face.  My friend had the Fried Chicken Sandwich and looks like I will have to find an excuse to go back to try it!  

Lunch platters were a really nice sized portion - delectable and oh so tasty!  Glad they didn't go overboard with serving size which seems to be the trend wth some places...
author: Novia C.

description:
Great food. Beer and wine only, and hard to seat large parties (7+) unless with a reservation. We had one and still had to wait 20 minutes. But without even asking they brought out free appetizers to our table 

Great service in a unique location. Good for after work with friends. Also a trendy place
author: Marc M.

description: The food and location are pretty amazing and I really loved the service but with the hot weather and no AC it was a little brutal for me. I started with the English Pea pancakes which were very different and flavorful then ended with the Marlowe burger which was dripping with juice and tenderness. I loved whatever they had soaked the meat in and wish I could have had the recipe.
author: Etta H.

description: Really enjoyed Marlowe.  Good service and food.
author: love n.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Make reservations long ahead of time. Go with a group and order a ton of different things.
author: Brenden M.

description: Honestly this was the best brunch I have ever had. The atmosphere is wonderful. The staff is so welcoming and great with suggestions. Make a reservation to save yourself any frustration. Eating here will not disappoint!
author: Matthew K.

description:
Food and sevice was exellent
 If your torn between the pork chop and chicken, opt for the chicken
author: Scott W.

description:
We went here for my girlfriend's birthday. This was during the last week of dine about town. I had reservations at other restaurants, but cancelled them for the awesomeness that is MARLOWE. The staff was amazing & went above and beyond to make the night special for my girlfriend. We did have a 10-15min wait paste our reservation time because the people at our table were taking their time, not marlowe's fault. The waitress gave us a free app when we sat down as an apology. Not needed but that was very nice of them. They put a candle in her desert towards the end of the night as well. The only thing I've never really liked about the spot was the space, its very cramped especially if you're at the community table. Its also a bit hot in there.

We ordered..
1) Crispy brussel sprout chips
2) Spiced jumbo gulf shrimp (the sauce is EXTREMELY SPICY be careful)
3) Angus New York steak frites (most amazing sauce ever!)
4) Brown butter brussel sprouts
5) Upside down strawberry crisp
author: Kevin K.

description: I came here with two friends and our overall opinion was that the atmosphere is relaxed and the service was excellent. The chicken was juicy and very tasteful. The pork chop was tough. The brussel sprouts were tasteful and perfectly seasoned. We also split a chocolate cream pie which came in a mason jar and was delicious. We all agreed that if it wasn't for the tough pork chop Marlowe would have received a five star rating
author: Natascha G.

description: I can't say enough great things about this restaurant. I took my family here after the play Beauty & the Beast. I called ahead of time to make sure they were going to be open and the hostess said no problem we will hold a table for you.  We each had different dishes and sampled from each others. The Rib eye was amazing, Risotto was excellent, pork chop was fantastic and the polenta was outstanding. We will definitely be back on our next visit to SF. Our waiter was outstanding!
author: George M.

description:
Delicious and affordable. 

1) Brussel chips - slices of brussels that were fried to have a crispy crunch. the aftertaste was a bit odd, but it was fun to eat

2) Bone Marrow - amazing huge pieces of bone marrow with slices of baguette. We spread the bone marrow on the bread with a capers sauce - melt in my mouth! the bone marrow tasted like butter.

3) French fries - freshly made with horseradish aioli

4) Sole - mmmmmmm. The sole was soft and stuffed with pieces of dungeness crab. Gobbled it up as quickly as I could

5) TCHO chocolate cream pie - rich chocolate with a crust that tasted like it was made out of coco beans. I wish there was more crust

Very good meal! The service was great.
author: Margaret R.

description:
After really enjoying their egg salad sandwich and the poulet vert I finally got around to trying the burger.  Although I still find Marlowe a gem of a restaurant, I really don't get the burger craze.  I mean, the burger is pretty good.  You can't go wrong with the burger.  But best burger ever?  That's a pretty tall order and Marlowe doesn't do it for me.  I'd stick to the egg salad and poulet vert.

Again, it was hard to see because it was so bright inside.  When will they fix this problem?
author: Jean K.

description:
Had a very enjoyable meal at Marlowe this weekend. 

Service was SO SO SO SLOW. Which happened to be fine by us, but it was literally a 2+ hour meal and we had to flag someone down every time we needed something. Very bizarre..... 

Bests:
Brussels sprout chips
Poulet vert
Caesar toast 
Buratta toast 

Pretty good:
Chocolate peanut butter pretzels 
Chocolate pudding
Steak
Burger 

Did not care for:
Cookies (tasted stale and store-bought!)
author: K. D.

description:
We were a party of 4 and looking forward to some yum yum food.  I was a little disappointed that it was wine and beer only but they had a couple of prosecco 'cocktails' that helped ease my pain.

Our dinner:
Brussels sprout chips
Burrata
Bone marrow
Burger
Poulet Vert
Scallops
Sweet Potato Gratin
Ahi Tuna Salad

We were all in agreement that the food was good.  I personally thought the chicken was the best thing out of everything we ordered - really tasty, crunchy skin, juicy and the accompanying crispy potatoes were delish.  The burger was, sadly, just ok.  Considering all the hype it's received, I was expecting to be blown away.  But unfortunately I think a lot of times things don't live up to expectations BECAUSE of all the high marks.  It's got nowhere to go but down.  Oh well.  Plus, when we asked the waitress for her recommendations and she highlighted the chicken and polenta (no mention of the burger), that should've been a warning right there.

One VERY disappointing aspect of the meal was the dessert selection. There's only 3 to choose from and none of them were appealing despite there being an option for some of our favorite flavors - chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.  

So the consensus for our group is that while we enjoyed the food and atmosphere, we wouldn't go back anytime soon.  There wasn't anything super special or different and there are SO many more options in the city to try.
author: Lena W.

description: I was really excited to try this place. The service was slow, food was ok orderded the corn soup and steak my friend got the burger she enjoyed it. Not worth the hype.
author: Huian M.

description:
3.5-4 stars.  Food was good, ambience was also nice, I probably wouldn't make it a point to return, but if I was in the area and nothing else was available I would. 

We had the burger, burratta, and brussle sprout chips. No complaints on the food, we also ordered the affagato for desert, which was strange ( not a traditional affagato ).  

Wine list was decent as well. 

For some reason though the restaurants vibe didn't really turn me on, or make it feel inviting. 

All in all the food was decent, service was good, and the price was average for a trendy/upscale place.
author: jason L.

description:
Whoa, my expectations were too high when I came into this restaurant. I saw someone on Yelp compare it to Nopa and Nopa it is not.

Every dish here is a-okay and we basically ordered everything on the menu at lunch, from their famous brussels sprout chips to their burrata, and two mains (one steak, one tuna conserva). None of them tasted bad, but it was all pretty basic. However, the burrata was too cold and tasted like a refrigerator. 

The prices are pretty decent and the service is smooth. It's unlikely I'd recommend this restaurant to a friend or go back by my own will.
author: Lisa Q.

description:
"They've got the nerve!"

Claimed my friend over lunch - as we realized their $8 white beach appetizer was nothing more than perhaps half a peach sliced with sea salt sprinkled on top and some dollops of cheese scattered on the plate.

Their other dishes were equally small and unsatisfying, with the exception of the green chicken dish whose fancy French name escapes me right now.  In short - dieters' heaven.  No one would ever run the risk of getting fat here.
author: Kristen S.

description: Had the deviled eggs, bone marrow, and scallops here.  The bone marrow was just OK, but the other two dishes were great.  The deviled eggs were a great mix of many different flavors, and the scallops were delicious and perfectly cooked, which seems to happen surprisingly infrequently.  I will definitely be coming back here for dinner sometime.
author: Simon L.

description:
I liked the burger, but it wasn't the best I've ever had. The fries were crispy and flavorful. 

We had brussels sprout chips that I do not recommend. If you roast brussels like we do, you know the straggly outers that fall off are okay tasting, but I personally wouldn't want to eat a bowl of them. 

The waitstaff were friendly and attentive. We were luckily seated in the very, very back - behind a door in a special area with 3 tables (one long and two smaller). I'd recommend sitting here if you go.
author: Cassie H.

description: Pretty delicious spot- not sure why it took me so long to get here. Yummy cocktails while waiting for a table and then shared bone marrow, Brussel sprout chips and the famous burger. All were amazing and can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Sarah A.

description:
Marlowe was great. I had reservations at 7pm but the table wasnt ready so we stood drinking wine and hanging out. 20 minutes and two glasses of cab franc goes by and we are finally seated.

Once we are seated, the waiter informs us that all the wine was on the house. He said it was the least they could do for making us wait. Ding, ding, ding.!! Hooray! Winner! 

Food: awesome! 

DUCK Liver Crostini ...11
roasted Champagne grapes, salsa verde
& pickled mustard seeds

Roasted Bone MARROW ...12
salsa verde & fines herbes

Warm Deviled EGG ...1.5ea
aged provolone, pickled jalapeño & bacon

Anson Mills POLENTA wild mushrooms, Parmesan & poached farm egg ...19

Marlowe BURGER caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli & fries ...14

Pan Seared Local Wild King SALMON roasted eggplant, crème fraîche, cucumber & red quinoa tabbouleh...26

All the food was amazing. The two top dishes above were the Bone Marrow and the Polenta!

The restaurant is small, like everything else in SF, but it was cozy and the noise was lively and fun. They have a good wine selection.
author: Steven W.

description:
So I came here after work one day with some friends. I have heard a lot of good things about this place but I think I might have set my expectations a little high. So what I got,
Bone Marrow, Brussel Sprout Chips
Porkchop,
Strawberry Crisp.

Bone Marrow was actually ok, not the best. But not bad. A little lacking on the flavor and the texture was a little off (not very smooth, actually kind of gummy). Sort of pricey for what you got. I mean I was expecting super buttery bone marrow that would just spread on all the toasts, with a bunch of herbs and spices on it, but it seemed meh for some reason. Came with a sauce that tasted good, but I mean yeah I could have just put the sauce on the bread then.

Brussel Sprout chips were amazingly tasty. I was not expecting that. Shared a bunch with a group of 3. I wouldn't call it a meal but it was a solid appetizer. 

Next was the pork chop, I was really really hoping for the same quality pork chop that you get at Nopa. It was a pretty big portion. The seasoning on the outside of the pork chop was pretty good. But the inside was really dry imo. I know it's pork but she said they would cook it medium. Left a bit to be desired although it was a lot of food. Still very pricey.

Strawberry Crisp - bleh just ice cream and a cookie or something. Not very crispy at all. Overall I was like um ok, this is it?

So it isn't amazing but it is not bad either. I don't find myself here on this side of the city too much in the evenings so I probably won't venture out for it again anytime soon, but I would be up for it.
author: Greg G.

description:
This place is really small so reservations is recommended. You are sitting uncomfortably close to the tables next to you.

Brussels sprouts chips: this is a winning dish, highly addictive so beware

Ahi Tuna Trio: don't order, too salty and tiny portion, it's more like an appetizer

Pulled Pork sandwich: looks really appetizing when it comes out! Plenty of pork chunks but a bit salty and the buns are really oily.
author: Emmie N.

description: Love it here. Great atmosphere, great service, great food. Best order was the deviled eggs. Definintely coming back here.
author: Popi N.

description: Breakfast is amazing including the bloody mary! We really lucked out, we showed up right when they opened. Highly recommended since it was packed with a huge line by the time we left.
author: Gessica T.

description: I'm giving the property two stars because the chicken sandwich was amazing but everything else was horrible, do not order the oysters you can taste and tell that it's slimy and warm as if they were pre shucked and replated for quick service. Also our server forgot my beer until thirty minutes later and you could tell it was warm and sitting at the bar and he simply forgot. Lastly after they took away or oysters it took another 30 minutes to get our entrees completely unreasonable they're is nothing worse then watching your neighbors get their meal before you when you arrived twenty minutes earlier.
author: Paul C.

description:
Great customer service

Had the Marlowe Burger...good; 
Fries had a great texture. Very good
Deviled egg.... OK. Different with cheese and jalapeño
Brussels sprout chips...good but a bit over cooked. This made them tasted slightly bitter.
Pork chops....good. extra thick to keep things moist. :) Great potatoes
Hopf beer...awesome if you like dark beers

Atmosphere was very dim to the point of annoyance. Felt like lighting was for a bar. There aren't too not many tables but they do have communal seating. . There is a bar with 7-8 seats open. Make reservations.
author: Eddie C.

description: Missed the chopped pork, ordered the pancake which is pretty Good, but I think it's a little bit overpriced.
author: Wu S.

description:
Very cozy spot for a date night!  My wife and I came here on Thursday and had a wonderful meal.  We definitely feasted.  Everything was delicious: the brussel sprout chips, the bone marrow, the mushroom polenta, and the burger.  Oh and we started out with the deviled eggs which I am not usually a big fan of but they had a unique take with jalapeno I was pleasently surprised.  Great wine available by carafe if you are not in the mood to take down a full bottle.

Service was great.  Very attentive the whole evening.  We will be back for sure
author: Jimmy E.

description:
Marlowe has created a monster. Their burger is so great I'm not sure that I'll ever order anything different as my main course, no matter how good everything else looked!

We started with the brussel sprout chips and burrata from the snack menu. If they sold these chips at movie theaters I might have to give up my popcorn addiction. As for the burrata, it was ooey, gooey greatness. A smaller portion, the perfect way to kick off the meal.

As much as I like bacon, I don't usually order it on my burger. But since Marlowe's burger came with bacon (and I'm one to always follow chef's orders!) I went with it. I find it hard to put into words how good this burger was. The meat was a perfect medium rare, perfectly seasoned and (following our theme) the fries were perfectly hot and crispy.

Wines are available by the glass, carafe and bottle. Service was great from beginning to end. But what stuck with us was how great the burger was. Wow. In a town full of fancy pants burgers, Marlowe's version deserves all the acclaim its been receiving and is firmly at the top of my SF burger list.
author: phil h.

description:
This place was incredible. I came here with a friend on a Monday night around 9pm (not very crowded at this time). We made a reservation here because it was close to where I was staying for work (near Caltrain at 4th/King). I had the polenta which was creamy and delicious. He had the burger which was about as amazing as a burger is capable of being. 

The real stars of the meal though were the appetizers. We got 2 deviled eggs to start and immediately had to order 2 more because of how delicious they were. The combination of herbs and the perfect crispy bacon was out of this world. The brussels sprout chips were also pretty incredible.

I'll be dreaming of those deviled eggs for a long time.
author: Carson S.

description:
I'm a fan of their sister restaurant, Park Tavern, so I knew that this place had to be just as good. 

I came with a group of people and ordered every appetizer plus the pork chop entree and scallop dish. The apps were phenomenal and I didn't dislike any of them. The favorite has to be the burrata one. (Burrata anything is delish, right??) 

The entrees were great as well. Service is superb and it's a great place to grub before a Gigantes game.
author: Joy A.

description: Absolutely amazing. The food was phenomenal, service was exceptional, and atmosphere was awesome. If you haven't been you need to go. We had the deviled eggs, baked mussel, bone marrow, pork chop, and burger. I would recommend all!
author: Sydney L.

description:
On a whim, we decided to visit Marlowe. For a few days all of our meals were associated with reservations made ahead of time. Funny enough, this unplanned visit to Marlowes was the best of our trip to SF. 

We sat at the communal table--and liked it. We enjoyed baked pistachios and brussel sprout chips. For our main, one got the pork chop and two had the NY Strip. Each dish was perfectly prepared and delicious. For dessert, they were presented in mini mason jars. The chocolate cake with sea salt was the perfect compliment to the dish before it. I recommend this place for a small group to grab a delicious and non-high maintenance meal. The only negative was the one stall bathroom. But all of the pros outweigh the cons, so get on it and get to Marlowes.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Went to the old location several times and enjoyed the food and service. The new location is bigger and brighter and let me tell you, loud loud loud. The food remains good, and service is great, but not so sure we'll be back anymore due to the noise level.
author: Bruce C.

description:
Came here today with Opentable booking, parking nearby isn't difficult if you look, unless you park in front= meters till 10pm, then it may be costly.
I added a friend to our reservation last minand the staff was very nice to accomodate our request, awesome+1pt.
The decor is intriguing in a way as the layout of the place isn't very big to begin with.
The menu is nice and simple, not too much option but very good selection of choices.
I ordered: brussel sprout chips (a MUST), oysters, duck liver tartar, bone marrow, and the marlowe burger. The brussel chips are amazing! Seriously delicious but greasy, so be aware. Oysters were small but good, order the qty you want = cool. Duck liver tartar disappoint, so i'd skip next time -1pt. Bone marrow was presented nicely, it was alright, not compared to some i've had elsewhere. The burger, ordered as medium rare came out Perfect! Also, because we had ordered so manydishes, we split the burger. The chef wasso nice to have cut the burger in half, and presented the halves in two dish, presentation became a WOW factor +2 pts!!
Dessert was the upside down strawberry, yumyum! Try it!
Bathroom was nice and sink was appealing, thought i put it out there.
Overall im a happy guest, good food and awesome service! This place was bustling during dinner time, i'd definitely return! Great job Marlowe team!
author: Hao B.

description: Awesome place for a date. Sat at the bar, where Gavin was an awesome bartender. Some of the better oysters I've had, and the burger was great. I hear the pork chop is awesome so I plan on going back.
author: Nick N.

description:
more like 3.5 stars.

we had the burger, pork chop, bone marrow, brussell sprout chips, and a deviled egg. Everything was good but nothing blew me away, especially for the price. Cost over $100 for two people. You can do better elsewhere.

The worst part about this restaurant is how close their seating is. I can tell you the life story of the group next to me even though I never wanted to know it. 

I'll probably try it again but I'm in no rush.
author: Jake B.

description: Crisp yet fluffy fries. Decently done burger. Friendly bartender. Trendy w/ lots of nicely and hipster dressed people around. A good atmosphere that's SF boom time. (Not normally my style but it suits the city well!) Dessert took 30 min though, and then they made it seem like it was just "on its way" -- clearly forgot the order as someone else was almost through their meal before we asked for the check. Tried to just pay and go but they kind of rammed it down our throats and charged us anyway. (Was only $10/person for that, so not end of world but made me almost eye roll.)
author: Conor M.

description:
I came in for lunch and I had the Brussels sprouts and the burrata sandwich - I am vegetarian. 
Both dishes were good - Brussels sprouts were well seasoned and lemony, size was decent and they were not greasy (happens many times with that dish, not sure why, maybe it's fried at some point...)
The burrata sandwich came with an interesting side of pickled vegetable and salad leafs ; bread was toasted and seasoned with an avocado spread - so I think some work went into it but overall the taste was not spectacular...
However, the price was spectacular...$16,  I think,  for the burrata sandwich...
I know by now that it was hand made, home made, etc. I know that rents, taxes, are high in SF but I am still seeking places to eat where there is a correlation between the price and the meal...put otherwise, places where when you sign the check, at the end of the meal, you feel the amount is reflected in what you had...these places became very rare...
author: VIORICA C.

description: Had dinner and drinks. It is a very small restaurant so definitely it's a place you need to have reservations. The bar has some amazing drinks, very original. I had the "sow" which was delicious and refreshing. My friend had the "country Lawyer" which was also spectacular. The appetizers we had were also delicious but extremely small in size for the price. The lobster and shrimp crepe was good, the burrata was also good. For a main dish I had the hamburger which was very yummy but pricey. My friend had the chicken and mashed potatoes dish and again it was good but small portions and expensive. The service was good. The place is very small but packed so it's hard to get a lot of attention from your waiter. But we were taken care of. For dessert I had the strawberry shortcake and my friend had the warm cookies. Both desserts were delightful. I'm not sure I will come back because of the expense. Our tab ended up being $178 for a drink, a couple appetizers, a hamburger and a chicken fish. And the restaurant is not very comfortable.
author: Shelly P.

description:
Love the food here but wish everyone else in town didn't.   It's always crowded to get in and a lil noisy because it's a small place.    The mood is very mellow w/ low soothing lightening and mild buzz of busyness in the air.   Nice wine selection with a couple pricier wines.   I know this.   Short story, had a blind date here that proceeded to tell me he didn't feel a connection but wanted to get my opinion on a girl that cheated on him and should he take her back.   I told him we needed more wine, ordered the good stuff and gave him the worst advice ever.   If you're not going to give your best effort on a date, I'm certainly not and it will cost you.   

The burger is everything it gets credit for and more.   You should get the Marlowe burger at least once.  My hands down favorite is their marrow.  Mainly because not many places offer it and Marlowe does it best.   If you've never tried it, this is the place to go for your first time.    Service is wonderful too from the hostess to the wait staff.

Highly suggest making a reservation, definitely not a walk in place.   Not saying you won't eventually get seated, just don't show up tired and hungry.   There's not room inside to wait so that leaves the stoop steps outside.....

And please, don't come in any party larger than 4, this is NOT ideal for large parties.
author: Deena B.

description:
I can't say enough about our delightful meal at Marlowe. Our waitress was knowledgable and professional. But in such a busy restaurant, having a floor manager to back her up was key. No finished plates stayed on the table, no empty glasses went unfilled. 

And the food? Brussels sprouts chips are yummy. The $2.50 half egg I could have lived without. But the pork chop (big enough for 2 people contemplating dessert to share) was a-mazing. And the vacherin was a light, sweet indulgence. Go There! Have fun! I wish I could be there!
author: Colleen A.

description: I talk about this place to everyone. The French wines that are offered here are amazing! Like all the reviews say, make sure you get the Brussels sprout chips and deviled eggs. Honestly, my mouth is watering just thinking about this place.
author: Michael H.

description:
Full disclosure: this was lunch on their first day at the new location, before the Giants playoff game. 
With that out of the way, the new space is larger, but the noise is unbearable. The waitress asked me to point at what we wanted. Service was chaotic, we got our drinks and brussels sprout chips quickly, but waited another 45 min for a burger and deviled egg sandwich. I couldn't wait any longer, because the pounding noise gave me a headache. The waitress was very nice, comped the drinks and appetizer and apologized. 
There you have it, you decide.
author: Howard B.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday dinner awhile back, and they were pretty accommodating... very important when you're with a large group!  However, though some of the dishes were hits, there were also a good number of misses.

HITS:
-Duck Liver Mousse
-Steak Tartare
-Brussel Sprout Chips (surprisingly, it works)
-Bourbon Ice Cream Pear Crisp dessert (very refreshing; recommended!)

MISS:
-Chocolate dessert ...Really gross... I typically like sea salt, but there was waaay too much sea salt in this chocolate, making it extremely salty.  I couldn't stomach more than a few spoonfuls, sadly.  Too rich, too much...don't get this!
-My friend's chicken dish was also way too salty
-My fish was entree was rather bland (reminds me of the kind of food you find at conference hotels)
-Lemon souffle was also a bit too rich -

I'm not totally sure if I'd come here again (given the number of misses when it came to the actual food), though it was overall a good night with great company...unless I happen to be really craving a lot of salt (and salty desserts).
author: Sarah T.

description: I have been here five times now, and have tried really hard to like this place. My partner and I live down the street and would come here when we wanted to eat something close. We have ended up EXTREMELY disappointed four out of the five times we have been there as the food tasted almost inedible. Had it not been for my partners inability to leave food we ordered untouched on the table there would have only been one or two bites taken from each plate. After each disappointing meal we would try to give them another chance because every time we walked by them they would be extremely packed and people seemed to enjoy it, but today was the last straw. The first two plates came out and I couldn't eat more than one bite. We will not be bringing our business back here anymore. This disappointment ruined my Sunday morning.
author: Isis A.

description: Very cute decor, it looks right out of Pinterest with the white floors and wood tables. The menu is a mixture of small bites, salads, sides, main dishes, dessert, and a good amount of drinks to choose from. There are options for vegetarians/vegans. My salad was so fresh! The waitresses are very nice and attentive. Can't wait to go back.
author: Krista E.

description:
Great food, beer and service. Started with the seafood pate, duck pate (amazing/probably really unhealthy for you). Topped it off with the Marlowe Burger & Fries. Wasn't the best burger ever (I miss you, NYC)...but still good.

Small place so be sure to make reservations.
author: Karen S.

description: Stopped in for lunch and got the deviled egg sandwich. It was incredible.
author: Kristin B.

description:
Marlowe is small so the place was pretty packed, but we were able to snatch the last 2 seats at the communal table without reservations on a Friday night!

The ambiance is nice - perfect for a date. 

My friend and I started with a devil egg each and it was was really good. I ordered the burger and it's definitely in my top 10 burgers EVER! i think the horseradish aioli made a big difference. I ordered it medium and it was a bit over-cooked, but it was OK with me. My friend ordered the stuffed sole and it was delicious as well. The baby fennel added a nice texture to the dish. If you like cheese, get the smoked cauliflower side dish, it was so good. I would order a few of them and eat it as an entree! 

I would definitely come back to try their other dishes...but who am i kidding, I'll probably ordering the burger again!
author: Terry C.

description:
I came here for their burger since I'd heard that it was fantastic and the new "IT" burger in San Francisco...overall it was okay, but nothing special.  The quality of the meat was good, but it wasn't seasoned very well.  Also, the amount of meat relative to the amount of lettuce/tomato/bun didn't quite work since you couldn't really taste the burger itself.  The bun was nice and dense and perfect for a burger.  The fries were pretty decent.
 
Overall, I thought it was good, but nothing great - there are a ton of other places that offer great burgers in San Francisco: Spruce, Fish and Farm, Burgermeister, Barney's.
 
As far as the restaurant itself, it's great - small and cozy, but cool and chic and very SOMA.  This is a good spot for a fun Friday or Saturday night since it has a cool, urban-hip crowd.  I'd come back, but I'd try something else on the menu.
author: Ken G.

description:
Try the panna cota affogado for dessert!  

The bone marrow is delicious.  At least 1-2 great vegetarian options.  The staff are super nice, especially the bartenders.

The biggest problem?  This place is small and loud!  Not the most private venue (lots of community seating) and probably unsuitable for business dinners.

Overall, I prefer Coco500 2 blocks away.

Nonetheless, a solid bet for SOMA.
author: Allen T.

description: No shortage of reviews here obviously-- Went for brunch with family on a Sunday, was able to get a reservation for 7 out in the teeny sweet patio only 2 days prior. Service was some of the best I've ever had. As a parent of a small child and someone who's married to a former server- I understand how annoying small children can be at a restaurant: they eat almost nothing but make a huge mess and are obnoxious to other tables who then take out their annoyance on you as the staff. This gal killed it- she was incredibly patient with my soft spoken 3 year old who loves to order her own food, while giving equal attention to every one else at the table. The food was some of the best I've had in the city-- and hands down the best burger. Ever. The polenta was also delicious, and there were rave reviews for the crab and lobster crepe. This place will not disappoint.
author: Anna L.

description: Ridiculously good burger.  Brussels sprout chips canNOT be beat.  To top it all off, the service is fantastic.  All in a beautiful space, what more can you ask for?
author: Ana M.

description:
Yes, Marlowe's burger is very, very good. Great, even. On its own, each ingredient is tasty enough -- Acme roll, Niman Ranch beef (plus a little lamb), horseradish aïoli, caramelized onions, shredded lettuce, and crisp bacon -- but in combination, they form a delicious Voltron for your mouth. The next time you're in search of grub near the CalTrain station, grab a drink at Marlowe's bar, order a bowl of crunchy/salty Brussels sprout chips, and tear into a burger. (It's better and cheaper than getting a beer, bratwurst and garlic fries at the ballpark, if that's where you're headed.)

But Marlowe's other food deserves high praise, too. The little gem salad and Berkeley burrata appetizer (with peach and chili) are nice, light starters, and the spiced prawns are terrific, too. I'm a big fan of the roasted bone marrow with salsa verde and herbs; I don't even bother spreading the oozy, fatty marrow on bread; after a dip in the salsa, it goes right into my mouth. And even my wife, who is unequivocally anti-scallop, doesn't mind the dayboat scallops with eggplant, cherry tomatoes, pine nuts and raisins. 

The only dish I've not absolutely loved is the seared halibut with spinach, glazed vegetables and bagna cauda butter. I'm sure an objective diner would find it delicious, but the subtlety of this plate was overpowered by the strong flavors of the other dishes I ate. 

Overall, I really dig this place. If you can access CalTrain, you should be eating here.
author: Henry F.

description: Good place to go after work and hang with friends.  Food is good, but portions are quite small for the price.
author: Edgar C.

description: Love this place. Limited menu, but very well executed. I was pleasantly surprised my first time, and I've gone back 5 or 6 times since.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Yummmm! 

I'm going to say it . . .better than Park Tavern.  I think the entrees were much better here overall than at Park Tavern.  Admittedly it may have been the chef the night I went to PT, but everything was a little over-salted and over-buttered (I know - I never thought there could be too much butter, but alas).  At Marlowe everything was juuuuuussst right. We started with the deviled eggs - delish!  Hubs got the Polenta and I got the Pork Chop.  The Tcho Pan Con Chocolate was absolutely the best -- we had to order two because there was NO SHARING going on. Service was great.
author: Kate H.

description: Drove by the place and it seemed like it had a good vibe. Hostess was great and said she might be able to get us a table b/c someone else canceled. We sat at the bar and waited 5 min. They placed in their back patio but we didn't really like it. So we went back to the bar. Drinks were amazing. I had the country lawyer, which is some twist of an old fashioned. Highly recommended. We didn't get main dishes but just some appetizers. We had the bone marrow and some special of the day that was bread and some dips. Definitely going to check this place out again for main dishes. Staff was superb. Great place.
author: Cëma M.

description: Awesome place! Super friendly service as soon as you walk in the door. The food is great. I usually go for a burger and a beer but their other dishes (like the chicken) are amazing too. Can get super packed and busy but they are usually able to fit me in somewhere which is cool. Usually at the bar which is great cause the bartenders are rad.
author: max f.

description: Great dining experience - we enjoyed the brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs and stuffed sole.  The risotto with the sole was delicious.  For dessert we had the chocolate peanut butter bites which were amazing.  Service was attentive.  Would definitely go back again!
author: Meghan M.

description: Terribly crowded and unhealthy food. I ordered a shrimp roll that came greased with butter and the side salad was extremely salty.
author: Masira V.

description:
Awesome meal.  They should sell their toasted pistachios with bourbon, maple & smoked salt for retail.  Try the roasted bone marrow.  I found Wayfarer Tavern's a bit better to eat but the salsa verde with herbs gave it a nice zing.  Got the addictive crispy Brussels sprout chips but may not be good for dates 'cause it's got that sprout aroma.  

The polenta with wild mushrooms, truffled pecorino and poached farm egg was almost too rich but we had a nice cab to cut through it.  Also got the blue sole stuffed with dungeness crab which was cooked perfectly but the winners were the Marlowe Burger with caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon and horseradish aioli and the poulet vert.  I rarely order chicken just because it's so easy for chicken to be overcooked or boring but this was phenomenal.  And arguably the best fries I've had was served with the burger.  Get it.

Pros: all of the above, good parking options, service was excellent despite us lingering over our meal on a busy night

Cons: Noisy, just beer/wine, can be crowded (but we bonded with our neighboring diners over how quickly we ate our respective burgers!)
author: kiwi l.

description:
I've dined here multiple times now. Just ate here last night as a matter of fact. I only have 2 check ins on Yelp but I've actually been here 6 times or so... 

I like going back to favorite restaurants when the menu changes.
My friend noted that it had changed so.... off we went.

ordered:
Baked oysters (new england chowder in a shell) - a favorite
steak tartare w/ poached quail egg & crostinis - they are light on the mustard so it's not too over powering. a great affordable tartare in my honest opinion.
brussel sprout chips - crowd favorite at Marlowe and pretty standard. I seem to always order this here.
honey glazed pork belly w/ braised beets, hazelnuts and vanilla cream - WOW. Hands down, probably the best pork belly I have had in a long time. My friend said it was the best pork belly he's ever had in his life. Excellent flavor from the honey glaze with the tartness of the braised beets. Amazing. Dare I even say... life changing?? hahahaa. The pork belly actually had fat AND meat on it. 
twice baked dungeness crab souffle w/ rock shrimp saute - LOVED. Once our server brought it over, I could already SMELL the crab before she put the plate down. One whiff and I knew I would be in love. SO MUCH SWEET DUNGENESS CRAB MEAT!! 
pan seared moro bay black cod w/ delta asparagus, Monterey squid, mussels, garlic aioli - this was something I could have done without. the black cod was not as rich and buttery as I have grown accustomed to. I really enjoyed the squid and mussels that adorned the cod though. Those were executed excellently.


Marlowe is a VERY solid restaurant and quite possibly one of my favorites in all of San Francisco.

MAKE A RESERVATION.
author: Susy C.

description:
There are so many reasons why I always leave Marlowe with a giant smile on my face:

Food: "Comfort food" is an understatement. It's pure exhilaration and complete satisfaction -- Brussels sprout chips and deviled eggs are a must. The steak tartare and bone marrow are incredibly rich and delicious, and their hamburger is the BEST in town. 

Drink: The seasonal cocktails are a wonderful start to your evening, and there are a wide variety of interesting selections by the glass.  You'd prefer to order a bottle?  Well, their well curated wine list is inspired and very reasonably priced.

Service: The staff welcomes you into their cozy space, where they work as members of a highly functional and happy family. The servers are extremely accommodating when it comes to sharing food and adapting dishes based on food allergies. The people behind the bar know their stuff and make excellent pairing recommendations. 

That's why Marlowe has become a destination for me, for special occasions and as a place to bring out-of-town guests for something a little different but always amazing.
author: Peng A.

description:
"I feel sorry for people that don't drink. When they wake up in the morning that's as good as they're gonna feel all day." Says one of the quotes written on the window looking in to Marlowe. How perfect since their wine list is something you can't pass up.

This place is hip, quaint, and ooze's with exceptional service and incredible food. The baked oysters were quite possibly the best I've ever tasted....no joke. They came out piping hot, you could see the butter melting off the oyster shell on to the plate, and the crispy salty bacon bits lying on top offered the perfect flavor combination to the slightly sweet oyster underneath. "Incredible!!" We uttered after each bite. The bone marrow was another culinary masterpiece along with the perfectly cooked juicy burger and crispy fries.

From what I hear this place always has a wait but don't let that deter you....go put your name in and order a glass of wine
 while you wait. Once your table is ready be prepared to pull up a bench and get to know the other diner's you're seated next to (think family style seating).

This place was a delectable treat and I can't wait to go back!
author: Kristy M.

description:
Appetizers: 

After reading reviews I was stoked to try the Bone Marrow - so many reviews said it was just fantastic. How can so many people be so wrong?!? I found it to lack flavor and substance although I will admit it was insanely tender. I think maybe my expectations were just far too high after reading the reviews, but both myself and my roommate were disappointed with the Bone Marrow. I found the Bacon & Egg to be a far better appetizer. Very unique, tasty, and very enjoyable. 

Dinner:

For dinner I had the Pork Chop and found it to be very good, but I've definitely had better. For $25 I'd say it was worth it but I'd probably try something else if I went back. Don't get me wrong, the place was good enough that I'd go back but I'd try something else on the menu. 

Dessert: 

Chocolate Mousse wasn't terrible but certainly not worth the calories. Had one bite and that was enough even for someone that loves chocolate. Upside Down Strawberry Crisp on the other had was AMAZING!!! Skip the chocolate mousse and go for the strawberry crisp - you won't regret it. 

Scene: 

Good upscale bar food scene. 

Service: 

Service was very good. Nice woman waited on us and I have to admit she warned us the Bacon & Egg was far better than the Bone Marrow. She was right.
author: Jackson B.

description:
I came to Marlowe for lunch to try their famous burger and I was not disappointed.  It came in a good size toasted bun with cheddar and bacon and an aioli sauce.  I think what really makes their burger is the sauce since the meat patty, bacon and cheddar were standard issue.  The funny thing I noticed that everyone of the male patron of this place ordered the burger.   

Overall, I was pretty impress with the good service and friendliness of the staff.  I don't think their burger was the best I ever had, however I could definitely see their appeal.  This is a good place that I would come back.
author: Jim J.

description:
Do I care that my sidekick was puking after dinner because she probably had a bad egg?  Nope, it's getting 5 stars.  In fact she also didn't care because the food was that good.  Now that's crazy, how can someone puke and still like this place?  Tells you something.  

I can't think of a bad thing I've eaten here, from the brussel sprouts to the mains to desert, all are done well.  It is a veryyyy rich meal so dont go in with too skimpy of a dress on a first date, because it's gonna stick out a bit when you're done.  Just saying.  

Small and intimate, tough to get a table, but a great vibe.  One of the few places in SOMA that actually delivers.

PS the puking was probably due to a egg recall that happened soon after we went so not blaming the restaurant because the dish required the eqg somewhat raw.
author: A A.

description:
This is a place that tries to do a lot, but doesnt do much well.  It is always packed, so I guess they have manage to convince enough people to put up with below average food to look cool in wannabe urban chic place.  For a cool vibe, I would much rather go to 25 Lusk.

I will say that the service was quite good here.  That was about it.  The decor, well there is not much space and some exposed brick, so i guess they were trying to look like a NY chic place.  It falls far short of that.

As for the food, I actually had to send one of the dishes back it was so bad.  I almost never send stuff back to the kitchen, but it the brussel sprouts were so salty, they were inedible.  The pork chop was good, but the parmesan dumpling was this over salted gross wad of cheese.  My friend had the risotto and again a bit over seasoned.  Everything was such a disappointment.  I ordered the lemon souffle to try to cleanse the palate and fortunately it was pretty good.

Save your time and don't wait for this place.
author: Scott C.

description:
This was my second time at Marlowe. I went here for lunch and recently went back for dinner with my boyfriend. 

We started off with warm deviled eggs and the bone marrow. The deviled eggs were really good and the bone marrow was mouthwatering delicious. For the main entree, my boyfriend had the Marlowe burger and I had the Poulet Vert. We were way too stuffed to even consider dessert, maybe next time. I'll definitely come back for the bone marrow.
author: Jenna Z.

description: Great place for a quick lunch. Fried chicken sandwich very good. Prices are reasonable. Nice bar and interior. Staff is very friendly and gets you seated fast. I will be a regular when in this area!
author: Ryan K.

description: Expensive, limited menu, nothing remarkable about the burger and cold, dry  fries. Wine pours chincy, but that's SF these days. Noisy. Bring back Lorretta Keller's establishments.
author: Valerie T.

description: What a success! First off, it was a last minute reservation which the hostess was so generous to accommodate us with.  She also recommended we grab some cocktails next door where we waited before our table was ready.  Pretty decent bar by the way. We were summoned earlier than anticipated and greeted by a very hospitable staff.  The appetizers were flavorful and the entrees blew my expectations. I took a group of 6 and they all enjoyed themselves.  Place had a very energetic vibe with a warm ambiance.
author: F S.

description:
What a cool place!!!

I'm always a sucker for deviled eggs.  I don't care where I'm at.  If you have deviled eggs on your menu, I'm ordering it.

Came here late last night for a burger with a couple of friends and it was busy for a Monday night.  My friend ordered the bone marrow and it was good.  The salad was decent.  The deviled eggs with the piece bacon was awesome.

The burger was fantastic.  Some say that Spruce has a better burger.  I haven't tried Spruce's burger but Marlowe's burger is pretty damn good already.  Then again, I'm also happy with an In and Out burger.  It depends on your mood I guess right?

All in all a very cool place in the South of Market area in San Francisco.
author: jason g.

description:
I had Marlowe bookmarked for a few years as it was once mentioned in SF Gate as having one of the best burgers in the city.

A college friend recently had her birthday dinner here, so I was finally able to try their burger. I had it prepared medium-rare, and it came out really juicy and flavorful. The included condiments were all great and complementary: carmelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli. The fries were really good as well.

The crispy brussels sprout chips are a must, even if you don't like brussels sprouts. Trust me on this one.

We tried several desserts, and while they were all pretty good, none of them really stood out. All were served in small little jars. Very hipstery.

Parking was pretty easy since there isn't too much around in the area. The restaurant is small, so definitely make a reservation and be prepared to possibly sit at the communal table. Service was excellent.
author: Kenny J.

description: Good service and atmosphere. Good for dates. Food is pretty good but had better for similar dishes elsewhere. Still worth checking out in San Francisco!
author: Michael O.

description:
Move over nopa, Marlowe's NIMAN RANCH PORK CHOP will definitely give you a run for your money! I still like the way nopa incorporates fresh seasonal greens with their pork chop, but the one at Marlowe was served in a more classic style with cream spinach, super juicy, and cooked perfectly.

ROASTED BONE MARROW: I love the acidic kick from the salsa verde in this dish! It's a must try!

STRAWBERRY & RHUBARB CRISP: Save room for dessert because you definitely can't miss out on this. It's served with bourbon ice cream and brown butter caramel sauce to satisfy your sweet tooth!


Note: Unlike their sister restaurant, Park Tavern, they only serve beer and wine. Oh and great service is obviously a priority for Anna Weinberg and Jennifer Puccio and it shows at both her restaurants!
author: Helen Z.

description: Amazing meal and service at Marlow! The cocktails are excellent too. Everything was superb!
author: Amy S.

description: Not nearly worth the price and absolutely no soul to it.  It feels like Marlowe is doing all the things that everyone expects it to do without knowing why.  Our total with tip for two people was about $115.  This included a marrow bone appetizer, mixed drink, cola, burger, and fish entree.  The marrow bone was pretty minimal on the marrow and the flavor itself was just ok.  The mixed drink was tiny and fairly bland.  The burger was underwhelming.  The fish entree was the highlight from the bunch but in general this meal was barely worth half of what we paid.
author: Bart J.

description:
I came here for the burger, and it was definitely worth it.  As other reviewers have also noted, the burger was actually cooked to the temperature I requested; that's an astonishing feat, it turns out!  I got my burger with a salad rather than fries, but my boyfriend's steak frites (which he liked a lot) came with a strangely small pile of fries.  I looked around the restaurant, and all of the servings of fries were too small.  Well, at least they are consistent.

The service was super friendly; everything about this place, with the exception of the cacophonous birthday party beside us, was pleasant.  My one negative comment relates to the reservation system: after I booked my table using OpenTable and received a confirmation email, I received a voicemail from the restaurant not only re-confirming the reservation (fine) but asking me to call them back in order to confirm (again) with the hostess.  I understand that this is a small place and that missed reservations are unfortunate, but this is more steps than when I make a dentist appointment.
author: Anna M.

description: My sister and I came here one night for dinner after an event we attended.  We shared the the crispy brussels sprout chips, the Dungeness crap cake, smokey baked cauliflower and the sweet potato gratin.  For desert, we shared the upside down strawberry crisp.  It was all very tasty.  My favorite was the smokey baked cauliflower and the sweet potato gratin.  Our server was fantastic, very helpful when we were deciding to choose on what to have for dinner.  It is small, yet very intimate.
author: Liz D.

description:
Nice atmosphere it wasn't loud and although the tables were close together I was able to have a private conversation
Food:
Deviled eggs were very tasty and warm for a change.
Brussels sprouts chips were a good beer snack I wish they had some chili in them
Baked oysters were way too lemony it overwhelmed the flavor of the oysters.
Duo of ahi tuna was a pretty dish and fairly good, the tuna conserva was great, and the seared tuna was pretty clean
Burger wasn't as great as I thought the bacon was way too smoky and I didn't appreciate the aioli as much. 
Wine list was very diverse and great
Service was excellent
author: Estefany C.

description:
First and foremost, the service must be commended.  It was busy right at opening so I can understand the kitchen getting a bit slammed.  To us, it was not overly long waiting for appetizers and entrees, but to the manager it was unacceptable and we were graciously comped with free apps and a round of drinks.   Pistachios, deviled eggs and brussels sprouts were all delicious.

My one complaint however is the burger.  If its going to be a signature dish (naming it the Marlowe burger would suggest just that) it needs a little work.  The bun was either too big or the patty was too small, leaving you with excess bread on most bites.  Additionally the bun could have been more toasted.

All in all a great experience, just some tweaks to the burger are needed.
author: Johnson H.

description: Great staff!  Bone marrow was great!  We wish there was more marrow but the bones were a tag too shallow.  Blacken cod was great but the steak was even better!  Can't stop eating the grilled flatbreads with the two yummy spreads!
author: Shirl L.

description:
Nice atmosphere, solid service. Food is good, not great. Nice add'n to the hood & always great to have options, but not a place I'm dying to come back to. Went with a friend for only one reason... Michael Bauer & his claim that this burger tops that of Zuni's. As a Zuni burger lover, I'm thinking "man oh man, this is going to be out of this universe!" NOPE. 

Started w/ a prosecco cocktail, 5 stars, yum 
Beef tartar, nice not spectacular, 3.5 stars 
Roasted brussel sprouts, pretty tasty, 4 stars
Burger cooked medium (house recommended med rare but I'm anti e-coli), good but nothing special, 3 stars 

Why, Michael, why would you say what you did about the burger? It's not even in the same cosmos as the Zuni burger & since my expectations were so high, I'm giving Marlowe a normalized rating of 3 instead of my true heartfelt disappointment of 1 star. I feel so betrayed. 

But hey, that's not your fault, Marlowe. You're still ok in my book & I'm glad you're here. Zuni, here I come to make up for cheating on you... forgive me for questioning your burger awesomeness.
author: Jen H.

description:
