My boyfriend and I have gotten lucky because each time we come we haven't had a reservation, however their hostess' are ALWAYS really nice, sweet and accommodating. Many restaurants in SF can have a snooty vibe at the hostess desk because they are a popular place with great food... not Marlowe. They have the best staff! Waiters/waitresses have always been very attentive. Will remain a favorite and a highly recommended place in my book. Great customer service. Keep up the great work! Neighborhood favorite.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Definitely not the best burger in SF IMO.  But the fries, brussel sprout chips, bone marrow are probably the best I've had in a while.

Walked in on a Tuesday night for two w/o reservations around 8pm and was told to wait 45-1hr, but we only waited for about 20 minutes.  Servers were extremely nice, and the place, though seemingly crowded was actually intimate.

The burger was really dry, a bit too charred, and wasn't seasoned well.  i asked for medium rare, and I wish I asked for rare, because my burger was more of a medium/medium well.

The fries are SO good though.  Way better than my favorite BK fries, and probably the best fries I've had.  And this place is now the ONLY place I will eat brussel sprouts at.  I've tried to like this yucky little vegetable for some time now, but this is the onlyplace that's managed for me to like it (okay I know it's not that healthy after getting fried, but still).  Bone marrow was awesome, and I loved the caper salsa.
author: Biqi C.

description: My girl friends took me here for my birthday brunch and it was awesome!!! French toast bites were so yummy and addicting! Nice ambience and sorta gives this New York vibe! Love it!
author: Elke S.

description:
Came here to try "the burger" for lunch. We all had it and it wasn't that great. Everything else we ordered was very good. Loved the baked oysters. I could easily eat 6 of those. I also thought the little gem salad was outstanding. Perfectly chilled and dressed. Desserts were also a hit. Too bad about our burgers. The bun was cold and hard when I bit into it. Meat was too small for that bun, way too charred and dry for medium rare. Bacon on one of them was inedible, as it was also too charred. Bad timing maybe since it was a full house? 
 
2-Stars for the burgers, but had we not ordered them, it would have been a 4-star experience since service was great as well. We all wished we went to Umami instead for our burger fix. Dang it.
author: Jane F.

description: Condescending staff when we called up ahead to book a table. Keep you posted on the food.
author: Daniel B.

description: The brussel sprout chips were delicious! Not too salty and the only problem was there was too little of it! The brussel sprouts in butter sauce was also delicious. I also ordered the fried chicken sandwich. It was good, but not extraordinary. They do good job at frying foods because everything was not overly oily. I also enjoyed the coffee ice cream with the meringue topped with chocolate and almonds.
author: Anna K.

description:
I was very excited to try this restaurant because it has 4/5 stars on yelp.  After trying the restaurant, I am confused by the rating... We started with the crispy Brussels sprout chips and it was very salty.  However, I could see how some people might enjoy these chips.  Then we had the bacon and eggs.  The flavors in that dish just didn't mesh well.  Why would you put anchovies (I think) in a dish with seared pork belly?!?!?!  The anchovies completely overpowered the other flavors on that dish. Finally, I had the Marlowe burger as my entree.  Unlike the other two dishes, the burger was very bland.  I don't understand a burger with caramelized onions and bacon can be bland.  Also, the burger tasted burnt.  

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.  Most of the dishes were over-complicated for no reason.  I'm pretty certain that you can get better food at any diner in the city.
author: Eric K.

description:
My go-to place for a hot date with my long term relation of 7+ years. Oh yes, the magic is still there, folks. You best believe it.

Marlowe helps too. Take me to Marlowe and I'm ready and roaring for you. Must-haves everytime I go there: Polenta with arugula and wild mushrooms, brussel sprout chips, their pork chop special cause there is always one available.

Only gripe: they don't have hard liquor.
author: Adrienne C.

description: This is a great place, but very small. There are a couple communal tables. If you want your own table call ahead of time. Great food and friendly staff. Try the Brussels spout chips and the chicken.
author: Payal V.

description: I recently went here for a group dinner (total of 6) on a Friday night. The staff was very friendly and food was delicious. The place is definitely lively so may not suit well for a quiet, romantic dinner but it was very fun for our group of friends. I would recommend ordering the bone marrow. The only downside is that it did take them a while to sit us down - our reservation was for 8pm and our table was not ready until 8:30.
author: Kai C.

description: Marlowe's burger was every bit as delicious as I remembered it to be -- and the Brussels sprout chips were even better.  I have to admit, I have been to Park Tavern a few times since my last visit here, and I am very partial to PT; however, little Marlowe seems to somehow have a leg up on the deliciousness.  Me and a co-worker did an ad hoc visit, arriving right at 11:30 opening.  Good thing we did, as the only available seats were at the bar (which was fine).  I can't say enough about the quality of the food, and my amazement that people who have stuff like this available would eat at a less than perfect spot.  The music, though completely my era, was a bit Lori's Diner but I can put up with that.  Oh what I would give for a nice nap right about now ...
author: Robert M.

description:
This is the Sonic Youth of restaurants. They take flavors and textures that could be considered off (burnt, grainy, bitter, super cheesy, earthy) and turn them into something unique & delicious. They have a strong point of view in terms of texture and flavor that I grasped it pretty early. I knew what to expect before dessert arrived and it was delicious.

The serving staff was helpful, courteous and professional. They were ON IT with the water refills.

I dined with a large group so I got to sample a wide range of menu items. The brussel sprout chips and tiramisu were my favs. The marrow was also tasty. I got the polenta which was unique and pretty good. The egg yolk made a huge difference but it soaked up and vanished quickly. The earthy mushroom flavor was wonderful but the richness and large size of the dish wore me out. I couldn't finish it. There were some other minor misses but overall this place offered some superb dishes that had me intrigued and delighted. I'll be back!
author: Kevan M.

description: Never went to the old venue but this was looks nice when you walk in. The crowd was mixed (a bit older than expected and some people dressed as if they strolled in from the Embarcadero... I know SF is ultra casual but...). The waitress tried to be nice but it seemed a little forced. The manhattan rocked! The Brussels sprouts rocked! The chorizo calamari dish was CONFUSED! The chorizo was so overpowering in the dish that it destroyed the integrity of the calamari and other delicate ingredients. The smoked cod was nice but not mind blowing... the twice cooked rice was like eating stale / overcooked rice which was distracting from the delicate nature of the fish. It was good to try this place, but I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend it. Sorry guys.
author: Sarah H.

description: Food excites me. New foods excite me even more. All the rage about crispy brussels sprout chips here reeled in my adventurous self and the boyfriend. Wouldn't it be fabulous to live in this area and be walking distance to all kinds of culinary jewels such as Marlowe AND AT&T park? Yes, yes it would be. We came here for a dinner date before the game and ordered the aforementioned brussels sprouts, roasted bone marrow, pork chops and an upside-down strawberry crisp for dessert. You'll find pictures of each dish that I posted. This was truly a 4-star experience considering the quality of food, service and overall atmosphere. The bone marrow was the best. Whoever came up with the idea of serving a $2 wholesale price bone marrow at an upscale place for $15 must be a millionaire. It's so simple and yet tastes so good. Here, they fleur de sel-ed it beautifully and added a nice salsa verde topping on the side. You really can't mess up bone marrow, but it's challenging to bring it above par, which Marlowe undoubtedly had done. The brussels sprouts were very addicting, aside from olive oil and sea salt, I wouldn't be surprised if they added crack in there. Although it had a bitter after-taste, the initial bite itself was amazing. This is the first place I have ever been to that cooks pork somewhat rare. First of all, more places should do this. Second of all, maybe not because it implies that the pork has to be of first grade quality, which is not available to all restaurants. It was tender, juicy, flavorful and slightly gamey, but delicious! Finally, dessert. Holy crap. Homemade gelato with caramel and strawberry crisp. What a great way to end the meal. We will definitely be back but also can't wait to try all of the other hot spots around the area, thanks to the hope given by Marlowe!
author: Priscilla V.

description:
Came for dinner.

1. Wild King Salmon Crudo - 4 stars - very fresh and delicious fish, the Enlgish pea purée was divine - Will order again

2. Steak Tartare - 2 stars - meat was fresh but the flavor was flat - Not order again

3. Warm Deviled Egg - 3 stars - was ok -  Not order again

4. Spiced Jumbo Gulf Shrimp - 3 stars - grilling was done nicely.  prawn was not dry and loved that the entire prawn was served (with head and tail).  But the dipping sauce didn't seem to compliment it so well for me.  Perhaps a bit more horseradish?  - Will order again and ask for more horseradish

5. Pan Seared Moro Bay Black Cod - 5 stars - amazing cod!  beyond perfectly cooked.  only complain is the portion was soooo small for the price.  please don't be niggardly with the fish - Will order again
author: Lev E.

description:
It's been a few weeks since I went to Marlowe to celebrate a friend's birthday...and I'm STILL thinking about their warm deviled eggs! Good Lawd they were yummy!!

The place itself is very cozy and quaint but I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic dinner because it's a small place and it gets pretty loud. Some of the seating is communal benches so it may be a bit tricky trying to manuever your way out. Also, once you get the urge to use the restroom, I highly suggest you get up and go...there's only one restroom. If you wait until you REALLY have to use it, you might have a problem.

One of the must-get items is the Crispy Brussel Sprout Chips...so addicting!! I guarantee you won't be able to help nibbling on them as you wait for your food to come out...if you do, we must have a talk.

Overall, I enjoyed the different foods we ordered. Surprisingly, the burger was my least favorite. It was a bit too dry and overcooked for my liking. The fries, however, were yums. Thin and crispy...just the way I like 'em!  The sole was flavorful but it paled in comparison to the polenta, which was heavenly...seriously! For the apps, the bone marrow was ok...if you're a marrow kinda gal/guy. Both the pate and mussels, served with thin and crispy pieces of crostini, were also worth mentioning. We even had to ask for more pieces of toast since there was a good amount of pate and mussels left. The cauliflower gratin was delicious and is worth getting.

The desserts, however, fell short on taste. Our group of six shared two of the desserts...they are forgettable. Save yourself the disappointment of getting dessert. You'll probably be much happier ordering another warm deviled egg to end your meal at Marlowe :o)
author: Christine P.

description:
Not that this place needs a review but I am overdue to give them the props they deserve.

I have only had lunch at Marlowe but it has always been excellent.

Marlowe Burger - Best burger in the Bay area, bar none, order it medium rare and you have pure burger heaven. Served with awesome crunchy french fries and aioli.

Fried Chicken Sandwich - Sometime I have a real jones for a fried chicken sandwich and this one satisfies my need. Perfectly cooked fried chicken, crunchy coating and moist inside, topped with bacon which kind of gilds the lily.

Brussel Sprout chips- Another Marlowe staple you must order, unique and addicting.

Baked Oysters - Delicious osters baked in the shelll with acreamy/crunchy New England style topping

As much as I like the Fried Chicken Sandwich if you are cming here for your sirst time I would recommend the burger, it's their own blend of Beef and Lamb and it is uniquiely delicious.

Someday I hope to get to their sister restaurant Park Tavern!
author: Dave H.

description:
I had been to South a few times and wasn't necessarily thrilled with the meal there so I was looking forward to seeing how it had changed.  The inside hadn't changed much as the table set up was pretty similar.  When we arrived at noon there were not a lot of people there but when we left it was more filled for sure.

The menu was pretty straightforward.  I ordered the burger and thought that it was pretty good but it's hard to mess up a burger.  My co-worker got the chicken which was ok but a little too saucy and not enough meat.

If you're in the neighborhood it might be worth checking out but I wouldn't go across town for it.
author: Blake B.

description:
I'm from South Texas and there aren't many restaurants in my neck of the wood with a female executive chef, so I can tell you from the get-go this spot appealed to me!

My large party walked in and were immediately seated at a communal table (with reserations, not sure you could get in so fast otherwise). I would love to see them change the bench to actual chairs. All of the ladies in our parties were in dresses and heels and there is no ladylike way to go about sitting down in that tight space on the bench. However, it must have been amusing to watch us try. ;)

The wine and beer selection was great. I just enjoyed glasses from the bottles ordered by others in my party, but was happy with all of it. I will send an extra kudos to our delightful waitress for staying on top of keeping those glasses full and also the water replenished. I tend to drink as much water as wine at dinner and appreciated so much that my glass was always refilled! Also, she was just as sweet as she could be and knowledgeable of the menu. All adding to this great experience.

The food was just incredible. Brussel sprouts definitely win here. And so do polenta and burgers with steak fries. Actually, that burger was pretty solid, and I'm from Texas where red meat is a way of life. I've been known to snobbily snub burgers in the Bay Area but this one is legit. I split it with a coworker to make room for other menu options, but definitely wouldn't have minded demolishing it all on my own.
author: Kay T.

description:
Came here for my bestie's bday, and thank goodness Marlowe delivered! First of all, loved the decor: nailhead benches, wood tables, and specials on butcher paper? *sigh* 

HITS:
fried brussel sprout chips
corn soup
steak tartare
baked oysters 
deviled eggs
duck liver mousse
polenta 

MISSES:
browned brussel sprouts
burger 

The food, drinks, and service was fantastic. I know their burger is famous, but there are just too many better eats on their menu,  and it's really nothing special. I LOVED the deviled eggs ( so surprisingly good!) and I'll definitely be dreaming of that polenta.
author: Irene B.

description:
insanely noisy - probably unhealthfully so - why they insist on the background drum beat so you can't hear the person you come with and have to scream to be heard (while listening to others screaming)  is beyond me 

i expected great food - it was only so so, even the hamburger - in fact the appetizers were better

the service was friendly but so slow they kept apologizing and brought out a free appetizer to appease us while we waited an ungodly amount of time for what we ordered

i enjoyed the place when it was on Townsend before moving to this bigger space

won't return
author: S K.

description:
It is a small restaurant so would recommend making a reservation ahead of time.  I tried the following:

 - Fried brussel sprouts chips:  I do not normally eat brussel sprouts but my friend ordered these so I tried them.  AMAZING!  I could not stop eating them.  The lemon and sea salt gave these crispy leaves a great flavor.  I really want to go back to have them again!

 - Sweet corn soup:  This was pureed yumminess.  It is a small bowl and had some chili oil drizzled on top.  It was hot, creamy, and hit the spot.  I had to stop myself from liking the little bowl.

 - The Marlowe burger:  It was a solid burger - nothing to write home about but definitely solid.  I really enjoyed the fries but then I am a sucker for fries.  Can't go wrong at $13 for the dish.
author: Janel Marie M.

description:
My friend put it best, "Hey we are eating in an adult restaurant."  I looked around, and yes, we were...How did that transition happen?  Wow, we are getting old lol, but I digress.  Marlowe was already making a positive impression; I made a reservation yesterday (when they were closed on Sunday) by leaving a message.  They called me back today at 9:30 am to confirm the reservation.  Wow, that is customer service, which is rare these days.  We arrived a bit early, and they noted that our table would be set up soon.  We were promptly seated at 1 pm. 

In my quest to settle the debate, where could you get the best fried chicken sandwich (Bakesale Betty's or Marlowe), I came here just to try the sandwich.  I also got to eat half of the deviled egg sandwich, which by the way is a genius idea for a sandwich.  The fried chicken sandwich definitely delivered with the buttery bun, bacon, and quality, crispy fried chicken.  Eaten alone, the fried chicken was just heavenly.  However, I unfortunately haven't settled the debate even after eating the sandwich...The sandwich here is your "classy chicken sandwich, and it is $13."  The other is a $9 chicken sandwich with cole slaw instead of bacon.  However, you have to cross the bridge to get it...So the jury is still out.  

A small tip would be to order the french fries instead of the salad (it comes with the sandwich).  The salad seemed like the same greens from the Costco mix with some like olive oil based salad dressing (seemed more like a filler to me).  Beware, they ask if you want something (e.g., brussel sprout chips) making it sound complimentary, but really it costs.  **I learned that from some Chinese restaurants that ask you if you want tea, and you see the charge on the bill.  Also, they try to up-sell beverages here.  These are just minor observations so that you could be an informed consumer.  It doesn't take away from the delicious sandwiches.  I would definitely make reservations b/c they restaurant is small and it is busy.  Why wouldn't it be?  Fried chicken sandwiches are waiting on the other side of the door!
author: Steph W.

description:
Oh mannn this place was delicious and the service was great!!!

It is pretty hard to impress me with American fare so you know this place is good!


I had:

the butcher's granny (normally called mistress - this cocktail changes all the time, as mistresses do) cocktail ($11):  prosecco with granny smith apple and cinnamon.   Oh this was so tasty!  It tasted like autumn in my mouth!

bone marrow ($11):  solid but I wish they gave us more crostinis.  The salsa verde that came with it was pretty good.

Marlowe burger ($13):  I can see why some think this is the best burger in SF!  The horseradish aioli combined with the juicy medium rare patty was just heavenly.  Just the right size too.  Came with fries but I didn't get to taste those.

Polenta ($18):  This was polenta with wild mushroom, truffles, arugula, and poached farm egg.  Really rich and smooth.  Loved every bite of this truffle goodness!  Again, a very generous portion.


Let's just say, I am dying to go here again!
author: Melissa W.

description:
Above average decent food, nice setting and ambiance, decent service.

I didn't fall in love with this place but I also have nothing to complain about. The dishes were somewhat tasty.

 With a group of friends we shared:
- steak tartar - was ok
- roasted bone marrow ( I love bone marrow but this didn't do )
- spiced jumbo gulf shrimps - was pretty good
- little gem salad - liked 

 and for the main dish I had:
- pas seared black cod - very good

I would go back since the food is relatively good and so is the ambiance.
author: Azi Z.

description: For appetizers, we had the Brussels sprouts and the burrata which were both decent. Our mains were disappointing, however; the artichokes that came with the cod were awful and my polenta dish was bland. The gingerbread cake with ice cream came close to saving the night however. It was fabulous! Overall, Marlowe has a fun atmosphere but food that underwhelms, especially considering the price tag.
author: Haley A.

description: Soooooo good! My boyfriend and I went to a SUPER late dinner here the other night and the wait staff was awesome. Very friendly, didn't rush us at all. Things to try: deviled eggs, Brussel sprout chips and the BONE MARROW! The bone marrow is an absolute must trust me.
author: Shanna M.

description: Marlowe has a great atmosphere- cozy and intimate. Had a burger with wine and was a very satisfying meal. Fries included a cream sauce and the burger was juicy with a lot of lettuce. Proportions could have been a bit bigger considering the price. Overall great place.
author: Penny C.

description:
Dinner reserved- Friday night 7pm.

Waiter was awesome.  In tune with us, personable, sense of humor, and knowledgeable.
I am normally not a beer drinker-- but on this night, I decided to try a beer-- a new one-- Session Lager.  Wow- talk about a smooth and  sophisticated   beer!
For appetizers:
My friend had the Steak Tartare-- loved it-- spiced just right.
I had the Spiced Gulf Shrimp--  pretty good, but not amazing.
For dinner:
He had the Grilled Lamb, which once he was finished- the plate was clean.
I had the Stuffed Sole, which was really nice.
We sat in what I say would be the prime spot, which was in the corner by the window... Full view of everything.
Would I go back, yes..  This restaurant is on par-- it does deserve to do well in SF.

oh yes-- the brussel sprout chips were awesome!
author: Stacy C.

description: Had a Brachetto, it was very well presented and tasted great. It's also a very good place to go out for dinner.
author: Krystal S.

description:
AMAZING.  I went to Marlowe with co-workers the other night and while we were admittedly a little boozed up, probably had one of the BEST meals EVER.  The brussel sprouts are epic - like crispy little chips - an orgasm in your mouth. 

Delicious. Can't wait to go back...
author: Jamie W.

description:
My husband and I stopped in here for an early dinner; I think we were they only ones there at 5pm. However, the service was great, decor is lovely and the burgers really are amazing! It's not a cheap burger joint though. The burgers were the perfect size for us but for the price may be a bit small. We enjoyed it though and it was the perfect amount of food; we cleaned our plates. We also got the spiced prawns - delicious! I will say that the beer is over priced! $6 for a 12oz beer (Session Lager). Yikes! I would say they should at least have a happy hour on drinks - it was expensive for a burger and beer 5:00 dinner!


We love the concept though and have been to Park Tavern - also good. We'll be back and try it again.

3.5 stars!
author: Cheyenne C.

description:
Was excited to try this place given the rave reviews! Tried the burger which seemed to be a popular choice; however, it was quite disappointing as it failed to measure up to the hype. Bread was dry and too flaky, and burger itself was too greasy. This was not a good burger, at least not one to rave about. 
Oh, did I mention that I found a hair in my burger after the second bite?! I would have been more disappointed had the burger been delicious but given it was barely mediocre, didn't care to get the same thing again. I informed our waitress who immediately agreed to swap my dish, and which to my understanding, would be compensated by the restaurant. Wasn't seeking a free dinner (just a yummy one) but after recalling the grossness, I thought it was suitable. Returned the burger and ordered the scallop dish - wish was quite delicious. It almost made me forget about the prior-disappointing and gross burger encounter. 
Finally time to leave; we get the check and the replacement was not compensated. I was surprised but enjoyed the new dish so made no big deal. Although...I did wonder why it wouldn't be important enough to satisfy a customer after what occurred.
author: Lu L.

description:
this place was not worth it!  I rated it low because there is just too much hype and not enough delivery.

These reviews cannot be accurate.  They must have changed ownership?

For the money, you're better off going elsewhere.  It was a unique experience, to say the least.

The bone marrow which everyone raves about is tiny.  
The brussel sprout chips are interesting & unique, but not worth the $$.
author: jump h.

description:
This was a very very good restaurant.  I cannot believe that I lived in the Bay Area for so long but never came here.

First off, this was probably the best roasted chicken I had in the Bay Area.  Tender, moist, well-seasoned without being too salty.  Really - kudos to the chef on the roast.

The chef here also has a certain love for seasoned salts, which makes a lot of the dishes interesting.  Even the simple fries were good here.

The desserts here we had here were also excellent - especially the panna cotta.

The way I see it, come here for decently priced and tasty simple food.  Really, the food here was simple and just plain good.
author: Mark M.

description:
why 5 stars, as opposed to 4?  Value!

food was awesome:  warm deviled eggs with super-tasty grilled cheese topping, fresh, buttery oysters, pea pancakes with smoked salmon and roe, steak-frites with awesome wine-shallot sauce, and delicious fish (forget exactly what kind :-) with celery root and lots of other fresh vegetables.  service was attentive, great wine choices, and well-made (albeit a tad pricey) craft cocktails.

the prices while not bargain-basement are quite reasonable, and all the mains were under $30, and some in the low-$20's.  given the excellence in the food: sauces, tastes, quality of ingredients, etc. i give this 5 stars as a great high-end dinner at reasonable prices.  wait staff was super-friendly and unpretentious, and overall atmosphere was great with lots of light from windows on 2 sides of the dining room, and a spartan decor that exuded a clean-cut "brasserie" atmosphere.

i would have no hesitation to go back
author: Frosty D.

description:
Service at Marlowe was excellent.  My friends and I were here for a birthday dinner and they didn't rush us at all.

Now down to the nitty gritty.  I tried:

Steak Tartare
Brussels sprout chipes
Duck liver mousse
Crab and shrimp with lettuce (forgot the official name =p)
Deviled egg
Baked Oyster
Marlowe Burger

With the exception of the burger, everything else I tried was pretty much  appetizers.  The deviled egg and oyster are "snacks" that you can order in singles.  I was very impressed by every one of their starters, particularly the steak tartare and I encourage anyone to thoroughly explore their appetizers and snacks as I was very interested in a lot of things that I didn't end up trying.

The burger itself was excellent.  I asked for medium rare and was not disappointed.  The horseradish aioli was pretty tasty as well.  I had a glass of port for dessert but all of my friends were pretty disappointed with the dessert offerings.  However, I feel that their food was strong enough to outshine their desserts and would say that Marlowe is solid 4 star joint.  Subsequent visits could definitely bump that up though.

Great location, great food, great service...check it out!
author: Chris C.

description: Consistently serving good food with good service!  After my third visit, I figured I should quit being lazy and write a review. All three times I have been please with the each course (last dinner... brussel Sprout chips, deviled eggs, steak tar, bone marrow, steak, and polenta).  One thing to keep in mind, seating is limited so I highly recommend making a reservation before going.
author: Sean T.

description: Very nice and welcoming. Checked up on us often, fast and friendly service. I love the marlowe w/ horse radish aioli OMG! The staff was excellent
author: Vi P.

description:
My arteries are still recovering from a ridiculously decadent meal at Marlowe.

APPS:
-Deviled Eggs: Devilishly good. Order 1 per person.
-Pork Belly: Favorite app ordered. Wonderful flavors, slightly crisp, subtle sweetness in the sauce. Beets are nice. 
-Bone Marrow: OMG - this clogged my arteries. Good, but so rich. From the actual bone marrow itself which seemed to be bathed in oil or butter, to the accompanying crostini and garlic spread - this thing is decadent. Worth it, but be warned - it may stop your heart right there.

MAIN:
-Marlowe Burger: Medium rare. Good, but I think the decadent appetizers already put me into overload. By the time the burger arrived, I wasn't too hungry. And I think everything I had was so rich that my palate was over saturated. The fries were tasty with a garlic herb seasoning and aioli. 

DESSERT:
-Panna Cotta: Good portion, very tasty. Big enough to share. Not a huge fan of the espresso though. I think I would've preferred a fruit like a raspberry sauce.

All in all, a fantastic meal. Just ordered things that were really heavy and rich, and should've balanced it out with a salad/vegetable. 

SEATING:
Yes, it's small and gets crowded easily. Make a reservation! Had a late res, but arrived early and got a spot at the bar which is a fun place to sit. I sat towards the side, so I didn't feel crowded. Plus the bartender was nice and funny.

PARKING:
Street parking is possible. Can valet with 25 Lusk down the street.
author: Veronica H.

description: My favorite burger in SF so far! I have to admit that I was a little worried about the horseradish aioli, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's not overpowering at all. I was equally impressed that I could pair this mouth-watering burger with a solid beer (try the Toasted Porter or Belgian Strong Dark Ale). I also recommend the Brussels Sprout Chips and the Rum Soaked Nectarine Split.
author: Riz W.

description: Good burgers, awesome brussel sprouts. This place is good, but nothing out of this world.
author: April D.

description:
Marlowe truly is a hidden gem. 

We came here for dinner a few weeks ago and the wait was fairly long, even for just the 2 of us. We figured that must be a pretty good sign that Marlowe is well-enjoyed. The atmosphere is very dim and romantic, with both bar seating, communal tables, and tables for two. 

We split orders of the Marlowe signature burger and the Chiogga beets salad. The beets salad was great! It was definitely on the skimpy side, with just a few pieces of mustard greens, beets, watermelon bites, and candied walnuts + blue cheese bits. However, the quality/combination of flavors compensated for the quantity. I definitely would recommend this salad, but NOT as a main solo entree. The Marlowe burger was on-point. Although it was ALSO on the smaller side (looked like a burger on a diet, hah), it was cooked to our liking - medium rare- and still very juicy! The fries were just okay, nothing to write home about.

We saved our bellies for dessert, too! We ordered the Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta Affogato, which was the true winner of the night. It was plentiful to split and the delicious soft panna cotta with with the espresso poured over, was absolutely, finger-licking delicious. Don't ask me why I had this dessert on my fingers. Just know that it was THAT good.

I'd come back again!
author: Kristina K.

description: Unfortunately, nothing memorable. The food was salty. One of the worst meals I've had in the city. I don't know if it was because we ate towards closing time, but food quality and prep was awful.
author: Jo M.

description:
Came after a Giants playoff game to celebrate our anniversary. My husband made a reservation online which earned him bonus points because 1) it was already packed when we walked in, and 2) a line formed outside after we sat down. They sat us immediately, wished us a happy anniversary, and brought 2 glasses of champagne to our table, for free. Really nice touch, thanks!
Started with deviled eggs and a salad. The eggs were amazing, I could have had a dozen for dinner. The salad said 'avocado' on the menu but I couldn't find a single one so I sent it back...apparently it's more of a mashed avocado (aka guacamole) under the lettuce, which they were generous with on the new salad.
Hubs had the burger...didn't say much because he was busy eating, so I'm taking that as he enjoyed it.
I had the pork chop and it was so. much. meat. Great if you are hungry! I don't even remember what was served on the plate with it because it was so minimal, but it was good while it lasted.
It's definitely tight quarters, so you might become friends with the couple sitting next to you by the end of your meal...or not.
Overall, was a great night, good meal & did not leave hungry, but I wasn't completely wowed either.
author: Tiffany S.

description: There were the highs and then there were the lows. The deviled egg were great and all the different elements complemented each other. The baked oysters were rich and really did taste like chowder. The bone marrow was so smooth and just melted on the bread...wish there was more. Then it came down, the burger was juicy but the flavors were good but nothing to write home about. The fries were the saving grace of the entree. They were crisp but still had a nice potato-ness to it. The beet salad but again..eh. Glad I came but I don't think there will be a round two.
author: Eve C.

description:
After a rough month, my good friend has been diligently persuading me to take a breather. I finally gave her my schedule and she picked me up to grab some lunch. I was excited to see her and also see where she would be taking me. Marlowe... for lunch. 

Read the reviews and must say they live up to there expectations with FOOD and SERVICE. 

Lunch entree' 
Marlowe Burger 
Chicken Fried Sandwich 
Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips - amazing 
Steak Tartare 

Jenny and I shared our entree - what was nice is that they split the burger and the chicken fried sandwich with bacon on each plate. 
The crispy brussels sprout chips, I was a bit hesitant, I think of it being bitter. Not the case at all, my favorite and with the other peoples review its a sure winner. 

Let me talk about the service... Pure exceptional! 
So when we ordered, we thought that the chips and tartare would come out before our entree. Since our server requested in that order, it came out after our entree. What was nice is that the chef came out to bring our snacks to us. So they gave us dessert free which was the pear crisp absolutely yummy . They also waived the snacks for free. 

Definitely coming back. I love this place. Thanks Jenny for great company and delicious lunch.
author: Jay B.

description: Love it, great brunch spot and the new england oyster is the gem, clam chowder in oyster shell, where can you find it? I didn't do cocktail for this, anyway recommedation goes to Brussel sprout chips. Get the poulle vert when you are in the mood of poultry, the rub for the chicken is amazing, the green herbs and also the roasted green, everything works perfectly, if you like seafood, get the dual tuna, one preparation is raw and the other is cooked.
author: Bryan T.

description:
I arrived on a busy Thursday night with a friend. We were seated immediately at a table they were saving for a six-top reservation so we could relax and order a drink. (We were told that if the reserving party arrived, we'd have to give up our seats).
This never happens. 

At most places, you arrive without a reservation and stand around while empty tables await the arrival of the parties that have reserved them and beckon for someone to be seated.

So we both ordered a glass of wine, and before they arrived were seated at our our very own two-top. Our wine was delivered, along with menus and we read them ravenously while sipping our wine.

My dining partner settled on a medium rare burger and a side of brussels in butter, while I, who grew up in the midwest, where pork RULES, decided on the pork chop. For a teaser we ordered the duck pate (yes, I know, not at all PC) but SO DELICIOUS!

In fact, everything we ordered was out of this world. the pate, served with mustard seed and cherries was delicate and smooth and melt-in-your-mouth delicious atop the cruncy crostini.

THEN our main courses arrived. The burger, which was perfectly cooked with a generous portion of blue cheese atop, was accompanied by the perfectly seasoned and proportioned fries (oh, you know the type...when they're thin and crunchy outside with just a bit of soft potato-goodness inside...delish!)

My pork, however, stole the show! Accompanied by a spinach BREAD PUDDING, the tender, crusty, blackened-on-the-outside pork fell off the bone and melted deliciuosly into the tangy arugula and prosciutto bed that accompanied it.

That is until we ordered dessert - upside down peaches with bourbon ice cream covered in salted caramel sauce, at which point my eyes rolled into the back of my head and I had to be escorted away from the table to my car, lest I die right there from too much perfection.

A++
author: sara jane m.

description:
came here with 5 other friends. we had made a reservation and were seated promptly. 

I had remembered this place to be known for its burgers but I ordered it this time and was really displeased. the patty strangely was disassembling. my friends ordered the steak and liked it.
author: Janet Y.

description: I took my staff here on a trip to SF in January so that we could bond and be inspired.  I must say, Marlowe did not dissapoint!  Although the diningroom was noisy, and we were seated at a communal table where a structural beam intersected between myself and my friend across the table from me, we managed to laugh about it and ducked beneath the beam to exclaim how amazing the food was.  We toured the menu and loved every bite!  The cheesy cauliflower gratin was the least exciting thing we tried, and it was still delicious!  The marrow was succulent, deviled eggs were delightful, brussels sprouts were crisp and perfect.  The service was attentive without being overbearing, and our server paced our meal perfectly as we sampled many dishes.  We all enjoyed our meal very much and had a great time.  I would return in a heartbeat.
author: Kris S.

description:
Marlowe is a charming little restaurant with a sophisticated feel.  The food and service is amazing.  We walked in around 8:30pm on a Saturday without reservations.  The host was super nice, took our drink orders and was able to get us seated all in 10 minutes.  I ordered a chardonnay off the black board and later a house cabernet.  I was pleasantly surprised how good both were.

We ordered:
- Dungeness Crab and Rock Shrimp Louie Pots ($12)
- Warm Marinated Mussels & Monterey Calamari Pots ($12)
- Bone Marrow ($11)
- Marrow Burger ($13)

I have to be honest, I didn't really care for the bone marrow.  That's not to fault the chef, it's my preference.  I thought it tasted like fat.  Everything else was great.  

One thing I have to mention is that there is only one unisex bathroom and its in the main dining area, making it awkward if you have to pee and you're standing there waiting in front of everyone.

Overall had an enjoyable time there and will go again when I'm in the city.
author: Cathy G.

description:
* * * Burger * * *
Just order this please.
With horseradish aioli,
It compliments well.
 
* * * Deviled eggs * * *
 What makes this so good?
 Provolone, bacon, and chili.
 It melts in my mouth.
 
* * * Brussel sprout chips * * *
 Individual
 leaves of crispy, light, salted
 perfected goodness.

* * * Bone marrow * * *
 I could go without.
 Fatty but not buttery
 bland thing. NOT a fan.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Quite possibly my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. 

I am a Top Chef fanatic, so when I tasted their polenta, I understood why that that dish in particular was so closely scrutinized all the time (and hard to make). Get the texture or flavor wrong, and it easily becomes bland and bleh. HOWEVER! Marlowe's polenta was DELICIOUS, heavenly and something I tell everyone about. 

Here are the other dishes I loved: 

- Warm deviled egg: SO freakin good. I usually don't like this, but it was so well balanced in flavor, easily becomes one my favorite dishes. 

- Crispy brussels sprout chips: unique but slightly oily.

- Roasted bone marrow: Yummy! 

- Marlowe burger: i remember it was delicious, but nothing in particular separates it from other good burgers out there. 

All in all, love the vibe and ambiance of Marlowe. We sat at the communal tables, but even so, such a fun experience. DELICIOUS food and good drinks.
author: G K.

description: Burger and fries were amazing, as were the brussels sprout chips.
author: Caroline P.

description: I like to dine out quite often and I am impressed with the fabulous food at Marlowe. Brussels sprout chips, who thought of those? They were delicious. I also had the baked oysters and the pork chop, all amazing. Wasn't able to squeeze in dessert. I guess I will have to come back another time, not complaining though.
author: Johny L.

description:
Food: 
1) Brussel Sprout Chips - 3 stars (The "chips" were slightly burnt and lacked flavor)
2) Roasted Pistachio - 3 stars (a bit on the salty side)
3) Bone Marrow - 4 stars (I'm craving some right now)
4) Burger - 4 stars (my picky 4 year old practically ate the whole thing)
5) Pork Chop - 4 stars (cooked perfectly, tender and seasoned well)
6) Chocolate Pie - 4 stars (seemed more like a chocolate pot de creme than a pie; the chocolate combined with the sea salt was delicious!)

Service: 4 stars - Good and efficient
author: Em D.

description:
We came to celebrate Dr. Pae's finishing her boards.  After all these years of training, she's finally about to have a regular job. How one kid can have the focus to be a surgeon, while the other can barely watch the same TV show for more than 15 minutes, is beyond me.

We had: brussel sprout chips, gem salad, the burger, poulet vert, cauliflower au gratin, chocolate cream pie and the pear crisp.  The standouts were the burger (as expected) and the pear crisp.  Almost everyone in the restaurant was having the burger.  It was juicy, with a great smokey flavor, and came with good fries.  

The chicken was overly seasoned and sauced so I couldn't eat much of it at once.  It was tasty but I felt full immediately.  The gem salad had an overabundance of cilantro, so it was like guacamole on some lettuce. I thought it could've used more acid.  The least favorite was the chocolate cream pie which had kind of a gritty texture I disliked.  I like my cream pies creamy.  Dr. Pae never leaves dessert on the table and even she didn't finish it.

Overall, it's a cute and small space with good service.  It can get very hot in there though and the street smells wafted in towards the end of the meal.  I'd go again but I wouldn't rush back.
author: Seong P.

description: The burger was greasy but just ok, not super flavorful. The mixed green salad dressing was extremely salty and almost inedible.
author: eric c.

description: I think the burger was pretty good here. I ordered a gazpacho appetizer and burger. The one thing I found not satisfying is that when I asked for goat cheese on the side, i found some in my bowl. They did indeed give me the cheese on the side for my friend whom I was sharing with. I loved that they split everything for us but I found goat cheese in my bowl and once I tasted that, it was a turnoff to continue having the rest if my gazpacho. I feel if I was allergic, this might have been really bad news. Not a big deal but maybe next time be more careful when someone asks for something on the side?
author: Jamie T.

description:
With the not-for-beginners trek from the office all the way down to Marlowe involving at least a moment or two of 'I really hope they're not just taking us to an alley and leaving us for dead', I knew that Marlowe was really going to have to bring it.

The intimate space was a good start, the fact that no one judged our table for adding alcohol to our lunch was even more promising, and then I almost need to stop my review here because I'm pretty sure I blacked out for a minute or two over the Brussel sprout chips with lemon and seat salt.

Way to make kids everywhere who refuse to eat these leafy greens look like complete idiots, Marlowe.

Not that this potentially Australian restaurant (we couldn't really figure it out...) has anything going against it, but the food really makes this place. An open-faced deviled egg sandwich with provolone and chilies?

I'll take five. Well, maybe two. The portions aren't huge so you might feel yourself wanting more on the way out although I have a sinking suspicion that even if you ate yourself into oblivion here, you'd still have a hard time saying no to the next dish.
author: Ben B.

description:
Must order: Brussel Sprout Chips! I will probably attempt at making this myself they were so good.

I ordered the burger, mainly because everything else jumped up in price and there wasn't a good middle ground. I am usually adventurous, so will want to come back and try some other items. Fries and midly spicy aoli? or was it mayonnaise? both? was delicious. 

Walked in on a Monday night around 7, which was unexpectedly busy (I hadn't heard of this place before), so I'd recommend getting reservations no matter what day of the week it is. Because all the tables were booked with reservations, we sat at the bar, which was perfectly cozy too. Place was pretty busy so they forgot one of our side orders, which was okay, since our time there was a casual one, but that's really how popular this place is.

I'll have to come back when I have more change in my pocket. I'd try their "pots" which really means a dish that you'll want to put together yourself, ie. bruschetta or lettuce wraps and the main ingredient is in a "pot" or jar. 

Environment and space is very cool- before you even walk in, there is a glass wall facing the street, which is has a ton of quote decals on the outside, so I liked it already. (I'm a big cheese like that.) Big hi-five for the interior decor. There is a large roll of unbleached butcher paper with a couple of handwritten daily specials on the wall. Not only do they have small tables, but they have a long table with benches on either side, so you could be sitting pretty close to another couple or group of people. This place works for a casual group wanting a nice meal or the married couple that wants some good food and wine.
author: Clara T.

description: The Marlowe burger is definitely worth the hype.  Just the perfect amount of everything on it -- crisp, the burger holds together until the very end.. just lovely.  The environment is really cozy too -- maybe 12 tables (including communal tables) in the entire restaurant.  Great to catch up with a few friends, or for a nice date.
author: Mel G.

description:
Walked in 8pm on a wednesday with my brother.

30min wait - brussel sprout chips, burger, steak. mmm mmm mmm.
author: Ameer N.

description: Two people. Three items and waitress forgets one completely. And since we're short on time, we can't wait for forgotten item
author: ITesh J.

description:
Not quite sure what happened here. These guys are proof that bigger isnt always better. I used to go to Marlowe when it was the old space, smaller, cosier, attentive. I was just there for lunch with a client in the new location, bigger, more wait staff etc, and to say I was disappointed is an understatement. It was a busy lunchtime and our waiter seemed more concerned with his other tables than with us for some reason...maybe we are not blond enough? Not sure. We asked for our wine no fewer than three times and only saw him go and check on the order after our third request. The burger was more bread than beef and unappealing, and I could have done better at in/out burger. This is my fourth time even at this new space, and I have to say I have two words-downward trend. As a business owner I know complacency is the kiss of death. You are suddenly trendy and bustling, but dont forget what made you good. Great food and attentive service. I live in the neighborhood, but unfortunately will not be coming back. Rule #1, customers will eventually vote with their feet and dollars. The Aussie girl hostess is awesome, but I find some of new wait staff have that attitude you will recognize in the city these days, the "you are lucky to be eating here and I am serving you" attitude, more east coast than SF, that is taking over the city.

Plenty of friendly, very good and warm choices in SF. I was just at Tradesman in the Mission. Its what Marlowe used to be. They couldn't have been happier for us to dine there and the food was inventive, tasty and filling. Hillstones on the Embarcadero is shockingly good and hearty, with top quality ingredients; an oldie but goodie- waiters actually anticipate you- imagine that? I keep going back because I KNOW its going to be good.  Reservations easy at both places. I would give Marlowe a miss- no value, food meh..
author: Mischa M.

description:
Hands down, absolutely 100% worth going for that darned hyped burger. It totally lives up to the hype, especially if you order it medium rare. Juicy, tasty, melts-in-yer-mouth, totally sinful.

Bonus for fun appetizers. We had the baked brussels leaves (or however they call 'em) and couldn't stop munchin' em - great portions for apps, too.

Fun champagne cocktails and an impressive beer list to boot.
author: Judy R.

description:
What a great dining experience! I had made reservations for 9:30 on a Friday night.  My party and I arrived at 9:30 but were told that our table wasn't ready.  We order a carafe of wine while we waited.  It was probably a 15 minute wait until we got our table.  The hostess was so apologetic for the wait and gave us the table of our choice.  When we were seated a complimentary appetizer, crispy brussel sprouts, was sent to our table.  I love great customer service!

Our waiter told us about the specials and we ordered two of the appetizer specials, one was a spin on a crab louie and the other a mussel and squid mixture served with a garlic aioli  sauce.  Both were served in tiny mason jars and fantastic, althought the mussel and squid dish was probably one of the best things I've put in my mouth this year.

My bff and I split the Marlowe burger. The burger was juicy on a nice soft brioche ( i think) bun... my kind of burger- simple.

I had an amazing experience at Marlowe, great food and service. My only thing was they only have a wine and beer license and I really was craving a cocktail but the waiter suggested some pretty tasty red wines.

I can't wait to come back and I just figured out I can take the 45 bus here! Woohoo!
author: danielle l.

description: Great location and ambiance. They had limited options for entree but the appetizers were very good and unique. The place is slightly small and can feel a little cramped, not a good option for big groups.
author: Yassy A.

description:
It's more than OK, but I am not yet a fan.

I had some things to take care of in SOMA and was anxious to try this place.  It was not quite noon and the very small restaurant was filling up quickly.  I was dining solo and the hostess and she didn't seem to want to seat me at a table; which is fine because all I wanted was a seat at the counter.

I had to try the burger, their signature item on the menu, or at least in front of the Brussels Sprout Chips.  The majority of items coming out of the kitchen were the burger and those chips.  

The burger was good, topped with cheddar, bacon, and caramelized onions, with a good burger/bun ratio.  The burger had a good char going for it, and was quite juicy.  I didn't get the euphoria that many people seem to get.  The fries were good, but a bit salty.  Dunking them in the horseradish aioli didn't help much and seemed to be missing horseradish.

I have never been into trendy places, but I really thought this place was just OK, as far as the burger goes.
author: Michael M.

description: I love this place because the people are so NICE! The food is fantastic. It does remind me of a modern tavern and seems to be a pretty popular hot spot. I do recommend making reservations because this place is small and the wait could be very long. A great date night location or meeting place with friends! I recommend the polenta! Its one of the best polentas I have had in a long time!
author: Christine D.

description:
Absolutely blown out of the water by Marlowe.  Maybe it was because I went in not knowing what to expect (besides a good burger), but this place really knocked my socks off.

After a dayhike to Wildcat beach near Pt Reyes, my friend and I decided to reward ourselves with a burger and fries.  After tossing around Burgermeister and Burger Bar ideas, we settled on Marlowe, as I'd heard raves about it during my Umami Burger research.

I didn't have a change of clothes, so I rocked my cargo pants into Marlowe, and I felt like I stuck out like a sore thumb, but no one really cared (I hope).  Luckily there was no wait (I've heard the line can get quite long), and we sauntered right up to the bar. 

I didn't realize this was such a nice place, as I just figured it was a burger joint (given that I'd heard about it spec. for the burger).  If I wasn't deadset on a patty btw two pieces of bread I would have branched out and ordered something more fitting...the chicken is supposed to be amazing, and all the descriptions made me salivate.

It was tough to decide, but we finally got the dungeness crab souffle and brussel sprout chips for an appetizer.  The former was incredible, more quiche-y than souffle-y in my opinion, but the crab flavor was hearty and rich.  The latter was equally impressive, lightly crisped and flavored with a salty/sweetish flavoring, and absolutely delectable.

We ordered two burgers (much to the chagrin of our server, haha) and MAN OH MAN, arguably the BEST BURGER OF MY LIFE.  If you haven't tried a burger medium-rare before, I highly recommend it, as it is a life-changing experience.  The beef that they use is high quality, and this patty was perfectly medium-rare, not a hair more, like you get at a lot of other places.  All the ingredients were immaculate, and blended together into a perfect bite...as soon as I sank my teeth into this sucker I was in heaven.  And how can you beat a side of fresh horseradish?

Fries deserve a shout out too, as they were perfectly fried, but the real star of the show was the burger.  Possibly better than Umami (although I'd have to do a side-by-side comparison).  Our server was very knowledgeable and attentive, and knew his shit.  I will absolutely be back, over and over and over again.
author: Michael C.

description:
I've been here a few times now and I can definitely say it's my current favorite fine dining establishment in SF.

As a vegetarian I feel well cared for here and the polenta with mushrooms and a poached egg is a favorite of mine as well as my meat-eating compatriots.

The decor is hip yet comfortable and the service attentive without coddling.

Prices are fair, but definitely in the fine dining range which is probably for the best.  The better things in life are best left for the occasional indulgence lest we spoil them for ourselves.
author: Kevin F.

description:
The two of us showed up around 6:30 and were seated at the bar within 5 minutes.  Good start.

What I had at Marlowe:

Marlowe burger
Cauliflower and cheese
Bone Marrow
Brussel Sprout Chips

The burger was fantastic.  I've heard that it's one of the best in the city and I can't contest that claim.  
I love the versatility of cauliflower, and I've never seen it used in this capacity.  The result was super tasty... definitely something I will be stealing!
The bone marrow was good, but I wanted a bit more than what was provided.  The method they prepare them (sliced long ways) leaves the meat a bit dry and tough.  I've had better elsewhere (usually cut across the bone so it's easier to spoon out).  
The brussel sprout chips, like the cauliflower, is another great side that doesn't add weight to the overall experience.  Although they are fried, you're still eating a vegetable, which is far better than french fries or chips or pretzels etc...

I can't wait to go back and try the stuffed sole, which I've heard great things about!
author: Mark A.

description: Sweet Corn Soup was creamy and delicious. The Marlowe burger was mediocre but it will fulfill your burger cravings. I do appreciate how they split your soup in 2 bowls if you're with someone. Overpriced place for the quality of taste though.
author: An L.

description:
Wow, wow, wow, maybe one more? Wow

So I've changed my last meal to this: marlowe burger, brussel sprout chips and upside down pear crisp with bourbon ice cream.

The Burger:  I love how the bun stays together throughout each bite.

Brussel Sprout Chips: I would like to call this dish, "the converter".  It will change all brussel haters to brussel lovers.

Upside down pear crisp:  Crunchy and caramelly with delicious baked pears! What more could you ask for.

Thanks Marlowe for one of the best lunches I've had in a while.
author: Gemma S.

description: Boasting one of the top burgers in San Francisco is a legit claim for this spot. Great fries, beer/drink selections, and the brussel sprout chips were a new and pretty tasty adventure for me. Not a bad walk from the Moscone area, but far enough off that it's a good mid-day getaway during major conference season.
author: Matt E.

description:
This place is crazy busy during prime times.  The space isn't that big, so it's good to make a reservation if you want a timely seat.  Sometimes you can get lucky with the 6 bar seats, but people waiting for their table usually camp out on them. There's plenty of street parking, but Giants games make it a lot harder to find one.  Good thing there's easy access to the 4th/townsend transit hub.

The wine selection is nice and the staff are really friendly. They seem to have really connected with the neighborhood.  It's laid back and loud. I was only here for a snack and a drink, so I tried their deviled eggs and beef tartare -- both were delicious. I hear they have a good burger and NY steak, so I'll have to come back to try them out.
author: Jermaine R.

description: They have burrata, brussels sprouts, deviled eggs, and super crispy fries. What else needs to be said?
author: L. M.

description: 4.5 Stars !!!  After trying for months, we finally made it.  Definitely Brussels chips, deviled eggs we awesome.  Polenta was fantastic and I don't usually like it.  I can recommend the steak tartare, but the steak entree was too chard - but tasty if you like it that way.  Service was great, we were in a rush to see a movie and Marlowe had us in and out in plenty of time.  So wished we could have lingered.
author: Jas S.

description:
This spot is ideal. The ambiance is so cozy, and unpretentious.  Our waitress was excellent--there when we needed her and wasn't overly in our faces.  Food was good, great cocktails, and a decent wine selection.

We had the oysters, steak frites and the shrimp roll, pretty damn damn good.  I just wish the spot was a little bigger so the wait wasn't so long, but I'm looking forward to my next visit for sure**
author: CeeLo L.

description:
yum.
cauliflower soup

bone marrow

good drinks
author: Jasmine N.

description: The cheeseburger is one of the best I've ever had. All dishes are carefully constructed and oh so yummy the pork chop and baked oysters are also my favorite.
author: Amanda L.

description:
The menu was a bit too small for comfort for me, but I really liked everything we tried, so I can't really fault them for that. We started with brussels sprout chips and toasted pistachios. The latter were actually my least favorite things - they were fine but not too interesting. I'd never had *pistachios* sweetened this way, but it was pretty similar to sugared pecans, etc. The brussels sprout chips were fantastic and converted one person at our table to a brussels sprouts lover.
 I expected the food to be great so ordered a bit more adventurously than I normally would. I got the open-faced deviled egg sandwich rather than a safer/more boring choice like the burger, which I'm sure would have been good too. I loved the egg sandwich, which also had provolone, bacon, and chilies. Normally I would think that was too much, but it was great. The open-faced sandwich was very small but well constructed. I also liked how the side salad was salted.
The layout is pretty tight and we were sitting at the table that has the large beam that comes down across the table, which was ridiculously in the way, so I'd recommend avoiding that.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I came here on a weekday for a impromptu dinner with some friends.  Half of our party arrived a bit too early for our reservations and found that there isn't really much of a bar/waiting area for patrons.  We worked our way up to the bar which was fully seated with diners and managed to put in a drink order.  Only then did we realize there was a crazy homeless lady sitting at the bar.  She harassed and annoyed the guy next to him so much that he wofled his his dinner and asked for his check.   With her main target gone, she started to make small talk with us and then one of my friends felt her hand stroking his back.  After that, we pretty much bolted to the small area by the host stand once we got our drinks.  Props to the hostess who realized what was happening and kicked out the crazy lady a short time later.

While the menu is simple, it has enough selections to satisfy most people.  We started off with a few appetizers including: oysters, steak tartare, and bone marrow.  The baked oysters were a little salty for my tastes, but the steak tartare and bone marrow were great renditions of the classic dishes.  For mains, the Marlow buger, steak and pork chop entrees were ordered.  The buger was good but not amazing as reviewed by Michael Bauer.  The steak and pork chop were both cooked just right and were both very enjoyable.  They comped us two desserts (carrot cake and some chocolate dessert in a jar)  since we had to wait a long time past our reservation to be seated, neither of which impressed me.  Both had a rather salty taste to it and I could not eat more than a small bite.   

If you are in a group of four or fewer you should have no problems being seated.  Any larger, you will have to wait for the communal table to open up or sit awkwardly at the over sized table by the door that needs bar stools for you to be at an adequate height.  Overall, a solid restaurant but do make reservations if you plan to come.
author: Wei K.

description: Bone marrow, very good. Watermelon salad, awesome. Everything else was pretty salty, like the baked clams, I don't remember what else but it was salty.
author: Deanna T.

description: Good food if you like gigantic burgers and wine. The place is very popular right now, but not underrated. The staff was exceptionally helpful & friendly.
author: M C.

description: Reservations are pretty much a must.   Well worth it though.  I would NOT recommend this place for a party larger than 4 people.  It is way too small, but a lovely atmosphere.   The burger is great but in truth the Fried Chicken is the best...AMAZING.  So glad we ordered that.  I look forward to my next visit.
author: Mo C.

description: I really enjoyed my dinner here. I met up with a few friends because we had heard good things about their burger and I wanted to check it out. Little did I know that they had brussel sprouts on their menu, probably my favorite food! We started with the chips (just the leaves of the brussel sprouts lightly salted) which were great. I had the burger which comes with cheese and bacon. It was delicious. The meat was cool perfectly (medium rare) the patty wasn't too big and it also came with a size of fries. The atmosphere was what I really liked; the restaurant isn't too big so its more homey than other restaurants downtown. The wine he had was wonderful and our server(s - there were quite a few of them), were all friendly. I would go back here again.
author: Shanna T.

description:
4 stars, Marlowe is fantastic on service but the food could pack a heavier punch.

Ambiance: hip. Come here for a trendy date or with a group of your cool friends.

Highlights:
- wine in carafes, cause you know, for people like me and my sister, one bottle is just too much, but one glass/person makes us ration our alcohol and that's just not as fun. A carafe is the perfect quantity and it comes in a visually forgiving open glass bottle. The verdejo (white variety from Spain) was mild and made for a very nice complement to the appetizers.
- service. Wow. Our server was super nice and sweet, especially for such a busy and loud place. Even though we had a corner table she never neglected to check on us, and was friendly without being overly so. The kitchen portioned our burger entree into 2 perfect halves when I informed our server that we'd be sharing it.
- bone marrow appetizer. It's basically a bone cut in half from probably what used to be a huge animal, and the marrow inside is melt-in-your-mouth, fatty goodness. Spread it on your bread. It spreads easier than butter.
- location is right across from the Caltrain. It's very easy to get to.

Brutal honesty:
- the burger was ok. If you like horseradish then get this burger, or ask for horseradish on the side if you don't. I wasn't blown away by it. The bun was boring. The patty wasn't as juicy as I would have liked it.
- brussel sprout chips that sound fancy, and they are pretty tasty, but when you think about it they're really just brussel sprouts pulled apart and fried to a crisp in oil. Fun to munch on, but nothing innovative beyond that.

Heart our server!
author: Brandy A.

description:
I had some family in town and I was on the hunt for a fancy dinner that would show off the culinary skills and class that only the San Francisco Bay Area can bring.  Unfortunately, waiting until the last minute to make reservations meant that I could not get a table for 8 at my usual go-to fancy joints.  So I looked on SFGate's Top 100 list and started perusing the menus.  Marlowe's menu jumped out to me.  I could not find a single item I did not want to eat.  Even better, they were very accomodating about making last minute reservations on a Thursday night.
So, we showed up.  The room was dark, not too loud but not too quiet and the decor was industrial.  Being the gustatory adventurers that we are, my party ordered a sample of every appetizer, multiple bottles of wine, various entrees and several dessert options.  Everything I ate was amazing.  Not just good. Amazing.  The highlights for me: The Brussel sprout chips, the steak tartar (holy crap I could eat this all day), the steak frits and all the desserts.
The service was great, the food was excellent.  Marlowe has just jumped up high on my list of places to return.  I can't wait to do it again.
author: Jim S.

description:
Came here on a rainy day after rescuing my brother-in-law from a non functioning car. I came with my fiance and brother-in-law with sweats and a hoodie with everyone in the restaurant in business attire or nicer clothes because it looked like many people were on a date.

We arrived at 9:30 and it was a wait of about 15 min to sit at the bar. The restaurant was full and people came in even after we arrived. The hostess was really nice despite my attire. 

Here is what we ordered:

- Warm Deviled Eggs -- This was sooooooo gooooddd. It had the right saltiness and flavor. It wasn't overwhelming but well balanced.

- Warm Marinated Mussel & Monterey Calamari Toasts -- This was light and flavorful. It wasn't what I expected when I ordered it. It was chopped up mussels and calamari on a toasted cracker like baguette.

- Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips -- This was very creative. The chips were very thin, almost paper like. It was a tad on the salty side but still good.

- Marlowe Burger -- It was a very rich and smooth burger. Some say it is the best burger they have ever had. I don't think it lives up to that hype. It's not good because of unique flavor but because of the smooth texture of the patty. It was good, but not the best.

- Angus New York Steak Frites -- This was good. It had good flavor and texture. I had it medium and it was cooked just right. Pink and easy to eat.
author: Mich L.

description:
This is a small, cozy restaurant in SOMA perfect for a date night out.  We walked in on a Saturday night, and had to sit at the bar.  I highly recommend making a reservation as this place is pretty packed.  

We had crispy brussel sprouts that yelpers were raving about, and seriously, it was AMAZING. So crispy, lemon-y, and absolutely delicious!! I think I'd prefer these brussel sprouts over potato chips or fries anyday. Wow. We also had crab and shrimp louie lettuce wrap, which was delicious.  Sweet chunky meat parts topped with chopped boiled eggs... Mmmm..  We then had the burger, which was seriously one of the best burgers I've ever had.  So juicy, cooked perfectly medium, with oozing cheese..  It came with a side of fries, which was also so crispy and delicious.

Their wine selection is small but good.  We got a karafe of new zealand sauvignon blanc because I knew all these fried goods and a burger will make me fall asleep. It was so crisp and refreshing.

Overall, I probably had too much fried stuff that night, but the food was so good!  I inhaled the whole thing, although I also needed to drink 3-4 glasses of water because the food was on the salty side.  Portions are slightly on the small side but it's extremely filling, we didn't have any room left to try the chocoalte cream pie. Next time...
author: Jen K.

description:
After all the rave reviews, I had to get a chance to try Marlowe for myself.  My friend and I made a reservation weeks ahead of time and still only got something at 5:45pm.  

Upon arrival, I was surprised how small the place is.  It's quite loud and there's not really any place to wait inside without being in the way.  I checked in with the hostess for our reservation and then stood waiting for quite a while.  I was a little irritated that she didn't communicate why we were just standing around, but eventually she explained that the patrons at our table had finished eating and had paid, but just wouldn't leave.  She offered that we could take a seat at the end of the communal table or wait for our table.  We chose to get seated right away and the hostess promptly brought us glasses of Prosecco to apologize for the wait.  It's that kind of service that makes all the difference.

So, I've been a bit obsessed with steak tartare lately and Marlowe's was no let-down.  It was flavorful and a huge serving and all the flavors worked together well.  I was very happy.

Although I've heard great things about the burger and almost got it, I had to get the polenta with wild mushrooms, a poached egg, and truffled cheese.  It was absolutely incredible.  Each bite was like heaven.  I am drooling as I write this....

Unfortunately, the desserts weren't very exciting and so we passed on that.  Despite the lack of dessert options, I would rush back here for that polenta and steak tartare...If I could get a reservation easily.
author: Jessica L.

description: Not the largest of places, went there for a business lunch and very glad a booked a table. Service was great, food came fast, and it was very tasty.
author: B V.

description:
Each year for the last few, myself and fellow grandchildren take my grandmother out for her birthday. Marlowe was the choice this year.

The menu is fairly focused, with a few options in various menu categories: appetizers, "pots," snacks, soups/salads, mains and sides. We ordered a variety of appetizers/small plates as well as an entree each.

Warm Deviled Egg aged provolone, pickled jalapeño & bacon - Served warm, the eggs were complemented primarily by smoky, crispy bacon and a mild provolone. I didn't really pick up any of the pickled jalapeno, but this was still a good bite or two.

Crispy Brussels Sprout Chips lemon & sea salt - Lightly crispy with smoky charred ends, these were quite tasty...though some pieces were a little oily. Because they were so thin, the leaves/chips quickly became soggy in any residual oil. Some lemon provided a nice touch of both citrus and acid.

We also ordered a few "pots" served with crostini/lettuce.

Warm Marinated Mussels & Monterey Calamari grilled country bread & green garlic aioli
Duck Liver Mousse roasted Medjool dates, pickled mustard seeds & crostini
Dungeness Crab & Rock Shrimp Louie gem lettuce, eggs mimosa & tabasco

Of these three, I liked the crab and rock shrimp Louie best. The seafood and lettuce cups  felt light while having quite a bit of flavor, particularly with a splash of lemon or tabasco. I thought the mussels and calamari pot was difficult to eat on the crostini, with the small pieces continually falling off the toasted bread. The duck liver mousse was a good one, with the rich minerality playing well with the sweetness of the dates.

Grilled Niman Ranch Pork Chop spinach & ricotta bread pudding, prosciutto & parmesan cream - My grandmother got this entree. Very juicy and quite flavorful, this was an excellent chop. A little bit of a smoky flavor was present too, adding an extra flavor profile to the pork.

Marlowe Burger caramelized onions, cheddar, bacon, horseradish aioli & fries - Ah, the much anticipated burger. The meat was cooked a nice medium-rare, though it wasn't quite as thick as I anticipated. The meaty flavor was there, with a really good smoky char on both the meat and toasted bun. However, I thought there was too much bread (the bread:meat ratio was high) on an otherwise good burger. Overall, disappointing given expectations.

Certified Angus New York Steak Frites red wine- porcini jus - A good steak, tender and flavorful. It was cooked right on point, and the red wine-porcini jus was quite delicious as well. The fries were the same ones that came with the burger - crispy yet fluffy, pretty good fries. Perfect for dipping in the jus. A simple dish; this was very satisfying.

TCHO Chocolate Cream Pie Graham cracker & chocolate cookie crust, cocoa nib, sea salt
Vanilla Bean Panna Cotta Affogato Amaretto & lemon biscotti

We were trying to save room for later, but a meal is not complete without dessert, right? We opted for these two choices, one was fine and one was very good. The chocolate cream pie had the expected chocolate flavor with some nice crumble textures. Nothing special. I thought the affogato panna cotta was more exciting, with the creamy panna cotta doused in a shot of espresso. The bitterness of the espresso countered the sweet vanilla panna cotta quite nicely - addicting!

Marlowe was good. I can't say anything was special enough for me to return though. Of all of the dishes we ordered, the burger had the highest expectations and fell short. However, the other plates were executed fairly well with the pork chop being the standout entree. And the panna cotta affogato was memorable.
author: Darin L.

description:
It's good, it's great, it's AWESOME.

I mean what is there to not like about this place? Better yet, what is there not to LOVE about it.

Service was impeccable minus the short wait with reservations.

Food was beyond FIRST CLASS. I couldn't help fall in love with their Brussel Sprout chips, the too-die-for Bone Marrow, and the mouth-watering infamous Marlowe burger (order medium). My top three choices off their menu.

Well you have my word about this place, so Bon Appetit everyone.
author: Sophia S.

description:
Love those brussel sprout chips!

How many times have I been to the CalTrain station without seeing this place across the street?! Love these nook-and-cranny discoveries!

Last night's menu selections:
Brussel Sprout Chips--All the flavor of the brussel sprouts plus a great combo of seasonings.
Little Gem Salad--Tasty, interesting citrus vinaigrette.
Seared Hawaiian Tuna--Very high quality tuna, wonderful texture and a very tasty bed of kashi.
Strawberry/Rhubarb Crisp--Unfortunately, a misnomer. I got a serving of creme(?) with strawberry/rhubarb compote. Good but nothing crispy.

Marlowe uses very high-quality ingredients and nice recipes that generated great tastes. Five stars in that regard. I'm giving Marlowe four stars because 1) the lighting was a bit dark for my tastes and we struggled a bit to read the menus, 2) I was disappointed with the crisp, 3) a full bar (beer and wine only) would be a nice enhancement, and 4) the pescatarian selections were limited.

Love those brussel sprout chips!
author: Jay C.

description:
The mushroom soup was _amazing_, but the wine selection was super meh - the Pinot Noir tasted like water and vinegar and had a smell like it had been stored in some weird gas - the smell was 'off', the Montepulciano smelled like grass and horsemanure, but its flavour was so bland, it didnt make up for it  - for the prices they are charging, I want better wine. The food was not a great value for the price, and the wine certainly wasnt. 

Edited to add: The service was excellent, and I suspect they would have taken back the glasses if I had asked, but I think while Marlowe is ok, they miss the mark to be someplace where a table of four should be dropping over 200$ for dinner. 

Probably wont be going back.
author: Gayathri K.

description:
Reservation was at 7 but got there at 6:40. Got seated no problem without a wait. The place was relatively small with little walking space. I already knew it was going to be the stuffy and kind of warm atmosphere. I quickly noticed we got the WORSE table in the joint!! Don't settle for table next to corner!!!!! Right in between bigger parties, small table for two...great.

That kinda irritated me already. This is what keeps me from going to "nicer" places like these. Maybe i"m just bad luck or whatnot, but small, dark, heated atmosphere and shitty small table put me at a bad mood.

Baked oysters- $3 each. They were small but not bad. Topped with chives and bacon bits i believe. Salty like a Yelper had said but worth the try.

Marlowe burger- $13. I've had better, but this burger was pretty juicy as well. The fries and horseradish was pretty good. Ate each and every one!
