Stuffed Sole- $23?! This was the size of my fist but it was delicious! Even if it's pretty good, $23 was jus a bit more than expected. 

Choc pudding- $6. DO NOT try it. It doesn't taste like chocolate. A yelper said don't and I should have listened. It's not the type of chocolate I am used to, tad toooo sweet, but everyone around me ordered it so I got suckered into it especially bc I was craving for chocolate the whole week...but definitely not my cup of tea.... :P

More than likely I won't be coming back. Good service though by the girl with all the tattoos. Kept my water filled =)
author: Helen T.

description: Awesome Brussel sprout chips!!! Ambiance is amazing! Romantic, cozy and downright goooood food!! You won't be disappointed.  I like the big community table, and the bar. There are private tables too in case you are wondering. Pork Chops melted in my mouth, not in my hand! :)
author: Christine K.

description: If it's on the menu, order the sweet corn soup with chili oil & chives. With a glass of white wine, it would've been fine to stop right there. Poulet vert with baby broccoli , infant potatoes,and tasting heavily of tarragon, was delicious but very salty. The burger looks luscious and would be what I would order next time.
author: Bleep S.

description:
I call on Marlowe people to change their very annoying policy of booking tables in a way that doesn't quite work!

It just can't be that each time we make it here we have to wait for our reserved(!) table for almost 30 minutes past our reservation time!

Last visit the food was good enough to make me forget about it completely by the time I had some yelping time. But this time I was already a little bored with the menu to help the memory of the long wait stick with me till the end. And I wasn't the only one to feel this way... My companions came from the south bay to have dinner and the wait was almost as long as their drive! 

So the chicken was, as always, very good. So was their burger, their sole (exactly the same as the last two times), the spicy prawns, the tartar, the soup, the deviled eggs, the deserts etc. ... But, I believe I will think twice before I come back, and definitely before I take people here with me (unless dreams of chicken take the better of me :). We shall see. If they do I'll report back, since that will be proof that I am wrong and this Marlowe policy is efficient even if very annoying.)
author: tal n.

description:
Love Marlowe's!  Love the sweet hostess and the cool table staff!  So much that I came here twice in a week.   

My first time here was with a high school friend that I reconnected with via FB.  We opted for a later 1:30pm reservation so that we could catch up and boy, did we ever!!  We shared the brussel sprout chips (delish and low carb, yay!) and we each got the Marlowe burger (yummy and only $12!) and finished with the chocolate cream pie in a jar for dessert.     The dessert was the only thing I wasn't entirely impressed with.  I love the jar concept but it was just a little too salty for my sweet loving tooth.   

The second time was part of our SF Food Tour, stop #3.   The three of us shared a plethora of menu items.   The brussel sprout chips,  Jerusalem Artichoke soup, Spiced Prawns, Classic Steak Tartare, Baked Oysters, and the Marlowe burger again.   I prefer raw oysters but if you like them baked and cheesy, these will fit the bill.  Our table attendant was awesome!   He brought us their lemon souffle for dessert which was light and tart.  

I can't wait to go back for dinner to try their bone marrow!
author: Christina L.

description:
Service=We had a reservation for 8:45pm... we were 10 minutes early.  The Hostess while answering the phone and shouting at a waiter mumbled something to us in an aussie accent.  Who knows what she said... we just stood there for another 15min waiting to tell her the name the reservation was under.... strike 1.  Wicked slow waitress but yet surrounded by utter chaos... not a relaxing or pleasurable experience 20 min to take our drink order.  Strike 2 and we haven't even ordered food yet.

Food=Sometimes even when the service is bad you go back to the restaurant because the food is to die for... this is not that place.  There will be no repeat reservation for me.

Atmosphere= It was a friday night so it was busy.  The place is small.  Tables are close together.  But worst of all it felt like it was 100 degrees inside.  When we ask the waitress if we could open the window she said no that she would try to turn the air conditioning up... well that never seemed to happen.  Strike 3

Price= too expensive for a average to poor experience.

Parking= found a spot right out front... should have been a sign

Bathrooms= never made it to the bathroom...

The two stars were for the parking spot.
author: Annmarie K.

description:
One of my fave foodie friends introduced me to Marlowe. I write this review a few weeks after having their fantastic burger for the first time. Day 2 of this raw food diet is making me crave their burger BIG TIME!!!!

I loved their elderberry prosecco drink, perfect mix of tastiness. The brussel sprouts chips are an absolute must have as are their warm deviled eggs. The bacon in those deviled eggs are calling my name!  Alas, as soon as the star of the show arrived - the brussel sprouts were pushed off to a dark corner of the table and sadly forgotten. This burger is definitely something to write home about...juicy, tender, perfectly cooked...crispy in the right places and amazing. When I return home from Vancouver, done with this raw diet - Marlowe burger, WATCH OUT, I'm coming for you. I'll probably gently prod the BF into ordering the polenta, I couldn't help but keep taking spoonfuls of Christine C.'s fragrant dish, it was so tempting!
author: Veronica C.

description:
This is a great place to meet up with a friend or two and is conveniently located by the Caltrain station.  The restaurant lighting is dim and the space is not very large, but still very cozy with a center communal table.  In fact, the lowered part of the bar in the far-right corner of the restaurant can be a good date corner if no one handicapped is using it.  Kind of private.  And you can go for a walk after dinner in the park behind the station before the scheduled Caltrain arrives! 

I wanted to try the Marlowe burger, so of course I ordered this.  The Deviled eggs and Crab louis were good but not the highlight for my evening.  The burger certainly was solid - pretty scrumptious patty on a toasted bun.  However, it didn't wow me as I had anticipated.  I almost closed my eyes on the first bite to really savor the taste!  Overall, a cozy spot with a solid burger and a nice chocolate creme pie in a jar dessert.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Woohoo! is right!  Loved it.

First, when my fiance and I came in for my reservation, the hostess was busy and these rude people walked right in front of us, trying to play it like they came first.  When she finally had a moment, the hostess graciously asked them to move aside because we came in first. They, of course looked put out seeing that their plan was foiled. I have no idea how she knew, since it seemed like she was elsewhere, but I took that as a sign that this was to be a memorable meal.

The food and service were standouts.  Our waitress Sarah was extremely helpful with opinions, yet not overbearing.  She checked in often, in spite of the full restaurant.  We got the brussels sprout chips, baked oysters, little gems, greens gratin, and brown butter sprouts.   If you're going to get ALL of those, I'd cut back, probably on the chips (if you're getting the burger, because the chips are essentially like fries), but THAT'S IT.  Everything else is buttery delicious, especially the gratin.

For entrees, we had, of course, the burger like every other freaking person, and I got the polenta.  THE POLENTA IS GORGEOUS, SUBTLE, YET EXPLOSIVE all at the same time.  At first you may think, "wait, this is bland . . . but then the mushrooms and truffled pecorino come in and you're like "WHOA" from  Bill & Ted's excellent adventure.  I know the whole soft poached farm egg is getting played, but this was  still a treat.  I feel like Marlowe is known for meat and people should know veggie is just as tasty.

For dessert we got the carrot cake and choco pie.  My fiance thought the pie bordered on salty, I thought it was PERFECT.  So beware, know you're chocolate +salt level.

I got pretty drunk because we had 2 carafts of wine (the sauv was my favorite) and a cocktail. The cocktail was probably unnecessary, but solid nonetheless.

All in in, a great restaurant.  I don't think I have to say anything about the burger because it's all been said.  It CAN be expensive, but also be cheaper if you'd like (I saw a lot of people order half burgers).  

They do food that's comforting, yet feels new and exciting.  Quite a hard act to pull off, I think!
author: Annie F.

description: Walked by and stopped in. Great atmosphere, great staff, great bartenders. Ordered apps and wine and it was perfect. Glad I came by.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Marlowe is a fun spot to feed yourself - it's almost hidden off the street. It's normally a little crowded for lunch, so make sure to call ahead for reservations if you plan on going. The hostess took our number and gave us a call when our seats were ready. 

Ok, so I'm an idiot and thought the cheese plate "burrata over arugula" was actually a salad. The staff are RAD and removed my meal from my group's receipt, even though it was 100% my fault. I didn't even ask them to- the gal said she wants everyone who comes in to eat something they enjoy.

Beef tartare, garlic chips and lamb burger are the way to go. The very greasy, salty and satisfying way to go. Also, get a Bundaberg ginger beer from Australia.
author: K M.

description:
Crab Souffle and Brussels Sprout chips were amazing. 

Went with a friend who lived in France and he said their steak tartar was of French quality.  Personally, I didn't have a method of comparison but I can tell you it was mighty tasty. 

A nice craft beer selection and decent depth on the wine list made this one of my favorites in my new home city of San Fran.
author: Paul W.

description: My husband and I visited Marlowe last night with a local friend and absolutely loved it! Everything was truly delicious. Our party shared the brussel sprouts chips, baked oysters, burrata, bone marrow, shrimp and the pork chop entree. We loved all of it -- too hard to pick a favorite!!! The vibe is low-key and unpretentious and the service was fantastic as well. Will definitely come back next time we're in the city!
author: Tasha I.

description:
Marlowe hits the spot everytime I'm craving quality meat in an intimate yet lively setting.
2 nights ago, I went for the fifth time and I'm happy to stay I'm still very wowed by the experience.

Our server was extremely friendly and beautiful!

We enjoyed the brussel sprouts chips, little gem salad, Marlowe burger and Creekstone Ribeye. Double Rainbow Wow
author: Coco M.

description: I'M A FAN. I go here often to "pregame" or grab a nice drink before going out most of the time. Did I mention they have the best baked oysters ever? I usually don't prefer oysters, but my goodness, they sure are delicious here. It's a nice place to go to for a date or just to grab some drinks with the girlfriends.
author: Katarina D.

description:
had a great lunch here. it was very busy for lunch but it was a holiday after all.

we tried their shrimp Louie, brussel sprouts chips, burger, fried chicken sandwich and chocolate cream pie.

everything was great especially the sprout chips and the burger. it also came with a great service and atmosphere.
author: Sung C.

description: Great service, Brussel Sprout and bone marrow were dynamite. Main course exceeded needs.
author: Joe F.

description:
Great burgers and the best french fries I've ever had.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu at Marlowe.  Last time, I had a Neiman ranch pork chop that was most excellent.

The service experience could be a little more unified.  One waiter takes your order and then a different employee shows up with every course.  It was a bit disorienting.

Very small place but intimate.  It makes reservations hard to come by but the effort is well worth it.
author: Jim K.

description:
I love good french fries and I'm always on the lookout for a great burger, so I was interested in Marlowe. But then I heard about the brussels sprout chips and had to try them. 

We showed up when they opened at 5:30 and got a spot at the bar. The restaurant was fully booked. Service was friendly, and the atmosphere was pleasant. 

First up were those brussels sprout chips. They have a flavor of lemon zest, are not over salted, and were fairly crisp. They were really good, but they would have been perfect if they'd been a bit crisper and a little less oily.

Second was Little Gem Salad with avocado, market vegetables and citrus vinaigrette. I liked all the different vegetables, which were sliced into thin strips, and everything tasted fresh, but the vinaigrette wasn't particularly delicious. The avocado had been mashed or pureed, and also was oddly flavorless. 

Finally, we had the much-vaunted burger. It comes with caramelized onions, cheddar cheese melted on top, and a disc of bacon. On the plate there is also a side of fries and some horseradish dipping sauce. 

The burger is fine, but didn't wow me. I found it a bit too thin to be really juicy. We both agreed that the bacon was superfluous and just made the burger too salty. It may be that they've salted the burger and should just cut that out so that the bacon doesn't overpower everything, but as it stood, I thought the bacon was detracting. And it's not as if I don't like bacon. The burger at Chop Bar in Oakland comes with bacon, and it is fantastic (still my top-rated burger in the bay area). 

The fries are excellent: crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. I prefer my fries to be made from peeled potatoes because usually the peel doesn't get as crisp as the rest of the potato and ruins the feel, but in this case everything worked fine. 

The horseradish aoli was not strong enough on horseradish, I thought. 

All in all, Marlowe seems like a very good restaurant, and I would give it 3 1/2 stars if that were possible, but it just isn't quite delicious enough to get 4 or 5.
author: Jacob L.

description: A group of 7 came on a Sat night and the place was crowded! Luckily we had reservations and were immediately seated to our table, although seated very tightly in a communal table on benches (the entire place is pretty small).  Also, for some reason, it was very warm, which made it feel more stuffy.  However, the service and food made up for it.  The burger, pork, polenta and chicken are definitely recommended! We all thoroughly enjoyed and finished everything on our plates.  Yes, get all the sides, with the brussels sprout chips, fries and cauliflower. Yum! But I would pass on the deviled eggs.  Not really worth $2.5 for each?!? I would also add that the wine list needs a little work.  A couple of us were disappointed by our variety of choices. Definite plus was the ease of finding parking!
author: Sheri H.

description:
This review is long overdue, as I've been to Marlowe several times for lunch and dinner.  Hands down, one of my favorite places in SF.  Every time I go the place delivers the goods.

I dig the relaxed yet trendy vibe of the place.  The lighting is at the perfect level.  The servers are super nice.  I also got a kick out of the Aussie hostess who messed up our resey and told us she "made a boo-boo".  Why do Aussie accents make everything sound cooler/sexier?  I digress...

The food is, how do you say, ridiculous.  The brussel sprouts and sprout chips are tastiness personified.  The baked oyster is crazy good.  The salads are fresh and interestingly seasonal.  The shrimp sandwich (lunch menu) is delicious.  

And now let me pause... because the burger is perhaps one of the best I've ever had.  SO FREAKING GOOD!!!  It's no mystery why it seems like half the people in there order the burger.  Just thinking about it makes me want one right now, and I just ate dinner.  Mmmmm... Marlowe Burrrrrgerrrrrrrrrr...
author: Clayton S.

description:
It was so loud that we had to yell to speak to each other, in a group of five. We were seated against the wall, and could barely get into our table, and our waitress had to practically crawl over us to fill up our water. 
The food was overpriced. The hamburger was okay, but it wasn't worth the price. For a $16 hamburger, it should be nothing if not fantastic, and it was not fantastic.
And the appetizer for five of us, which came 40 minutes after our wine, comprised a single piece of bread that was difficult to share. 

It wasn't a good restaurant, and I would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Gina K.

description: Marlowe has great atmosphere, friendly and trendy environment.  We had the Brussel sprouts, beet salad and burger which were all very flavorful.  The aioli horseradish sauce was a slightly spicy addition to crisp French fries.
author: BreAnna K.

description:
Burgers and fries are excellent, the best I've had!
Brussel sprouts were very tasty.
Excellent service.
Prices were above average.   $14 for burger and fries, $4 for a soda.
author: Eric N.

description: Loved it! Bomb brussel sprouts, burger, and delicious cocktails!
author: Kristin B.

description:
Nice ambiance. It was relaxing inside and quiet - great place for a date.

The brussell sprout chips are a must! I enjoyed the salad I had but thought it was a bit salty. I should mention that I hardly ever eat salt so I'm very sensitive to it.
author: Jeanette L.

description: We had pork chops (quite a big portion) and steak frites, delicious! Great service, the hostess was exceptionally welcoming.
author: Anupa M.

description: Had a great time here! I have no complaints, this place was awesome! The Brussels sprout chips were addicting! I had the scallops with bacon wrapped asparagus and it was amazing!! Definitely make a reservation because it was completely full the whole time I was there.
author: Alex M.

description: I've only been here once with friends from work and I remember leaving the place feeling so good bc all the food in my belly was just pure deliciousness. We started with some brussel sprout chips which at first sounded gross, but were actually pretty delicious. I ordered the amazing Marlowe Burger minus the bacon with a side of the marlowe fries. I was in true bliss eating the delicious perfect burger that melted in my mouth. It was cooked and created very good. It's not like a huge burger or anything, but for what it was, it was amazing. My taste buds were singing. And i was singing along with them afterwards. This place does get pretty crowded and pricey but the food speaks for itself!
author: Rehana K.

description:
SO SO SO GOOD!
I came here last week with a friend and couldn't believe i hadn't been before. Absolutely delicious!

We started with the baked oysters...I'll also mention, I don't really like oysters....but now, I don't think I can say that again as they were DEE-LISH! We also had the brussel sprout chips. WOW. I don't care if you don't like brussel sprouts...do yourself a favor and order them! We also shared the gem salad which was the tastiest salad I've had in a while. There was nothing overly special about it - everything just tasted fresh and delicious.

I was in a fishy mood...so I ordered the sole with the stuffed crab. HEAVEN. Perfectly prepared! My friend got the lamb and she loved hers.

We couldn't decide on dessert so we got one of the lemon & one of the chocolate...dear Lord, HEAVEN! I know, I know, I sound ridiculous with so many "CAPS" and "!", but it really was that good. Next time, I'm going to try the burger.

I will absolutely be back for another round!
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
This place is delicious. Good service, great selection of wines and a delicious menu to choose from. I had the crab louie, brussel sprouts, roasted bone marrow, burger and the pear crisp.

My favorites were the brussel sprouts, bone marrow and burger. Brussel sprouts fried, how could you go wrong! The bone marrow was super tasty, and it is served with toasted bread. The burger was a decent size, full of flavor and the fries with horseradish sauce. 

My only compliant was the pear crisp; the caramel was overly sweet. I was unable to eat it.

Although a small space, I like the overall ambiance they have created. They take reservations, but also have a communal/bar area where you can dine. Can't wait to come back and try other things on the menu!
author: Laura H.

description: Absolutely delicious! The food took a little longer than expected and they comped our dessert. Great service I'll definitely be back!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
After reading "The Best New Restaurants of 2010" in the Chronicle the day after New Year's, I promptly put Marlowe on my list of must-trys for the year.  Quick Open Table search, snagged a reservation, date night with husband planned.

We were promptly seated on our Friday night, and quickly decided on things to order.  We ordered the brussel sprout chips, bone marrow, poulet vert, and of course, the burger + fries.

Upon the arrival of the brussel sprout chips, our eyes widened--so NOT what we expected, which is a good thing!  Never having been fans of the b-sprouts, we found these to be so delightful.  Each little leaf peeled and fried.  So light, crispy, salty, superb!   We were at the bottom of the basket before we knew it.  The bone marrow was one of the better ones I've had--like eating butter, and not oversalted/spiced as many others do.  The poulet vert was delicious--wonderfully seasoned, moist, we found ourselves trying to sop up all the au jous.  The burger + fries--well, I don't need to say what's already been stated here.  Didn't try any desserts as we had other plans for the night.

Service was attentive.  Overall, a wonderful dining experience.  What a great start to knocking another one off my list for the year!
author: Vivian T.

description: Every time I come here the food and service are a-mazing. totally chill atmosphere, good variety of wines, and again the food is so tasty.  'nough said
author: Shayla D.

description: Hostess was really friendly and went out of her way to make us comfortable. We were seated 30 min after our reservation but we were enjoying ourselves so it was okay. Everyone loved the food so much. Brussel sprouts, fried, mussels, cauliflower, bur rata toast-- are all the things I ate and all were superb. Great wine too. I had the chocolate mousse cake dessert and it was amazing!
author: Alexandra W.

description: It took a while, but I was finally able to get reservations. Great menu with a lot of small plate choices. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the table we sat at. It was a two top right next to the long picnic style table. People forget that there are people behind them, so as they are pulling out the bench their a** is right up against your should/face. No good. Move that table out or elsewhere Marlowe! Back to the food . . . we started off with the mussels with chorizo and warmed deviled eggs. Both were good, full of good flavor and leave you wanting more. We both had the steak and it was cooked perfectly, really tender and flavorful. I love the crunch of the fried shoestring onions on top. For dessert we got the chocolate cream pie and panna cotta affogato. I really liked the deconstructed chocolate cream pie. The "crust" was a little salty which helped cut the sweetness. The only thing I wish they did was layer it or put less cream pie in it. The panna cotta affogato was also good. The layer of concentrated espresso (i think) on top was good, but it will probably keep you awake at night so beware!
author: Adelina W.

description: I went here with my wife & we both left without much of a positive/ negative opinion. Looking back, it was ok food, but nothing more. I had clams to start, which were in a soup-like sauce but served with a spoon. I had a fish course for main, but was neither pleased/ disappointed that I can recall much about it only two weeks after having it. My wife enjoyed king prawns, which I was envious of, followed by a fillet steak which was charred & very chewy. The wine menu was pricey but the Syrah was great. My biggest dislike was the lack of space- be prepared to be over heard as it is so packed that tables were moved to allow people to get out from their seat. Still there is something that makes me want to go back and try this place again, maybe because it is local, who knows, hopefully I will see what the queuing patrons do.
author: Barry O.

description:
SOMA fru-fru...

It's become so trendy... when did SOMA become THE spot?  I missed the memo.  I came to Marlowe with Raimey D. who was in town for the weekend and I was in the mood to show her how food is more amazing in the city versus "the No" (Fresno).

To my disappointment, Marlowe embodies the new Marina... kind of hipstery, snobbery and all of the above. The table next to us looked like married couples from Greek life at a big football school... loud, slightly obnoxious and nauseating.  

The one redeeming quality would have been the food... but the food isn't even that great!  The brussel sprout chips are greasy and too salty, they made me feel gross.  The portions are HUGE - not necessarily a bad thing, but what happened to portion control? We both had the little gem salad.  I had the pork chip and Raimey had the polenta. We were stuffed half way through dinner. 

And there is only one bathroom. Seriously? 

I'd have to be convinced to come back. Sad.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I wanted to try a couple of different things then from my first visit and I'm still a fan!  

On the menu, the steak tartare was screaming my name but since the burger looked pretty good I didn't want to order too much "meat".  The pork chop sounded good.  Unfortunately my friend's "poulet vert" was just ok.    

Crispy Brussel Sprout Chips - as always a great staple to share w/ the table - yummy!
Warm Deviled Egg - delish
Crab & Rock Shrimp Louie - excellent!  extremely happy with this dish, i highly recommend!  
Marlowe Burger - good but not as good as I remember.  i only ate 1/2 because i was so full.  

Service was good.  Prices are reasonable.  By the time we left around 7:40pm, there was only a couple of empty seats.  Pretty good for a Monday night!
author: Meredith K.

description: Marlowe makes the best hamburger I've ever had. I've been back several times, and it just blows me away every time. They really know their stuff. Great atmosphere, although it gets a little loud - but absolutely worth it for the food!
author: Rajesh S.

description:
A+ service.  I wish I remembered our waiters name as he was awesome, but unfortunately I do not.

On one hand, the brussels sprouts chips ARE AMAZING.  UH-MAZING!!!  I also LOVED the stuffed sole.

On the other hand, the Bone Marrow is solidly mediocre and the burger is nothing to write home about.  Perhaps these two items were built up in my head too much, but I just didn't find anything about either particularly noteworthy.

That said, the first two items make this place a spot I'll definitely visit again.
author: Mystery V.

description:
A friend recommended this place to my wife and me so we checked it out a few weeks back. Overall, it was a decent experience, but not spectacular and with a few little annoyances.

First, I was surprised (and more than a little disappointed) by the lack of a full bar. Also, the seating here is so tight that you feel like you're dining on top of your neighbors' laps. 

The food was decent (I got the much touted burger, which was satisfactory), and my wife got the cod, which was good. We shared the chicken livers appetizer, which we both really enjoyed.

The service was a plus: friendly and well versed on the menu and offerings.

Bottom line? A good meal but less than great marks on the overall experience. There are too many other great options in SF, so we'll not likely go back soon.
author: David G.

description: Fell in love with this place the moment I walked in. Tiny, so don't expect to show up with a large group and get a seat. Great food, great service. Make sure and get two orders of brussel sprout chips because yes the hype is true, they're THAT good.
author: Jessie S.

description: Great lunch at Marlowe. We started with the fried brussels sprouts chips, which were really tasty but on the greasy side. The burger was also as tasty as advertised, but maybe a little bit on the small side. I know $14 is the going rate for "fancy" burgers in San Francisco, but it was a bit light on meat and toppings, and the side salad was small as well. I will happily eat the burger every time I'm there, but it'll always be better when someone else is paying!
author: Pilan C.

description:
Small establishment with mostly small 2 top tables and what is supposed to be a communal table. Space is limited but I didn't feel like I was touching elbows with my neighbors or eavesdropping on their conversations since the atmosphere is lively and a bit on the loud end of the spectrum. 

RAVES: Order the brussel sprouts chips and the bone marrow appetizers! I had a bite of my friend's Anson Mills polenta and it was delicious as well! Upside down pear crisp for dessert is to die for! 

We also had the steak tartar appetizer, Marlowe burger and New York steak. Very gracious of them to split each dish into two separate plates if you let them know you are sharing. While these dishes were all good, they were not amazing in my book. I felt like they were all pretty standard and lackluster and the same 'ol boring side of French fries didn't help with that either. The lemon soufflé cake was underwhelming to say the least. 

Overall, great prices and solid food. Service was nothing to complain about but the hostess was not the friendliest. 3.5 stars
author: Vivian D.

description:
Met a friend for lunch and was able to get a table quickly.  The service was friendly but took a really long time to get around to taking our order.  The food was overly salty.  The Brussel sprout chips were very very salty and greasy as was the chicken...it was delicious but for the rest of the day I was so thirsty!  
The portions are not large...it was rich and tasty and very oily but not large.
The issue arose when my friend, who is a big guy and had just come from a gym session asked to see the menu again the waitress told him the only thing available at the time (2:30) was the burger... he asked if he could just get another order of the chicken and she said the kitchen WILL refuse to do it.  Well I think that is lame. It was literally right after they apparently stop serving the lunch menu...it wasn't like a whole hour had passed.  
I may end up there again but the food was too salty and I am not clamoring to get back here.
author: Nilu r.

description: Took a while for a table at 9ish on Friday night for two, though we would have been seated within a few minutes if we had opted for the communal table. Nice, woodsy yet modern ambiance with nice and speedy staff. The food was very good, well done, and more than one dinner entree option for vegetarians!
author: Lana L.

description:
This was a damn fine dining experience. Took the little lady here for our anniversary and it did not disappoint.

Shrimp appetizer, yums.

We both had the steak frites. Yum.

Believe it or not, it tastes like they really take the time to do the fries right. The texture inside was like creamy mashed potatoes. The outside crisp and light. This points to fresh fries, double fried. The best 'plain' fries I've had in a long, long time.

My wife opted to substitute brussels sprouts for the fries and she reports that they were the best she's ever had, and she's had them a lot. I wouldn't know, I don't dig on the greens.

The pie in a jar was an interesting touch, but delicious.

I felt like we were under dressed for the Saturday night crowd but the staff did not treat us any different. The place is cozy and warm and our waitress was attentive without being overbearing. Our water was filled and I barely noticed. One of the best service experiences I've had in SF.

There is ample motorcycle parking across the street, though if it's after 6 you can probably find street parking. Meters run something like a quarter for 5 minutes so you want to avoid that. At the time we were there, the street behind Marlowe was barren and there were a zillion parking spaces. It's right across from Caltrain, too, which means lots of buses and easy access to taxis.
author: Matt J.

description:
This restaurant is about a block away and I've waited 7 months to try it. Not for a total lack of effort, but it's evidently hard to walk in without a reservation and grab a table - which is what I attempted the first two or three times. Granted - it's also quite easy to get a reservation, especially on OpenTable. 

We tried the brussel sprouts chips and burger. The chips were greasier than I ever imagined brussel sprouts being, but they were good...and quite unique. My friend was visiting from NYC and she proclaimed it to be one of the best discoveries she's had in SF.  The burgers were good. I wouldn't put them as the top burger I've had, but they're definitely good. While nothing was wrong with the fries, I almost felt let down since they weren't  the truffle oil parmesan type fries. They were disappointingly average after the burger and brussel sprout chips. Overall, the ambiance reminded me of a Brooklyn loft restaurant. I'd come back.
author: Bern H.

description: I don't know why I haven't been here before. I have been in this neighborhood quite a bit recently and seeing the news that Redford was here recently (while looking for eats in the area), I figured I shared his taste in movies, so we are also likely a match in food too. I was apparently correct. We had the brussel sprout chips, deviled eggs, and almonds for appetizers. The deviled eggs were a standout, (they have bacon and cheese) and we had a burger and a polenta dish between the two of us. I will probably be going here anytime I need any amazingly delish standby food. And recovering from start-up overload.
author: Kourtney P.

description:
The awesome: 
* Figs with bacon: interesting contrasts, visually exciting, well prepared.
* Pork chop: generous, tasty cut of meat, unexpected herb accents
* Deviled eggs: spicy and gutsy. Great start.
* Wine: great recommendation from the staff. Smooth white, that fit the meal and didn't grow tired.
* Service: friendly, attentive yet laid back.

The meh: 
* Cod: everything on the plate was so mellow and soft. It needed something crunchy and dry for balance.
* Brussel Sprouts: A little too crispy on the outside
* Oysters: small and drowned out by the "chowder" preparation
author: Chris P.

description:
Honestly, I wish I was doing something other than writing yelp reviews on a Friday night... but seriously... this place is AWESOME! I just had the steak tartar, the burger, and the amazing watermelon sangria at Marlowe. 

Ok, I know you think it's JUST the 5 star food that would make me come out of my hermit state. BUT NO! it's the service too. For the cost, the waiters are EXTREMELY attentive... folding the napkin if you were to depart for a second, water glasses always full. I mean really, most restaurants should LEARN from Marlowe! 

I can't wait to come back for the mouthwatering food and the delightful staff.

... I hope I can get a resi... :(
author: Rada I.

description:
We went here for a holiday dinner with friends. Beforehand, I tried to make a reservation for 6 and Open Table just wouldn't allow it. I called and learned that I could get a reservation for 6 people, but we would be seated at a high pub-like table with bar stools. No problem. 

When we arrived, I realized why obtaining a reservation was so difficult. This restaurant is small. The footprint accommodates 8 individual tables plus one long bench style table with seating for about 6 on each side plus the high bar table I mentioned previously. I don't consider this restaurant a good option as a spur of the moment choice. 

On to the food. We started by ordering cocktails and a couple of glasses of white wine. Each one of the white wines was equally disappointing. They both lacked body and tasted as if the bottles had been open for several days. For dinner we learned our lesson and ordered a New Zealand Pinot Noir. I highly recommend this wine. It was the perfect compliment to the wide array of different dishes that the group selected. For the most part everyone was satisfied with their entree choice. The folks who ordered the poulet vert were rewarded with an overly generous portion size. No one finished it. I wouldn't recommend the sole entree, even with the crab Louie stuffing, it still tasted bland and unimaginative. In retrospect, I should have ordered the rib eye. My bad....Quelle dommage.
author: Richard R.

description:
Service = friendly and prompt
Wine = very fresh with interesting wines
Burgers = amazing  just the right amount of char for the size of the burger.  Juicy and delicious.  Not huge but everything perfectly proportioned.
Fries= Awesome
Beer selection =perfect
Overall a great lunch before a game.  I have to say the burger really was amazing.
author: David T.

description: The food is a mixed good/okay. But I have been numerous times over the past few years and the service is always the worst. This is why my attendance has been so spotty. It is close to my office and the food is pretty good but the service always drives me away and I am not high maintenance. One time my friend ordered a burger that was supposed to have goat cheese in the middle and it didn't so they just brought her a cold blob of goat cheese on the side like that was the same thing. Today our waiter was in such a hurry, no idea why, they were not crowded. He spewed through the specials like it was an auction, so okay we will order off the menu. Then when we both ordered a glass of wine that was the same kind he said, "Will you be getting a second? I can get you a bottle". We said no, there is no discount on a bottle so we will just decide if we want a second glass. After that he sped away from the table like a rocket saying he was getting us a bottle. We had to call after him to repeat, no bottle. Then there was the clencher, I saw him at the bar pouring the wine and then pouring from one glass to the other if a millimeter went over the logo they put on their glasses to decide what a pour should be, how tacky is that? He can't spare a moment to talk to us but he is a lab scientist when it comes to pouring wine. And yes, the bill was all wrong.
author: Lisa S.

description: Great food, nice ambiance, attentive service! I particularly enjoyed the brussel sprout chips and the burger. Reservations are definitely recommended, even on weeknights. I'll be back if I'm in the area again.
author: Diana G.

description:
Marlowe is my new favorite restaurant and I may actually be slightly obsessed. I recently had one of the best meals I have ever eaten and seriously  loved every flavorful bite from beginning to end. 

My favorite is the poulet vert which I have ordered multiple times and is always just as good as the first time I had it. The brussel sprout chips are as tasty as everyone said they would be and the polenta with wild mushrooms, truffled pecorino & poached farm egg was perfection as well. I have to disagree with other posters that said the upside down pear crisp was not so good. It was delicious, not too sweet  and the  bourbon ice cream was out of this world.

Oh and the service is great too and it is a beautiful cozy space to enjoy a wonderful meal.  I have only been for dinner but I look forward to trying it for lunch!

Note: Went back recently and the poulet vert has changed!! I'm sure it is due to the seasonality of the veggies which I am all for,  but this makes me very sad. It was not nearly as good as a whole dish as it used to be (the chicken itself was still good.) But man, I can't wait till the other version comes back.
author: Rachel P.

description:
3.5 stars.
Drafted this review shortly after experience so it remains fresh in my mind.
Firstly the food here is very good except for the one issue mentioned below.

Brussels sprout chips were crispy, almost melt in your mouth good. There was a slight aftertaste but not so bad as to disrupt the palette.
The steak tartare, quail egg and crostini on greens was a perfect combination, the fusion of the tastes was smooth and delectable.
The famed burger was cooked well and constructed for eating. The sauce provided a good balance and the fries were the exact blend of crispiness and fluffiness to be fully enjoyed.
The steak frites was cooked medium rare as requested and tasted good.

The downsides...
-0.5 star for ambiance. Some may like it but it is just too cramped, dark and noisy for a truly pleasant dining experience.
-0.5 star for saltiness. We ordered the Brussels sprout chips, steak tarare, burger and the steak frites. All but the steak tartare had too much salt which kinda hid the flavor of the underlying food which is a shame as I'm sure it would still be good.
-0.5 stars for value. I have been spoilt regarding portion size but Marlowe has particularly small portion sizes for the cost. The steak was the size of a baseball.

Service was ok, could be better but more than acceptable.
We are undecided if we would return here again due slightly inflated prices for what you get.
author: Nick L.

description:
Since we are lovely ladies, and I am uber prepared (or paranoid), I had the insight to make reservations for lunch.  It was ok that the reservations were for 11:45 since I had class at 1:20 (for which I ended up being late, and then, as punishment, my prof made me sing in front of the class).  It was a lovely walk from the Hall, and we were able to chat.

Once we got there, we strolled past some very well respected suits with the phrase, "we have reservations."  We were sat by the window.  It was cramped in that oh-so-hip manner.  Luckily there was no one at the table adjacent because I would have had to flash my bottom at them as I got in.  

Unbeknownst to me, there was the dine about town menu in full force.  Cleverly, Marlowe had the insight to put their burger on it.  Because everyone loves the burger to begin with, and if it was not on the DAT menu, there would have been a raised eyebrow.  

And for the appetizer, there were two choices: artichoke soup with creme fraiche or little gem salad.  I got the soup, Liz got the salad.  Both were delicious.  The salad came on a large plate where 4 small romaine leaves were lovingly coated in deliciously tart dressing.  Something about smashed avocados.  But it had carrots.  The soup was velvety and smooth as bisque.  It was topped with a beautiful dollop of creme fraiche and some slivers of fried something tasty.  

I got the burger and Liz got the shrimp sandwich.  Her sandwich looked lovely!  The shrimps were braised and peeled.  They were huge and pink and firm.  There were many of them.  It was not a skimpy "lunch" serving, it was a fully stuffed, non-fried shrimp melange of tasty, colorful ingredients.  

The burger was....eh.  It looked beautiful.  I asked for it rare and it was delivered rare.  The center was just the way I liked it.  But the accutrements were distracting.  The shredded lettuce did nothing to add to the texture.  If anything, it made the burger feel more like a piroshiki than a gourmet burger.  The sauce, mayo, gooey, moist stuff was overwhelmed by the burger juices.  As someone mentioned, the meat was not allowed to rest so everything was presented like a pregnant sow.  

The fries were beautiful.  Gorgeous.  Effing Fantastic!  This was the highlight of the meal.  BUT.  Would it cost that much more to make the serving just a little bit BIGGER???  Is the whole of the budget going towards the burger that some fries must be sacrificed for the cause?  Puh-leeze.  I hope the side of fries was bigger for the price they were asking.  

Funny story: when I asked about the salad and whether the carrots can be removed, the waitress said that the chef was very picky or particular about the way the ingredients were put together and they would be unable to accommodate a request for no-carrots.  As a result, I think I was afraid to ask for the burger to be de-constructed with out mayo or other greasy secret ingredients.  She made it sound like the chef would come out and personally yell at me for my boldness.  

I'm sure this place deserves a higher rating.  But I was unimpressed with the burger.  It might have been the DAT, it might have been something else.  I will give this place another try and thusly adjust the rating.  But for the current experience, it was A-Ok.
author: Christina C.

description:
This place is exquisite. 

The staff knows their stuff, the food was absolutely wonderful, and the prices are so great!!! Intimate bar or floor seating, the decadent desserts in a jar, the fresh fresh ingredients. Great foodie spot.
author: E B.

description:
So this has been one of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. Granted, I haven't eaten much outside of fast food meals lately, but this place reminds me of what makes a dining establishment truly great through the basics of service, food, and ambiance. 

Food:

Appetizers
-My girlfriend and I ordered a total of 4 plates (2 apps, 2 entrees). We started with the famous bone marrow and baked oysters. While I've heard much about the bone marrow, the oysters were quite the surprise. Never have I experienced such purity in oyster flavor, letting on to the freshness of ingredients (a recurring theme of the night) and the skill of the chef preparing them. The fact it tasted like oyster chowder on the half-shell didn't leave much more to be desired from the dish. 

-In between stuffing our faces with the delectable little mollusks, we were also thoroughly enjoying the little bites of creamy bone marrow over the wonderfully smokey slices of toasted bread. The only gripe I had with this was the size expectation of the dish. It looked a lot bigger on yelp =\ 

Mains
-I was stuck between a rock and a hard place when deciding between the pork chop and the scallops, but my logical side told me to balance out our meal with a bit more seafood, so I opted for scallops and....well, sometimes logic sucks. I was actually satisfied with my scallops; juicy, tender, succulent, more or less cooked to perfection with no hint of fishiness, the ingredients were fresh and masterfully prepared. However, I'm not particularly a fan of capers...in the last bit, so despite how wonderful the scallops were, I wasn't too fond of the capers accompanying them. Adding insult to injury, the gentleman a table away from us received 3 orders of the pork chop, so when the smell wafted over, I grew jealous....oh well, there's always next time.

-Hands down the highlight of the night, ironically enough (because my gf jokingly suggested we go to a fast food burger place for my birthday instead), was the hamburger - medium rare, of course. It looked deceivingly simple. A no-frills bun. No-frills lettuce, no frills cheese with an unassuming set of fries to accompany the almost generic-looking burger. After cutting it in half and handing me one of the two pieces, spreading some horseradish on the bun and taking a bite, I was hooked. Suddenly, the loud chatter of background noise turned into trumpets and angels sang. Then I quickly took another bite and it was even better as I got more of the medium rare patty. This burger is almost life-altering, made even more impressive by how unassuming it looks.  Honestly, I could live an abandon warehouse ridden with trash and stained by bodily fluids, but I would not give two shits if this burger was in my grasp. It's that good. 5 stars just for this!

Service:
-The already delicious food was certainly enhanced by our server that night. I don't recall her name but her wine recommendation in regard to the foods we ate that night was accurate to what she claimed and I thoroughly enjoyed my Gruner white wine. I guess the only downside, err moment of comic relief was when she first showed up and spilled water on me as she explained the beverages of the night, but I lived so no biggie. 

Overall:
-Great middle to upscale casual atmosphere
-Good, simple food.
-Friendly and helpful service people

Hopefully next time i remember to get the pork chop as well as a burger entirely for myself...possibly as the appetizer.
author: Nick C.

description:
randomly stumbledupon this place!

brussel sprouts chips are so amazing!
author: Christine K.

description: I went here for lunch, and while I thought the food was good, I didn't think there were a lot of options.  I had the burger and fries, and thought it was good though by no means the best burger I've ever had...I did enjoy the atmosphere, though the service was a little slow.  The brussel sprouts appetizer was interesting.
author: Nicole M.

description:
This place is amazing! 
Of course I had to get the brussel sprouts chips. It's a must for me. Yum. 

The fries were fried to perfection and came with a horseradish aioli. Double Yum. Think we could've had two orders of these.

We debated on the burger and ended up ordering the "Poulet Vert" which was so juicy!!! We coudn't stop eating it. I can't even remember the last time I had such a great chicken dish. Usually, it's dry or has no flavor... but this was a true winner. It came with olives, fingerling and purple potatoes. 

The dessert wasn't so great though. We had the TCHO chocolate pot de creme and i really don't remember anything about sea salt on the menu but it was way too salty! and I love salt! especially sea salt!!

It kind of didn't leave us with a nice finish to our meal, but I will definitely be back for those fries and a burger my next visit for sure!
author: Heidi L.

description:
Marlowe is amazing. I've dined in and done take out several times. This place is straight up brilliant. Luckily, I live right across the street, so it's an easy stroll for me. There can sometimes be a wait, so I try to avoid rush hours. No hard alcohol served. 

I'll admit to not having tried every single thing on the menu, but here are the things I've tried and loved:

Poulet Vert- Oh My God. I love this chicken. I've tried to find the recipe online, I've watched Jennifer Puccio's video where she makes it multiple times, etc... I think I'm close, but what I want to know is how the herbs stay so vibrant and how do they continue to cling to the chicken so well? I've got some ideas and will experiment. 

Lamb- Delicious, simple.

Roasted Oysters- Hell to the yes, amazing. I'm a oyster fanatic. I like these better than hog island cooked oysters. 

Burrata salad with peaches (in the summer)/ Little gem salad- The salads are sparse, but so pristine and fresh. Recommended. 

Brussel Sprouts- Addictive. Definitely not healthy, but you can order them and pretend to be a little virtuous. 

Burger- Oh no. This is the one dish that I don't think I love as much as everyone else does. I've had it twice, I want to love it, but there's just not enough contrast in flavors and textures to me. If I'm going to eat something fatty and soft, I want something sharp, crisp and maybe a little sweet. The fries that come with it are amazing though, as is the aioli, and the restaurant cooks the burger to order perfectly. However, when I want a burger, I'm not coming here. Maybe I just have bad taste in burgers (I don't like Zuni's either).

Desserts are uniformly amazing. The little chocolate pot is my dessert splurge when I have one.
author: Julia K.

description:
This is what I want when I go out to dinner. First and foremost I want excellent food. A great wine selection helps. I also want seductive atmosphere. This is achieved with interior design, lighting, music and service. Combine with a touch of class and a lack of pretense. For an object lesson in how to do this correctly, see Marlowe.

My beautiful girlfriend and I wandered into Marlowe without a reservation and lucked out with a spot at the bar immediately. The (awesome) bartender was our unabrasively attentive server. Every moment of our meal was perfect. Just to reiterate what everyone is saying, yes, the Brussels Sprout chips and bone marrow are amazing. The burger is now firmly in my top three.

Last night I ate at another 'New American' restaurant in the mission and I continually wished I had returned to Marlowe instead. Next time, i'll see that I do.
author: Zac H.

description:
Came back and tried the burger again without cheese, much better. But they didn't let my burger rest so all the juices flowed out when I bit into it. Still a good burger though so I'll raise my rating.

The shrimp dish came with an overly salty sauce so they took it off our bill. The marrow and the baked oysters were really good.
author: Derrick V.

description: I actually enjoyed my dining experience at the bar instead of the communal tables. Bartender was super nice. We had the brussel sprout chips, deviled egg, and gem salad for starters and split the poulet vert for our main. The brussel sprout chips were as commonly yelped very delicious. Strong lemon flavor, reminded me of potato chips after a while. The deviled egg had an interesting combo of flavors with the jalapeno but pretty pricey at $2 per egg I believe. The gem salad was a medley of root veggies tossed in a light citrus vinaigrette, pretty refreshing. The main course was delicious with tender chicken falling off the bone and a simply divine sauce. It got quite salty by the end of the meal hence the 4 stars. Overall a really convenient location near the caltrain, not TOO expensive ($60 for the two of us splitting one entree and a few apps). Would love to try the burger next time.
author: Joyce H.

description:
4.5 stars....
This review is long overdue..

The food was amazing!  I had to try the burger and was not disappointed.  Matter of fact, everyone in my party ordered the burger.  It was a consensus, best burger we've ever had - by FAR!  The burger was super juicy, tender, and full of flavor.  The bun was toasted to perfection.  For appetizers, we had the roasted bone marrow and brussels sprout chips.  The roasted bone marrow was truly a heavenly experience and is a must-have.

I loved this place and will definitely check it out again.  An incredible dining experience and our server was really helpful.  Marlowe is definitely one of my SF favorites.
author: Ryan P.

description: I had a really pleasant dinner experience here. The food was great. 2 of us got the steak and one got the chicken. Everything was amazing. Great service too. I will definitely be back when in San Francisco.
author: Laila B.

description: Stopped in for lunch and took a couple seats at the bar to skip the wait. Ordered the chicken sandwich, which was good. Didn't really stand out, but it was a solid (if overpriced) sandwich and probably not super representative of their entire menu. The service was good and the space is pleasant, so there is not a whole lot to criticize. But, there are probably 20 brunch places in the city that I would find basically interchangeable (the decor, the menu, the crowd, the price) so I wasn't blown away. Still, it may be one of a kind in the not-yet-entirely-gentrified area and will very likely satisfy those who are excited to discover a new place to "brunch".
author: Oliver M.

description:
OVERALL: Get the brussel sprout chips and burger!  Skip the TCHO chocolate dessert. 

AMBIANCE: Inviting, intimate, dim lighting, a bit on the loud side (I had to speak in louder than normal volume but not shouting), reasonably priced. Two tops, a communal table, small bar.

FOOD:
-Brussel Sprout Chips: I thought these would be round fried brussel sprouts.  But they are brussel sprout leaves (?), individually fried.  You don't taste brussel sprout flavor, just sea salt, meyer lemon. Texture is crisp w/slight chew.  Greasy, oh yes!, but that didn't stop me from devouring the basekt.

-Baked Oysters: $3/each.  Delicious.  Would have ordered more but wanted to save room for the mains.

-Burger.  Tasty, comes fully assembled.  In my opinion not nearly as good as the juicy pefection at Spruce. Fries w/aioli were good. I don't recall there being bacon in the burger, although the menu says there is.

-Pork Chop. This thing was huge.  Came with these "crispy parmesan dumplings" which I thought were similar in texture to chickpea fries that One Market.  In any case, they were delicious. The pork chop I had seemed to have a ton of fat on it. Maybe that's the way it always is. (I don't eat pork chops that often).

-Dessert: some chocolate thing in a glass jar.  It was ok, I would skip this next time. TCHO chocolate something other (pot de creme?) with cacao nibs, but tasted just ok to me.  I wished there was something more cakey on the menu.

THAT CORNER TABLE:
Like a couple other yelpers mentioned, there is a 2-top in the corner.  Debateable whether this is a good table (can peoplewatch the entire resto) or bad (you are staring directly at the table in front of you, so when you talk, you're essentially talking to that other table.).  Can be a bit awkard.  Your call.
author: Caroline I.

description: Extensive yet personalized cocktail menu. Small but quaint bistro close to Caltrain. Great food. A classic San Francisco establishment.
author: Peter D.

description: I would say Marlowe is your typical San Franciscan fare. The food was good, but I was expecting more flavor from the baked oysters we ordered. My only other gripe is that even though the menu is similar to the about 90% of the rest of the cities "New American"/"Californian" menus, it's on the pricier end. Service was great though.
author: Olivia H.

description: One of the best after work dinner spots in SoMa. Great ambience and the food is consistently awesome. Best burger I've had in they city.
author: Tracey L.

description:
Marlowe impressed me most with their service. We had to wait for a table, and were served wine as we sat outside on a bench near the entrance.  We took a corner table and ordered a feast! Our eyes were clearly bigger than our stomachs.  Of the many items I tried, the steak tartare and the bone marrow were my favorites.  Also part of the fun was getting to know our waiter and the people around us. The restaurant has a friendly, kind of New York-ish atmosphere. 

However, right before dinner, a friend told me she had recently been there and found the food to be salty. This stuck in my head, and I found it to be true, but I still very much enjoyed my meal there. 

Full disclosure - I selected Marlowe over other options because I liked the font on their menu. It was a good choice overall, and one of the most enjoyable nights out I've had in SF.
author: Katie M.

description:
Walked in on Friday night without a reservation and the amazing hostess was able to get us in with just a short wait.  The night was off to a good start.  Looked over the menu and everyone here on Yelp recommended the burger, so went with that medium rare.  The bone marrow looked really interesting, so might have to make a return visit to check that out.  The burger was perfectly cooked, juicy, and the fries that came with it were great.

Two wishes: (1) The horseradish aioli did not have enough kick for me, but maybe it was because I saw horseradish and had really high expectations.  (2) I ordered the Trumer Pils and I know it is not exactly the most masculine beer out there, but do they really have to underscore this by serving it in the most feminine looking beer glass ever?
author: Bernard L.

description:
Cozy, intimate, decor, awesome background music, and delicious food: Brussel sprout chips, steak tartare, and the best pork chop I've ever had. 

Bonus was our server with a big grey handlebar moustache - the type of guy you trust making food recommendations.
author: Eric W.

description: The menu is very limited. I enjoyed the salad and the drinks - butcher's wife & Butcher's Mistress. Service was good and so were deserts.
author: Astha S.

description: Marlowe looks like a small casual bar.  It's not cheap considering the decor is very pub/bar like, but this place has awesome food and may possibly have the best burger in the city.  The "Green Chicken" which was a roast chicken with green sauce was outstanding as well.  Berry parfait very refreshing and a great way to finish the evening.  We'll be back.
author: Paul K.

description: If a restaurant has pork belly on the menu it does not mean their food is good. I learned this lesson over and over again by going to mediocre places that serve piggy parts. Nothing memorable about Marlowe - blah food, generic service, boring crowd.
author: Viola B.

description:
Man, I love this place.  Yes, the food is delicious, market-driven, and unfussy but the real reason Marlowe holds a special place in my heart is my two year old willingly ate his first bite of Brussels sprouts here.  My tiny, carb-loving, self-imposed vegetarian (who hates vegetables) wolfed down a plate of Brussels sprout chips faster than Joey Chestnut gulps down a barrel of hotdogs.  I have to wipe away a tear as I type this...

Since it's located right behind the Caltrain station, I've always wanted to come here with my rugrats for our bi-monthly family dinner in the city.  I was hesitant to do so since it didn't seem particularly kid-friendly when I dined here a couple months ago.   However, I was determined to make a go of it with the kids last Tuesday.  Don't worry all you kid-haters, I made sure our reservation was early and I was armed with snacks, iPad, and bribes.  Who knew that it would be the hottest fricking day in history and Marlowe doesn't have A/C?  Despite the heat, no melt-downs from anybody (me included).

Even though the menu is small, everything I've ordered has been really yummy.  This time, the four of us split the Brussels sprout chips, burrata and peaches, little gem salad, roasted bone marrow, Marlowe burger, spiced prawns, and seared halibut.  My favorite was the little gem salad - perfect, crisp greens with paper-thin shaved roots, al-dente baby veggies, dollops of creamy smashed avocado, all of which was lightly dressed with a balanced vinaigrette.   The Marlowe burger is delicious and my 5 year old proclaimed it the best burger and fries he's ever eaten.   On a previous visit, I also really liked the steak and poulet vert.  Damn it, I guess every thing I've had is tasty!

If you are bringing kids, please note that there are no high chairs (there are boosters) and the tables are really close together.  Plus, you will most likely be seated next to a young hipster couple who will be shooting dirty looks at you for bringing your kids.  Just make sure that your kids are well-behaved and you will be fine.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Hello deliciousness!!! Been there 3-4 times and tried a new dish each time I went and have not been disappointed. I do love their "Stuffed Sole blue crab, baby turnips, radish, Armenian cucumber, pea tendrils & lemon verbena" soo good!!

The restaurant is small so you would want to make reservations. Its cozy and very cute. Not much privacy but staff is friendly and service is excellent.
author: Kajal P.

description:
Rich food, cute surroundings, easy access across from the San Francisco Caltrain station. 

Caveats: 
-the brussel sprout chips were played up too much! They were alright tasty, but too greasy and, at least in my bowl, the seasoning wasn't evenly distributed...some leaves were way too salty, some were bitter, and others too tart from over-lemon zest/juice exposure.

-the polenta was amazing for the first half....then it just became really heavy and rich. Maybe another veg to cut it? Something. Food like polenta, in my book, should be a staple and should be easy to eat in large quantities! Ha.

Otherwise, very friendly service and wait staff, tasty food for the most part, and a really fun environment that reminds me of the cute little shabby-chic cafes in Seattle.

I'd go again. :)
author: K. L.

description: Convenient location, decent food. Appetizer menu is a bit light, and include things like brussel sprout chips and nuts that although taste decent, really don't offer much substance and you'd find as free beer food in other places. My steak came out a bit on the dry side a more of a well done instead of a medium. Having said all that, service was good, and the majority of our party seemed to enjoy their food. Bottled beers only - nothing on tap. Also a bit pricey for bottled beers - up to $10, which is ok I guess considering they are more craft brews in general. I had a good experience, but not sure I'd come back again.
author: Anderson L.

description: HUGE entree portions...... SoMa style (exposed brick walls and I beams) and attentive service. Did I mention the huge portions?
author: Calvin W.

description:
I just finished dinner at Marlowe and unfortunately don't think I'll be going bad. I came here when they first opened and it was a bit chaotic and the food was "ok." Months has passed since my first visit and I was willing to give Marlowe a second chance since newly opened restaurants usually has a lot of kinks to work out. 

Overall, the service was good and our server was friendly. We didn't encounter any 'tude from the Host which is always pleasant. It was much calmer tonight and we didn't have to scream across the table to ea other to be heard which was also a nice change from my previous visit.

We ordered the following: Baked Clams (App) - good
Toasted Pistachios (App) - ok
Sole with Blue Crab stuffing (Entree) - ok
Poulet Vert (Entree) - good; tender, tasty and can feed 2
French Fries (Side) - YUMMY! nice and crispy...
Vanilla Bean Pana Cotta (Dessert) - good; reminded me of a Flan

Although they were much more organized this time around and my overall experience compared to my first visit was better, there's nothing that compels me to want to return.
author: Soozie H.

description:
If I could give this place a ZERO I would! There were 4 of us one person ordered the shrimp roll (they brought the wrong thing and then instead of fixing it right away brought 4 other tables food before finally bringing hers- we were done eating) , the burger was ok at best (Holy Grill down the street is WAY better and half the price) and the Fried Chicken sandwich was way overdressed with loads of mayo! 
Not to mention the service was terrible and I want to say that may be the biggest waste of 20 dollars in my entire life... especially since now I am eating a bag of Doritos because I couldn't even eat my lunch..it was so bad ..  YUCK!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Took my boss here for lunch, and it instantly gained his seal of approval when we ran into a buddy of his. 

The ambience is a little dark, but that makes the space feel more intimate.

I ordered the open face egg sandwich and was blown away with the sheer deliciousness of it all. Good serving size, an elegant take on a deli classic.

Also - brussel sprout chips were addicting!
author: Shana M.

description:
i was very unimpressed with marlowe given all the great reviews on here. i really didnt find much good to say and you know the old saying about if you cant say anything nice dont say anything at all... 

well here is what i will say. brussel sprout chips were just ok. really greasy and pieces were so small they were difficult to eat. sangria carafe was very small and nothing special. and the crab cakes were burnt, i am surprised they were allowed to leave the kitchen. 

maybe it is a pure lack of other options in the area that have people excited about this, i have no idea. but it didnt do it for me.
author: Christina H.

description:
Another concierge recommendation. Great service and the food was awesome! Too bad there were a couple of loud large parties which made it difficult to hear ourselves think. Once they left, it was a much better atmosphere.

Reservations were necessary for a weekend as it is small. Service was very attentive. They held our table for us even though we are about 10 minutes late. ( we had called to advise them) 

Funny to see the younger couples enjoying a burger there- the menu is very varied and appealing to all sorts of tastes and wallet sizes.

Very close tables, of course. Located across from the bus station so it was difficult to find a cab back to Union Square. Had to wait in line for a cab.

Definitely a hidden local gem- would go back again! Thanks for a great dinner for our last night in the city!!
author: Lala C.

description:
The rare five stars. Rare in that food, service, and atmosphere all exceed expectations. Here's why:

1. Very friendly and accommodating hostess
2. Very courteous service and staff
3. Fantastic and tasty food; at a reasonable price
4. Nice intimate atmosphere; tight but efficient, never felt crowded.

Well done.
author: H H.

description:
When I come to Marlowe, I go for the burger.

Last night, I had a HUGE craving for a Marlowe burger. The waitress asked if we wanted to sit at a table or at the counter. I said I needed to sit at the bar because Kraig was serving at the bar. I like Kraig. He is the friendliest bartender. 

I ordered my burger medium and with the first bite, I almost fainted. It was that good! It was perfectly prepared. The crispy bacon strips and the flavorful beef patty was super juicy. Fries were just the way I liked it...crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They were perfect with the spicy horseradish. 

Burger goes well with beer. We had Sessions beer. 

Thank you Marlowe!
author: Molly T.

description:
Weeks can drizzle by, and when the drop of Monday falls, a place like Marlowe is a welcome pairing to a fog hidden San Francisco sunset.

Marlowe is a sleek, street level space, that brings together modern SoMa accents. Dark wood plays with the hard, clean surfaces of granite with accents of cultured pieces. 

The space reflects many of the touches I love not only in restaurants but in my own home. Weathered wood integrated with modern pieces that breath life not only into the charm of the space, but nourishing the eyes of it's users.

As with most times, we found ourselves securing our spots at the bar and greeted warmly. 

Burgers. That was the calling.

Served on a long plate, the aroma from the kitchen does the talking way in advance of it landing in front of you. 

The Niman Ranch beef patty with lamb mixed into it gives the burger a hearty feel with a serious flavor profile. Even with the lightest pressure from picking up the burger, the juices of the sensitive patty drip with heavenly flavor.

Sitting on a soft Acme bun, a criss cross of crisp bacon and a healthy slathering of horseradish aioli, the burger is decadent.

For extra texture to the dish the fries are like fire crackers. Crunching and exploding with a golden crust. Salt has found it's reason for birth.

To serenade the finish, the raspberry and lemon pudding cake was a perfect blend of sweet and cool down. Served in a small mason jar, they hit the chord that will always get my blessing.

Marlowe has risen from it's past and transformed into a straight forward hit. Next Monday, grab a stool.
author: Mike K.

description:
Ah, I love love Marlowe. I used to frequent this restaurant quite a bit when I worked nearby and I have to say, I didn't easily get tired of it, and there was nothing I ever ate that wasn't simply fantastic. 

The Marlowe burger was my go-to dinner item when I'm torn between menu items. It's rich and flavorful, filling enough to share, not that you will want to! It lives up to it's reviews and expectations. It comes with a side of fries with horseradish aioli that you really can't stop eating no matter how much you think you're going to burst!

The Anson Mills polenta, however, my absolute favorite item here. This dish really is to DIE for and completely dreamy and mouth watering with the wild mushrooms. Creamy and just soooo soo satisfying. The deviled eggs and brussel sprout chips are also some must-try items that are always a hit. I also love that they have ginger beer on the menu--a nice alternative to beer and wine when you're looking for something non-alcoholic.

I highly recommend a seat at the bar for a little more privacy with less maneuvering, if you're not in love with the communal seating they have here.

-1star for the tight quarters but a great experience nonetheless.
author: Panda B.

description:
Group of 3 had dinner at Marlowe on a relatively warm November night

- Food: 4 stars - Started off with the bone marrow appetizer which was a tad disappointing. It was more fatty than meaty and was a bit hard to scoop with the crostini and I am not convinced the salsa verde accentuated any flavors. Moved on to the famous Marlowe burger which was very good and adequately sized but I am not ready to award it any prizes yet. Tried the cauliflower gratin (very good) and brussel sprouts (stick with the chips not the hearts)

Wine: 4 stars- pleasantly surprised with the worldliness of the wine list. Good California representation but really interesting wines from Europe and South Africa as well. Sell wine by the carafe (= half bottles but cheaper)

Ambience: 4 stars: - casual chic. Perfect for friends catching up for dinner (groups of 6 or less). 

Service: 5 stars - very attentive (but not overtly so) and knowledgeable. showed up early for a 7:45 reservation but was seated immediately even though I was the only member of my party. 

Welcome addition to San Francisco dining scene!
author: Rumesha A.

description:
Made a reservation here for a Tuesday (T.G.I.T, amiright?!).  Arrived on time, but had to wait for more than 20 minutes anyway.  That's okay, though, because the hostess busted out four glasses of free bubbly for us.  Free champagne is basically the key to my heart.

I really liked the vibe of the place.  If I ever open a restaurant I would want it to feel like Marlowe - classy yet rustic.  It is a little on the cramped side though, since it's a pretty small place.

The food.  Oh the food.  We got the brussels sprout chips and the bone marrow as appetizers.  The brussels sprout was simple but very very delicious.  The bone marrow, too, was amazing.  My entree, though, was by far my favorite thing.  I am a huge lover of polenta.  In fact I had gotten a pretty delicious version days before at Zazie, but this one definitely takes the cake.  Delicious mushrooms, poached eggs, all on top of creamy polenta.  Best vegetarian option ever.

I would definitely come back again to try their burger that I have heard so much about.  I did have a bite of my friend's order, but that's just not the way to judge a burger!
author: jon y.

description: Had a great dinner here with a coworker. I kind of expected an over-rated touristy place (given the location near the ballpark), but was surprised in a great way. Good wine-by-the-glass list, very good wine-by-the-bottle list. Brussel chips were good, but frankly didn't wow me as much as other reviewers. The individual deviled eggs were really good, though. And my entree (the pork chop) was perfectly cooked. Friendly staff, and easy to get a reservation - what's not to like?
author: Dan K.

description:
You must try Marlowe!  What a great addition to SOMA.  It's across the street from the CalTrain station with a small dining area and bar.  I made reservations on Open Table for dinner at 9:30 on a Wednesday or so I thought.  I must not have clicked the final reservation button because there was no reservation, but the hostess was super great and despite the place being absolutely packed (on Wednesday!) was able to fit us in at the bar in 20 minutes.  The Brussels sprout chips were yum...this coming from a huge fan of Brussels.  Had the tambo tuna as an entree that was served with cous cous.  The tuna was cooked to perfection, juicy and slightly pink in the middle.  The cous cous was light and fresh and moist, not dried out which a lot of places do.

I was so impressed with dinner that night that I booked a work dinner there a few weeks later.  Service again was impeccable even with our group of 7.  This time I had the pork chop and boy was it a chop.  Big and mouthwatering!  I had to take home half...leftovers!

If you want my advice definitely make a reservation, it is a busy place.  Hope you enjoy!
author: Kylie S.

description:
Brussel sprout chips... ZOMG!  Soooo good!

Also shared a burger and a fried chicken sandwich.  The burger was solid but not stellar.  The chicken sandwich reminded me a bit of Bakesale Bettys with the breaded and fried chicken breast and spicy slaw.  It too was well done, but hands down the best dish was the brussel sprout chips.  Fan-freakin-tastic.  I don't know if I'll be able to eat them any other way now.  Damn you Marlowe for ruining an otherwise healthy vegetable!!  Damn you, I say!
author: Gary L.

description: Came here based off of reviews and was not disappointed :)  Steak was delicious and well cooked.  We had to wait a half an hour for our table even though we had a reservation, but they were super nice about it and gave our whole party of 6 glasses of champagne to thank us for waiting!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Delicious wine, appetizers and main courses.
Deviled eggs are a must! 

Also, I would suggest making reservations in advance as Marlowe is pretty busy even on weeknights.
author: Rachel R.

description: Excellent food, great ambience.  A bit too loud for a date, otherwise, great!
author: Athens F.

description: Was there for brunch yesterday with some friends.  It was fine, I had the crab and rock shrimp crepe which was good although the accompanying salad was not dressed properly.  The server was fine.  It's a decent spot
author: Lin C.

description:
Thank you Allison,
Best Deviled Egg,
Best Pork Chop
Best Burger,OMG
Strawberry&Rhubarb Chrisp is okky///
10***************
author: Sanfrancisco O.

description:
Marlowe has been on my list of places to try for some time. I finally pulled the trigger and made reservations a few weeks ago on a Saturday night. The reservationist called me the day before and reminded me about my reservation and also told me about the parking for the bofa lot and the code for the discount. I thought that was a nice friendly service. 

We arrive for our reservation on Saturday night. Our table was ready and waiting for us. I was taken aback on how small the restaurant is. It is very cozy though and I liked the long communal table. 

Thanks to Yelp, I of course ordered the burger, brussel sprout chips, my companions ordered, steak & Frites, little gem salad, cauliflower gratin and the polenta and mushrooms dish. I love the brussel sprout chips, well maybe because I liked brussel sprouts as a kid. haha...my burger was perfect and the steak was YUMM! The sauce that was all over the steak was excellent. My companions liked their dishes as well, the polenta is very rich. 

We were too full and had to skip dessert but I will be back again for the burger. The fries were yummy as well. I'd recommend making reservations.
author: Julie F.

description:
I went in for lunch for Dine Around Town, and yes, the food is just as good as you've heard.
